I will not be visiting this facility again.

name: John Dorsett
text: All the staff was very helpful, cordial and led us thru this procedure effortlessly. This is a great group of people who took good care of my loved one. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks, John!

name: Mohammad Firouz
text: Very polite staff and nice service

name: Marla Dean
text: I have never had an experience like I had there today. Was seen by a female physician by the name of Moor i believe. Will never go back. Hopefully, the other physicians ask questions before they start talking about your history.

resp.text: Marla, we hope you feel better soon and wish you the best of luck in your search for a new provider.

name: Kimani Evans
text: Firstly the staff here is phenomenal. They go above and beyond to ensure that you are getting the very best care. I dealt with the “African American doctor from OKC” (pardon me for not remembering her name) but she was very understanding and patient. The nurses were very well trained. My only recommendation would be to develop  more private way for patient to describe their Symptoms at the check in desk. Other than that I was very  impressed.

name: Jason Williams
text: Wonderful. Kind. Professional. Efficient. Very impressed.

resp.text: Thanks, Jason!

name: whitney dillard
text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you're unhappy with the service we provided. Please give us a call so we can better understand your frustration. 205-547-3901.

name: Melissa Snyder
text: Please note that if you go to Med Help in the evening or weekend, you will be charged a non-advertised $44 night/weekend clinic charge. This is charged despite the services being marketed as "urgent care." They don't seem to use the actual urgent care billing code and use primary care code instead. I'm assuming to make more money and later charge the extra night and weekend fee. If they would advertise honestly, I would not be so upset by this. My specific grievance is with the Trussville location, but I'm sure this is a company-wide practice.

name: Christine
text: Dr. Bernreuter was excellent - very thorough and went through all the treatment options.

name: PJ Albano
text:
Drs Vaughn and MedHelp Administration:

I literally felt like the proverbial train hit me, and  was being beyond a wimp.  After labs, rapid flu, & CXR , Julie Phillips, MSN, CRNP, and her NP student Christina Ray, RN, doing her clinicals) were probably the nicest and most caring providers I've ever come in contact with.  The two of them and their support staff went well above and beyond taking care of me today.
I've been in the medical / pharmacy field, physician relations for well over 20 years, and they're simply  top notch.  I know you probably get, albeit completely undeserved, complaints of some nature from patients, so I thought I'd drop you a quick review and say GREAT JOB, GREAT HIRES, GREAT MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS... I'll be transferring my records from to MedHelp as soon as possible.Thank you again...PJA.

resp.text: Thank you, PJ!

name: Charmaine Perry-Livers
text: Very nice greeting when I entered the clinic. Clean and free coffee! But the service I received from the Doctor was excellent! I recommend this place to all that have Urgent Care Needs!

name: Valerie Rodgers
text: If Dr. Smothers is there, go somewhere else.  Don't get me wrong, he was a really nice doctor but he is VERY slow.  Walked in at 4:50...didn't leave until 7:10.  There were four people in the lobby in front of me & I saw 2 people come from the back.

name: Mallory Edmondson
text: Both my husband and I went in last month. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the doctor was great! We were in and out within an hour!

name: Jose Cortes
text: Excellent environment, the Dr. associates are very helpful, fast to do their good job, and the Doctor is great, perfect to visit by anyone, is well recommended.

name: scott gamble
text: Dr. Felgner wasn't there for my scheduled appointment and they didn't call me or send me any notice via the online portal so I showed up and had to leave or come back 4 hours later for a different Dr.. Don't waste your time coming to this place.

name: Frank Lloyd Bite
text: This place is truly the worst. Super rude and judgmental doctor and staff. Will definitely never go back.

name: rebecca smith
text: Just went in for a check-up. The staff was very friendly and my appointment was quick. Dr. Orso was friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. All together I was only there for about an hour! The waiting room is really nice too: spacious, well lit, with drinks, snacks and coffee dispensers.

name: anita brunner
text: Nurse Pam was a wonderful nurse to work with! She was very knowledgeable and answered all of our question with confidence!

name: Dallas Carroll
text:
Dr. Smothers ran blood work, flu and streph test all of which came back negative. I had a horrible headache and and a temperature of 102.8. He did no additional testing and came back into the room and said, "You're not going to like this, but I think you have a serious infection- meningitis! You will more than likely need a lumbar punture or spinal tap."
He recommended that I go to the ER, but dont worry his medical assistant to offer the ER a heads up that I was coming...
After waiting countless hours at the ER and NUMEROUS TESTS I had a viral infection. All of which required fluids, ibuprofen, and lots of rest. I will NEVER return here. Apparently telling someone -after running a handful of tests- it's perfectly fine to tell them that they most likely have one of the most UNCOMMON and RARE infections. He didnt even ask if I was vaccinated as a kid- which my mother made sure I had every vaccination know to man.

name: Lauren Brady
text: Front office was friendly. I didn't wait long. Doctor was knowledgeable and kind. Doc sent meds to 24 hour pharmacy and I was on my way. Great experience!

name: Christopher Anderson
text: I am out of town on business for a few weeks here in Birmingham, and needed an emergency refill. So I walked in here to see if they would be able to do this for me, and I was promptly told they were not able to do so by the front desk without actually consulting the nurses or Dr. On staff. So I went down the road to another urgent care and got my prescribtion refilled within 10mins. So yeah, terrible service, do not recommend.

name: Marty McArthur
text: You can either make an appointment or just show up.  Those with appointments go first, of course, especially if they allow "first available doctor," but I have never had a horribly long wait, even during flu season.  For convenience, there is a complete pharmacy on the premises.  I believe the pharmacy closes at 5:30 or 6:00 PM.  I have never been displeased with a doctor or a staff member there.

name: Ross Carpri
text: I went to this site per my Doctors instructions to have blood work done.  They refused to do the work because they said that I needed an appointment and was not allowed to work on me since my primary doctor was not in that location.  Thank God I didn't have an emergency or they would have probably let me die right there on the lobby floor.  Very bad service and the two employees were not compassionate in the least.  I won't  ever go back.  I'll take my chances somewhere else.

name: Reed McMullan
text:
MedHelp is the worst example of a medical establishment. I can't even begin to describe the worst medical experience I have been through. I took my wife to this MedHelp after she was recovering from the Flu, because she clearly was not recovering. Dr. Solomon Saul has the WORST bedside manner of any physician I have ever met. As he began to look at her symptoms, he kept shrugging them off. He said, "your symptoms are general, so I'm not sure why you came in." He continued to verbally harass her and question her symptoms. After he sat in silence staring at us, he finally said, "I guess I can prescribe you something for your GENERAL symptoms." What a jerk!

To top off the whole experience, I wrote to MedHelp's Facebook page, hoping for a different, friendly customer service experience. Boy, was I wrong! After not even receiving a reply, I followed up. I have posted the conversation below. DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT use this medical company for any service.. They do not care about the patient, not care about the medical betterment of their PAYING customers. What a rip-off.

name: Cats Mcc
text: I'd been here multiple times for urgent care issues, usually respiratory infections, and they've always been very fast and nice! I recently decided to establish with a new PCP and became a patient of Dr. Felgner, who is extremely nice and really cares about his patients. He's very kind and actually talks to you instead of over you. I'm in and out in less than an hour, even with urgent care problems after 5:00. From the front staff to the end of your visit, everyone cares about you and I've yet to meet a rude person there. I can't recommend Medhelp Lakeshore any more highly! Great people giving great care! --Liz M

name: Walter White
text: Friendly staff and knowledgeable doctors. Needs more Auburn stuff in pharmacy !

name: Juju Vyez
text: Avoid at all costs! The doctor I saw for my back pain was nice. The lady at the desk said they'd send a bill if anything was owed. Nearly a year later and not a single bill received, and I find myself dealing with a collections agency due to their ineptness. I wish I'd suffered through the back pain. It would have been far less painful than getting dinged on my credit report and having to clear that mess up.

name: Gabrielle Hernandez
text: They were very quick with bringing me back and I was in and out right away. Exactly how an urgent care should be.

name: Gene Floyd
text: Recently drove myself here with chest pains. As I walked in there was a sign that said they handled "heart attacks". I walk in, tell the lady at the desk I thought I might be having a heart attack. She replied that they were full and couldn't get to me. I looked at her and asked for her please to check that I was in a lot of pain. She finally walks into the back and then comes out and tells me again that they were too busy I would have to go elsewhere. This meant I had to get in my car and drive to Brookwood, where I ended up having to have a stent put in as I had blockage. Needless to say, I wouldn't take my ex-mother-in-law's dog to this place. I mean what kind of people, especially at a doctors office would tell someone having heart pains to go somewhere else without even offering to call an ambulance?

name: Andre Campbell
text: Thank you for your great service would highly recommend medhelp to any one and will definitely go back for any future needs thanks to Beverly bridges and your wonderful staff for your care and compassion....

name: Olivia Stiles
text: I had a great experience Tosha the nurse was the bomb dot com at giving shots. I had a great experience.

name: Susanna H
text: As a medical professional, I'm not going to go see a doctor unless I absolutely have to. I went to this urgent care on a weekend when I couldn't go see my regular doctor. Dr. Orso, who saw me, did just that--looked at me, shouted out a diagnosis and sent me on my way. He was rude and rushed (spent less than 60 seconds in the room), didn't even touch me, and became angry with me when I asked about whether I could go to work or not. He also completely dismissed the primary reason I had come in, and told me treatment for my primary complaint was "excessive." It would have been nice just to be listened to and felt like he gave a flying flip about his patient.

name: vandalyn green
text: I give this a -5 for service! I went to MedHelp Lakeshore on 2/11/16 at 8 am. I had a temp and chest pain. The wack doctor gave me a shot for sinus and a list of vitamins to take. I told him 3 times how bad my chest was hurting! On 2/14/16 I went to AFC. I had the flu and pneumonia! A lot of fluid in my lungs.

name: Grace
text: Don't waste your time. I have been here once and I don't know what happened in a year but apparently a lot. Waited an hour for the staff to find my insurance and talk to me about my co pay. I was told because I was an emergency visit and they werent my Pcp it would cost more which is garbage. They were unwilling to work with me on figuring out the issue and so I left. Not worth the time.

name: Bobby Wallace
text: Great Physicians and a great place for walk-in medical care

name: Pamela Flanagan
text: I see Dr. Southworth , he has been a very good caring Dr.

name: Cynthia Stewart
text: On the rare occasion I need to go, I see Dr Pink (sorry, just love saying my dude dr. has a color name :) ). While his staff are probably the most non-congenial group of folks, he seems nice enough. He actually takes time to have a conversation and explain things well. My husband saw the black female dr. (sorry, didn't catch her name) and she was friendly as well. As far as Dr. Orso, he was my OB when I lost my first child in 1990. He delivered my first-born and 23 years later, he remembered me when I walked through the office. He hugged me and asked how the kids were. So while the staff have no personalities, the doctors seem knowledgeable and I have definitely had worse experiences.

name: Jana Lee
text: Friendly, prompt service from a knowledgeable staff! Will definitely be back!

name: Michael Hoadley
text: Hello: I had an extremely unfortunate experience today at the Med Help, Inc. Lakeshore (Birmingham, AL) location. After arriving just on time for my 11am follow-up appointment with Dr. Richard Crittendon, and paying my $30.00 co-pay up-front, I took a seat in their waiting room. After about five minutes, I was escorted to the back patient area by a nurse who proceeded to weigh me, then take my blood pressure and my temperature. She then took me next door to an exam room to await Dr. Crittendon. "He'll be with you in a few minutes," she said. I sat in that exam room for the next 55 minutes, listening to the nurses' and Dr. Crittendon's voices passing outside the door. AT NO TIME did anyone "check in" with me or acknowledge the doctor's tardiness. At 12:05pm, I left the room and attempted to speak with one of the four nurses at their station just outside; however, each one was seated and on the telephone. Eventually, I just explained to the receptionist that I could wait no longer (another appointment was pending), and left the building. Now, I understand that physicians are often over-booked or encounter unexpected issues with their patients, however, I do believe that a modicum of professional attention could have been paid during my almost one-hour wait. But, of course, they did have time to process my debit card for the co-pay. I'm afraid my second visit to Med Help on Lakeshore will be my last.

name: Ricky Whitley
text: Love this place!  Quick and professional!

name: Jim Cowley
text: Very Impressed by the Medical Care provided. Will use them again for both my urgent care needs as well as primary care.

name: Elena Neumann
text:
Wow! Not what I was expecting for what I thought was a general "walk-in clinic." I called & made an appointment to meet with Dr. Pink Fulmer.

This place exceeded my expectations. As it took a few minutes for the front clerk to check me in; it didn't take long (maybe 10-15 mins) before I was being called back. (I am a new patient). The lobby to this office is modern, has plenty of seating, and has a neat "charging station" for smart phone users who are running on their last fumes. :) I got called back and the young lady who took my blood pressure/weight was really nice. We talked briefly of the symptoms and she got me back into my private waiting room.

It wasn't long before Dr. Pink was in my room talking to me and asking me about my symptoms and conditions. He has a very calming and relaxing personality which puts a nervous person like me to ease. He truly seemed to care about my concerns and listened to all of my worries about my "condition." He gave me a thorough examination, and even had some tests/xrays done that made me feel a lot better about what I "thought" was happening to my body.

He thoroughly went over my results and overall I was really pleased with he and all of his medical assisting staff. They were all really nice as I was super nervous about even being there. (I rarely go to the doctor). I also ended up getting a flu shot while I was there, and the girl who did it (med assistant) was sweet and did the deed quick and painless.

I was sad to learn that Dr. P. Fulmer will be retiring sometime this year; but I really liked this office and will give their other doctors a shot. Fast and convenient!

I also visited their in-house pharmacy (Rx Pharmacy) and I was thoroughly pleased. They were extremely quick and you can't get any better than picking up your prescriptions up at the same time you saw your doctor. It was cheap and the Pharmacy Owner (can't remember his name) was so down to earth and really pleasant to deal with.

Overall, really pleased with this medical experience and glad to know I have this great place so close to where I live!! :) My husband and I will be using them as our PCP.

**Side note** They also do walk-in's!! So if you are considering this as a walk-in option; try it. It's just as good (in my opinion better!!) than your typical "American Family Care!"

Thanks MEDHELP LAKESHORE!

name: Patrick O'Donnell
text: I have been seeing Dr. Pink Folmar since I was transferred to Birmingham in May of 2013.  The level of care this physician provides is the highest I have received in my 46 years.  His bedside manner is that of an "old world doctor" who would make housecalls if the need arose.  He genuinely cares about his patients.  As a modern physican, Dr. Folmar uses all current diagnostic tools and an incredible wealth of information to provide accurate, efficient health care solutions.  When you leave the office expect to have a detailed printout of your individual care and instructions for patient compliance.   January 6th, 2013 Dr. Folmar saved my life by finding a spontaneous pnuemothorax (collapsed lung) and directing my induction to Brookwood Medical Center.  I am grateful for Dr. Folmar.

name: DJ RaptorXS
text: Dr. Hickman is the best!

name: Sarah Inman
text: Dr. Felgner is one of those old school doctors that will sit and listen to you.  The office staff is friendly.

name: stam ahat
text: This place has the worst customer service I have ever seen. Zero in crowd management. This is a business after all, and they don't appreciate you.

name: Linda Wolfe
text: Excellent care at Med Help

name: Jarek Murdock
text: Terrible service, it's been this way for years! My mother had a SCHEDULED appointment and waited on the doctor for TWO hours just to be told that he couldn't see her. I contacted the COO and the supervisor only to be given a mediocre response. Never going back.

name: Emmalee Tidwell
text: The staff ignored me as I entered in and no one was at the desk when I came and signed in. They finally noticed me after a half hour and asked who I was. It was very frustrating and the staff was in no way punctual. I do not plan on returning.

name: Stephanie Smith
text: Best doctors & service

name: jd
text: Good doctors!

name: Mintrel Stewart
text: No sir go elsewhere

name: Kenny Sample
text:
(Translated by Google) Very rude front hand.

(Original)
Very rude front dest.

name: Jim Casteel
text: I liked the people but when it came to getting in tough with questions, it is almost impossible. The local office number isn't listed and the automated , leave your name type system, just didn't seem to get me anywhere. Very frustrating. The definitely isn't like dealing with your local doctor's office.

name: Mark Asperger
text: A spreadneck, covidiot anti-masker owns this place.

name: edward lyons
text: Malpractice. I have been having undiagnosed chronic body pain for almost 4 years and then Dr. Jernigan was supposed to give me a referral to a rheumatologist but they failed on the first try because of some lab tests mixup and then the 2nd one nothing was happening until i made some phone calls and finally got an appointment myself. Then i wanted to try a different medication to see if i could stop taking less of another drug. The new meds made me sick so i wanted my initial dose of the the original med back which i have been prescribed for almost 2 years. This man then ignored my request completely and reduced my dose again. I pleaded with the nurses on the phone but they told me he was going to cut me off completely before the date of my specialist appointment. Dr. Jernigan is by far the worst doctor i have ever experienced in my life. Doctors like him just proves that you can spend 8+ years in medical school and have absolutely no idea what you're doing. They also NEVER answer the phone. I've had to call OTHER medhelps to call them just so they'd answer the phone. I work and go to school full time and now i gotta find a new doctor. He cut me off of ALL of my medicine. Thank you now my pain is going to be way worse. Aren't doctors supposed to help with your pain? Guess not. Disgraceful.

name: Kalista Alexander
text: Dr McIntyre and his whole team were fabulous! They took care of my 12 year old when we had her tested for COVID.... so compassionate so good to children and parents! It’s a great feeling when they make you feel like family! Thank you guys so much!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Kalista!

name: Lauren Jones
text: This clinic has been so awesome! The nurses in the back were so amazing and did a great job. Belle was so sweet and helpful and the nurse practitioner did a great job explaining everything to me. Macy was so nice and did awesome swabbing me. Allison was amazing and convinced me to start seeing Dr Jernigan for all my pcp needs. Great clinic overall!

resp.text: Thanks, Lauren!

name: Brooklynn&Zach Moore
text: Medhelp narrows was a wonderful clinic. The three nurses Allison, Macy and Belle were great and such sweet girls. Would definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: MEGAN LAMONT
text: Went in Saturday after being sick all week. Front desk lady was super nice. Dr was very nice and i felt like he truly cared. This was my 1st visit since MedHelp took over that office and they were leaps and bounds better than when I was there last. Thank you!

resp.text: Thanks, Megan!

name: Rachel Hudson
text: Woke up with a terrible head cold, called around and no one was available to see me, even my primary. I called medhelp and they were so nice and accommodating. Fit me right in and after a quick negative covid test they were able to see me right then and got me in and out fast. Everyone was super nice and very friendly. I would definitely go here again.

resp.text: Thank you, Rachel!

name: Jasmine Robinson
text: The receptionist (Kerri) was very sweet , friendly. The nursing staff (Ethan, and Shelby) we’re very down to earth. Very professional. And the Dr. Russell was very sweet, and caring. I would highly recommend here to anyone. ❤️

resp.text: Thanks Jasmine!

name: Louis Bode
text: Very helpful, caring and responsive. Dr Shannon is helpful and spends the time to get to know you.

resp.text: Thanks, Louis!

name: Shannon Ray
text: Doctors and staff are always friendly and helpful!!

resp.text: Thanks, Shannon!

name: Stephen Jones
text: I use to come to this place for urgent care needs. They started offering primary care physicians and mine just retired. I started seeing Dr. Jernigan and he is the best primary care physician I have had in a very long time!

name: Shelby Hurt
text: I see Dr. Jernigan as my Primary Doctor. He is very thorough and has helped me tremendously! I definitely recommend him for your primary care needs!

resp.text: Thanks, Shelby!

name: Bell Eddins
text: Sad to see how this business responds to honest reviews...cringeworthy.  I have a big family and we live so close we would come here when sick, but I won’t be anymore out of fear that this place will be ugly to me when I’m the one who has an issue.  Very unprofessional to their clients.

name: Todd Stein
text: This place claims they are a family care facility, but my 11 year old son was turned away stating the doctor doesn’t see kids.  You May want to consider removing FAMILY from your business if you don’t see kids all the time

resp.text: Todd, your 11 year old needed to go to the ER. We appreciate you coming to MedHelp, however, as a parent, you should use better judgement. We are a family practice URGENT care facility and take pride in our ability to see all ages. We rely on our physicians to determine a standard of care based on the situation that is presented.

name: skyler barnard
text: Do not go to this place if you are sick. All they are going to do is look at you and tell you its viral so that you have to come back when you aren't better. What a scam and a dangerous game they are playing.  Oh and not to mention the horrible customer service. I'm really disappointed in how bad this place has gotten.  Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

name: Jamye Morris
text:
I had a terrible experience at MedHelp Narrows with Dr. Larisa Russell.  I took my daughter in today due to a two day headache, fever and fatigue.  Dr. Russell was very condescending, sarcastic and ended up joking that my daughter might have a brain tumor.  It was not at all funny.  I felt like I was under attack the entire visit.  When I tried to talk to her about my daughter’s headaches, she laughed at me and said “ are you sure she doesn’t have a brain tumor?  I said “
What did you say and she said it again”.  At this point I requested a new doctor.  She became even more rude and told me just to come back tomorrow when another doctor would be in.  I left the office shaking and crying.  It might not sound bad on the post but it was.  Having had loved ones die of cancer how could this be funny for anyone.  Did she give my daughter a flu test, no, a mono test, no, consider seasonal allergies even? This person has a terrible bed side manner and has no business working in the health care field.  I’m still not over it. By the way, the other ladies in the office ( nurse and office staff) were very kind and apologetic. No apology was given by Dr. Russell only a comment that I did not get her sense of humor.

name: michael jones
text:
I can't believe how horrible this place is now that they have changed company hands. I called one day because one of my prescriptions didn't get sent to my pharmacy. I was transferred to the nurse who talked to me horribly. She even insulted me repeatedly, yelled, and was beyond rude. She wouldn't listen to anything I had to say.

All I wan't to know to do was verify what was sent to the pharmacy. She kept going on and on about it was time for me to come in anyway for my three month check up, and I have already gotten, first she said three months, then changed it to six months of prescriptions already, (she was actually right the first time when she said three months) but it wasn't even two months yet. Which means I would have eligible for my third month. I didn't even receive the first month. So even if I did use the first two months, I would have still had one month to go.   But that wasn't my issue.

My issue was all but one of my other prescriptions actually made it to the pharmacy. I just need to confirm it was sent. My wife and I filed a complaint against her. And left them for another clinic. After requesting that my medical records get sent to the new clinic, I get a certified letter that they were dropping me. Lol, that was too funny. I never heard anything further about my complain against the nurse. And the certified letter was from the nurse manager that we actually filed the complaint with. So I guess if you complain about one of their nurses, you automatically get the axe lol. So I guess they get the green light to treat their patients any way they want.

But the nurse we filed the complaint against was the nurse for Dr. Jernigan. My wife who is also a nurse could overhear her said she's heard anything like that in the 20 plus years she's been an RN which is why she recommended that I file the complaint.

resp.text: Best of luck to you Mr. Jones.

name: Jackson Lake
text: Great Place for Urgent Care and also to establish a regular doctor.

name: Jessica Wallace
text: Been there twice now for minor sickness. Got seen right away and had great care.

resp.text: Thanks, Jessica!

name: Joshua Price
text: If you don’t feel good this is the place to go! Great doctors and nursing staff! Special thanks to Ashley, Shelby and Andi.

name: Harley Juneau
text: I have tried to schedule a covid test so many times here. For one-you cannot EVER get anyone to answer the phones and tells you to just schedule online so I did for Saturday morning at 8 am....got there and there was a sign on the door they decided to close!!! How unprofessional you either left it up where people could still schedule or you just didn't call us to let us know. You guys have wasted so much of our time when my husband had work this morning and we had to go find somewhere else down 280 (because your other location doesn't answer phones either). I wouldn't send my worst enemy here. Yall are awful!

name: Adira Dixie
text: Friendly, fast and gentle!  No one likes a Covid test but these guys are the best I have experienced.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Adira!

name: Jennifer Brand
text: Everyone there is exceptionally wonderful!!! Dr. Vaughn (dad and son) have provided top notch quality care for myself and family since I was 19 (47 now). We are so appreciative of the staff and Dr. Vaughn especially! We drive from PCB, FL just to see him every three months.

resp.text: Thanks Jennifer!

name: Beth Cline
text: The doctors here are wonderful. Especially Dr Mcfaden.  He is the best doctor I've ever had the privilege of seeing.  The whole staff is wonderful.  They are prompt to help with your every medical emergency needs no matter how big or small the situation.  They are my number 1 go to facility with all of my medical needs. I couldn't imagine using anyone else. If you want true medical treatment and you want to be seen fast, this is the place to go.  Thanks MedHelp. You guys are absolutely amazing!

resp.text: Thanks, Beth!

name: Jania Walker-Anderson
text: NEVER use this facility for your medical needs. Jeffrey Young, DO didn’t even do a physical examination when it was necessary. My symptoms persisted even after completing the medication he prescribed me. I had to go somewhere else to get the proper care that I needed. And now seven months later, I’m still being sent bogus bills for services not rendered. Save your time and money. Jeffrey Young, DO is definitely not my doctor of choice.

name: Allyson Varley
text: I love MedHelp! I’ve been getting my primary care here for over a decade. Dr. Russell is an excellent doctor and provides the highest quality of care. Anytime I need anything I am able to send Regina a message via the patient portal and my request is responded to at lightning speed. As I’ve gotten older, my healthcare needs have changed and they continue to evolve their approach to suit my needs. I am so grateful for both Dr. Russell and Regina’s willingness to go above and beyond for their patients.

resp.text: Thank you, Allyson!

name: Layne Viot
text: Left with an astronomical bill after scheduling what essentially should have been a FREE COVID-19 curbside test. Instead they decided to try other tests without me giving consent or the technician making me aware they were doing more than what I had scheduled the appointment for. Now I'm left with the bill. Never had this problem getting tested for COVID at MedHelp in The Narrows.

name: Jason Almon
text:
I had some problems getting all my prescriptions transferred from my pharmacy in Cahaba Heights to Walgreens at Ross Bridge in Hoover. After several attempts of getting some
help, an Employee named Taylor took the Time to get all of my business straight. She was very professional, respectful as well as courteous and Knowledgeable. It’s people like Taylor that make things run smoothly in any organization,  business or Medical facility.  Also,  Dr. Jordan Vaughn, his Nurse and Staff are another example of exemplary attention to detail, as well as true respect and care for their patients. Just as their motto says, they follow the Golden rule!
And that is very much appreciated!

name: Mark Asperger
text: A spreadneck, covidiot anti-masker owns this place.

name: TIARA CALHOUN
text: Mrs Pam is alway great when we come over to our appointments. She is the first person that has drawn blood from me an my mom an we have not complaints. Dr. Perry is our doctor and he always does an amazing job. Shout out to the whole 280 office, I wouldn’t trade y’all for the world.

resp.text: Thanks, Tiara!

name: edward lyons
text:
I'm astounded by how bad the service is at Medhelp. I just received a letter in the mail saying they wont provide any medical care to me anymore. DESPITE being on medications I've taken for years, they wont even give any refills or refer me to another doctor. All because i got upset over the phone. Unbelievable. Disgraceful. Not even sure if it's even lawful. I found another doctor in time for refills hopefully i can actually receive good medical care. Thank god now i wont be having withdrawals because of the incompetence of Medhelp. Malpractice at best. Proves anyone can get a degree or go to medical school for 8 years and be bad at your job.

Response to Owner: Thanks for absolutely nothing. You have done nothing but cause me more physical pain and stress since you cut me off. You do the exact opposite of what you set out for. You call yourself Christians, clearly a lie you don't know ANYTHING about the lord.

resp.text: Mr. Lyons, we are glad to hear that you have found a new doctor and hope that you get the help that you need.

name: Mohammad Firouz
text: If you expect to be treated nicely avoid this branch. The staff were not polite to me at the front desk. Instead use the other branch at Lakeshore with way better service

name: Sydne Rawls
text: I couldn’t be fit in for what I needed help with, but the front desk lady took it upon herself to find me information for someone who could! What a genuine and caring person. She really helped me and I will definitely use their service in the future because of it!

resp.text: Thanks, Sydne!

name: Andrea Wilbanks
text:
I recommend Medhelp to people all the time! I've had Dr. Perry for orthopedics and Dr. Mcfaden for primary and I have to say that I really liked them both, they are very nice and good doctors.  My husband goes to Dr.  Vaughn, has been for years and he wouldn't dare ever change doctors. The rest of the staff has always been friendly BUT I really must brag about nurse Pam! She is just so sweet and such a wonderful nurse. I've had so many blood tests and IVs at Brookwood over the last few weeks leaving my arms bruised
and veins blown. Every single nurse that I have encountered recently has had a hard and in some cases impossible time trying to stick me. Not Mrs. Pam! She just went right in like a breath of fresh air NOT having to dig around inside my arm with a needle! Thank you for making my most recent experience so easy.

resp.text: Thanks, Andrea!

name: Brenda Gonzalez
text: Everyone at the facility is soooo nice. A huge thank you to ALL the staff. I had given up on doctors roughly 3 years ago but they definitely gave me a new perspective on medical care. So thank you

resp.text: Thanks, Brenda!

name: L B
text: I just want to say how proficient and caring Eugene was in giving me a Covid and flu test swab. The procedure was very quick and painless, and delivered with a smile and caring nature. I was very pleased with this MedHelp facility.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Destin Booker
text: I have to brag about Pam…I’m generally a really hard stick and she got it on the first try. Also very sweet.

resp.text: Thanks, Destin!

name: Susan Latham
text: Due to cough and chest congestion, called to get covid test. Talked with Dr Willoughby via a short virtual visit.   She ordered covid test and, as an aside, said she would also run a lung test.   I should have said no to the additional testing.   Covid test was covered 100% with no deductible by my insurance.   The additional test was originally $653 which included an additional office visit, adjusted by insurance agreement to $322.33 all of which I owed since I had not yet met my deductible for the year.   Not pleased.

resp.text: Susan, we hate to hear that you haven't yet met your deductible, however, we are glad that you received the same excellent care that we provide for all of our patients. Thank you for choosing MedHelp.

name: Wendy Love
text: I needed a rapid Covid test, and Med Help went above and beyond to make sure I got it. Eugene was fantastic! I can’t say enough about his professionalism and caring attitude to make sure I got everything I needed. This is a group of outstanding individuals working through what is arguably a dangerous time for front line healthcare workers, and yet they still smile and treat you with kindness. I Highly recommend Med Help 280 because they are such compassionate and professionals.

resp.text: Thanks, Wendy!

name: Elizabeth Robinson
text: Litisa was amazing....:I did not feel good at all and she made the intake process a breeze...I will be recommending to all my family and friends....

name: April Showers
text:
We began going to Dr. Vaughn Senior at MedHelp on Lakeshore. We adored him. He was the most awesome doctor. However. Since he retired, the quality of care has steadily decreased to the point where at my husband's last visit for a wound that spontaneously opened on his lower leg, Dr. Willoughby would not even touch him to look at it and simply threw him a prescription for antibiotics and a dressing for him to apply HIMSELF, and told him to come back in ten days if it wasn't better. She did not do any sort of examination, biopsy, or treatment and showed little to no interest in why his skin would suddenly just open and begin to ooze blood on its own. Then she charged us $121. REALLY???
I had to take time off of work to take my husband to a REAL doctor who immediately sent him to a wound care specialist.
We will never go back to MedHelp.

name: Jonathan Braxton
text: I received excellent care and courstesy from Pam the tech in their Ultrasound Department. I love the service  when I go to Medhelp on 280!!!

resp.text: Thanks, Jonathan!

name: Rebecca Donze
text: We have called and been on hold for over an hour as the voice box was full and we couldn’t leave a message. When we did see a doctor they told us to go to the emergency room which we did and they stated our doctor should have taken care of the problem in their office as the hospital is there to see what your problem is and treat that and not what the MedHelp doctor advised us. Poor Service by doctors.

name: Amy Huddleston
text: I called this past Saturday to come in to get treatment for a standard sinus infection that arises normally this time of year with everything blooming. Was told by a hateful receptionist that I would not be seen unless I submitted to a Covid test, which FYI is illegal to try and force medically on anyone. I took my business elsewhere and got properly treated for my STANDARD sinus infection!!!!!

name: Kyle Mitchell
text: Terrible medical advise. In a time of medical need they throw me out to the curb. Trust me there the garbage. Lol joke folks.

resp.text: advice/they're - Best of luck to you Kyle.

name: Allyson Varley
text: I’ve been a patient here for over 10 years and have had a great experience. I see Dr. Russell regularly and she is a great primary care physician. They are super responsive to messages in the patient portal and provide really high quality care.

resp.text: Thanks, Allyson!

name: Cody Hall
text: I just had a COVId test done by Lauren B and she was very professional and sweet to my kids. If your unlucky and need a COVId test I would recommend Medhelp 280.

resp.text: Thank you, Cody!

name: jan schumann
text: Kelly from med help scheduled us for covid testing tonight. She was so efficient, friendly, professional and diligent. She was working after hours to help get everyone scheduled for tomorrow. I can’t thank her enough! Js

resp.text: Thanks, Jan!

name: Terrica M.
text: I come here for my routine visits. The facility is clean and everyone is taking safety precautions for COVID-19. The staff are super helpful and friendly. Thanks to Ms. Pam for jumping in and drawing my blood. Alesha and the rest of the nursing staff are wonderful too!

resp.text: Thanks, Terrica!

name: Laura Wilson
text: I came in with sinus pressure, stuffy nose and right ear ache. The staff is friendly, quick and efficient. The doctors and the nurses listen and respect you. I was in and out in one hour with a Steroid shot and antibiotics to help me. I will definitely go back and HIGHLY suggest Medhelp 280!

resp.text: Thanks, Laura!

name: Andrew Odom
text: I called to get tested for Covid-19 and the flu. Amber on Telehealth was caring, affectionate, took time to make sure I was taken care of and got me in super fast.

resp.text: Thanks, Andrew!

name: Laura B
text: Dr. Smothers and the nursing staff were incredibly helpful and professional. We were able to schedule a curbside COVID test after speaking with the doctor, and after arriving were tested quickly without an extended wait time.

resp.text: Thanks, Laura!

name: Wolfgang Landl
text: I was there to get a PCR Test. Fast and comfortable Testing from Evan

resp.text: Thanks, Wolfgang!

name: Martha Bath
text:
I’ve been seeing Dr. Jordan Vaughn for several years and I must say he is a very caring Dr., the fact that he listens to you  and always willing to help anyway he can!!  I say he is THE BEST!!

I want to give a huge shout out to Kennetha his nurse!!! She is very responsive anytime I leave a message, very prompt in returning calls!  She goes above and beyond for her patients, I’m thankful Dr. Vaughn & Medhelp have her she is truly an asset !!!!!!

Thank you KENNETHA YOU ROCK!!!
💖💙💖💙💖💙💖💙💖💙💖💙

resp.text: Thanks, Martha!

name: LaDarius Williams
text: Ayanna was great and made me feel special.

resp.text: Thanks LaDarius

name: Lax Factoid
text:
Awesome Ayanna!

My wife and I are flying to Kenya and require a negative PCR test to travel. We’ve traveled a few times internationally over the last few months and know the drill. However, our “go-to” clinic in Guntersville informed us that the lab they send their tests off to — Compass in Memphis, TN — was currently backlogged and may not be able to get the results before our scheduled flights. We searched and found MedHelp that has the capability to perform PCR testing and process the results ONSITE! So, we made the >90 minute drive to their 280 Office. We were greeted quickly — within 5 minutes of arrival — by Ayanna, who was professional and personable all at the same time, and made the unpleasant experience of having a swab jammed up your nose about as tolerable as possible. I should also mention that she’s adorably cute as well. ;-)

We had our printed results in under 30 minutes! So, MedHelp really bailed us out and we can continue with our Missionary plans to the orphanages in Africa without worry!

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Fred Blevins
text: I called at 8:00am and left a message to schedule Covid testing. I waited 3 hours for a call back. I didn't hear from them, so I went there. There was no drive up testing site. I asked several staff members and no one knew anything. It was very frustrating. I finally left and went to AFC.

resp.text: While we find this very hard to believe, we hope you were able to get tested quickly.

name: Corey Smith
text: Dr Mcfaden is awesome. Very knowledgeable. The nurses are very nice. I went in 3/4 of my way to a mental breakdown and they were very supportive, didn’t give any kind of judgment. I would recommend them 100%

name: Lisa Strawn
text: I will change this rating to 5 stars when the front reception workers mask up. I was there last week and asked why they were not wearing masks. Today the same woman checked me in and was again not wearing a  mask. Last week I called management was assured that masks are mandatory. The doctors here are great. The nurses knowledgeable and supportive.  Every know tool to prevent/slow the spread of Covid should be used. It us unacceptable for anyone, especially health care workers to not wear a mask.

name: Colleen Burroughs
text: My family member received excellent care for symptoms that needed referral to a specialist. Shelly P. worked tirelessly, over THREE months, to cut through administrative back-log at the specialist's office downtown. It meant calling her multiple times to re-request records I knew she had already sent. She remained patient and kind through a really cumbersome process. She had my family's back and even called me back to confirm the new appointment at the next office. Thank you Shelly for sticking with us! I am so grateful.

name: Matt Pritchett
text: Just talked to Kelly who is seeing up a test. Friendly, professional. I am thankful.

resp.text: Thanks, Matt!

name: Victoria Sutherland
text: The lack of communication is astounding. Everytime i  try to get my medication it just gets worse. Do NOT, I repeat do NOT come to this place.

name: Kimberly Willis
text: Dr. Perry is the best! I have been seeing him since I have been in the Birmingham area. If he were this ever leave this location, I would definitely follow him! He is truly an awesome soul. You ROCK Dr. Perry!

name: Thomas McMillan
text: This office runs like a well oiled machine when it comes to COVID testing!  We call late yesterday, they let us know that they were though testing for the day ( they stop at5pm). But we could call back at 8 am in the morning and get a same day appt.  I called at 8 the next morning and was immediately scheduled for my requested time of 4pm for the teledoc and then had til 5 to get to the parking spaces to be tested.  The teledoc actually called early and and inky took about 5 minutes.  We pulled into the parking lot at 430 pm for swabs. Got swabbed at 440, had the results and paperwork by 1700!!  This was a great experience!!!!

resp.text: Thanks, Thomas!

name: Taylor Dunn
text: Have been seeing Dr. McFaden for almost a year now and am very pleased. He’s been professional, had no problem writing my prescriptions that my old doctor refused to continue writing unless I seen a psychiatrist. Staff has always been kind, lobby and offices are clean. Usually don’t have to wait too long either. He’s pretty to the point with diagnosing and even though he doesn’t personally take Medicaid, he always writes my medication so that Medicaid will pay for it at the pharmacy. Which I greatly appreciate.

name: Chelsey Standridge
text: First time here and it was a pleasant experience. I usually don't like going to the doctor's office, because I'm sick and it takes forever. However, the entire staff was so kind and helpful!!! The doctor was very thorough, giving me a blood test, strep, and flu. The results were fast and I felt like the doctor was super nice and caring!! Everything was quick, and thorough Thank you! I will be referring people here!

resp.text: Thanks Chelsey!

name: Sarah Riley
text: Dr. Russell and her assistant Regina are absolutely amazing! The communication is outstanding!

resp.text: Thank you, Sarah!

name: Shaquita Houston
text:
I went thru 4 different ppl yesterday sticking me to draw blood and was told to come back the following day and Ms.Pam stuck me one time and drew all the blood samples I needed with ONE STICK!!
She’s awesome

name: April Gurley
text: Nurse Pam is amazing. I have small veins and it's hard to take my blood, let me tell you she finds them with ease. Within 2 mins. Blood taken and Ms Pam is on her next mission. Thank you Ms Pam for all you do. Thank you to Med Help 280 for always taking care of all of us.

name: Shawn Williams
text: SMALL KID COVID TESTING APPROVED!!!THE ONLY REPUTABLE URGENT CARE to count on during COVID. Other urgent cares are not using precise testing as this facility. After being given "false positives" by another urgent care NOT affiliated with MEDHELP ;and after visiting the ER and testing negative we were referred to Med Help for testing for myself and 2 small kids. Ethan, one of the nurses providing the test was super patient in administering to my 2 and 4 yr old  " there was no screaming or uneasiness while he gave the test" We opted for the send off test for more accurate results. The process this location offers from the telehealth visit to the COVID testing in their parking lot is so smooth and hassle free it seems as if it should be the standard procedure for all URGENT CARE facilities. KUDDOS to this entire staff at this 280 location!

resp.text: Thanks, Shawn!

name: Becca Jackson
text: I don't know if it's just bad luck but every single time I've gone to this place, it's been bad. Most recently I took my husband to get tested for covid, flu, and strep because he was running a fever. We set up the telehealth appointment, parked and called them to tell them the parking number, and we sat there for over an hour while we watched people come and go with their test results. At one point we were the only people there and still no one came. We called them and they literally forgot about us.... He tested negative but they said nothing about the other tests so we called them the next day and no one answered (their voice mailbox was full). Called the next day and they said the test would ready in three days. It's been a week and I am pretty sure no one is going to call or email us.

name: Lukas Pauer
text: The testing with Evan was very comfortable

resp.text: Thank you, Lukas!

name: Abigail Crafton
text: I have nothing but fabulous things to say about the entire practice! They are very responsive - even during a pandemic!

resp.text: Thanks, Abigail!

name: Angela Isbell
text: This is the best place to go. I know for my family we have been several places and none compare to the quality of care we receive here. Dr. Jordan Vaughn is the best of the best.

resp.text: Thanks, Angela!

name: Adam Franklin
text:
I didn’t make an appointment and they were pretty busy but it was a little frustrating that I had to wait for 2 hours. However, my nurse Taylor and the doctor were extremely nice.

I felt a bit dismissed though once the nurse cleaned out my ears. They told me the doctor was pretty backed up with patients so I could just go. They did call me back not long after though to follow up and put through a prescription!

name: LUVU1KX
text: I was there 01-28-20, at the Trussville location.  It's very traumatic when I have to get blood drawn, due to my tiny rolling veins.  Nurse Pam made me feel at ease, and drew blood on the first try.  I will ask for nurse Pam if I ever have to give blood again.  She was excellent

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Tim Lybarger Jr
text: Mrs Pam was awesome...best needle job ever

resp.text: Thanks, Tim!

name: Mary McLeod
text: Kelly, a nurse at Medhelp 280, was so pleasant and professional. We were asked to stay in our car because of fever; she was compassionate and kind and walked us through what to expect.

resp.text: Thank you, Mary!

name: Jim Warren
text: Everyone was kind and professional, my nurse Robin took care of all of my needs from drawing blood to x-rays and shots. Robin and Beverly were very friendly and professional at all times during my visit. Made my visit a pleasurable experience thanks to everyone there.

resp.text: Thank you, Jim!

name: Kenentha
text: I want to give a shout out to my co worker Mrs. Pam. She is always willing to lend a hand to help her coworkers. Her strong phlebotomy skills comes in handy.

name: Sherlodin
text: Waited for an hour for rapid testing

resp.text: ....during a pandemic. We hope you had a shorter wait elsewhere.

name: Alyson Perry
text: I didn't have an appointment and I was in and out of there in less than 20 minutes. Staff was friendly and helpful. Facility was clean and nice. The in store pharmacy was very convenient. Blew AFC out of the water.

resp.text: Thank you, Alyson!

name: Tonya Jernigan
text: Nurse Pam has a great personality and is amazing at her job!

name: Joseph Haupt
text: Dr. Willoughby and her staff was awesome! Stitched me right up and very sweet. Front desk was super kind as well! Couldn’t of been better!

resp.text: Thank you Joseph!

name: Abi Carter
text: My visit was wonderful and everyone was great. My only complaint is when they did my stats such as blood pressure, temp, ect. They did NOT have (or chose not to use) a heart rate/o2 sat reader. Due to my medical history I feel that is a very important tool to have in all doctor’s offices. I will continue to go here I just hope next time they are better prepared.

name: Elizabeth Wilson
text: The front desk staff and medicinal assistants were nice, but the physician I saw was dismissive and rude. I left the office with no real solution and feeling very frustrated. I will not be returning.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you are unhappy with your visit and will note in your chart that you will not be back.

name: Reginald Streeter
text: I was seen at the 280 MedHelp  location by Dakeltra and my blood pressure was really high and she was really nice an professional. I will return back to MedHelp 280 for my health care needs.

resp.text: Thanks, Reginald!

name: Michael Forrest
text: Dr. Jordan Vaughn and his staff have been most amazing. Don't be scared by the big building. The Doctors Nurses and other staff members have gone out of their way to make me feel like family. It would seems with the number of people they see there's no way the staff would remember me, but they do. I'm called by name. Then out of nowhere asked about events in my life that I may have mentioned like months before, if they are putting on an act they get a Grammy because it's always with genuine concern. To say you'll be treated with respect is an understatement. Dr. Jordan Vaughn has changed the way my mother in law from Homewood looks at family practices. She wanted to know why her doctor's office can't do what Medhelp does. My only answer is that's it's a different philosophy that's not only written on paper but practiced everyday. Crissy went out of her way to check on me when having a stress test. She made sure I was on time for another appointment. Truly treated wonderfully

resp.text: Thank you, Michael!

name: O A
text: Ive been seeing Dr. Vaughn for a few years now. He is an excellent and thorough physician. He always makes a point of addressing all of my concerns as well as keeping up with me on a personal level. The front desk is always very kind and courteous with me and everyone else in line with me. Also, the most important thing to mention is that I am seen at my appointment time! Im hardly ever waiting in the lobby, but even when I am waiting, theres free coffee!

resp.text: Thanks, OA!

name: Daphne Bell
text: I was being seen with my daughter at the 280 location and I spoke with Dakeltra she checked us in she was amazing and my daughter got dignosed with the flu but The last at the clinic was really nice and she got us in a timely manner I will keep this clinic in mind when I get sick or my  family members .

resp.text: Thanks, Daphne!

name: Sara Syron
text: Faither at the front was awesome and super helpful! She put a smile on my face even though I wasn’t feeling great! My primary care Dr is here and I keep coming back because of people like her and the staff that make when ya feel bad, feel better.

resp.text: Thanks Sara!

name: Madison Harbin
text: WONDERFUL clinic staff & dr’s. Dr. Jernigan is my PCP and he is thorough and listens to any concerns. All it takes is a little patience to see the Doctor and you are in and out! Nothing bad to say about ANY doctor. I have seen at least 4 of them.

resp.text: Thanks, Madison!

name: Leslie Brewer
text: Medhelp has qualified providers who are thorough. Beverly the NP saved my husband's life this week. He had very vague symptoms but she went above and beyond and in her expert discernment ordered a CT scan. Acute appendicitis was found and he was in emergency surgery hours later. So thankful for her care.

resp.text: Thank you, Leslie! We all prayed and we’re grateful that you received good news!

name: Elaine Scott
text: I have tried for 3 weeks to get an appointment to see Dr.  McFadden to get refills on my blood pressure medicine and and can't get one that works with my work schedule.  Two of the staffs members said they called out my blood pressure medicine on two different occasion and it's not there.  I called the 280 office and spoke to the staff there and they told me they didn't have any record if Dr. McFadden ever prescribing my blood pressure medicine.  I will find another doctors office that is capable of keeping better records of my health records.  This is very disappointing and frustrating.

name: Jenelle Golden
text: Being one that thinks ," I will be better tomorrow", when that does not happen I have used the Trussville MedHelp facility on several occasions rather than wait for an appointment with my regular doctor.  I have always received prompt and competent attention.  Also, last Fall my son, who did not have health insurance at that time, sought their assistance in treating him for a severe case of the flu.  They took care of him without a hassle and their charges were very reasonable.  I will and have recommended MedHelp.

resp.text: Thank you, Jenelle!

name: Donielle Holmon
text: The doctor, nurses, and other staff members were super nice and friendly. I have never gotten in and out of a doctor office that quickly! I will return if I need the doctor again.

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Thanks, Donielle!

(Original)
Thanks, Donielle!

name: Ali Marie
text:
My boyfriend went in because he was experiencing stomach issues for weeks and hadn't been able to keep food down in days.  The doctor here was dismissive and didn't believe his symptoms, they even said that "it wasn't what they did there".  BEWARE if you have vomiting or abdominal pain, they WON'T treat you!

He was in serious pain, and the doctor here recommended vitamins.  Also said he had been "sick for too long", and that they were more a place for a sprain, or the flu.  Seriously if you are in need of actual medical attention, not just a minor fix DO NOT GO HERE.  Its too bad zero stars isn't an option, they said his situation isn't "urgent".  Clearly they need to invest a bit more money in bedside manner and clinical training.

resp.text: We definitely do treat abdominal pain and vomiting. We hate to hear your boyfriend had an unpleasant experience, Ali, but in order for us to understand the nature of his visit and the circumstances surrounding his treatment, we will need to know who he is and when he visited us. Please ask him to contact us directly.

name: PC Harris
text: Great front desk staff and  nursing staff. I have seen various drs here over the last two years and been helped by their care. Dr. Hickman, Dr. Vaughn, and Dr. Smothers provided exceptional care.

resp.text: Thanks very much!

name: Angie Mills
text: I have been seeing Dr. Vaughn and his team for over two years. I wanted a Dr. who would help me in providing a natural approach to medicine, but who was also a medical doctor. I truly found that with Dr. Vaughn and I feel that following his suggestions have greatly improved my quality of life. It is very easy to get appointments and I don't have to wait forever in the waiting room like other offices. This team does a great job!

name: Corey Namors
text: Great staff. I've been there 3 times, unfortunately. Tosha was great and very personable. She actually remembered seeing me from ~4-5 months prior. Dr Vaughn is nice and informative and doesn't seem to rush through the process.

name: rick hurtt
text: I have been going to Medhelp for several years and have always been blown away by the service I have gotten and the attention to detail I have received when I see Beverly. I have been to doctors at other clinics who are not as thorough or meticulous and who just want to get you out the door. She wasn't like that.   I also appreciate Regina who I have had draw blood on me several times. I am a very hard draw and she gets me painlessly and without problem every time, whereas other places have had me fearing for my life.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Rick!

name: Kristen Russo
text: I have always had great service at MedHelp 280 with whatever I or my family member's issue was. Friendly helpful staff, and great docs and nurses. Nice waiting area, too.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Kristen!

name: Matthew Richards
text: Regularly use them as my family doctor, not for just another "doc-in-the-box." The staff cares about their patients and the doctors' listen to patients' needs and are extremely helpful. We have been here too many times to count and can't wait to see what changes the new building will bring!

name: Anna Martin
text: Had a great experience here.  I made an appointment and the wait time was average, about 15-20 min total.  Dr. Moor was SO nice and knowledgeable. I will be back!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Anna!

name: Jonathan Mardis
text: Couldn't give a higher rating. The staff is very friendly. The doctor I saw was knowledgeable and more than willing to spend time with me explaining my injury and follow up care. I highly recommend them to anyone who asks.

resp.text: Thank you, Jonathan!

name: Greg Waters
text:
Great experience! Friendly staff, minimal wait and top notch doctors.
They're open until 8 pm during the week and until 6 pm on the weekends, which makes it really convenient when I need to see a doctor quickly and without an appointment.
I will definitely recommend MedHelp!

name: Brandy Adams
text: Love all of the doctors and nurses at Medhelp. Nurse Shelley at the Narrows office  is wonderful and always very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you, Brandy!

name: Meagan Gaultney
text: I haven’t even been seen yet and I’m already so pleased with this facility. Since I’ve been here, (about 30 minutes) I’ve seen multiple waiting patients go back quickly and effectiently. I was concerned there might be a wait because I did not have an appointment but so far everyone is being seen quickly. The facility is extremely clean and the check in is on iPads! Love that idea as it makes checking in so much smoother. There is also a coffee bar inside which is always a plus. I haven’t even been seen but will definitely be coming back.

resp.text: Thanks Meagan!

name: Mr Smith
text: Was told my doctor Stevenson retired when she did not. Don't appreciate being lied to when she was the only reason I came here in the first place. Average wait is about 2-3 hours or more, this place gets so busy you always have a long wait even with an appointment. Would recommend pretty much any other place.

resp.text: Sorry you were disappointed in the answer you were given, however, Dr. Stevenson did retire from MedHelp. Best of luck to you, Jezebel.

name: Hayden N
text: I'm not going to complain about the wait, because literally everyone and their mom was there. However, I came in complaining of strep throat. And as I guessed, I had it. They gave me an antibiotic and a steroid shot. But that's ALL they did. They did not do a flu test, look in my ears or nose. I didn't realize that I had to complain of those symptoms for them to take 30 extra seconds and check them. 8 hours later I am home and have the chills and body aches. I have had the flu a few times, and this is exactly what it feels like. Now I'm going to have to go back somewhere else in the morning, wait for an hour and have another copay, when this should have been taken care of on my first visit. Again, I get they were busy, but they should have done a more thorough check.

name: Kohler
text: I saw Dr. Orso in the past and today I saw Dr. Vaughn. The facility was clean and the staff was excellent. The doctors were incredibly professional and never made me feel rushed or uncomfortable. I will continue to use and highly recommend them to anyone. Thank you to everyone who works there.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Sondra Ryel
text: Walk-in appointment for acute illness. Very short wait time. Physician very thorough and personable. All personnel were professional and friendly. Overall, a very positive experience. This facility has become my new "go-to" for any urgent care needs.

resp.text: Thank you, Sondra!

name: Cyla Kelow
text: Management is unprofessional in handling patient grievances. Yes miscommunication happens all the time but for Greg Walters to not only call to find out what happened but then calls again which is recorded by the way and bluntly be disrespectful and tells me he reviews information and his employee was in the right smh not healthcare had turned into money money money not about being compassionate or sympathetic at all horrible

resp.text: This patient has never been seen by MedHelp and will not be allowed to do so.

name: Chris Bever
text: Front desk is the best help I’ve ever had at a medical facility and Dr. Larissa Russell is a delight!

resp.text: Thanks Chris!

name: Nameless Faceless
text: The doctor and medical technicians that I saw were very professional and very kind. The building itself was very clean and organized. The wait wasn't terribly long. I will definitely be returning to this urgent care.

name: Stevie West
text: Medical assistant was very sweet. Dr. Scott on the other hand was a condescending jerk and treated me like an addict and proceeded to yell at me.

resp.text: MedHelp doesn’t have a Dr. Scott. You have MedHelp confused with another clinic.

name: Rachel Cattell
text: I don't care about waiting time, I've never waited more than 30 minutes in the lobby. Most doctors here are top of the line, especially Dr. Bridges and Dr. Perry. But the staff in the front seem inconvenienced and don't go out of their way to help you or call you back.

name: Kelly Chadwick
text: MedHelp 280 has always been our go-to place for check ups and urgent care. The staff has always been thorough and caring. I recommend it to friends all the time.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelly!

name: DAMIANO RODGERS
text: I went in the HWY 280 location, and I was denied service because they stated since it was flu season I could not be seen.  This was per the so called physician that works there, the time it took me arguing with them and going back and forth I could have been done and gone.  Then they had the nerve to send me an email stating patient came in but not seen!  I have Blue Cross Blue Shield insurance, and was denied service due to being deemed not an emergency medical condition. I usually go tot he trussville location in which I have not had any issues there.  I have never been denied any type of treatment. The physician or so to speak there of would not even come out and tell me such a thing . I will be reporting, this matter all of the way up the chain plus contacting Blue Cross as well!!!!

resp.text:
Mr. Rodgers,

While we understand your concerns, your visit doesn’t fall within the parameters of urgent care and does require you to see the same physician you’ve been seeing. The number to BC/BS of Alabama is 1-800-292-8868. We wish you the best of luck.

MedHelp

name: Courtney H
text: Great experience. Clean waiting room, friendly staff. Got in and out quickly. Doctor was friendly and addressed my needs. I would go back again.

resp.text: Thanks, Courtney!

name: Kimi Portabella
text: I have been struggling with severe pain on my back. I went to see my chiropractor and he suggested for me to go see my regular doctor to get a prescription to help with the pain. After unsuccessfully trying to get an appointment with my regular doctor, I made an appointment with MedHelp (suggested by my chiropractor). I was SO impressed with the service I got by MedHelp, from the receptionists, to the nurse that took my vitals, to the Nurse practitioner, to the doctor. From the moment I step in the building, I felt people cared and were concerned with my circumstances. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. Extremely impressed!

resp.text: Thank you, Kim!

name: Bill Powell
text:
I've had Dr Michael Vaughn at Medhelp as my primary physician since 1996.  He is the best and most widely knowledgeable Doctor I've ever associated with.  At a walk in clinic all their doctors must have a wide range of knowledge and experience and Medhelp is the very best.
The doctors there have literally saved my life more than once over the years.  I recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Thanks so much Bill! We really appreciate it!

name: Jesslyn Blake
text: I’ve been seeing Dr. J. Vaughn at MedHelp for around two years now. I’ve never had to wait more than 20-30 minutes to be seen on a busy day, and in some cases have been seen almost immediately after checking in. Dr. Vaughn is kind, caring, and thorough. He takes a genuine interest in his patients’ well-being. The staff is friendly and the office is always clean and tidy. The only complaint I have is that it seems very difficult to get issues resolved or prescriptions authorized by calling the office and/or leaving messages on the nurses’ line. Even my pharmacy has had trouble getting a phone call returned. Other than this one, occasionally very frustrating flaw, MedHelp is an excellent clinic with excellent doctors and staff. 10/10 recommend.

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Thanks, Jesslyn!

(Original)
Thanks, Jesslyn!

name: Ron Moos
text: I have been going to MedHelp for 15 years, both the one on Lakeshore and more recently MedHelp 280.  Have I ever had less than 5 star service ever? Only once, but I didn't like the lecture I got for smoking when I had pneumonia.  In retrospect, I deserved it, but I was not happy at the time.  Other than that 4 star rating, I have nothing but the highest praise for the physicians because they truly do listen and are sincerely devoted to helping.  During one annual physical exam, my blood sugar was elevated, and I was given several options on how NOT become a diabetic.  I really didn't want to give up my chocolate candy, didn't want to take the medicine, didn't want to get stuck in the finger frequently to test my blood sugar at home, and didn't want to exercise more. But, I followed doctor's orders, and my last two A1C annual tests have been good.  Dr. Mike Vaughn and Dr. Jordan Vaughn are my preferred physicians at either the 280 or Lakeshore locations. but when neither one was available, I have experience great care from either a staff physician or a physician assistant.  Being a senior citizen who has live in many different cities with top notch medical schools, I can honestly rate MedHelp as among the elite and would certainly rate their services better than some local hospitals.

name: Brittney Stoll
text: A couple of weeks ago, I got a pretty nasty cut on my leg. This was after 6 on a Sunday. We drove to the 280 location and Dr Jordan Vaughn happened to be outside. I asked if they were open, and he told me no, but looked at my leg anyway. He decided to go out of his way to help me and took great care of me. This was my first visit to an urgent care facility and I was floored that he was willing to go above and beyond help me. This place, and Dr Vaughn will  be my Dr of choice from here on out.

name: Desiree Scott
text: Been going here for years started at the Trussville office first I have always had the best care . Dr. Vaughn is an awesome doctor that will answer any questions you need.

resp.text: Thank you, Desiree!

name: Luis Sanchez
text: Service is great but when calling these people they will leave you on hold for an unacceptable amount of time

resp.text: Luis, thank you for your feedback. We will look into why you were left on hold and rectify this issue asap.

name: Karen Fili
text: The clinic did a great job today.  Quick flu test and diagnosis.  I was in and out in about an hour. Very professional.

resp.text: Thanks so much Karen!

name: Chandler Moore
text: Came in about an hour and a half before close, but was still there at 8 when they close and all of a sudden it just felt like they were rushing to get me out. On top of that, they took a nose, throat, and blood test but failed to diagnose me with walking pneumonia (which I found out 2 days later after going to AFC) so I went into work the next 2 days miserable but thinking it was just a bad cold. The doctor also tried to prescribe me all these antibiotics and other medicines without even knowing what the problem was. Very impersonal, he just sat on his iPad typing in the prescriptions rather than talking to me and informing me of anything

name: Ravyn Davis
text: It was an amazing experience this is actually my second time coming and everytime I come everybody is always polite. Mrs. Patrick was absolutely phenomenal. Mrs. Patrick covered my co-pay because I didn't have it at the moment. She didn't have to pay my co-pay, but she did I mean she is a true blessing. Thank you so much again!  I came in here in a bad mood and leaving with a smile on my face! I recommend anybody to come to Medhelp. you will not be disappointed.

name: David Price
text: I've had two terrible experiences with medhelp 280. They misdiagnosed me twice. Both was from lack of investigation and completely ignored my comments. The nurses are very short with you on the phone and are rarely helpful. They "patch" you up and tell you to come back in a week. All they care about is getting your money rather than taking care of the patients.

name: Sami Daniels
text: This is one of the worst places to go for actual medical care.  I asked for a blood test and got a prayer instead.  I didn't need a faith healer but actual medical care.  I was in the hospital having medical procedure days later for something they SHOULD have been able to handle very easily.  NEVER going back and I did use this place many times because it is close to my home.  The quality of care has diminished in the last 5 years.  I know several people that refuse to return because of their own experiences.

name: Nasasha R
text: I have been going to MedHelp 280 for over 2 years and have never had a problem until after the remodel. Prior, the doctors or nurse practitioner would actually take their time to diagnose you and actually figure out what the issue was. Now, with the expansion and increase in patients, it's really just a get you in, guesstimate your issue, and get you out. I go in the other night complaining of stuffiness, sore throat, and other flu like symptoms, PLUS lower back pain that hurts when I walk or move. The doctor tells me it's possible that I have a UTI and then says he needs to go and review the urinalysis??? How do you determine something like that before reviewing it!!!?? Come to find out, what I actually have is a lower back sprain which makes so much more sense. For the copay I gave, I would have been better off diagnosing myself. I wouldn't waste my time with this urgent care facility. The doctors and nurses may be friendly, but I would rather you just be thorough and accurate.

resp.text: Nasasha R, it sounds as though the Doctor needed to rule out the possibility of a UTI, which is why he wanted to review your urinalysis. That is being thorough and striving for accuracy, hence the diagnosis of a back sprain. Sorry that you were disappointed with your visit.

name: Niyah Jordan
text: The staff was extremely professional. It was my first time seeing the doctor without my mom. Tosha made me feel very comfortable through the entire process. Additionally, the service was fast and Dr. Willoughby was patient in explaining my diagnosis.

resp.text:
(Translated by Google) Thanks Niyah!

(Original)
Thanks Niyah!

name: Courtnie Harris Anderson
text: This was one of the worst Emergi-care facilities I have ever been to. I have Access Health and the lady let me sit there with no paperwork for an hour, only to have an extremely nasty attitude when she realized I had signed in. Please do not go here. The doctor literally gave me multiple shots and antibodies after 2 mins of speaking with me. Save your time and go to your real doctor. This place gives the true meaning of Doc-In-The-Box.

name: Jena Callaway
text: If a negative rating were possible I would give it. Medhelp 280 is HORRIBLE. The doctors do not thoroughly evaluate their patients, and the billing department will screw you everytime. My first visit was related to suspected appendicitis. The doctor talked to me for 10 seconds and told me to just drive myself to the hospital. Verdict at the hospital after 4 hours and $450 later--not appendicitis. With a thorough exam, the waste of time and money could have been avoided. My second visit was for respiratory issues. Again, extremely minimal time spent with me (the patient) in the exam room. I was given a steroid shot and told it was allergies. Four days later, my symptoms the same, I go back to be diagnosed with walking pneumonia. I was charged twice. Once for each visit, even though the visit four days later was for the SAME symptoms they dismissed four days prior. Again, a thorough exam could have avoided this poor decision could have been avoided. Their billing department is a joke. I had to pursue it for a week and a half just to talk to a person about it; they never call back.

name: Wendy W
text: I would have given them a zero, but that wasn't an option. I was seen, diagnosed with a sinus infection although my entire body was hurting and no x-rays or blood work was done. No flu or strep test was administered. I was given a steroid shot and an antibiotic shot, along with an antibiotic prescription. Less than 15 hours later I called complaining that my chest was hurting with every breath only to be informed I would have to pay ANOTHER co-pay to be seen. They stated that it was a "new symptom" when this could have been there all along but with no chest x-Ray who would have known. My son and I were both seen. $75 worth of co-pays down the drain. Thanks for nothing. We will not be back.

resp.text: Hi Wendy W. I'm very sorry to hear that you were unhappy with your visit to MedHelp. We strive to provide our patients with the highest quality care available. While we never want anyone to be unhappy with their experience, there are instances when a patient doesn't respond well to their treatment and/or symptoms develop after they are seen. We hope you'll re-consider coming back to us and certainly hope that you're feeling better. If your symptoms have yet to improve and you are able to come back in, please do so and we will waive your co-pay. Please ask for Greg.

name: Kendahl Schnell
text: I was pleasantly surprised to see my favorite doctor, Dr. Willoughby, after a rather long wait (I always recommend getting am appointment if you can). She's the dermatologist, but saw me for my cold/flu symptoms today. Her nurse kept me distracted for the two shots I had to get and I had me laughing.

name: Tifani Sorensen
text:
This is the WORST place to get medical help. The front desk was extremely unfriendly and so so slow. I feel like I just wasted my time and money. NO HELP! The doctor acted like I am just a waste of time. And if you have a question, or need to call, good luck!!! they will NOT return your call. I now have to go to another Dr for the same reason I went to this Dr. Wasted my time and money.

Please don't waste your time on the clinic.

name: Amanda Duren
