text: I had the best experience here last night. I arrived after work and didn’t have to wait very long to be seen. Everyone that I spoke with was so friendly and helpful. I ended up getting two shots for a sinus infection and bronchitis and felt a little nauseas afterwards. The nurse (I unfortunately didn’t get her name) was so sweet and patient with me! She and Dr. Bernreuter were wonderful!

resp.text: Thanks, Amanda!

name: Zel Fayt
text:
I've visited this location quite a few times and the conclusion i have come to is it's hit or miss. You had better come in with something identifiable and you already know for a fact what you need to help it if you are seeking good aid. The Dr's don't seem to think too much about what may be the problem and are quick prescribe you something ludicrously expensive than actually figure out what might be your problem. They are eager to get you in and kick you out while you are left in pain to get that medical bill up and since you are frantic for help you revisit when what they prescribed you doesn't work in the slightest.

No mention of referral or tests are spoken just "If this doesn't work come in again and we'll prescribe you something else". I ended up having enough of the BS and watching the bill escalate. I ended up figuring out what was wrong myself and self-helped faster than the professional could.

I'll say again If you have something easily treatable then it's a good place to go as it's a quick in and out. Place is clean and staff are ok.

name: Steven Allison
text: Worst customer service ever. URGENT CARE IS 10X faster and filled with staff who cares about customer service and your health. WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME. LINES ARE LONG.

resp.text: Mr. Allison, MedHelp is Urgent Care. Are you sure you visited MedHelp? We don't have any record of you in our system. It seems as though you've posted a review for the wrong facility.

name: Red Farms
text: I only go to the dr when I am truly sick. I went there today on my lunch break because I was having trouble breathing. I felt like I had walking pneumonia, I know how it feels because I've had it before. Dr Orso said that was impossible because I was not running a fever, never ran a fever in my life. He said I had allergies. No bloodwork, no chest xray no nothing but his careless diagnosis. Do not waste your time or money going here. Dr Orso is truly an old quack, retire old man, you are obviously worthless at being a dr.

name: Emily Austin
text: The staff was great and Tosha did a great job when I had to have blood drawn.

name: Aubrey Gilliland
text:
Don't go here unless you absolutely have to. Very rude and disrespectful staff. They were not very nice, helpful, or well trained to do thier job.
They are not here to help you, they are here to pay bills.

resp.text:
After looking into your visit, we don't have any record of having seen you as a patient.
You apparently have the wrong clinic.

We're very sorry to hear you were disappointed with your visit. We strive to make every patient happy with every aspect of their care at MedHelp and hope that you will call us to give us more information as to what caused you to be dissatisfied.

name: Liz Maddox
text:
Doctors and nurses here are always kind but to the point in a professional manner. They always explain my diagnosis to me in a comforting and informative way.

Most importantly (to me)- I am a very "hard stick"- it usually takes seasoned veterans 3 or 4 tries to get blood work on me, if at all. If this is you, ask if Tosha is there! She and another nurse practitioner were both able to draw my blood on the first stick and were very understanding of my anxiety caused by my usual uncomfortable experience! Knowing that blood work isn't going to be a nightmare is what brings me back to MedHelp 280 (and sickness). Thank you, Tosha!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Liz!

name: Kristen Harrison
text: I had talked to them on the phone about a drug test I needed done that day, I live over an hour away and didn't realize I had to take one til later in the day. I arrived exactly at 8, not even 8:01, and they locked me out.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience, however, our hours are Monday through Friday, 8 am to 8 pm, 8 am to 6 pm on Saturday and 1 pm to 6 pm on Sunday. Hopefully you can find a clinic closer to you so you won't have to drive an hour away for a simple drug test. While we are glad to help you during our normal business hours, driving to a clinic so far away seems counter intuitive. Best of luck to you.

name: John Glenn
text: Don't get there within an hour of closing, because all they're worried about is going home. And that is not the front desk people, that is the doctor and the nurses. Ridiculous, waste of time.

name: Cindy Anderton
text: Quick service and friendly, knowledgeable staff.  I will definitely be back:)

resp.text: Thank you, Cindy!

name: Linda O'Bryant
text:
On 10/26/17 I broke my foot and drove myself to Med Help near Target on Why 280. My doctor was good, no complaints there.  After staying at home for a couple of days, I realized I needed a handicapped placard for my car so I could get in an out of places like Walmart.  I went back to MedHelp. I am 70 years old and live alone.  The front desk staff, and in particular one young lady, seemed preoccupied and not interested in helping me standing there with a broken foot.  In fact, I had to move to another window to get any help as the first lady was too busy in casual conversation and disinfecting her chair.
I was told that I could not get a handicapped placard without making an appointment with a nurse (payment, I'm sure).  Ridiculous!

name: Charmaine Perry-Livers
text: Very nice staff and the Doctors are caring! I wouldn't go any place else for Urgent Care!

name: Charlotte Lewter
text: I have been going here for the last 5 years and have always gotten excellent service.   I have asthma and have had several episodes of bronchitis and pneumonia and they have treated me as well as my asthma doctor does.

resp.text: Thanks Charlotte!

name: Courtney W
text: Took my daughter in last night.  Nurses and Dr. Willoughby were great!  Facility was nice and clean.  Minimal wait time.  What I expected to take a couple of hours took less than an hour.  YAY!!  The only reason i'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars-FRONT DESK!  No greeting, no  smiles, looked like they hated their jobs, pretty rude to be honest.  With that being said, this will not deter me from using MedHelp in the future, just thought you might want to know.

name: Patrick B.
text: I placed an appointment online 4 days before the scheduled day and I followed-up the day before by calling and a lady told me that online appointments dont work. It's apparently a known issue but they dont seem to care about fixing it. Will not return.

name: Rachael Riddle
text: The facility is nice and clean, the front desk receptionist and my triage nurse (Mischa) were incredibly pleasant. Dr. Felgner leaves something to be desired for bedside manner. He seemed to be passive about some of my symptoms presented. Maybe this comes from having been a medical assistant for another doctor, but I felt as though he thought I was adding irrelevant problems. However, I don't feel like this necessarily warrants a bad review, as it's more my personal opinion. That being said, he did listen when I told him what has and hasn't worked for me in the past (I've had similar episodes of what I have now once or twice a year for about 3 years now). He seemed to be more focused on his frustration with the computer program than he was focused on the patient exam... he just wasn't very personable. I'd use this facility again, as they are convenient to where I live, but probably only on weekends when I can't see my PCP.

name: Richard Inman
text:
A lot of hassle for an ear ache
I took my daughter in for an Ear Ache. They prescribed eardrops that cost $256.00. I spent 2 hours of my work day driving back and forth to various pharmacies and Med help. Finally the Dr got on the phone with the pharmacist and prescribed ear drops that cost $165. The pharmacist filled the script for $15 by substituting eye drops instead of eardrops. The Dr seemed to be very out of touch with the real needs of parents.

name: Katrina Nakhjavan
text:
The worst possible healthcare with the most possible amount of hassle and wasted time. If you are "sick in body or spirit" (as their ridiculous phone recording states), I would go somewhere else.

Also, see below where they claim to have "no record" of having seen me at this facility. Lol okay. Idiots.

resp.text:
Hi Katrina,
You have MedHelp mistaken with a different facility. We have no record of having seen you as a patient.
Please check your facts before leaving inaccurate google reviews.
Best of luck to you.
MedHelp

name: Rebecca Armstrong
text: Great fast service, Tosha was very kind and caring.

name: Kaila Ogle
text: I called ahead of time and told the lady that I think k my son brine his collar bone, she told me how much it would cost to have a X-ray and for the visit.. i told her we were coming from sylacauga and she said ok we will see you when you get here and when we get there im signing him in and she said has he ever been here then she asked how old he is and I told her 4 and she says we can't see him i was like WHAT!!! She said yeah he's not 6 and I said well y couldn't yall tell me that on the phone before we drove an hour to come here! Where can I take him then and with a verry smart ass audited she said ummmmmmmm I don't know maybe I don't know!!! I was like whatever... she wasted my time with a kid that has a broken collar bone and didn't seam to care at all... she doesn't deserve to have that job where she has to interact with a parent like this!! It's uncalled!!! I will never come to this place again and I will tell everyone I know and I will post on different pages for people not to come there,  promise I will go above and beyond to let everyone know about what happened!!!

name: Hannah Radermacher
text: I have been here a thousand times and it has progressively gotten worse each time. When I got there I signed in as normal and sat down like I always have and waited to be called to pay my co-pay. When I went to the receptionist she told me my co-pay is $60, well EVERYTIME I've ever been there I have paid for a regular PCP copay which is not $60. My insurance has not changed. I asked the receprionist why it was $60, with an attitude she said "because that's your urgent care copay look on your card it's on your card", so I explained that I had never paid for an urgent care before and I've never made an appointment to come in so it didn't make sense for my co-pay to all of a sudden jump 35 dollars. Receptionist was extremely rude and gave no explanation except "this is how it is if you're not going to pay it then leave". Very disappointed and extremely annoyed at this point. I will never l go back again. I do not recommend you go. Previous to this experience I had a doctor who diagnosed me incorrectly 4 different times, where I had to come back and pay the copay 4 different times because the doctor could not diagnose me correctly, and they would not waive my copays. Prior to that, I had to get a steroid shot and a week after the shot, the spot became infected and growing large and swollen and filled with green puss. I had covered it with bandaid and washed it normal as I always have. I don't know what is going on with this facility but the staff needs to get it together.

name: Lee Wilson
text: Not LGBT friendly, I had a one night stand. The condom broke and I wanted to get tested. The nurse practitioner(Doctor) told me that a penis doesn't go there.

name: amanda maze
text: This facility ran tests and said they were unable to even read results during my time at the facility. The doctor perscribed two medications without having a diagnosis. The nurses at the checkout were very rude and sent me back in for a doctors excuse for missing work and had to wait 10 minutes while the nurses and Doctor ate their Arby's in front of me for me to get excuse. They were telling each other to make it for me, which I felt like my time was not worth theirs. The doctor said he assumed it was the flu and perscribed me two medications when it was not after further test results at another clinic. The doctors perscribed medications that were not covered by my insurance and also perscribed a medication I did not show symptoms of even needing that drug. The billing associate was also extremely rude after two days of trying to contact the office with no call back. After finally reaching the billing office and paying the bill for tests that were not even able to be useful since they took longer to show results for than the time of being there, hung up on me at the end of the conversation without thanking for even using their clinic. I work in customer service and rate this clinic overall as a one out of five because of the doctors and nurses. The only thing I cared for about this facility is that it was that it was clean. I never want to use these doctors again that want you in and out so quickly. They run tests without looking at the results and diagnose you as quickly as possible to get you in and out. It doesn't help that the workers are not appreciative of your business either.

resp.text:
Amanda,
We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your experience at MedHelp. If there is anything we can do to reconsider using MedHelp, please let us know. We strive to offer the very best care with the least amount of wait. Thank you for your feedback.
MedHelp

name: Katherine Archer
text: Great Physicians and great care! Minimal Wait.

name: lori shamblin
text: I visited MedHelp and had an amazing experience!  If you are looking for a Primary Care Office or Urgent Care you need to visit MedHelp!

resp.text: Thank you, Lori!

name: Leah Thornton
text: cannot get them to answer my calls or call me back. Have been trying for a week now.

resp.text: Were you seen as a patient at MedHelp? We don't see any record. Any feedback you could provide would be greatly appreciated so that we may use the information to better serve our patients.

name: Tyler Gowens
text: Doctors were very nice, but the  receptionist at the front were extreamly rude! Other then that It deserved 5 stars.

resp.text:
Thanks for your feedback. We will work to make sure that our front office staff is as friendly as possible. We appreciate you letting us know.
Greg Waters

name: William Byerly
text: LOve this place, best doctors in the area!

resp.text: Thanks so much!

name: Joseph Strain
text: Dr. Mcfaden is good but staff is poorly trained and lack basic manners.

resp.text: Mr. Strain, please email me directly at greg.waters@medhelpclinics.com with more information regarding your experience so that I can address your complaints with our staff.

name: JJ Sports
text: Attitude

name: Rudy Rudulph
text: Receptionist has too much attitude

resp.text: We’re sorry that you had a bad experience, however a copay is required at time of service.

name: Sam Disston
text: Friendly staff, in and out within an hour.

resp.text: Thanks, Sam!

name: Justin Simon
text: Desk and phone.

resp.text: Troll

name: Kristina Visser
text: No regard for patients time.    Waited over 2 hrs to be seen.  Only four patients were ahead of us

resp.text: Thanks for letting us know, but a sports physical isn’t urgent. We pride ourselves on our ability to take care of Urgent needs first. We appreciate you choosing MedHelp.

name: Adrianna Bowen
text: worst experience ever, associates were extremely rude and it took them an hour just to tell me they don't take my insurance.

resp.text: Sorry to hear that Adrianna, however, we have no record of having seen you as a patient. It seems as though you must have the wrong clinic.

name: Tamara Owens
text: Awesome

resp.text: Thanks Tamara!

name: Robett Robinson
text: Excellent service, obtained Covid shots for travel.

name: wilhelmina bean
text: Don't go here.  Nursing staff is NOT trained properly, tried to push a hugely thick I.V. into my daughters arm causing tremendous pain, they said they were sorry they were out of the standard sized I.V.!!... sat for almost 2 hours to see anyone.  When you try to call (tried calling 20 times over 3 weeks) they NEVER answer the phone.  unbelievable really.

name: Angelisa Madison
text: I came to this place to see if they could find out what was making me have fevers, headaches, and chills after going to multiple urgent cares days before hand with no results. This office gave me every test they could and even gave me an X-ray to find out what was going on. They went above and beyond for me. After getting mediocre help at the other urgent cares I definitely recommend everyone to come here. At least they care about finding out what’s going on with you than just collecting the $30 copay the other places want. 5 stars!! If I could give more I would! 🥰

name: Vicky Tran
text: They don’t answer the phone ever. Wait time is forever which doesn’t make sense considering when they do get to you they rush so they can move on to the next patient.

name: Joseph Miller
text: Went in for sinuses and was told that required a covid test, but they stop covid test at a certain time.  It's called urgent care for a reason. Load of garbage

name: Trinae Carter
text: The staff is terrible I sat there for almost an hour until I got up to see why the wait and the front desk staff say O you gotta have a covid test. Okay really so when was you going to tell me or just let me sit in the waiting room with NO covid symptoms and be in pain. I really liked the doctors but the front desk staff needs to be in class for caring for patients in pain. Thank you for wasting my time while I am in pain because they could have told me that over the phone. Thumbs down to this establishment.

name: Min Kim
text: Dr.Wahid is a good and caring doctor but the staff and management is just terrible. Does not feel like they value patient urgency or needs whatsoever. Would love to go back with a change of staff but until then, do yourself a favor like these comments say and go somewhere else.

name: Mary Durham Anderson
text: I have got to find another primary. I went to my appointment and waited 2 hrs before seeing the Dr. She never called in my prescription, I've called and received a message that there is no room to leave a message. Meanwhile my blood pressure is 147/102. I need a Dr that is concerned about my health not my wallet.

name: Joseph Dillard
text: doctors are so so but the service from the nurses and staff is the worst...would not recommend this office to anyone

name: Brent John
text: Highly recommend not use them!!!!! Terrible doctors both husband and wife. If you’re healthy and just need to see a Dr. for yearly visit then okay. But they very unprofessional. You tell them about symptoms and their response will be like- things happen with aging it’s normal nothing to worry.

name: Laura Rumer
text: I came in because my primary care doctors office was closed and the doctor and his staff were all helpful and answered all my questions. They did tests and tried every possible way they could to help me. I will definitely be going back there! I strongly recommend this place!

name: Patti Burgener
text: My husband had COVID, and Dr. Wahid managed his care very well.  I truly believe his symptoms were lessened due to the medicine the doc prescribed and the supplements he recommended.  I was very thankful for his care.  Also, the nurses were amazing!!

name: Coach Miles
text: Phone system or office management leaves much to be desired.  It’s 5:10pm...  web says they close at six, phone system says 8:00...  system says to call back during business hours...  leave message in random box...  no I really didn’t expect a response.  Par for the course in Montgomery.

name: Tom Babington
text:
Needed care when primary physician was closed. Injured leg in fall, wanted to have doctor check leg for potential injuries. Doctor checked leg without actually touching me. He said x-rays indicated no fracture in foot or ankle. What was missed by not carefully checking my leg was a cleanly fractured fibula, the smaller leg bone. By relying on this doctor’s judgment, I only sought further care after several days of experiencing continued discomfort and pain. The orthopedist assistant asked for me to show him where the leg hurt after x-raying. Said he, “that’s where the fracture is.”
My point is this. We all make mistakes but this one, with carefulness, should never have happened. We hold doctors to a higher standard than the care I received from Dr. Wahiduzzaman which was clearly substandard.
I won’t go back and perhaps you mightn’t either as long as the Small Animal Clinic is open.

name: Tripp Burnett
text:
Office advertises “Rapid COVID-19 Testing”
There’s nothing “rapid” about this 4 hour process. If stuck between “waiting until something else opens tomorrow” & “sticking this one out” do yourself a favor and go home.

name: Raqchel Patrick
text: The entire staff minus the office manager Nikki, are all unprofessional. My 70+ year old grandmother had been a patient of Dr. Bailey for years and at every appointment the doctor would talk over my grandmother, dismiss her symptoms and concerns as well as not communicate with her other doctors to insure that the medications she were taking were not interacting with each other in a negative way. The wait times were always long and the doctor would spend at the most 10 minutes in the room with the patient. My grandma was dealing with thrush for the longest and instead of running test or actually listening to her signs and symptoms they dismissed it as sinuses/allergies. I had to take her to another doctor and pay out of pocket just to find out what was wrong with her. Never made needed referrals and when we finally found another doctor, Bailey’s office held her records to delay the transfer. As a registered nurse myself, I would never work or send any patients to this office. Gave a 1 star by I wasn’t able to post my review w/o it....I wouldn’t give her not one star

name: Dennis Woodling
text:
Aweful!! Don’t waste your time here, staff not helpful and condescending. Took my elderly parents here to be COVID tested and they kept us waiting over 3 hours. Every time I asked how much longer the unfriendly girl would say at least 2-4 hours. So at 3 hours I asked again and she said “at least another hour “ I then said we needed to leave cause my mom wasn’t feeling week and she asked what my make was ?!?!
WTH , how could she know how much longer when she didn’t even know my parents name !!! Save yourself a big headache snd go somewhere else

name: Alyssa Doiron
text: Went in just to see someone about a stuffy nose and waiting 4 hours in the car without any directions. I went to ask if I could just get a note for work since I had been there for four hours and needed to head home. I was rudely told no and I would have to wait to be seen if I wanted a note. Worst experience ever. I waited another 40 minutes after that and still was not seen.

name: Nikki Windham
text: Amazing staff! Dr. Wahid is so caring. Love that they get myself and family in and out quickly!

name: Thomas Parnell
text:
My wife and I went in to get tested on November Friday the 13th of all day's for covid-19.
We were informed that the time would be awhile.
Could be possibly over 2 hours to get results.
We did as they asked and was very informed about everything that was going to be happing.
The nurse that took are test was very very pleasant and you could tell very passionate about her job

She is so gentle in the testing process and listened to all questions and needs.
The facility only has one machine to process the test and it takes about 15 minutes per test so it all depends on how many that are in line being processed before as the wait.
The doctor called and gave my wife and I meds that we were able to start taking.
The doctor was extremely concerned that if are h20 level changed to call and go to the hospital. We needed different meds and it got took care of immediately.
We went back November the 27th and this time waited for about 3 and half hours. Same caring nurse and staff was so so nice.
Seen the doctor made us feel like family.
So that said thanks for all your hard work and carrying staff.
I know people don't like waiting but it's the staff and doctor that makes it all worth while.
Thanks from my family to yours.
Almighty Father God continue to bless you 🙏.

name: Mia Crenshaw
text: This place is awful I asked for a specific test & they gave me a Covid test which I had to pay $200 and could not get a refund. The doctor was very rude and not helpful. I had to pay out of pocket for a test that I did not ask for.

name: Melissa Orum
text: Great service and the wait time was very short! The entire staff was super friendly and Dr. Wahid is very kind and patient. Nurse Melodee  was very attentive and answered all my questions. I would recommend their services to anyone. Thanks so much for all your help.

name: Ebonee Goins
text: Facility Is very clean . Staff are not very Pleasent and they are verrrrrryyyyyy SLOW

name: Ctaylah T
text: Rude staff, won’t call in prescriptions, Doctors barely look at you. Do not go here. They also increased the Copay after COVID started. I’d recommend any other Urgent Care place in Montgomery, or allowing whatever symptoms you may have to take over to the point of going to the Hospital, Seeing how they won’t help you or throughly look at you here anyway. Waste of time and money.

name: Trey Johnson
text: Horrible experience! Never have I experienced this type of rude customer service from a healthcare facility!  The staff and manager were very rude and unprofessional! They would not test me for COVID and I was showing symptoms and I told them I had been exposed! They would rather get off on time than to stop the spread of the coronavirus!

name: Barbara Tankersley
text: I'm not speaking for my mother who is a patient of theirs. BUT,  I haven't been all that pleased with this office. For one, my mom has been in the hospital for nearly 3 months, was under full life support and now that she's recovered, I only needed them to make a referral for home health. It's been 2 days now. Day one, I was told the nurse who handles referrals would get back to me..around 4 pm, nothing. I go there to pick up paperwork for my employer and inquired about the referral I had requested earlier that day..was told nurse is busy and would contact me. Day two, no calls. Its 4 pm and I call the office and was told that the dr was not in today and she would leave a message. I JUST NEED A REFERRAL FOR MY MOTHER TO HAVE HOME HEALTH...WHAT OTHER INFO DO THEY NEED??!!! They know what happened, they know her condition..just get on the damn phone or fax them the damn referral already!!!! My family has been through the ringer not knowing if the matriarch of our family, a mom, grandmother and great grandmother was going to survive, but she has..and all that I ask is for a piece of paper to get my mom on home health. How hard is that?!?!?!

name: Hope Riley
text: Dr. Wahid was extremely helpful and kind. This is the only urgent care I will go to in Montgomery. Every time I have come to this office, they have been exceptional. Very attentive, understanding, and gracious. The ladies at the front desk go above and beyond to help you check in and get settled. I have been to other offices where the front staff is rude and short with me. I am happy to say that I have never had an experience like that here!

name: Lindsey Cope
text: First of all, I wasn’t greeted when I walked in. She put up a clipboard and told me to sign in. To me, if you are walking into ANY place whatsoever in which you are paying for their products or services, you better get some sort of greeting when you enter or it’s considered rude! Then, she would not accept my passport as identification and was not nice in telling me that she absolutely couldn’t except it. I won’t be back.

name: Amber Sellers
text: Would give them less than one stars if I could. The front desk staff was horrible. I was made to pay for my appointment because the lady at the front desk was to lazy to actually verify my insurance. I was seen by a doctor just for him to recommend over the counter meds. Did not prescribe anything else! Now that my symptoms are getting worse I can’t seem to get through to a nurse and have been calling all morning. The workers at the front desk is NOT friendly, cuts you off before leaving a full message for a nurse and is not empathetic at all. This is the worst experience I have ever had! I will not be returning to this place.

name: William Perkins
text: One of the nicest staff that I have had the opportunity to visit with!

name: Junior
text: Best urgent care ever!

name: Grady Smith
text: I always have been skeptical of the quality of urgent cares and have tried to avoid them, but when my son fell and cut his chin, we went here simply because they were one of the few still open late at night.  We were very impressed.  The front desk staff, nurses, and doctor were very professional and very friendly.  They were great putting my young son at ease and treating him kindly.  They also have great hours and really seem to want to serve the community.  I hope we don't need their urgent care services often, but if we ever do they will be the place we go.

name: Melodee Robinson
text: I would leave less than one star if possible! Dr. Bailey is the WORST.  She had ZERO consideration for my 84 year old parents while my mom had Alzheimer's.  She talked to my brother and I SO disrespectfully and NO compassion for what we were all going through!  We changed doctors and finally got the compassionate care my parents needed!  Use ANYBODY else but Dr. Bailey!!

name: Ky Marie
text: Had to take my daughter because I was pretty sure she had a ear infection. The facility was clean, the staff was friendly and very helpful in keeping my daughter calm while they checked her. She's not very fond of doctors offices. The doctor was great, just gave him the symptom and not what I thought she had and he was able to diagnose her quickly and get her the medication she needed to get better and my daughter left a happy camper. Will definitely be going back.

name: jaydon Thomas
text: The lady giving the Covid test is rude as hell, other than that the staff is nice.

name: Nita
text: Place was clean and well decorated wished I had the opportunity to meet the doctors. Waited 45 minutes to be told that my insurance would not cover my visit. I had already contacted my primary care provider and authorization had already been approved and I was given the go since they were in my network. Not sure what the issue was, young lady called her supervisor who advised her that my insurance wouldn't cover the visit (Tricare Prime). So I went across the street to Vaughn Urgent care and received quality service with no issues. Be sure to call ahead or you might be wasting your time, and that's not good when you already dont feel good.

name: Christina Lozano
text: I absolutely love this facility. The doctors are very patient and kind! There was almost bo wait time and the facility is very nice! I will only be visiting this establishment if I can help it-even my toddlers like this place!

name: Sari Capilouto
text: The front desk staff are not  very responsive.  When trying to get a prescription refill,  she did not take the time to get the full story before rudely stating we couldn’t be helped. We waited for over an hour for the initial visit while the doctor showed his family around the office.  The doctor did not listen to our concerns and stayed in the room about 3 minutes.

name: OMAR ABDELAZIZ
text: Horrible service, very unprofessional about their closing and opening times. I have been there 3 times before the closing time and they have decided to close already. For an “Urgent Care” they suck at being urgent.

name: carlos rogers
text: The facility is always clean. The doctors are respectful and attentive  to your needs.

name: Nicole Hall
text:
Since this office opened I've been a patient, in my neighborhood no long and forget about you waits
Staff and Doctors takes care of issue at hand. Get meds needed to Rx, asap to get patients getting to feel better
The convenience open til 8pm, ucan still be seeing u walk in 730!
I thank the Drs for all they have done for family

name: Betty Carr Thompson
text:
Wonderfull place.  EXCELLENT MEDICAL CARE WITH UP TO DATE EQUIPMENT,  LAB AND X RAY available on site.  Dr. Wahid AND Dr
Bailey are a true blessing to this area.  They are so caring and concerned for their patients.  Their medical assistants and staff are excellent.  Montgomery is so fortunate to have "Your Doctor's Office" on Vaughn Road.    What a great location!

name: Fiblast Tuskegee
text: Very clean. Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. Very satisfied with the care. They are very conscious about patient wait times. I will highly recommend it.

name: Sohala Araiinejad
text: They are great and honest and very well organized !

name: Jackiee Jones
text: Two wonderful doctors that are caring and compassionate. Very nice and professional staff members. Also the facility is beautiful.

name: Josh Yates
text: I made an appointment for today and had my annual screening. The new office building was wonderful and staff were very nice. I met both Dr. Bailey and Dr. Wahid. I highly recommend Your Doctor's Office.

name: Carla Henry
text: Wait time was minimum...everyone was friendly and had me laughing...love this place I highly highly recommend them

name: Alicia Austin
text: This has got to be the most thorough doctor's office I have ever been to! I'm from Mobile and got sick while visiting family! If I ever need a doctor again I know where to go!

name: patty rovnyak
text: This clinic is absolutely awful. Beware before you you. I fell and hurt my wrist. I went to have it examined to make sure it wasn't fractured. I told the nurse and doctor both I had broken my wrist a year before. So they did X-rays and when the doctor came in he said he wasn't sure but thought my wrist was broken again. If you are emergency doctor how can you not be sure while looking at X-rays. Then nurse came in to splint it and had no clue how to do that. I was then handed a paper and told I had appointment at southern orthopedic for that day to look at it and put cast on. I went southern orthopedic to be told I had no appointment and that they never called to make one. Luckily they fit me in. After seeing doctor there I was told my wrist was not broken, just sprained. Really after wasting copay on two places, all day at doctors offices and all day in a badly made splint to be told the first doctor was wrong and doesn't know the difference between broken and sprained. So beware

name: Team Scott96
text: I came in with a bad headache and sinus issues. Knowing full well it’s flu season, after I was swabbed for the flu, I still sat for 2 hours (Literally) and some minutes when the dr that wasn’t the usual dr for the clinic and I diagnosed myself and was prescribed all these meds for what the dr said was a “common cold”. Turns out I had to go to a reputable Urgent that’s been around for a while to find I had a Ute sinusitis. Another round of shots and 2 prescriptions later....I’m on the toad to better.

name: Ralph Crenshaw
text: I brought my wife to her appointment today and was very impressed with how thorough and professional the doctor was.   All the staff were friendly and the facility very clean.

name: Pamela Pruett
text: Staff is very friendly and appointments are easily made

name: Qaice Hijaz
text: Great service and smart Physicians.

name: Phenix Boricua
text: Very professional and friendly

name: MONIK MCGUIRE-SCOTT
text: Waited 50 mins in the front for them to tell me that I had to pay more than what my insurance require me to me pay at any visit... INCONVENIENCE

name: Michael Henig
text: Great doctors and friendly staff

name: Shae Christianson
text: Love them

name: boss mrs
text: .Front desk nurse service really bad.they NEVER answer the phone

name: Paulette Robinson
text: The doctor was amazing. I am giving this place a low rating because of the receptionist. I walked in and she was on her phone and did not ask what I was in here for. The other receptionist had to end her call to assist me and was very friendly with continuing to assist me. When you are in the business of caring for people your staff needs to be friendly and welcoming. As I stated, great doctor but receptionist was awful

name: S Beachlife
text: Disorganized front desk, slow service, definitely not somewhere I would want to be of I urgently needed any type of medical service. The staff was friendly just not efficient or organized.

name: Jamie Shaner
text: Dr.Aldridge is the best! I have been using him for years and love him! So kind!

name: Jubilee Dueck
text: I recommend this place. I didn't have to wait very long, the doctor and staff were friendly. My visit wasn't very expensive considering I do not have insurance

name: Robert Turner
text:
Urgent Care- not a fitting name
I arrived around noon for a covid-19 test, and was told they were not given any more for the day even though they are open for another 6 hours!!! I said I will wait as long as needed since this is extremely important, but the nurse seemed completely indifferent to my health concerns. A little bit of compassion and steadfastness would have been appreciated in this difficult time.

name: Cash Cannon
text: Horrible experience. Everyone here was rude especially front desk lady and non helpful. This place should be shut down. The worst “health care” place in town. Will never be back. And if you do come here plan on being here all day.

name: Wynn Piper
text: I came in Saturday so sick and while Nurse Ebone was collecting a nasal swab I became extremely nauseated and told her I was about to throw up. She immediately helped me into the lobby and set me down and brought out a bag that I ended up filling up and another 1/2 one. She also placed cold wet towels on my neck and head which brought some relief because I was clammy and burning up. She then wheeled me into a room and laid me down and turned the lights off because I had a splitting headache, and brought me a bottle of cold water. The care, compassion, and genuine concern she gave me was extremely comforting in my vulnerable and painful state. She treated me with dignity, respect, and gentleness. I can tell this is not just a job to her but a true calling and I am so thankful for her.

name: Rachel Rhodes
text: had to visit for a quick COVID test before being around family for thanksgiving... the process was quick however the nurse was the rudest person i have ever came in contact with. unfortunately i don't remember her name. I had to have my test in the lobby and she had an attitude about any questions I asked. VERY RUDE!! being in health care myself, it really would help if you got staff that cared about their jobs. You are taking care of sick people and the last thing they need is to feel like a bother to the person supposed to be there to help them.

name: Melicia Owens
text: Dont come here for covid19 testing  I was swabbed at 8:15.Sat in my car for three hours,had to ask about my results for them to find them.Staff need to be trained no one knows what they are doing..Needs new managment and staff..This is ridiculous

name: Susan Hutto
text: The triage nurse was like a army sergeant. The Dr. Was also very rude. Very bad experience, will not go back. People who came there to be tested for Covid were allowed to come and go freely through the waiting area.

name: Robert Sachar
text: Go somewhere else...

name: Kaitlyn P
text: Wish I could give this place 0 stars. I’ve ALWAYS gone to Wetumpka Urgent Care. Today I went and paid my $75 copay. The front desk staff waited until after I paid to let me know I had a $900 account balance which it total BS. I was never notified. I have always had insurance and paid my copays. Any bill that comes to my mailbox gets paid right away. I don’t play when it comes to my credit. Never again will I go there. I absolutely loved how they told me this after I paid $75 then asked me for more money due to this “balance” I will now go to primed! Disputing this BS as well. Staff has changed to snobs and ignorance. Don’t waste your time people. Go to primed

name: Katelyn Lambeth
text: They literally NEVER answer the phone. Extremely unprofessional of a business...

name: Mandi Carmichael
text:
I brought my daughter in this morning and was blown away by how wonderful all of the staff were.
We were placed in a room quickly and even had two separate staff members come in to check on us to see if there was anything we needed while we waited for Nurse Practitioner Singer to see us.
NP Singer was amazing, extremely nice and really listened to the issues.
Very impressive and very professional group of people..A+ in my book.

name: George & Aimee White
text: The doctors and staff are very good and friendly.  Ivy Creek on the other had will inflate your bill.  Make sure you get a print out of the services provided and compare them against your EOB.  I did this and found additional lab charges that were not performed along with discovering that they sent some samples to the Elmore Community Hospital to run similar tests that way they can charge an additional "facility co-pay" for using their lab on top of the lab at the urgent care facility.

name: basspro159
text: The front desk person was so rude. I decided to leave and go to the primed down the street. Avoid these places if you can.

name: Jeania Mathews
text: I was treated very friendly here, however, the lab machine was down that day so I was told they would call me with the results. And they would set me up with a primary care provider. 2 weeks go by I call to ask for my lab results and ask about the primary care physician. I am told someone would call me back with my results and that they don't refer to primary care physicians but that I could call River region to get a doctor. Still have not heard back from my labs. I don't know anyone that likes to go to the doctor let alone an office that can't return phone calls or give lab results in a timely manner. Very poor management in my opinion.

name: Whitney Jones
text: Just had the worst experience I have ever had I will never go to this establishment again. I wouldn't even rate this business a 1 but you had to leave a start to give a review! Ebony, demillya and calea are far from professional! One laughed, one tried I give her that and the other one could give 2 cents cant help but wonder if it was because i walked in at 615 and they close at 7

name: Lysee Spigener
text: People are very rude... I went to urgent care because I was sick to my stomach, acing everywhere and couldn't hardly think straight they said it "sounded like the flu" And gave me all this medicine after a whole week I was still sick sick so I went to my primary doctor and turns out I had walking pneumonia and the medicine they gave me was not effective with the pneumonia I had had so I was taking unnecessary drugs.. Oh and yeah I was miserable a whole freaking week and a half...

name: Aimee Clements
text: The staff was great. Very friendly and easy to talk to. The Dr I had was also very nice and very understanding to my needs and pain level. (I have double ear infections pretty bad.) I was so out of it though, I didn't pay attention to her name. Overall a great experience.

name: Nic Lloyd
text: The x-ray techs (Kristal, Alex, and Nic) were by far the nicest, most professional, and of course the most efficient employees of the Wetumpka urgent care staff. Yes all of the other nurses were great, but not once did I notice the x-ray crew NOT doing there jobs!!!! Urgent Care has the best X-Ray techs around town! Dr. Aldrich and Dr. Floyd are very knowledgeable and courteous. I recommend this establishment to anyone and everyone from symptoms perusing the flu or if its just for a common cold. Urgent Care if the staff to see!!!!

name: Nic Ole
text: Been waiting here almost 3 hours now and they aren’t even busy. Front desk worker is not friendly. Just need some antibiotics and to be sent on my way. I won’t return.

name: Candace Moore
text: This place is horrible . I just left there highly disappointed!! Some of the staff was very unfriendly especially the one that sits up front at the window. The one that took my vitals was totally uninterested in what she was doing. At the end of my visit I was basically told there was nothing they could do. They ended up supposedly writing me a prescription.  I take the prescription to Wal -Greens only to find out the prescription was for someone else. So I'm still in pain and I have someone else's prescription . I don't know where these people came from but I would advise you to go somewhere else!!

name: mallory chandler
text: Dirty inside in waiting area. Front desk not trained well. Saw me signing in my 2 year old son. Stated to them I was signing in my son. I filled out all of the paperwork and was told,”oh we don’t see 2 year olds.”

name: keesha Osborne
text: My mom have been going there for almost 4 yrs.and Dr.Aldrich save her life with his knowledge she swears by him very courteous and and patient thank you so much my mom seems happier than she has in years

name: lilhayme
text: The best urgent care in the area. Knowledgable and friendly staff. The doctors have the best beside manner, and check everything to make sure they are giving you the best diagnosis. When my family and I have urgent care needs, this is now the only place in the area where we will go

name: Dixie Forever
text: They have only one doctor on duty.  I had chest congestion and a cough.  All I wanted was a prescription for an antibiotic.  The waiting room was jammed up.  I spent about 4 hours waiting to be seen.  The doctor, Dr. Barrow, was very nice, but she wanted to get me a chest x-ray and breathing  treatment.  It was now after 7PM.  I needed to get to the Walmart pharmacy before they closed so I could get my prescriptions filled.  I declined the x-ray and breathing treatment because of the late hour. They need more than one doctor on duty..

name: C M
text: Some of the staff was friendly, I sat there an hour before the staff awknowledged me and remembered to give me paper work to fill out. They also sent me two bills, one was for lab tests that they didnt tell me they were doing and didnt even bother letting me know the results.

name: Mary Ball
text:
I always get good service. Staff always friendly
During FLU season the wait is always longer

name: Emily Briggs
text: If I could give them zero stars, I would. I showed up to this urgent care to get refills on my medications, because I had moved to Wetumpka a couple days prior. They were not prompt in acknowledging my arrival into the waiting room, but eventually, one of the two ladies stopped gabbing and asked if they could helped me. I explained that I needed medication refills, and they asked what medications I was on in front of all the other patients in the waiting room. I am not shy about the medications I'm on, but some people are, and they should be sensitive to that. I told them, and they informed me that they don't have primary care physicians, and that they generally don't write prescriptions except for things such as sports injuries or general illnesses that pop up in daily life. I understand that, and said that was fine, I could find somewhere else to go, but they seemed upset at that prospect, and said they would ask the doctor on call if he would make an exception and asked me to fill out paperwork while they asked him. I did, and the doctor said he would make an exception, so I waited and filled out the paperwork to be seen. I waited a good while in the exam room, and when the doctor finally came in, he ho-hummed about giving the medicine that he supposedly had told the office staff he would give me with no problem. He finally asked me if I had enough to patch me over, and I informed him that I did not, so he wrote me the prescription (with refills, so he must not have had too much of a problem prescribing it), and sent me on my way. I left on my merry way, said good-bye to the office staff on my way out, and headed to the pharmacy to fill my prescriptions. Upon handing over the prescription, however, it was discovered that the doctor had given me an *unsigned* prescription! I'm fairly certain that could have ended very badly for him, had I chosen to make it, but since I needed those medications, I grumpily brought the prescription back to the now-busy urgent care, waited about fifteen minutes for the office staff to again acknowledge my existence at their window, and then get them to have the doctor sign his own prescription, that he had issued and sent into the world to have done who knows what with without his signature, begging to have fraudulence done in his name. So he signed it, and I filled the prescription, but the nonsense did not end there. Beyond all of that, I got a voicemail, without my phone ever ringing, which I'm sure was not their fault, but the fault of my phone, but the voicemail said something to the effect that they had made me an appointment that I had not asked for that I would be charged for if I did not show up for at an arbitrary date and time, and to call or come by if this was an inconvenience, and leaving no phone number to call back. I then got a letter in the mail, stating the date and time of this arbitrary appointment I had not asked them to make for me, which I was to be charged for if I no-showed on, that had a number to call if I wanted to cancel the appointment. I called the number, and it brought me to a busy signal, which hung up on me after five seconds each time I called (I tried this three times before coming on Google to look up their actual number to call and ream them out). Supposedly, they have cancelled this bogus appointment that they made for me. My question is: why do they make appointments at all, if they do not do primary care, and are supposedly only available for sports injuries and normal day to day illnesses? Do people nowadays schedule their injuries and illnesses? Why on earth would they schedule me an appointment in the first place, let alone without my asking for them to do so? Avoid this establishment at all costs. If you are looking for a place to receive urgent care or primary care, try PriMed that's right next to Walmart, right up the road. They actually respect their customers, do not make you appointments you never asked for, sign their prescription pads, do not ho-hum about writing you life-saving prescriptions, and treat you like a human being.

name: Sabrina London
text: Just called Wetumpka Urgent Care to ask a few questions about insurance acceptance. They intake nurse was rude, and cut me off several time. Each question was answered with Uhhuh instead of Yes. I believe her name was Jeniva. My elderly mother is ill, and at this time a bit of understanding would have been nice.

name: Camaron Kelley
text: In and out not alot of time spent with patient. Sign in room says limit complaints to 2 come back if you have more.... Really??

name: ashley kilano
text: The only thing good about this place is that it's cheap. The staff is always rude and they could care less about you. They sound like they play around more than take their job serious and one of the girls at the front desk was laughing at someone on the phone. Terrible customer service. Not friendly at all. I don't have any medical experience and I could probably do their job better. Every time I go I feel really uncomfortable and the doctor never seems sure about what he's saying. It makes me sad.

name: Bridget Cheathem
text: The Dr. I had literally looked everything up online. I saw him do it... any question I had he went to his laptop. He didn't wait for test results. When I tried calling back to get my results I was told I would get a call back, that call NEVER came! Also, It seemed like he didn't listen to a word I told him. I will not be going back or reffer this place to a friend. The AFC  next to Walmart is ALOT better!!

name: J Day
text:
Nephew came with flu like symptoms, ran blood work given IV and was told he had stomach virus.  Went to Baptist East next morning and he tested positive for viral meningitis and put in hospital.
This was there second chance because several months he went and told it was a stomach virus and the next night had to go to Baptist South ER only to find out it was kidney stones.  Don't thing we will try a third time.

name: Kris Johnson Kephart
text: Professional & Sweet! ___ PROS-Super sweet & smiling staff! (Cathy, Nicole, Karman) * Very clean waiting room, powder room & facility * Personal TV in the back patient rooms! * Great Doctor (Dr. Cobb) Thorough & super nice___ CONS-Possible 1 hour wait time on 1st visit * Little Reading material-No Magazines & very few brochures (bring something to do) ___ SUMMARY: I went there as I am changing doctors and my 1st appointment is a month away. I was a bit nervous, not knowing anyone, and in pain. I was taken care of and left feeling better all ready:) Feel free to go to this Care facility if you need medical help!!___ * KRIS JOHNSON KEPHART * TALLASSEE, AL

name: Michael Mann
text: Unfortunately, when you need assistance after your visit, such as cough syrup for the flu, they don't have time to order a prescription. Was told their priority is patients in the waiting room above anyone already under their care. This is corporate policy. Not sure, maybe this has to do with who's money they already have vs who's they don't have yet!

name: Shannon Geer
text: Longest wait times

name: Sandy B.
text: I've taken my 80 year mother to see Dr. Hasting several times at this clinic, and he has always been kind, friendly, and thorough with her.  Each diagnosis has been accurate and her condition resolved. She thinks highly of him and the staff.  So, this past weekend, I woke up, feeling like I might have the flu and knew I needed immediate medical attention.  With a convention trip coming up the following week, I had no time to spare in getting this treated.  I live in Hazel Green and first checked reviews of walk-in clinics that were closer to home but didn't like the reviews I read on them.  So, I drove 24 miles to this clinic and saw Dr. Hasting.  He was great!  I will not hesitate to go to him again.  The staff was so nice, and they checked out everything.  They checked for flu and strep and found through blood work that I had a bacterial infection, which was good to know, because that can be treated with steroids and antibiotics.  24 hours later and I feel so very much better than I did this time yesterday.  There will always be somebody to write a negative review.  However, based on the experiences that my mother has had and that I now have had, I highly recommend this clinic and this doctor to everyone.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, we appreciate your support!

name: Stephen Wisener
text: In all honesty this facility is on point with their care. The receptionist was very nice and knowledgeable. The wait time is a bit long but I was a new patient so I get it. The Nurse Practitioner and the Nursing staff all together was friendly and helpful. Awsome place to go for help. 👍

name: Charly Hill
text: The doctors and PA's here have always been above board about addiction control. Since they streamlined things I don't have long wait time anymore. They keep a close eye an people 'screwing up'  and they always have a plan in place to get you back on track. Nobody here wants anyone to fail. And you can feel that in the care they give you.

name: Kit Smith
text: Everyone at Phoenix Emergency Care was wonderful. The staff treated me with kindness and respect and the doctor went above and beyond his duties. He spent a bit of time explaining to me treatment options and about my condition. I have never had a doctor take as much time to help me understand my options. Would recommend this place to anyone. I will definitely be using the place again if needed.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support!

name: Renee Stevens
text: I have been a patient for years, and have seen the drug seekers come and go. Those with no proof of pain, and they ALWAYS want their money back because they didn't get a narcotic. HINT: If a complaint is because they didn't get their money back and complain and their "treatment", you can almost guess what they wanted, You want a guaranteed narcotic? Find a drug dealer and stay out of the doctors offices!  Same old complaints because they didn't get their way, or get the pain meds they wanted. If you are looking for a legitimate office, who provides real medical care, Phoenix is the best place you will find.

resp.text: Thank you so much for those kind words. We have tried to remain true to those principles consistently so that our actions earn exactly that praise.

name: Mindy S.
text: I became a new patient here yesterday and wonder why I didn't come here sooner. Everyone that I've spoken to over the phone was polite and answered my questions. I had difficulty getting all my other Dr's office's to fax my patient files and it took about 2 weeks to get everything. Andrea is my new nurse and it was clear to me right away that this office actually takes the time to read over a new patient's file. They made room in their schedule for me just one day out. I was very impressed with the level of care and attentiveness their staff displayed. Brittany and Andrea talked to me like a real person and not like an automated phone operator. I will highly recommend them to everyone.

name: Kelly Nole (quaver muze elan)
text: Because why not, just because I was there doesn't mean I was a patient. They looked good. I was just giving someone a ride.

name: Nancy Vreuls
text: Doctor Hastie is wonderful.  I had pain in my right ear, and he is sending me to a specialist.  So glad I went to see them.  I was in so much pain!  I didn't have to wait long at all.  And the service and staff were wonderful.  I will definitely use them again if I ever need to...

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support!

name: Phalicia Wencil
text: Dr. Edwards works on Tuesdays and is the best doctor I've seen in my life. He truly cares about fixing whatever problem you have. He'll do whatever he possibly can to help you, not like some doctors who don't listen or treat you like an idiot. I know Dr. Plotka is great too, really listens to his patients. This is the best place I've found in Huntsville.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support!

name: paula mccain
text: Courteous and professional staff.  They had to work us in and the wait was still manageable, the care exceptional.  It is without reservation that I recommend this facility.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your glowing review.  That is what brings us back every day.  Thank you.

name: Lynda Smith
text: They're awesome, been going there for years, the Drs themselves are extremely caring and take the time to listen to you. Your not just a number, your cared for "your needs".

name: Heather Libhart
text: I’ve had some lengthy waits here a time or two but lately I’m in and out in a snap. Dr. Glasgow is always pleasant, thorough, and always effectively treats my illness. Thank you!

name: Liz Wozny
text: My brother, my dad, and I have all gone here for different medical conditions and all three of us loved our experience. My brother calls Dr. Hasty "Dr. Santa Claus" because he is a white-bearded man with a smile that can light up any situation. I went to see him because my throat was swollen and i was having trouble breathing and swallowing. Within just a couple hours they had done a swab test for strep that came back negative, a test for mono that came back negative, and then a blood test to figure out that I had an infection of my lymph nodes in my throat. I got my prescriptions after lunch and was feeling well enough to eat a little at dinner. Everyone at the clinic is very kind, the process is quick and simple, and i would never recommend going anywhere else.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!

name: Jason Gleaner (Salt Yeeter)
text: Long wait but great doctor. In short a great doctor to see. No need for an appointment, walk ins are welcome. But of course it's always best to make an appointment if possible. Dr Plotka is one of the few doctors that will sit down and listen to you, and do his best to diagnose your problems. And personally I wouldn't listen to the negative comments. Most likely these are pain management patients that have been rejected because of abuse of the medication they are given. Or they couldn't tell him what they wanted and get it. He prescribes what is needed not what is hot on the street at the time.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and your continued support!

name: Una Faber
text: Excellent experience. Doc was very nice and spent alot of time with my daughter. Staff was nice and very helpful.  Would, and have, recommended to other friends and family.

resp.text: Thank you so much for you review and support!

name: Rebecca Austin
text: Dr. Hastie is absolutely amazing! He works extremely hard to care for his patients.  He takes his time and triple checks that you are on board with the treatment plan, if you do end up having to make changes later on, he is right there , trying to figure the best possible care plan. He is even dedicated enough to this facility and his patients  to work while he is preparing to have surgery, and was back at work within days of having his surgery.  This Dr. Has made a huge impact in my life. Oh and his stories are great, I actually look forward to going to see Dr. Hastie, I've seen Dr Polatka, and he went way out of his way to help me when there was confusion over some things. I do have some issues about the staffing but the doctors are worth it. I'm a pain patient there, but I am more than willing to bet they are great at all they do.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and your continued support in us!

name: John Quinn
text: Showed up 5 minutes before they Closed. I have an object in my Heel. Was instructed to visit the ER. Go anywhere but this Place. They don't care about there Patients. The object is like a deep Splinter.

name: Karin Mack
text: Wait time was not too bad and the staff is really nice and friendly.

name: Chelsea Sanders
text: Dr.Hastie is my absolute favorite physician but the staff that works the front desk is the absolute worst group of people I have ever encountered. They are rude, short, and make you feel like you are inconviencing their day. I do not recommend this facility at all. These people are not equipped to handle people at all.

resp.text: After discussing the situation with our staff, we have certain policies and procedures in place that all of our patients must follow. It is unfortunate that you feel this way since we do strive to make patient care our first priority. If you have any other issues, you are more than welcome to contact our office via phone or email and we will be more than happy to help resolve them.

name: Willease Robinson
text: Highly Dissatisfied! This office is very unprofessional. They lack empathy, and seemed disinterested in making sure their patients are taken care of. I visited the office on 11-29-17 with lower back/side pain. I was told urinalysis was fine, but they would send off a culture and blood work. Upon registering for my visit that day,  I updated my contact information. The office unsuccessfully entered my phone number in their system. I called  many times to check on my test results, to which they advised me to make another appointment  (mind you pay another copay) to get results. Every time I called I would leave the correct cellphone number on my message.  Eventually, the nurse told me on 12/1  my results were negative (after having to go in  to the office in person). Fast forward 9 days (I'm still in pain the whole time) I get a text from CVS stating a prescription had been called in for me. I call to inquire why, I was transferred to a voicemail. I never got a call back.....I go to the office again to verify the phone number they had on file and of course it was wrong. I explain about the prescription being called in and the receptionist says I will have to wait on a call back and it may not be until Monday and its a Friday 12/8. I ask her, so you're telling me you know my number was in the system wrong and you can't tell me why I have meds called in?? Then some one comes out and says you have a UTI. She didnt introduce herself, No apology, no empathy.....I have been suffering for 9 days, and the attitude is....oh well.  I will never visit this office again. They didn't care and that stood out the most.  Already it's bad enough to have something wrong with you and not know what, it's just unfortunate that the people who are supposed to get you back to health could  care less.

name: Korey Cowan
text: I went there and really liked the Dr. He took his time with me and answered all my questions.  I didn't feel like I was rushed.  He actually cares about his patients.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support!

name: Nick Stone
text: Doctor and nursing staff were very kind and respectful. I will definitely go back and reccomend others.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support!

name: Thomas McAulliffe
text:
This is my go to Doctor when I cannot get to mine.  Prefer this over ER for minor illness issues.
I have been going here for over 5 years, probably longer.  I like Dr. Plotka and he listens and takes notes about what is going on.  Let's face it people, if you have insurance and it pays wells at age 51 -  I have learned that Doctor's will run tests on anything to make a few extra bucks off you.  Get over it and move on.  If you are a cash customer, they will be very particular about what tests are being run.  Besides you always have the right to refuse a test or just say no.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support.

name: Jennifer Whitehead
text: ----PATIENT BEWARE!!!!!!!  ----PATIENT BEWARE!!!!!!! ---PATIENT BEWARE!!!!!!!---   WENT HERE BECAUSE I INJURED MY BACK... WENT 3 TIMES.... NO HELP- BACK STILL HURTS... 105 WASTED IN CO-PAYMENTS....... THEIR HOUNDING ME SAYING I OWE THEM MORE MONEY....... BIG RIP OFF- WASTED TIME- WASTED MONEY- NO HELP-

resp.text: If you could please get in contact with us at Info@phoenixemergencycare.com and share your experience we would great appreciate it so that we may correct any issues, if possible. Thank you for your review

name: Justin Mcclung
text: this is a great place I've been going hee for about 2 years now and Dr plokta and Dr hastie are the best doc I've ever seen they really care about you and listen to what you have to say

resp.text: Thank you for review and your support!

name: Alina Rodgers
text: Just unbelievable!  Demand our SSN and when we wanted to talk to the manager, they told us there was no manager on site, nobody could take charge.  Very incompetent.  And definitely don't care about patients, my daughter who's in need of their service is only 3-year-old, obviously they don't care what would happen to her, except they just wanted our SSN so badly that they rather turned us away for not giving them ours.  And I bet if we were illegal immigrants, they would have no problem treating us without having our SSN.

resp.text: In order to guard against insurance fraud, we require a guarantor's Social Security Number on all our patients that we see. If you have any other issues, please contact us at info@phoenixemergencycare.com.

name: Spazzarattack
text: I personally worked at Phoenix Emergency Care for a year. It was my first experience working as a receptionist at a medical facility. Most of the people that wrote reviews saying not to go to Phoenix probably went there as drug seekers. Dr. Plotka has OVER 20 years experience as an M.D. No, they don't diagnose too quickly, he and the CRNP have excellent experience and know what they're doing. The reason that it takes so long is that he actually TALKS to his patients about what they have going on instead of treating them like ignorant imbeciles. That, and there are over 300 regular patients for one M.D. and one CRNP. The facility offers family medicine, pain management, addiction treatment, and emergency care. Please take those facts into consideration before you write a review saying that the office and/or services provided are crap. He's a doctor, not a magician.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review and support

name: Stephanie Kennedy-Mell
text: Horrible Service! Do not waste your time here, if you are really sick!

resp.text: If you could please get in contact with us at Info@phoenixemergencycare.com and share your experience we would great appreciate it so that we may correct any issues, if possible. Thank you for your review

name: Melanie George
text: Way too slow!Even with an appointment you will be waiting a minimum of 3 hours (on a good day!) Dr. Plotka is rude and arrogant. They want you to keep coming back for misc reasons just to get your money. Will never go back.

resp.text: If you could please get in contact with us at Info@phoenixemergencycare.com and share your experience we would greatly appreciate it so that we may correct any issues, if possible. Thank you for your review

name: Stewart Mitchell
text: Waited for two hours in the room for the Dr. to show up. The place opens at 8am yet as of 11am the Dr. hasn't even made it into the building. Inexcusable they couldn't even refund me my copay.

name: Robert Smith
text: I have had very good experience at every visit, no matter which Doctor or Physicians assistant saw me.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: michael davis
text: Five 🌟 clinic easily

name: Nora Morris
text: I've been going here for years. The wait is lengthy sometimes but the service and staff are great.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, we strive everyday to work on our wait times and your feedback helps us tremendously!

name: Lacy Kuenzel
text: I have been here numerous times between my children, my husband and myself. I have been for myself twice in the last few months and both times were less than an hour. We have never had a bad experience. The entire staff has always been super friendly and knowledgeable. I am very pleased with the service and care provided.

name: Rachael Dannelley
text: If you are going to utilize a contactless registration system, you should make sure that someone is managing it during your scheduled business hours. Waited an hour and a half to find out that “because of an issue” the clinic had not opened on time and we would have an additional hour wait before being able to be seen. Also, placing a sign on the door would have been a simple way to let the public know that you were not able to see patients at this time. The parking lots full of waiting patience could have made the decision to go to a neighboring urgent care or go back home without wasting their morning.

name: Kevin Rush
text: This place is supposed to be Veterans Administration approved as indicated on the VA's website. I am a veteran with VA insurance and over a month after my visit I received a text that payment was denied and was sent a bill for over $600 for an office visit! No one contacted me but my credit card was billed $125. I will be contacting the VA to have them removed from their approved walk-in clinics!

name: Mary Cathryn Brooks
text: How do you speak to anyone on the phone??? My visit was fine. I get the wait. I work in a specialists office so I get it. I just can't get ANYONE on the phone! The prompt says to push 5 to talk to a staff member, so I push 5. Then it takes me back to the main menu. Please fix this. PLEASE!

name: Sasha Bishop
text: My daughter was just refused care because my phone couldn't scan the registration code and wouldn't load their website.

name: Miller Sherling
text: Awesome: friendly, efficient service. QR code on door so folks can register outside in car. Receptionist & 2 folks in waiting room wearing masks, with both mouth and nose covered. NOT awesome: person who took my kid’s temp wearing face shield only, no mask, in small closed room, no ventilation, and used ORAL thermometer. So kid had to lower mask. Not safe for anyone. I should’ve said something and didn’t.

name: Eric Phillips
text: Went here for our kids ear ache.  The sign on the door says mask required if you don’t have one please request one from desk.  Went in and they would not let us in because we didn’t have a mask and when I requested one they said they were out.? What kind of urgent care do not have mask.

name: Denise Thrasher
text: When I decided to get my Covid vaccine with them I was delighted because they were always organized and it’s convenient. The day I was to go they called me and asked me to come the next day which was New Year’s Eve . They said someone didn’t take it out of the freezer. Ok then the next day I went as I was told, it took a while but I was ok with that because it was new. They were nice and apologized because they were “ learning” and that’s fine. Well I was suppose to go Thursday the 28 but I told them I work out of town that day but I could get there by 6:00pm. The nurse said just come Friday morning, we are open half a day, ok that’s fine. So today I tried to register just as I was told to do and it didn’t have an option for Covid follow up so I called the office, explained it to the nurse she said let me call you right back. Ok, I waited and waited, finally someone from CORPORATE called me explaining they didn’t have anymore vaccine to give. WHAT?? She started out telling me well you were suppose to be here yesterday. I stopped her and said hold on , I told the nurse I could come but it would be 6:00 and she told me to come the next day,I even called WEDNESDAY and told them again I could come but again I was told to come Friday!  I didn’t do that on my own! She said well she didn’t have the authority to tell you that. After going back and forth she said she was gonna have to find me a vaccine and it would take her a week! So guess what Iam not a happy camper. I told her Iam in healthcare and I am pretty upset for being able to get it because if their mistake. Am I wrong for this?? I know this is all new and I realize mistakes happen but come on give me a break! I have pts and family members to think of!!  Still upset!!

name: Brandy Gray
text: It wasn't the 3.5 hour wait that was upsetting to me.   It was the nightmare of a sign in process from your car!  Once I finally got through the many many many questions, copy of drivers license,  insurance info,  copay info,  etc and I finally get to the 'finish' button at the end, the circle went round and round and round and it never submitted my info after spending at least 30 mins on filling out all the info.  I walked inside only to be handed an iPad and told to fill it out again!  Needless to say I left and went to Pricare.  They were able to see me immediately.   Very very dissatisfied and disappointed with the long sign in process at Main Street when im already feeling absolutely terrible and exhausted.

name: Katrina Kennedy
text: I registered my boyfriend online for a COVID test at 9am. We waited outside until 1:49pm!!! AND HE IS STILL INSIDE!! Its 3:15 and they still arent done yet. If we ever get out of here, we wont be back that's for sure. He could literally have COVID and they got him up in there for that long.

name: W “Annie”
text: Register online now?. What an annoying pain in the backside! Wasn't this way first time we came for testing. Over an hour trying to get the online registration to work.!  Still sitting here outside trying to register. Place be closed by time we finish.

name: Tom Lozaw
text:
Medical assistant Tameka provided great service. She was professional, friendly and caring. I was impressed that she took history information, blood pressure and even took exrays.

Nurse Practitioner Callie diagnosed my illness and prescribed medicine to help me get well.

resp.text: Thank you so much Tom! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Debbie DiBenedetto
text: I have had 2 out of 2 great experiences at MainStreet.  I've never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes and the staff is all so friendly, efficient & caring.  NP Ellison is wonderful as are her nurses.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Debbie. It was a pleasure serving you!

name: Destiny Benford
text: I would like to give it NO STARS but it want let me do that but this place sucks and needs to be shut down permanently. The reason why my 71 year old grandmother went there for abdominal pain at 2 p.m and didn't get out till after 6 and in between all of that they were sneaking patients in and out through the back door skipping over her and still didn't solve her  problem she came back home even worse than she left and with this place supposed to be urgent care she might as well went to the ER as long as she stayed in there my family is completely done with this Urgent Care of can't say the same for the others but this place the one in Alexander City AL needs to be closed down (NOT A FAN OF THIS PLACE) NO STARS IF POSSIBLE

name: MainStreet Family Urgent Care
text: Love the convenience of having an urgent care clinic that is open after work.      The staff was very friendly and the facilities were Super Nice!  They even have Free Coffee and Juice.  Oh and I love that they had my medicine on site so I could go straight home afterwards!

name: Sha Lewis
text: Fast and professional. And they also have fleece blankets if you get a little too cold. Very thoughtful in making sure patients are comfortable from beginning to end.

resp.text: Thanks Sha! We always want to make sure are patients are comfortable and well cared for the second they come in the door.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Wendi Alexander
text: Fast, friendly,  and very professional!! Great staff!!

name: Brandon Thornton
text: CRNP Cassandra Gammage was great. Very caring and thorough. Went above and beyond for my little girl. Seemed passionate about her work.

resp.text: Thanks so much Brandon! We love Cassandra and are so happy we could make you feel like part of the MainStreet Family!

name: Kevin Brown
text: They got me in fast. And the staff and DR was very professional and friendly.

resp.text: This is great news! We're so happy to know that you had a good experience.

name: Sheretha Woodyard
text: I took my son into the Urgent Care on Sunday for abdominal pain & vomiting.  Upon examination of my son, the Nurse Practitioner said she would have to send him to the ER because she could not scan him there.  My first thought was, she is in a hurry because it's close to closing.  To my surprise, she called the ER to let them know she was sending a patient and told them what she thought was going on.  We arrived at RMC where my son was diagnosed with appendicitis and had to have emergency surgery.  Today I received a call from I think Lisa the NP that was working on Sunday calling to check on my son.  I appreciate the thoughtfulness & her taking the time to check on him. Awesome Customer Service! Thank you Main Street Urgent Care & Nurse Practitioner Lisa.
