resp.text: Sheretha, thank you so much for your kind words!  We always strive to treat our patients like family and want to make sure your visit was great!  We certainly hope that your son is on the mend!

name: Amanda Hill
text: My husband and I went to the clinic a week ago. We both have the cold crud going around. He was diagnosed with URI and ear ache, they diagnosed me with the flu even though I had no symptoms, and my husband had all the symptoms. They took us back at the same time, to the same room, and tested us at the same time. They treated us with steroids and mucinex d. A week later we are both worse off. I don't have insurance so I paid $125 for nothing. I would not recommend this place and I will not go to another one of these clinics.

resp.text:
Hi Mandy,

We appreciate your feedback, and we're sorry your experience was not satisfactory! Someone from the clinic will be reaching out in the next 24 hours to see how we can help. Thank you for choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care.

name: Brian Dodson
text: Never again will I visit this place.  So you said that my insurance denied my visit to you.  So you charged me cash price for a visit.....Really? And you charged my card without my consent.  No thank you, if my $ is all you’re worried about and not my health or how you treat your customers.  Don’t care to do business with you.

name: Joe Littrell
text: Waiting over 4hours  as walkin.And still waiting.

name: Fran Arnold
text: If I could give 0 I would. Do not take your child there. I have a toddler who was prescribed a medicine both his physician, choa and the Walgreens told me he should never have been prescribed... they do not have drs there only pa or np... I get they are medically trained but this is not a place for children at all...

resp.text:
Hi Fran,

Thank you so much for reaching out with your concerns! I've passed your information along to our Chief Medical Officer to review your child's chart. The medication prescribed is approved by the FDA and CDC for children, but we'd be more than happy to discuss any concerns with your child's pediatrician!

name: Tasha Reese
text: Very fast pace and knowledgeable staff.

name: Bama_ Diesel
text: The staff was very friendly and respectful. They got us in and out fairly quickly.

name: Misty Goodson
text: Long wait time

name: Kerry Bulin
text: Very friendly, caring, and efficient staff.

resp.text: Thanks, Kerry! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Robert Vines
text: I received a covid test here in Jan. and tested positive. I received 2 "check-up" phone calls while in quarantine which I have never had happen before. I was never told I would get charged for those calls. Not long after they showed up as charges on my insurance. Complete money grab.

name: Constance Taylor
text: No stars for me if I could give. I came in about 857am signed it and they asked for drivers license and insurance card! I sat down and noticed it was 935 and I haven’t been called back up to pay co pay or sign new patient forms. At 935am I asked if she already entered my information and she said not yet so I asked for my cards back and came to AFC and was in the back in less than 10 minutes. I do not recommend at all! The young ladies behind the glass were just sitting around laughing and joking. Avoid this place if you can

name: Tiffani Parnell
text: Today I made a visit. After waiting 40 min the desk clerk advises me that the doctor prefers that I go to the ER. Mind you I haven’t seen or talked to the doctor. Because I’m an asthmatic patient having some chest pain he didn’t want to “risk it.” This comes after I watched the desk clerk attempt to turn people away because they were closing in 3 hours! What. I left upset and crying and still unable to breathe. Don’t go here.

name: Sylvia Smith
text: It is 1:59 p.m. I arrived at 1:44 and the doors  were already locked. However, one of nurses let me in. I walked to the check in desk, where there were TWO PEOPLE and they let me stand there until 1:57, before asking how they could help me! I said that I needed to see a doctor and was told that it's almost closing time, so we aren't seeing anymore patients! I would not be out in this rain, (I have lupus) if I didn't need to be. I understand that I was cutting it close BUT THE SIGN SAYS THAT THEY CLOSE AT 2PM  AND NOT WHEN THEY DONT FEELING LIKE CHECKING PATIENTS IN ANYMORE. It's unfortunate because I love Dr. V and  don't know if I'll be bringing myself, my husband, or kids back. It was WHOLLY UNPROFESSIONAL!

name: Stan Fortner
text: Do not recommend if you have breathing issues, I have asthma and copd with trouble breathing and they won’t see you without a mask. I’ll never go back even after I get the breathing problem fixed because anyone with an ounce of common sense knows if you have asthma and copd you don’t wanna put a mask over your face especially if your breathing shallow as it is!

name: Linda Wickliff
text: Poor front counter service. They do not inform you nor provide any instructions to how their process works. They just leave you in the lobby and assume that you know what to do. They nurses in the back were nice but that’s the only thing.

name: Kristie Hutto
text: Have been here several times for various reasons. Always easy and efficient experience.  Staff friendly.  Facility clean and safe. Doctors professional and courteous.

name: Hannah Miller
text: Dr. T has been the best urgent care doctor I've seen in the montgonery area so far. He was very kind and listened well. I had to wait a bit but not too horrible, was in and out within an hour.

name: Treyy Treyy
text: Very nice people ‼️

name: Jeremy Warnken
text: 2 hour wait to then be rushed out.

name: Rachel Mcgough
text:
update: went today and it's still been the best doctor office experience. I actually prefer to go here than to my regular doctor because they are so kind, fast, and thorough. My regular doc may have more equipment at her fingertips. But I feel like these folks care more.

2 years ago: I've been here twice so far. Once for a back injury that could have been serious and they sent me straight to E.R. at no charge for the visit to the clinic telling me to go now. The doc didn't charge because he wanted us to feel less of a financial struggle and resistance to going right then. Second time, my husband had pneumonia and I was with him. Both times, they thoroughly explained what all the potentials were sac answered all of my questions. They even worked with us on pricing the second time. I saw a previous review claiming racism. My husband and I are a mixed couple and yes, he happens to be black. He was with me both times with a different doctor and nurse each time. And, yes, they take people without insurance. I'm not sure what that last bad review was about but my own experiences have been completely different, treated with respect and a lot of consideration I never would have expected at a walk-in clinic. It didn't feel like a walk-in. The folks there seemed to genuinely care, especially when I was pregnant.

name: Guy Fawkes
text: You come in knowing you have a nasty infection brewing. Dr. T simply tells you to take sudafed. I told him I had high blood pressure. So he saud I would just have to take claritin. I asked if I could at least get a steroid shot and he saud that might help with the swelling and reluctantly gave me one. Basically, you have to be ypur own doctor. There are way better doctors at otger doc in a box locations. Not impressed. They also tell you when they're open when you call. Then you show up abd they're closed. Just try somewhere else..

name: Fredrica Johnson
text: The amount of time it was taking to just be called up and give my insurance information was ridiculous. I was one of the first people there and 35 minutes later the first person in the door still had not been seen.

name: Amy Asay
text: I have stage 4 cancer and ended up with pneumonia.  The entire staff was amazing. What I thought was a routine get some antibiotics visit turned into so much more. It turned into a 2 day visit for IV antibiotics each day, which made me very sick during the infusion. Amazing and caring staff! My husband and I are a mixed race couple and I'm on medicare, that didn't matter to them. They were very good to us

name: Anne Paine
text:
Service here was super awesome and environment exceptionally clean.

Staff was extremely professional and caring.
Dr. T and amazing staff, from the bottom of my heart °•○● thank you●○•°!!!
I highly recommend this urgent care.

name: fillup87
text: Dr. T was awesome. The support staff was super friendly. The facility was clean. Would recommend.

name: Kristy Bales
text: I have a stomach bug and was treated at Eastside Urgent Care. The staff was very polite and Dr. T was quick to act in treating my nausea and vomiting.  I felt like he was very knowledgeable and did an excellent job explaining the treatment plan throughout my visit. I am currently breastfeeding and he knew what meds he could give me that would not be bad for my milk supply or my baby. Would definitely recommend this urgent care clinic.

name: Riketa Johnson
text: This place ruined my entire life how can a person come here and take a drug test for a job that they have had for a year and pass due to no drugs in their system but fail due to a small piece of the line where the temperature line is was not all the way shaded in is ridiculous. They black young lady was very rude to my husband he has a hernia mesh in his stomach close to his private area he passed why would you keep making him strain himself to use the bathroom for you then to watch him take his 2nd and 3rd sample what kinda of training is this. What kind of customer service do you people think that you are providing y’all ruined my life and I would like you to know that you made this man lose his job when he passed clear as day but hmm no proof because you know it’s all about who you get don’t know the lady name but she needs to be fired and lose her job too this place is for Caucasian people I guess because they treat black people here any kind of place here do not go here if your black especially

name: joey shelby
text: Super fast experience! Great caring doctors and staff!! love this place! in and out super fast every time

name: Becky Henderson
text: Love this place. The people are so nice and friendly. Dr. V.J is the best.

name: Nathanial Howell
text: I have had a cough for a month and finally decided to go to the doctor. The nurse dos her job but the doctor that saw did nothing. I understand that I went on a Saturday and he probably had better things to do. But I still have a cough and I believe that it is getting worse. No prescription. No diagnosis. Nothing. I paid $56 for nothing.

name: Mae Payne
text: These people have become my family! Dr Vjay Tirumalasetty has literally been my lifesaver. I don't know what I would do without them they're are quick, yet very thorough the Doctor is very knowledgeable. Will continue to keep going.

name: Junior
text: They close earlier than they're supposed to.

name: will t
text: DR veejay is the absolute best and the staff is so nice

name: auwildflower
text: Super nice! Got me in and checked  fairly quickly. Very attentive and kind!! Highly recommended!! Dr. T was great!

name: Sam Lynch
text: Super friendly staff. In and out in no time after getting sick while visiting from Texas

name: Bryony V
text: Dr. T did a great job treating my son. The entire staff was super friendly even after we showed up 20 minutes before closing.

name: absouthern1986
text: Paid a $40 co-pay, sat there for two hours, and the doctor refused to treat me and told me to go to the ER instead. I might as well have put $40 through a paper shredder.

name: Kiki Jo
text: My husband was injured while at work and this was one of the two places he could be treated. I’ve never been treated so rudely & been so disrespected by anyone or any facility. Nurse practitioner Lisa King was very rude and obviously needs assistance in bedside manner. My husband injured his hamstring very badly and she wrapped him up with an ace bandage and gave him ibuprofen and told him to come back Friday. When I asked why he was coming back & what meds did they send she immediately got an attitude with me and stated, “she’d call his job & speak with them since they’re the problem?!?” We asked her for a referral to an orthopedic specialist since there’s nothing they can do for a hamstring & she refused to give it. If you can’t treat someone then refer them to someone who can! There’s no need to come back Friday when you could’ve referred me from the beginning to someone who can actually help. This is my first experience with this facility and I can promise you we won’t be returning. And after speaking with “his job” they won’t be referring any of their employees there either.

name: Lauren Farrow
text: I went yesterday set over a hour and half to be seen once called to the back nurse ask me what was wrong i told her i wasnt sure if it was the flu or sinuses but once the doctor came in and asked what was wrong i told him and the tech was like they always change whats wrong with them when the doctor comes in she was rude and unprofessional the doctor ask me what i want instead of prescribing me what he thought i should take wont be back

name: kemi Bamigbola
text:
My experience over here was super horrible.  Do yourself (or at least if you are black) a favor and go somewhere else. I have a Daughter at Alabama State University and when she complained of a very bad stomach pain, I immediately consulted with our insurance company Aetna, who referred us here (because it was in network), On getting there, they refused to treat her because she did not have a copy of her insurance card on her, I pleaded with the receptionist over the phone and she bluntly told me no, we don’t treat people without insurance. Here is the case I told her, we have insurance, in fact we have the really good kind, (everyone knows college students misplace stuff all the time), so I told her, I will email her a copy of her insurance card, for her to call the insurance company to verify (the standard procedure).  She refused, and said she is unable to verify her identity. I asked my Daughter to show the receptionist her driver’s license, ID card and a copy of her driver’s license and she still refused her care.
At this point, I am hearing my daughter in the background almost in tears, so I offered to have the insurance company fax her the proof of insurance, she refused and proceeded to refer us to another urgent care center that takes “people like us without insurance” I am deeply saddened and disappointed.
At the end, we ended up in the emergency room. DO NOT GO HERE

name: Patricia Bell
text: The staff and Dr. Is very nice friendly people the Dr. diagnosed me correctly and very concern about his patients he also remembered me from the last visit the stay is not long at all I was there about 45 minutes if that AWESOME PLACE TO GO WHEN YOU ARE SICK!

name: Phillip McIntosh
text: Always quick and efficient! Dr. Vijay Tirumalasetty is great

name: Sonny
text: Very professional and quick.  Also a beautiful building.

name: blacky
text: Very fast. Professional staff.  They care about the patient.

name: Michael Irving
text: Saw the Dr yesterday with a diagnosis of a bladder infection. Prescription never called in to pharmacy. Not very professional!

name: Melissa Ohlrich
text: Took my son here today. What a GREAT experience we had. Not ONLY do they genuinely care for their patients,  but they charge a reasonable fee to see a doctor which was incredibly helpful since we have no insurance.  Great people, clean office and knowledgeable.

resp.text:
Melissa,
We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your experience! We hope we can continue to treat all of your healthcare needs!

name: Kristin Marie
text: This place is amazing!! Heather at the front office is so caring and sweet! I've been late before and she still remaind kind and sweet!! Dr.Morgan the nurse practitioner is amazing!! I hadn't seen a doctor in over 10 years because of the way I had been treated. She made me feel welcome and safe!! She answered every question and has took care of every need I have!! This place is the best!! Thank yall so so much for being so kind and so attentive!! I'm not afraid of going to the doctor anymore because of yall!! Thank yall so much!!❤

resp.text: We are so very happy you enjoyed your experience with us. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Malee List
text: The staff at this facility is very professional and just amazing. They went above and beyond to help us. If you contact the facility they will not hesitate to get back with you. The scheduling process was seamless for whatever your needs are.  Even thru the Christmas Holiday they were available to assist us. Today you can not find that level of personal care at a time like this.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We deeply appreciate our patients and treat each and every patient as if he/she was a member of the family. Happy holidays and have a blessed day!

name: marlene tew
text: I'm new to area went right in no wait great experience they were friendly and great people I highly recommend I saw Olivia she was great I highly recommend and thanks again 😊

resp.text:
Marlene,

Thank you so much for your kind review! We are so please you enjoyed your experience. We hope you continue to come back and see us for all of your medical needs.

name: Ryen Katherine
text: I used their Huntsville Rapid Test Program for quick COVID results and was really impressed! They communicated well, delivered the results quickly, and  were very helpful. I will be using their program again for my next COVID test!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We are so happy to hear your enjoyed your experience. We try to make everyone’s experience as positive as possible.

name: Bobby Dempsey (Sambo)
text: Great staff and doctor...

resp.text: Thank you for leaving such a kind comment. Have a blessed day!

name: Tiffany Robinson
text: I will say the good things first. Scheduling is convenient and they have a variety of time slots available. Also, the nurse practitioner I seen was very nice and sweet. However, the wait and the unprofessionalism is ridiculous. PLEASE do not go here if you have a genuine urgent matter because I waited for 2 hours. The nurse misplaced my paperwork. Then, the nurse thought I was automatically there for a Covid test which lets me know she didn’t even bother to look at my paperwork. I got the feeling the nurse did not want to be there at all. Needless to say this was my first and last time ever visiting this office and I absolutely would not recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Hi Tiffany, so sorry you had an unpleasant experience. We are required to test anyone for COVID who exhibits certain symptoms regardless of what their visit is for. Due to the increase in COVID cases and the demand for testing, our wait times are much higher than usual.

name: Kristina Teeters
text: What’s going on? We have to pay a copay for the Covid-19 test? I came back in today so I can get retested so as to return to work. suddenly you change your policy and want to charge me me for an office visit when the government is already paying for it! Not cool guys!

name: J Stone
text:
I’m not sure exactly who is running this place, but please save yourself the time, and headache, and go elsewhere for medical treatment.  I am kicking myself for passing two other urgent care facilities to visit Stopwatch. I have TWO insurance carriers. One is the main account and the other is supplemental which pays my copays. Well I went in May, and just received a bill for over $200. When I called and asked why I was receiving a bill they told me “The girl put your insurance information in wrong.”  I asked could they fix it, and was told “No you have to fix it yourself.” How am I supposed to fix their error?!  I called back and asked for a number for their billing department.  I have called the number they gave me 3 times a day, for the past 6 business days with NO answer.  I called the front office again yesterday and was only told, “If it makes you feel any better, the lady that put your information in, was notorious for getting people’s paperwork wrong too. But she’s fired now.”  Not only was that unprofessional of her to say, I STILL have no resolution on my billing issue. PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE.  If you can’t make it anywhere else, pull into the parking lot and call an ambulance. Anything will be better than this place.

2 months later: I spoke with someone in the billing department and they said they would correct the issue.  Issue still not corrected and I just got a new bill for the same amount.  Called BOTH insurance companies and they said STOPWATCH has not billed either of them. They have only billed me the customer.

Update #3: I’ve started getting text messages about my balance. This marks 7 times I gave called their billing department (pictured below at 10 AM). Once waiting as long as 47 mins. Problem still not resolved. Each rep says they “see” the issue on their end and they will fix it.

name: Austin Tucker
text: In and out ahead of schedule, Dr and staff did a great job

resp.text: Thank you for your review, we are so glad you had a pleasant experience!

name: Daniel Gutierrez
text: I’m not sure why they have bad reviews. Everyone was very nice and professional. Very well done here!!

resp.text: Hi Daniel! Thank you very much for the fantastic review on your visit with us! We greatly appreciate the positive feedback!

name: Aminah Shah
text:
I love the convenience of this clinic, and for urgent matters, I’ve always felt that they handled the situation adequately. The staff has been consistently polite, and I found the online registration to be straightforward and efficient.

I took my 11 year old for a Covid test this morning (a Saturday) and had a short wait. The nurse who swabbed her for Covid and strep was gentle and reassuring because she saw my daughter was really scared. The doctor was nice, and I was given her (thankfully) negative test results on paper when we were done.

StopWatch in Hueytown is my go-to for non-emergency urgent care. 👍🏼

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review, Aminah!  We will pass this along with our team.  We are always happy to help!

name: Ronald Green
text:
I went there a few months back on a Sunday after church with a fever and typical cold like symptoms. They tested me for covid which was negative never looked at me give me two prescriptions and sent me on my way.

They didn't take any blood no physical examination just assumed that I had a sinus infection and sent me home.
Two days later I was worse and went to my doctor turns out I had bronchitis sinus infection and an ear infection
The antibiotics had given me would not treat the bronchitis.

It was obvious when my doctor listen to my lungs that I was having trouble breathing.

I would seriously avoid this place

resp.text: Hi, Ronald.  Our team would like to hear more about your experience with us.  Please email mmorgan@stopwatchurgentcare.com. Thank you.

name: Jeanie Hickman
text:
I made a same day appointment to have a COVID test done. When I got there, there was about 6 other people in the waiting room and probably a few patients in the back, so there was a wait, but, being a doctors office during a pandemic, that was to be expected. I spoke to two receptionist while I was there. Both were very kind.
When I went to the back the doctor came in to do the test, then there was more waiting for the results. During the wait time another tech came in to take my vitals and symptoms.
Honestly, I was just there for a COVID test. I just wanted to hear positive or negative. However, the doctor there could see there was obviously something wrong with me. So when the test came back negative, she took the time to check a few more things to see what I needed. Just a reminder, we are in the middle of a pandemic, so I was expecting to be shuffled in and out fairly quickly. But the staff kept me there until they narrowed down the problem. My test was negative, but I do have bronchitis with an upper respiratory infection, which is why I was showing similar symptoms to COVID.
The called in my prescriptions  to the pharmacy and told me if I didn’t show signs of improvement to come back.
Overall, yes... there was a wait. But after being seen myself I can say I honestly believe the wait was because they take their time with the patients.

resp.text: Hi Jeanie! Thank you for taking the time to leave us an awesome review! We are so glad you had such a great experience with us!

name: Jamise Null
text: The receptionist at this location is extremely rude. Visited to get tested for COVID, upon checking in, she asked me did I have my Medicaid card. Mind you I filled out the online portal stating I had United healthcare. So she assumed I used Medicaid. Second visit, they failed to provide me with my patient portal paper to get my results online. Went back and instead of her answering my question about getting my paper, she insisted that I wait for them to call with the worst attitude. Will never visit this location ever again.

name: Latonya Ward Podcast
text:
I scheduled a same day appointment online, process was quick & easy. They even texted me status updates. This establishment appeared to be very well kept, you could smell the cleanliness in the air.
The staff was incredibly courteous, knowledgeable & responded with urgency . Thank you Alexis Suttles & team for such a pleasant experience.

name: Bobby Gray
text:
I scheduled an appointment online before they opened for 4:20pm to get tested for Covid. I happened to drive by at 7:50am(they open at 8:00am) and I waited for them to open. They were able to get me in at 8:00am and did my test. I was very pleased with the professionalism from the clerk to the nurses. Great experience. Super fast and efficient.

***Update***
I received my results yesterday around 5:00pm, roughly 32 hours after my test. Very pleased. I was told 3-7 days for results, they came the next day!

name: Ryan Dye
text:
Avoid this place like the plague. I attempted to call 6 different times to make an appointment with no answer after being on hold for 10 minutes each time.

The information on Google also says no appointment required.

So I walk in and discover that it is appointment only and they offer me an appointment at 2:12pm. 3 hours later, after driving 30 minutes to get here. ANSWER YOUR PHONE!

name: MrsMisfit5
text:
Scheduled appointment which was almost an hour and a half behind.  Requested be to be checked for other than just Covid19 - they did not.  No results now for 8 days and left 3 messages with no return calls.  Definitely will not return and will advise others to go elsewhere.

Edit:  finally got my results which all was good.  The lab company claimed they faxed over the results and the nurse told them they are not coming through via fax.  There definitely needs to be better communication for the Lab company and the clinic.

name: Lauren Laurent
text: Scheduled an appointment for Covid-19 test.  There is no instruction as to wait in the car or come in. It says to arrive 10 minutes early which I did.  Tried calling when I pull up and even with an empty parking lot it was hard to get anyone to answer the phone.  When someone finally answered I was told there was one person ahead of me. After waiting 30 minutes in the car I called back and told the same thing..one person ahead of me.  Their parking lot is practically empty...seriously how busy can they really be.  The test does not take that long to do.  The 2 to 3 cars out here are probably the staff inside doing nothing.  Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.  This is just ridiculous.  I will never be coming back here for covid-19 testing or anything else.

name: Nakesha Willis
text:
Had a very displeasing visit today. The receptionist was extremely rude. I went in and scheduled an appointment on yesterday with a different receptionist, who was very kind and understood that if I took the appointment time for today, I wouldn’t be able to tarry because I had a meeting at 1:00pm. The appointment was for 12:08 today. I arrived at about 12:00 exactly. After checking in, I waited until about 12:40. At that time, I inquired about how much longer the wait would be. The receptionist, in turn, said (with a very outlandish tone), “I don’t determine how long it takes to have a test! Just because you schedule an appointment at 1:00 doesn’t mean you’ll get seen when you get here!” I asked if there was someone else she could ask. Her response was “No, we don’t know!” I explained my situation and asked if the wait is usually that long each day. She made a point to tell me that she doesn’t know how long it’ll be each day. I said, “Well thanks didn’t answer my question but ok.” I was led to believe that she wasn’t interested in helping me and didn’t care to display great customer service. After finally being seen by the very kind nurse and doctor, I asked for a work note, because at that point, I was late for my meeting. She said, “You’ll have to get it from your provider!” I shared that I have NEVER gotten an excuse from my provider. She said, “Well, you should’ve told them that in the back. Oh, and you can’t be on a phone at the desk.” I moved back closer to the door while she finally went to check on the doctor’s note. I stated that I was trying to login to the meeting I was now late for. She told me to stand outside or across the room or she’ll call Hueytown (police). After that, I moved across the room and she threw the work not on the counter and said, “There it is!” I got it and left.

Let me just say that I have visited this clinic quite a few times in the past. The staff is usually so nice. They have always displayed great patient care. However, I am very uneasy about ever going back. I’m still mind blown at the level of unprofessionalism displayed today. It is my prayer that the behavior and negative disposition displayed by this receptionist is addressed. The pandemic we are in is stressful enough and creates a great deal of anxiety. A doctor’s office is not the space where I would ever expect care as such.

name: Kayla Acton
text: Just left there with my husband and we had an awesome experience. The lady at the front desk gave us an appointment even though we didn’t have any before walking in. The 2 nurses that triaged us were so nice and helpful. Dr. Fong was quick and efficient. I would give more stars if I could! THANK YALL!!

name: Donald Henderson
text: Very rude workers would not recommend

resp.text: Hi Donald, our Director of Operations would like to learn more about this situation. If you could please email Mark, at mmorgan@stopwatchurgentcare.com. Thank you!

name: Jennifer Gibson
text: I went here to get a COVID-19 test done. The online scheduling process was super easy and the text updates were very convenient. The receptionist was friendly and the facility was nice and clean. But the 2 women that did my test were exceptional! Not only were they friendly and professional, but they were very transparent and informative. With the way things are these days and all of the conflicting information out there about Covid, I am extremely appreciative of the time they took to educate me from a medical standpoint. Definitely glad I went here!

name: Ron Prevatte
text: Stopwatch Urgent Care was extremely professional and caring during my visit. I appreciated the care I received especially during these crazy corona virus times.  I give them a 5 star rating!!

name: Donna Peak
text: Very pleased with our visit.

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating, Donna!

name: Donna Bland
text: *,DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE* Myself along with my son and daughter,  went for Covid-19 testing on July 8 we were told  2-3 days for results because they were using a new lab for processing. I was told I would be contacted by phone with the results. After waiting for more than 7 days, numerous phone calls with no answer, leaving several voice mails I received no call back or phone call with results. I then returned to the office to get some clarification. The receptionist initially told me they had no results, but because I was persistent she then looked in a stack of papers laying on her desk and low and our test results were there. They were all negative "Thank God"!

name: john j
text: Dont bother calling them they dont ever pick up. Dont see how they a urgent care facility

name: Dennis Warren
text: Sweetest lady's that I've ever meet at a doctor office. Receptionist was so sweet and caring.  Nurse is the most awesome shot giver. And the doc is amazing.  I recommend to anyone and I definitely will go back to them in time of need.

name: Mike Harrison
text:
I registered and receive Covid test on August 10.      Today is August 22.  I still have not receive results.  Phone calls not returned.  Extremely unprofessional.

Update:  Today is Oct. 1,2020.   I finally got my Covid test results exactly 21 days later after personally going to their office.  I was told to call the call center. I called the call center.  I was asked if they could put me on hold for a couple of minutes.  18 minutes later i am told that a supervisor would need to call me back.  An hour or so I get a call telling me my test was negative.  I asked why I lost my sense of smell, headaches, extreme fatigue, and a 100 - 101 temp for six days.  “Your test maybe a false negative.”  Why did it take so long?  We don’t know.
I wrote letters to both the CEO (steward Roberts) and the Operations Manager (Mark Morgan) requesting explanations for unprofessionalism and incompetence and not charging my insurance.  It has been three weeks or more and I still have not heard from these people.  It is obvious that employees take after their bosses. Stopwatch Urgent Care never again.

name: Austin Cox
text: As a place of certainty that helps those in the community through emergency care and possibly now COVID testing is no where equipped to perform under a pandemic. As I went in Friday for a covid test with an appointment, I was instructed to wait in my car for them to call me in. I waited for about 30 minutes, no big deal, and I go in and have them perform their test. Before leaving I was told the results should be back Monday at the latest. Today is Wednesday. Yeah I know they could have been late so I go back in there and ask just as a general question as I am working college student for when can I get my results back. The reply was possibly 7 more days, a whole working business week. I was told this was due to the changing of labs and the unfair way of testing. As the test are put into a box with others from the days past and only so many are grabbed to actually be tested. Seems fair or unfair, who am I to judge?

name: Adam Beagle
text: I would say they take the word care very seriously. The staff and the doctors were very kind and considerate and showed that they care. Thank you Stopwatch Urgent Care you might have just saved my life!

name: Kenneth R. Huff
text: The front desk clerk and the people working at the covid 19 test area inside on the evening of Tuesday, June the 30th were very friendly and professional. The test was done safely and quick. These people are awesome!

name: Yep! That’s Ke
text: For starters whenever you go on their website it lets you reserve your spot and gives you an estimated time for your appointment so you don’t have to sit in the waiting room for hours. Once I got there I notified the lady at the front desk that I had an appointment, she told me she has to sign me in and gives me a clipboard to fill out all my information even though my information was already in the system. It took about 2 and a half hours before they called me to come inside. I wasn’t going for a covid test, I just wanted to be seen by a doctor because I was sick but none of my symptoms were related to the virus going around. Since they gave me a covid test anyways I wasn’t able to go back to work until it came back negative. I got tested last Thursday, July 2nd and the nurse told me I would have my results back in 7 days and to not come back into the office to get them. 7 days go by and I don’t get a call or email so I try to call and every time I call it rings twice and then goes straight to voicemail. I finally decided to go up to the office to get my results and when I got there, there was no one in the waiting room so I’m wondering why the phone isn’t being answered. Also the front desk lady notifies me that my results aren’t there and then proceeds to hand me a slip of paper with 2 websites on them and tells me I can find my results on either one of the websites. I’m very frustrated that I wasn’t notified of these websites before hand because I could’ve been back at work by now if I would’ve known about them. This is just completely ridiculous and unprofessional on how things were handled here.

name: John Orman
text: Very nice staff. Long wait for very short Covid test due to shere number of folks wanting tested. Longer than expected wait time for test results 3-4 days....

name: rusty vines
text: They were super nice and no wait maid the appointment in and out in no time . Great experience

name: Shea Faulkner
text:
If I could leave less than a 1 star, I would.

When I walked in the door, I was greeted with, "Have you been here since our name has changed?"  Not, "Hello" or any sort of polite greeting.

I waited in the front waiting room for over 45 minutes before I was called back.

When I was called back, the nurse or technician was polite at first, but then the conversation changed tone.  She asked me if I was on any medication and I began to list what I was taking.  I got to my anti-depressant and dosage and she said, "Do you have depression or anxiety?"  I said, "Both."  She then said, "Oh, so you're on an upswing today?"  I said, "The medicine helps."  She then gave me a condescending smirk that I took as meaning, you don't need medicine to make you happy.  She then said, "You just need some good friends."  I said nothing further.

I have been belittled and talked down to before for having mental health issues, but never at a Dr.'s office.

The doctor that examined me was extremely polite and the best part of the entire visit.  She did however tell me I would be getting a shot and some anti-inflammatory drugs to help with swelling.

The nurse that came in to give me my shot said, "You're getting a steroid shot in your hip."  I got the shot and then she said nothing else to me and instead started cleaning the room.  I gathered that this meant I could leave.

I went to the check-out desk and asked if I needed anything for my prescription and was cut off and told, "She (the doctor) does everything online, so whatever pharmacy you provided, it will be sent there."  That was Friday, 1/18/19.  It is Tuesday, 1/22/19 and I still have no prescription at my pharmacy.

When she told me about the prescription, I left, and nothing else was said.

It was the absolute worst experience I've ever had at that location and I do not plan on coming back.

I'm sure they won't be disappointed in that as they seem to care less about bedside manner or common courtesy and find it humorous to belittle patients about their mental health.

name: Cliff Mak
text: It’s a urgent care but you have to make an appointment. If I need an appointment then the situation isn’t urgent. Urgent means I need a dr right now!

name: Barbara Owens
text: These people NEVER answer the phones and NEVER return calls. Are they actually doing business????

name: Brandy Renz
text: Waited for 3 + hrs on 6/30 for Covid testing.. just received a call today, 7/16 with results. I called so many times, left messages, sent emails.. NOONE ever responded. The girl that called today told me there was issues with the lab.  DO NOT RECCOMEND.  Very poorly managed.

name: Justice Groom
text: They will not answer the phone COVID testing no call it’s been two days

name: Betty J
text: 1st and last time I use this clinic. I went June 28th for a covid test and still DO NOT have my results! I called several times and left messages without a returned call. I had to go somewhere else to get tested. Will not recommend this clinic to anyone.

name: Jamal Johnson
text:
No one answers the phone I called 11 time at 10 in the morning no one answered

Im a college student and just want my results that’s all 🤬

name: Shirley Land
text: My experience wasn’t bad at visit. Just received care after taking medication prescribed by Nurse practitioner and as still having symptoms which was only 7 days after the initial visit. Called to see could I get some more medications or re-evaluated to get an proper diagnosis. Office informed only had three days to be rescene in office. Still sick and no help from the office after waiting on return call from doctor.

name: ItZ Clown
text: Do not go here for testing waiting 2 hours in the parking lot for my test and now It’s been over 2 weeks and still no result and can’t get anyone to answer the phone

name: mo anderson
text: Fast and courteous service 🤗🤗

name: Jerri Marie Vice
text:
Rejected at the door with a kid with an earache, appointment only!? And this is from the website :
COVID-19 testing center
Appointment not required
Referral not required
Testing for all patients
We just needed general assistance!!

name: Amber H.
text:
Since Stop Watch Urgent Care took over, my opinion is this place is horrible.  In my experiences: they don't do stitches, they have an x-ray machine but can't read the x-rays, 99% of the time an actual doctor is not there, so you see a nurse practitioner who is very limited on what she can do.  When they took my x-rays, the x-ray tech was reading instructions from a binder.

Will not go back for anything!

Staff was nice, but in my opinion, medically uneducated.

name: Chris Williams
text: Quick, friendly, and knowledgeable. Highly recommend if you cannot see your primary physician.

name: Felicia Pickings
text: I’m still waiting on my Corvus-19 test results. It have been 10 days and they will not answer the telephone nor will they call you back after you leave a message. That is too long to wait on results

name: Billy Misso
text: If your looking for healthcare continue looking. You won’t find it here. This was a descent place until it became the stopwatch. New ownership and management made a huge turn for the WORST.

name: Mary Feltman
text:
This has been several little urgent care facilities, over the years, and all have been very good about taking care of my health issues, either after hours or when I just couldn’t go to my primary care doctor. I can’t say the same for this newest company; they left me in just about the same shape as when I went in, and $140.00 poorer.

First, I was so sick (flu) that I wasn’t thinking straight and didn’t bring the right purse; I didn’t have my physical insurance card. But I have a pic of it, front and back, and knew (ahem...ASSumed) they had my records from the many past visits. Didn’t think there’d be a problem. WRONG on so many levels. They refused to take the pics of my card…which all they were going to do was take a pic (copy) of a “real” card. They could have verified its authenticity several ways but chose not to.

Then they said they had no records of my past visits!!  They weren’t going to see me at all.!!!!!  I finally told her to just pretend that I didn’t HAVE insurance. “Oh.”  Really?!!?  So I paid the $140.00.

My asthma had my breathing so tight that I could hardly walk the short distance to the room. I had finally got to where I could take enough of a breath to use my inhaler, and that’s what enabled me to get TO the clinic and to the room; I was truly in need of a breathing treatment. Didn’t get one. Doctor said I didn’t need one because he “couldn’t hear me wheezing”. I reminded him that I had just, in the last 30 minutes, used my inhaler, and THAT is why he didn’t hear me wheezing, but told him I DID need a breathing treatment. Wouldn’t give me one. UNbelievable.

I have had asthma for probably longer than he’s had his MD....I KNOW my body. I KNEW I needed a breathing treatment! So “no shot and no help for my asthma” later, I left with a Rx for the FLU, and a work note for 3 days later (Monday), because I “should be able to go back to work by then”, which I wasn’t. I couldn’t return until Wednesday.

Poor, poor excuse of a doctor’s office. I won’t go back until it changes hands again.

Can not / will not recommend IF you’re really sick.

name: Billy Harrison
text: Office does not answer phone calls. Does not call or message with test results.

name: August Nelson
text: Worst place do not go .... got covid test and today is day 10 and they still have not return results no will they even pick up their phones . Do not go here if you need covid testing .

name: Kristen Jacobs
text: At Stopwatch, the medical teams are professionals with an extraordinary bedside manner and kindness. They provide great service with a very welcoming atmosphere. Great experience, you won't be disappointed!!!

name: Kristin Melton
text: Very warm and friendly place! I would recommend them to anyone! Receptionist was warm and friendly with a contagious smile! Great staff and physician! Highly recommend them!!! Thanks again guys!!

name: Laurel Bertram
text: I went to the Stopwatch Urgent Care in Hueytown last night at 6:00.  There was no one at the receptionist desk . I registered on th computer and sat. After 15 minutes my daughter knocked on the glass window and was told that the receptionist was in the restroom. When I described my foot injury to the receptionist she replied with “she can’t give you pain meds. You need to go to the emergency room.” She then called back to what I am assuming was the attending who also said go to the ER. No one actually looked at my foot. On top of that I was charged my copay for a visit. I would never recommend this business to anyone.

name: Latoya Herring
text:
This is the WORST doctor's office I've EVER visited. I attempted to be seen regarding swelling/fluid near my ankle...  The receptionist wasn't even friendly, she asked if I had been there before & sent me to check in at a kios. Then told me she called the doctor while I was checking in & was told they didn't have an x-ray tech there so I needed to go to the emergency room (bluetooth headset around her neck). I asked if the doctor planned on seeing me at all bc it was poor service to turn me away without even examining me. She gave some sorry excuse-- I was frustrated and in pain. They closed in an hour and I feel they were simply ready to leave.

I've also visited the facility one other time. I went for severe stomach pains. The doc wrote me a prescription and told me they would refer me to a specialist. I called for 2 weeks and they continued to say oh let me check on it but I wouldn't hear back. When they FINALLY called me back it was nearly 4 weeks later and I had already visited another physician who told me it was my gall bladder and I had even had emergency surgery by the time they called me back. SMH. THIS FACILITY NOR THE DOES THE STAFF TRULY CARE ABOUT HELPING THE SICK/ILL. STAY AWAY!

name: POSRockCrawler
text: Doc seemed competent enough. But rest of staff is not. 1st visit for foot injury I was told they would set me a referral with an orthopedist. I was never contacted. Went back 13 days later for follow up, was told same thing about them setting me up with ortho. Again, heard nothing. I called them 5 days later to let them know I was still not contacted and they said they would look into it.  That was 10 days ago and still no ortho. I can not go back to work until being release for full duty by ortho. I have now used all my vacation and am losing money.

name: tomoney 873
text: My experience was amazing here.The staff was friendly and very professional.TC was helpful and courteous.  I Highly recommend them !!

name: Aaliyah Brown (lele)
text: Took them forever to get to me, it seemed as if there was only one nurse who took everyone’s checkups. I was three for 1 hour, horrible service.

name: Halie Davis
text: Great experince every time we use Stopwatch. In and out within 30 minutes. Friendly staff. The doctors truly care about their patients and and want to get you feeling better as quickly as possible .

name: Lizbeth ortiz
text: Test results take forever , and they don’t ever answer the phone ...  also took them more than a hour to call me up to the front desk just to ask questions and took another 30 min to take me to a room ... ! Terrible service’s

name: Bryant Irwin
text: Best experience in diagnosis and treatment.The receptionist was super helpful and friendly and knew how to handle insurance procedures.I would definitely refer this clinic to my family and friends for the superior speedy service I received.Thanks Stopwatch!!

name: Tanner Cofield
text: 0 stars. Got there at 12:15.. got called back at 2:15.. then waited another hour in the room. So if urgent means 3 hour care then yes they’re urgent. The doctor popped in for 1 minute said “influenza A”, quickly listened to heartbeat, then said you’re good to go and walked out. Was in no way helpful. We had to ask for a prescription and shot. Terribly unprofessional care.

name: Tina Hoover
text: Great service and a very friendly staff. My son was see by the doctor and had prescriptions and out the door under an hour.

name: Kathy Cornelius
text: Fast, friendly and they knew I was in pain as soon as I walked in and tried to make everything quick as possible

name: timothy lawson
text: Great place with friendly staff! Highly recommend them!!!

name: Tim Hendrix
text: I had a sinus infection needed allergy shots. Got none no antibiotic just wrote prescriptions for atuff available over the counter . Total waste of time and my co pay.

name: The Little Scientist's
text: Great service in and out in 1hr even with me filling out new patient paper work

name: Isaac Johnson
text: Very nice service love the smiles

name: M
text: Great service . AWESOME!!!!

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Had excellent experience at the imaging center!

name: Amber Allison
text: When this place first opened the Doctor was great as well as the staff. They listened. It became my go to place and a place I recommended. The last few times it has gotten worse every time. Yesterday I came in and the staff was rude. The nurse had a bad attitude, you could see and feel the dread in her attitude. She didn’t listen. The doctor was just okay. The other nurse that came in to give me a shot treated me like a dart board. I get sick often so I’ve endured my fair share of shots. After the first STAB I let her know that was really hard and she didn’t blink an eye to STAB me again. Then they called my scripts in to the wrong place after I waited at the pharmacy for an hour. I call the doctors office back and they said it would take awhile to get it to the correct pharmacy so I said I’d just pick it up where they sent it. I get to the next pharmacy and after waiting 30 minutes to get my scripts they informed me the doctors office called and moved them. I call the doctors office back, not happy, and the receptionist had an attitude. I asked why they moved them after I asked them not to and where did they send them this time and she had an even worse attitude. 3 hours after my visit, I got my scripts. 6 hours later I arrived back home. Not pleased with at all! If there was a rating of 0 they earned it. I understand everyone is running ragged here lately. Doctor offices and sick people but rude treatment is still unacceptable. Disappointed!

name: Nancy Waller
text: Whenever I have to go to Southeast Urgent Care, I am welcomed immediately.  I have rarely had to wait more than just a few minutes to go to a room with a technician.  That process goes very quickly and professionally, and within minutes, Dr. Taylor comes in to make his assessment of my plan of care.  I usually require a shot...and the best shot-giver is Josh.  He is a very caring technician and does a great job.  Even though going to a urgent care clinic is due to an injury or illness, this is a wonderful place to go and I always have had a positive experience.  Thank you all!!!

name: NiKki C.
text: The girl's that run this office, from the nurses, to the girl's at the front desk, they are all so helpful and they are always so sweet and very patient and polite. They have gone out of their way to help me with questions even though I called them several times for a few days. Even though their waiting area was full of people, they never did say anything rude to me at all. The doctor is very good also. He is very caring and he's a great doctor.

name: C Willingham
text: If zero were an option that is what they would get. Made me feel like a moron for walking on their door. I was diagnosed with Flu at another facility on Wednesday and went in on Sunday because I am not any better. The NP said well what did you expect? You have the flu. She was so condescending to me it was ridiculous. I have a terrible cough, guess what she prescribed? Phenegran!!! That is not for coughs!!! Terrible place

name: Toni LaVecchia
text: If negative stars were an option that’s what I would pick. I’ve never been treated so poorly at a Doctors office. To top it off they sent my prescription to the wrong pharmacy after telling the Doctor AND the nurse which pharmacy to send them to. Then tried to get me to go pick it up at the pharmacy I had never been to!!!!! I do not recommend this place to anyone.

name: QJ Jordan
text: I was very pleased with my experience. The clinic was very clean and the staff were really polite and professional. I feel the RN gave my toddler an accurate diagnosis and the appropriate treatment. I would definitely recommend Southeast Urgent Care at Fultondale!

name: Rhonda Lovell
text: I have always had a great experience here! From the receptionist to the nurses. The doctors take time with you and don't try to rush to the other patient. Also the wait time has always been minimum.🤒🤧😷You go in feeling bad and within a day usually a lot better!🤗😉😇

name: Mike Prather
text: Love this place. Jessica gives great shots.

name: TL STEWART
text:
Dr. No Bedsidemanner was callous. Nurse basically threatened me because I was crying from news dr gave me. Didn’t want to do my blood work.
Was a nice Dr there before.  Won’t go there again unless I feel like being emotionally abused!

name: Terah Phillips
text: If zero were an option, that's what they would have. My husband nor I have ever received a bill from them, we haven't been to this clinic in over 2 years, but we have received 3 notices of being turned over to collections. Never received a call apologizing, still fighting a $40 charge that was paid 6 months ago. Unbelievable. I cannot say enough bad things about this place.

name: Amelia Garcia
text: Not too happy. I was told that there was one person in line ahead of me when I signed in online. When I got there there were about ten people ahead of me. I was lead to believe that my spot would be held when I called. I have a very busy schedule. When I asked if it would be a reasonable expectation for me to be out at specific time, the lady at the front smirked and informed me that all of the other people were still ahead of me regardless of me previously signing in online. I'm so glad that she got a kick out of it.

name: Nelda Drummond
text: I arrived 30 minutes before closing and an employee locked the door as I was getting out of the car to come in. She looked at me as she was doing it. I was parked in the nearest parking space to the door. This shows no caring and compassion for the sick! I will never go there again and I will tell everyone I know of this experience!

name: Lucy Kiley
text: Took my husband, was treated great, in and out in a timely manor, doctor very through! We will go for our next ER needs!!

name: Meredith Knight
text: I saw Dr. Taylor and he is amazing.  I got my shot and prescription and was done in about 22 minutes!  I usually hate going to the doctor but I will be going here from now on!

name: Dearilo Arnold
text: Everytime I go there they r always helpful.

name: Emile Hughes
text: I went in because I have been having some neck pain. They did a great job, took an xray, talked to me about the problem, and we agreed on a plan if it doesn't resolve. A+

name: Greg Randall
text: I went up to this urgent care with a nasty cold, and they got me in to see the doctor in just a few minutes. It was awesome cause they took care of me, and got me in and out FAST!

name: Lee wright
text: Very nice the Dr was very polite to me.

name: Designs by Me
text: Dr. Jacobs will take care of the situation.

name: Misty Williams
text: So slow... took forever to be seen.

name: JM Wilson
text: No tests, no x-rays, diagnosed within 5 minutes with a stethoscope.

name: Rebecca Jones
text: Fantastic & quick.

name: Jennifer Berry
text: Signing in on line was nice. The front desk staff was so friendly to everyone that walked up. The nurse who triaged me was very kind. The NP that took care of me was knowledgeable, answered questions, and made the experience less stressful. Very satisfied.

name: Caitlin Seahorn
text: We came in at 7:30, right before closing, and we were the only patients there. The staff did not show any sign of any frustration. They were quick to assist me and allowed my husband to do what he could for me. The NP kept me talking to get my mind off my migraine and without realizing, it actually helped. She recommended a pharmacy right down the road since it was after hours and would be easier to get than the pharmacy I listed. Both ladies were super friendly; I’ve never had such a great interaction when I was in such pain.

name: Kei Bottoms
text: It's nice to be able to hold your spot from your phone, and enter all of the necessary information before heading out. You still have to wait some from time to time, but nothing compared to just walking in. Front lady is always very nice, she listens to you well and gives you what you need. I can tell how busy she can be, yet she is very very patient and polite. Entire staff is very nice group of ladies. Highly recommended.

name: Carolyn Holt
text: I am a veteran and the Muscle Shoals location is approved for urgent care needs of veterans when we can't get into our outpatient clinic fast. Upon arrival, I gave the receptionist the info she needed to make sure I am approved for care thru the VA. This poor lady was on the phone for close to 45 min trying to get the information she needed on a reference number. She was transfered to other numbers, only to be disconnected. She was literally my guardian angel towards the VA to get me seen. At one point, I even offered to pay the costs and "argue" with the VA on my own. She refused to let me pay out of pocket expenses for my visit because I was a veteran. I was so touched by her help and determination. Unfotunately, I don't know her name, but because of her kindness, I will always give this clinic high reviews to anyone who listens. To that receptionist: YOU ROCK and THANK YOU!!!

name: Melissa Scofield
text: They do a great job!  Very nice staff and they know what they’re doing. Highly recommend.

name: Taylor Boston
text: I have visited this facility a couple different times, and overall have had a good experience every time. I went yesterday and saw the NP, who is always great. I left very pleased, and even got on and left a good review. Today, I retract that good review. I understand they are busy, and it’s a crazy time. Yet, things were told to me by the front desk on the phone on one call, and then I was told “I am putting words in her mouth” and had a nice little argument on a separate call. I will not put the whole situation on here, unnecessary, but I just am not pleased with what happened. I work in healthcare, and usually do not complain about bad experiences, because everyone has bad days. Just felt like something needed to be said.

resp.text: Taylor, we regret you had a negative experience while in our care, especially after several good ones. We strive to ensure every patient receives an exceptional experience, every time. We appreciate your feedback as we would like to address your concerns and improve where we can. Please contact us directly at info@hhurgentcare.org to discuss your experience further.

name: Sandra B
text: Very friendly staff! My in and out time was amazing.... shortest visit I\'ve ever had while getting excellent care. Would highly recommend

name: Michael Charpentier
text: Fast and efficient. No hassle health-care. An oasis in the maze of finding quality care. Thank you Courtney 😊

name: John kyler
text: Here I was delivering to a local business. Started rushing around to get things done because it was Friday evening and I didn't want anyone to stay longer than needed. Welp it ended up that I got a nasty injury on a finger. The crew at Huntsville got me right in and had me fixed up good. The staff was very professional, caring and friendly. Whether it's a dust storm or a virus. They got it covered!

resp.text:
John,
We are sorry you hurt yourself but glad we were able to get you taken care of. Thanks for choosing us and thanks for the great review!

name: Kendal Crowell
text: I have always hated going to the doctor, however, the office staff and the practitioner, Courtney, made me feel so comfortable and welcome. They took good care of me and made COVID-19 testing not bad at all. I will definitely be coming back here when I need healthcare in the future.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback and 5-star review! We appreciate it.

name: Baron C
text: Extremely friendly, professional and courteous staff. The entire staff was very knowledgeable and made my visit quick and easy.

resp.text: Thank you for the review.

name: Bill Beard
text: Very poor service.  I pre-set an oppointment for 9:45, I arrived early and waited for over 3 hours to see a nurse.  I will never come here again.

resp.text:
Bill,
We are sorry you did not have a good experience due to the extensive wait at our center. We appreciate feedback and use it to improve where we can. Please contact us directly at: info@hhurgentcare.org and someone will reach out to you shortly.

name: Rachel Walls
text: From the super friendly office staff to the amazing Nurse practitioner I had a wonderful experience.  I love the way they are constantly spraying Lysol to help with the spread of germs!!  Nurse Practitioner, Erica Hogeland was awesome. She is easy to talk to and very knowledgeable of my condition. I will defiantly recommend them to my family and friends!

resp.text: Thanks for this great review and recommendation. We are here to help!

name: JulieAnnShultz
text: The staff was so sweet with our 2 year old today. It was 15 minutes until closing and we came in with a broken arm. They took their time and gave her the best care! 100% recommend this clinic!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Tracy
text: The NP and other staff provided quick and competent care . I will definitely return for any urgent care needs

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Ella Cannon
text: The ladies who took care of me were super nice and professional. If you ever need blood work done go here and ask for Haley. I have always feared getting my blood drawn but I barley felt it at all!!! Thanks ladies for being so awesome.

name: Laurie Lane
text: This place is great! I cannot stand going to the doctor. The staff here is super friendly and helpful. The facilities are clean and modern. Highly recommend!

resp.text: We appreciate your business and thank you for leaving a 5-star review. Come back and see us when you need to.

name: Chad Thompson
text: Absolutely Amazing Experience! Super Friendly Receptionist, The Nurse Practitioner Was Excellent! Made us feel cared about, and like a family oriented atmosphere! Highly Recommended!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your recommendation and great review!

name: Katie Holt
text: Unfortunately we have had to visit this urgent care several times since Christmas because of sickness, but I wouldn't dare go anywhere else in the Shoals when we need a quick visit. Everyone I have met on their staff is very friendly and helpful.  Ms. Pennington, CRNP is my favorite to see. She is very nice and seems to be genuinely concerned about our health.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We are glad we've been able to help.

name: Morgan McCullar
text:
The best advice I can give is DO NOT go here. I went in this morning because I had a sore throat and runny nose. I simply wanted to be tested for flu or strep before I returned to work. They did not take my temperature or anything, but asked me if I had been to China. When I responded that I had recently been to Europe (not China), the doctor came out and said, “I will not see you. You need to leave”.
She made me feel like a freak and she did not treat me like a fellow human being. I asked, “you won’t even test me for flu?”  And she said, “no, you need to go to the ER. This is serious.”
I went to another doctor’s office and it turns out I have a sinus infection. These people should be ashamed of the way they treat patients. I went there for help and I was turned away very rudely.

resp.text:
Morgan,
We apologize for your experience at our center. There is a protocol for international travel and we do not turn away patients that need care. This situation is being addressed and handled by management. If you would like to discuss further, you may contact us at: info@urgentteam.com.

name: Dee Rachela Houston
text: Always wonderful from the moment you walk in until you leave. Truly a wonderful staff! Even my kids love to come because they have a kid friendly table and crayons w printouts. Above and beyond and the medical team here is superb!

name: Captain Krunch
text: Took my insurance card, charged me a 10 dollar co pay. 3 weeks down the road I received a bill for the full amount. I seen a similar review of this here and had I known this was going to happen then i just would have left. Seems pretty shady to me.

resp.text:
Sorry for the delayed response. Our centers offer a safe credit card payment option called Secure Pay. The front desk should have made you aware of this as it provides a convenient and secure method for you to pay your insurance deductible and coinsurance prior to service. Additionally, your credit card will be used to pay any remaining balances your insurance does not cover.

After your visit, we submit your medical claim to your insurance company for the services provided. Once your insurance company pays its contracted portion, you will receive a statement in the mail explaining the portion your insurance paid and what (if any) balance is your responsibility. You will then have 14 days from the statement date to either arrange for another method of payment or request more information regarding the bill. If we have not received payment after 14 days, Secure Pay will charge your credit card for the balance due.

If you would like to discuss further, please email your contact information to: info@urgentteam.com and someone will reach out shortly.

name: Em
text: Wait time was minimal but I was misdiagnosed. I was told sinus infection but I actually have shingles that spread to my eye.  I was very clear with my complaints/symptoms, but was still misdiagnosed. (I didn't know it at the time, but all the symptoms I had basically screamed shingles infection.)  You'd think if I'm capable of googling this, a nurse practitioner would have certainly recognized the symptoms and learned about it in school. 🤷🏻‍♀️  She was actually kind of rude, didn't listen to me (obviously) and seemed more concerned with the little brown flecks I have in my irises. Seriously?! I was given antibiotics but should have gotten an antiviral medicine. Timing is crucial with this, and since I didn’t start the medicine in a timely manner, it’s going to take twice as long to heal, and I could lose vision in my eye. This place is probably okay for kids ear infections, bronchitis, etc., but that’s it. I won’t be going back.

name: Destinee Barnes
text: This facility refused to see a patient that had a fever of 101.3 and is 6 weeks pregnant. Told I would have to come back the next morning at 8am. It was 4:30 and they didn’t close until 5.

resp.text: We are sorry we were unable to help you at our center recently. While we take walk-ins, we also encourage the use of our online scheduling to avoid long waits. Unfortunately, due to unprecedented volumes, some centers may reach maximum capacity before the end of posted hours. When this occurs, it is necessary for the center to stop additional registration/check-ins for the remainder of the day. We are making ongoing refinements to meet the community's need for services during the pandemic and keep everyone safe, and apologize if this happened when you needed to see one of our healthcare providers.

name: Lisa Green
text: Had to carry my son in on friday August 17,2019. He had been stung on his face by an unknown bee/wasp. His face had began to swell as well as his eyes swelling shut. I knew we didn't have much time. He was seen immediately and treated with the best care possible. Everyone there was amazing and very professional. Big shout out to the entire staff and a special thank u for calling to check on Alex today. ❤❤❤

name: Brittney Shupe
text: I have been here several times. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The wait time has never been very long

resp.text: Thanks Brittney

name: Aaron Page
text: Front Clerk was excellent as well as all other support staff. Quick, Efficient, Friendly!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Mercedes Alexander
text: The CRNP and the black nurse where amazing they both were sweet and understanding . My issue is with the receptionist she has ZERO personality and was kind of rude. I would go back because I received good care but I think they should hire more personable office assistants.

name: Breanna Prestage
text: Super fast visit in and out ! Everyone was super friendly and very caring.  I would highly reccomend urgent team in muscle shoals !

name: Archantia Whiteside
text: The Receptionist Is Rude , Didn’t Smile Not Once At Anyone Who Came In Interrupts You ,  While Thinking She Knows Everything Do Better Please Ma’am But Other Than That Great Place And The Nurse Was Sweet And Caring .

name: jaidah riboldi
text: This place is amazing they are totally kid friendly and they have really nice service and will take care of your every need

resp.text: Thank you! Glad we could help!

name: Hunter Barnett
text: Was in and out in 30 mins. Got me taken care of. Much faster and better than Med Plus.

resp.text: Thank you Hunter

name: Kimberley Powell
text: When your sick, you don’t want to get out in public much less wait anywhere and I was in and out here within 30 minutes. Very friendly staff and super clean place! Highly recommended!

name: Dusty McCain
text: Quick friendly knowledgeable staff! Would definitely recommend going here.

resp.text: Thanks Dusty!

name: Jon Cannon
text: They really care about you and your need. Great Medical Treatment. Thanks!!!

resp.text: Thanks

name: Lee Watkins
text:
Positives - Facility is clean. Very little wait time. Staff is friendly. CRNP Erica is thorough and friendly.

Negatives - CRNP Laura is rude. Interrupts. Doesn’t listen. Also brought teenage child in with flu A and cough. They can’t prescribe anything stronger than over the counter. So don’t waste time or money unless you need them to help you pick out an over the counter med. Go to your medical doctor. So I gave it a 1 star as the visit was unproductive and wish I’d waited 12 hours until our pediatrician opened.

resp.text:
Lee,
We are sorry you had this experience at our center. With the flu, the only prescription given is for anti-virals (Tamiflu, and the brand new Xofluza) IF given within the first 48 hours since symptoms first came on. We are more than happy to discuss your treatment (and your son's) further -- if you'd like to send your contact email/phone number directly to: info@urgentteam.com someone will reach out to you shortly.

name: Maria Strickland
text: Came in 10 mins before closing my husband had poison oak and they took him in with no problem. Very friendly people and was in and out quickly.

resp.text:
Maria,
Thanks for your review, we appreciate your feedback. Glad we were able to help.

name: Patrick Oliver
text: Great staff , fast, super friendly and great care everytime !

resp.text: Happy to oblige!

name: Cody Braly
text: Haley, Sherka, and Nataline provided very great, fast, and professional service.

resp.text: Thanks

name: Reyaires Anderson
text: Very friendly staff, clean facilities, always very helpful. Wait time is little to none and the nurses are always caring to each situation you may have.

resp.text:
Reyaires,
Thanks for the 5-star review. We appreciate it. We are glad you had a good experience and hope you rely on us in the future to help take care of you.

name: Gee Connson
text: I used these people once, your best advice is if you are reading this and your name has not been called yet leave and go to some where down the street.

name: Brandon Staggs
text: They charged my insurance company $409 for a a 5 minute office visit that included no lab work or anything. It’s a scam.

resp.text:
Brandon,
Unfortunately there is an after hours fee that is billed (to some insurances) for hours outside of regular office hours. If you wish to discuss further and see your cost breakdown, please contact us directly at: info@urgentteam.com

name: Charlotte Chamberlain
text: Super nice staff..It didn't take long. Fast diagnosis ..Thanks for helping me today.

name: Rhonda Mannon
text: Super friendly and caring staff. Love them here!

name: Jaz N
text: Usually no long wait. Always friendly and helpful. My kids and I have been here multiple times.

name: Dar Spe
text: Everything was fine as I signed in to see the dr. They took my insurance card and charged my copay but a couple weeks down the road I received a bill for the entire amount. I found out later they dont take my insurance. There was no mention to me of this or I would have left. Now I owe over 120$ because of it. I won't go back that's for sure. I have a very well known insurance ot would have paid but now I'm stuck with a bill.

name: Kimberly Osborne
text: I had to wait 40 minutes to see anybody. There was only 2 people in front of me. The nurse told me i tested positive for the flu but are thought it was alloy gone so she didn't give me a prescription for it. Needless to say I'm worse Rossi than yesterday andI feel I waisted my money going here. The receptionist let me stand there for 10 minutes after I see the nurse waiting for a paper to take to my job.

resp.text: Kimberly, We are sorry you’ve had this experience at our center. And sorry you are not feeling well. We would appreciate the opportunity to follow up directly with you. Please email your name and email address and/or phone number to info@urgentteam.com and a center manager will reach out to you shortly to discuss. Thank you.

name: ANTOINE Robinson
text: Best Urgent Care clinic in the area !!!! Hands down!!

resp.text: Thanks Antoine!

name: Kellie Calderon
text: Great service. Modern

name: Stitchedbyyoshi
text: Great timing and staff was profesional

name: Linda Hudson
text: Friendly, professional staff, very clean facility!

name: Brandi Cash
text: Nice place! Doctor and nurses were so friendly! Very convenient to go on weekends close to my home when I can not go to my primary doctor out of town. Def will go there again!

name: Sue Oden
text: The doctor was wonderful!  He gave me his full attention.  I felt that he really cared about me.  He was gracious and so well- mannered. He took his time to listen to my symptoms and not only wrote my prescription, but also gave me additional advice in order to help me feel better as quickly as possible.

name: Erin Gilchrist
text: The staff and professionals in this office took such great care of my daughter yesterday.  They have excellent bedside manner, and seem highly intelligent in medical expertise.  I will be going back and seeing these helpful people when needed, again.  The NP was great with my 3 year old.  A family man himself, he seemed very familiar with children's care and their needs.  I can't recommend enough!

name: Kim Goodwin
text: I have been here twice, once for strep throat and today for stitches.  I've had a great experience both times, staff and doctors are super friendly.  I was in and out fairly quick, and they fixed me up both times! I would definitely recommend them to friends.

name: Bonnie Malone
text: Fast, caring, accurate medical service with no unnecessary tests, procedures, or fees in a clean, modern facility. I love the automatic doors at entry and swing/push doors inside to cut down on germ contact. I took my mom last week for bronchitis and had to go back myself this week after waiting in my doctor’s office for four hours as a walk-in before canceling my appointment and going to the GoNow Doctors a couple of minutes down the road. Both doctors we saw were cheerful, knowledgeable, and expedient without making us feel rushed, as were all support staff as well.

name: Natalie Cone
text: VERY sweet doctor. I was grateful they were open n a Sunday. All the lab techs, nurses, and office admins were very sweet. When my 6 year old got restless they gave him a Capri sun. :)

name: Brandon Godwin
text:
The facility is located directly off interstate and easily accessible. The staff were all kind, courteous, and helpful ..... and The Doc rocks. I currently find myself without insurance, but there were no obstacles or hoops to jump through ; just one very reasonable fee.  The Doc took the time to hear out my health complications and listened to my situation,  which, sadly, is something many doctors neglect to slow down and do these days ....
.... if there were more than 5 stars to give you guys, then you would be receiving those too.
Thank You guys .....

name: mama22munchkins
text: I’ve been here several times and never seen it crowded. The doctors are all very friendly and quick. I have been very pleased with this place on every visit.

name: Sandra Robinson
text: So nice to have a place to go that is close by and you are treated very well! So pleased with everyone there, they was very sweet and patient! Thank you so much!!

name: When life Talks
text: The staff and the Doctor were great. It was Christmas Eve and I ended up diagnosed with influenza B-I had no choice but to see a doctor that morning, my fever was worse and my blood pressure had been plummeting the night before. I can’t thank you enough for being open! Everything was clean & the visit was quick. Thank you.

name: Ed Brasher
text: I can’t remember the doctors name but he was super! Spent time with me to discuss my problem and was in no hurry. Hard to find that anymore. I always have a good experience here but today was the best. If you are the doctor who took care of me I’m sorry I can’t remember your name but I know you understand and you will never know how much you helped me today. Please keep your bed side manner! You don’t see that much anymore. Thanks again. Ed

name: Patrick Eskew
text: Office was very clean. Employees were very nice and helpful. Was seen very quickly and treated like a family member. Highly recommend everyone should come here.

name: Kathy Lacks
