They told me, after I was hit by a car mind you, even though I have insurance, & I have even met my out of pocket, I have to self pay.. a reimbursed is given after my referral is recieved. Referral is recieved within 24 hours but it takes SIX weeks to get your money back. If you need immediate help, go to SOUTHERN RAPID CARE in Orange Beach. Its worth the drive. They will see you with no if, and or butts... because there, you are a PATIENT with immediate needs.

This place is just another pop up "fake" doc in the box.

name: Blake Evans
text:
Con: Its taking them days to simply send a referral to the orthopedic group, after I have spoken to them multiple times about it.

Pro: they usually answer the phone the first time 🤷🏼‍♂️

name: Evelyn Lowery
text: Immediate Care in Foley was great in my visit. Donna Beck CRNP, Courtney Warren RN, Tracey Gatchell RTR, and Stevie Ivec were professional and efficient. I would recommend using them. Walter Lowery

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our staff tries very hard to give excellent customer service!

name: Ralph Mitchell
text:
After a long wait (although there were only 5 ahead of me)...I 1st saw the nurse, then the PA, then the doctor.  I told him my problem and after less than a minute he said “that doesn’t make any sense” in effect - calling me a liar. He left without another word. Then the nurse came back with prescriptions. Had he listened to me more closely, his treatment plan would have been different. Now I’ll have to Take off from work again spend time in another waiting room.

Update: As predicted, I eventually had to make an appointment to see an ENT because the issue persisted. The wait time was minimal, and the specialist immediately saw the problem.  Within 5-10 minutes, the issue was completely resolved.

name: Melanie Buettner
text: So happy to find this clinic! The staff and doctors were so nice and friendly! We will always go back when in town!

name: Candy Vinson
text: The worst experience ever! If you're sick, please go elsewhere even if you have to drive 3 hours. The wait is horrific and the doctors are worse!

name: Don Wilmot
text: First time patient. I was going to go to the Gulf Shores clinic but since I live in Foley thought I would give them a try. Got in quickly. Was there for a cold and received a shot, three prescriptions, and cough syrup.  Was very happy with the service I received and will definitely return.

name: Jill Arnold
text: This is a great place!!! The staff is amazing. I highly recommend.

name: Alley Neil
text: I had a great experience at Immediate Care. The staff was friendly and caring. I was in and out in 1 hour. I will definitely go back.

name: Carley
text: Excellent service with courteous staff! I was in and out very quick. Highly recommend!

name: Amanda Keesee
text: Dr.Morrar was rude and disrespectful. I too would have left him zero stars if possible.

name: Jone Noble
text: Spent 3 hours in waiting room and then was misdiagnosed. The Dr said my ear was impacted, it was not. I went in for an ear infection. Had my ear lavaged for 20 mins, nothing came out. Then they told me my Medicare Advantage insurance card was no good and I paid $150. My insurance company paid them 7 days later. I guess they filed a claim after I left. Now they owe me a refund and I have been trying to get it for 3 months. They will not call me back. It’s unethical and illegal to refuse to pay a refund.

name: Jdubyah
text:
Care was very good although wait time was about an hour. Doctor was very efficient.
Forgot my medicare card and was charged $75.00 co-pay. I went back on 12/15/2014 in the A.M. and presented my medicare card and was told the 75.00 would be refunded. I contacted the billing dept. in  ‎February 2015 but as of yet I have received no refund.

name: Pamela Roberts
text: I've been going here for the past few years if my primary Dr is closed or if they are busy.  I have never had to wait a long time.   Yesterday was busy when I got there for the crud, I only waited about 30 minutes in the lobby.  They gave me a shot and I can actually breathe, then of course an antiobiodic. The Dr gave me all the time I needed.  Staff has always been kind and considerate.

name: Local Business
text: I went Thursday for an  infection. The nurses were attentive, caring and friendly .Brett, the P.A actually LISTENED TO ME!! Asked questions and agreed to what I  knew was the antibiotic I needed. A woman knows her body! So many doctors do not acknowledge this!! There was one minor glitch in that my prescription was sent to the  the wrong pharmacy. I went back the next day and spoke to charlesee (spelling?). She said it was called in so I drove over again.. Charlesee realized it was sent again to the wrong pharmacy. SHE GOT IN HER CAR AND DROVE TO THE PHARMACY TO APOLOGIZE AND INTERCEPT ME!!  Amazing customer service!

resp.text: Our staff try’s very hard to give excellent customer service. Thank you for the review!

name: Mary Matthews
text: I went in with a bladder infection early Saturday. I was seen fast and got a prescription. They had to go out of their way to call in the prescription  because the pharmacy was in one town but listed in phone book as another. I was able to get the prescription and make it to a 10:00 am meeting. Very good service above and beyond. Thanks!!

name: Tracy Clifton
text:
The staff and care are top notch.
The facility need a serious scrubbing the bathtooms were out of paper towels
Huge cobb webs in patient exam rooms
Furniture was filthy

name: Jennifer Austin
text: After seeing 2 nurses and 1 doctor, no diagnosis was given and the doctor said he would call in antibiotics for my child. Went to pharmacy and no prescription had been sent. BEWARE.

name: Marty Majors
text: Went with serious back pain, With insurance. Wanted $150 co pay! They were out of their flipping minds, I would pay less at the hospital emergency room for a visit. Receptionist's were nice and definitely not their fault but this is absolutely what's wrong with our medical system.

name: Annie Mcmahan
text: The staff is pleasant, professional and very efficient.  Recommended for everyone who needs a great experience with Urgent Care.

name: Jacqueline Ozburn
text: Great doctors. I went in for a broken bone and was in and out so quickly. Thought I would have had to go to the hospital but little did I know they had x-ray and on-site lab! How great is that? Friendly, very clean, and in and out so quickly. It was a great thing to have this in Foley!

name: Ryanne Lempert
text: went in because I was coughing blood. I called to request x-rays after a week of taking antibiotics because the blood in my mucus was increasing. Response ? “There is no note in your record saying you were coughing blood” LITERALLY THE ONLY REASON I WENT IN?! I feel really let down by this team of medical staff...I don’t even know how to process this information because even if I call corporate nothing will be done... I am now at Southern Rapid care in orange beach, where I have revived x-rays, bloodwork, and a steroid inj by an angel of a doctor! For the same $150 I had to pay just to be seen at immediate care.  She even looked in my ears and told me to stay on my antibiotics because my ears are still infected (something the other doctor,, Dr. Mark Russell, didn’t even mention) bottom line immediate care: sketchy as hell, Southern Rapid Care: A+

name: tpitts90
text: Immediate Care has advertised Sports Physicals for $10 on their billboard outside their office for months. Every time we have called to see what times we could come by we are told they do not have a physician there that can perform the physical. After being told the same thing again today I decided to call back and inquire when exactly they will begin doing the physicals they have been advertising. I was told they have no idea when they will have a physician in the clinic. I believe it is time to edit their sign. In case anyone is in need of having one performed Thomas Urgent Care will do them for $25 anytime/day they are open.

name: Amy Rivers
text: We've been here several times. Everyone is very nice and efficient! We've never waited long and have been happy with how they handled our medical situations!

name: Steven Graham
text:
This place sucks.

I went in there in a lot of pain and worried about what was going on. I don't have a primary doctor because I am from out of town and wanted to get checked immediately to make sure I was alright.

The lady that saw me didn't even check me out or anything. I told her about one of my past conditions and she had to Google it to tell me what I already knew. Like literally read google off of her phone. She did no diagnostics and wouldn't even give me a prescription for the pain when I had my old medication bottle from my previous doctor to treat the same condition. She gave me some crappy shot that didn't do anything for the pain. On top of having to pay this place for nothing and laying in bed with pain all night, I had to go to the emergency room the next day to finally get some treatment.

Do not go here. This place sucks balls.

name: Marah Olivia
text:
I went to Immediate Care for FULL body hives. I checked in and was immediately told that because of the insurance I had I would have to have a referral to be seen. This was a Saturday and I had no way to get a referral, but regardless I was told I could pay or go somewhere else. I kindly asked if I could have my primary care physician to fax a referral over first thing Monday and was told no.

I was desperate so I just left and luckily found another facility 30 mins away.

I promptly reached out to my insurance company and I was told that I had 72 hours to provide a facility with a referral. I was also told that after 6 pm on weekdays and weekends I didn't even need a referral.

This kind of treatment is NOT PROFESSIONAL!

name: Marion Jennings
text: This is the place to go if you are looking to feel better, have a physical, preemployment drug screening, full labs and pharmacy, digital xrays, quick in and out, with a kind and caring staff!

name: Alan McCaa
text: Takes forever and a day! I know all Dr's offices take a while, but geez, 3 hrs is ridiculous!

name: Brock Cook
text: If I could give less stars I would. Sat in same place for 3 hours then get to back room to wait another hour and a half. You probably will feel better with no assistance in the amount of time you wait.

name: Brandi W
text: Every member of my family has had occasion to visit Immediate Care in Foley and we always receive excellent care and quality service. Quick, easy, and accurate. Thank you!

name: karen owen
text: Great efficient service. Will recommend to my beach buddies. Thanks

name: Janet Dill
text:
Would go back again.  Dr. Sheila Dillard was very helpful and nice. She diagnosed the problem within minutes.
Only thing I did not get any kind of paper to leave with to tell me what I was given or instructions.

name: Clayton Singleton
text: Up to this point in time my family and I had visited and had a good experience. But this time I was in for a surprise. I was told that because a military doctor was seeing all patients and I was using Tricare as my secondary insurance, that I could not be seen. I said just use my Blue Cross only. But, because I had used Tricare before, I still could not be seen. But I was informed that I could come back tomorrow and see the civilian doctor that would be there. I left feeling I was not worth receiving treatment because I had Tricare. The decision was made that my family and I would never return. I will go anywhere but Immediate Care in Foley. Let me know when you have figured out how to see patients no matter what the situation is. I might reconsider.

name: Hicham Elouardi
text:
Believe me guys,I was shocked coz the young man dr came in in my room to check on me and stayed less than 30s.
I didn't  know what was going on.is it all about money !!
He did ask me the same question that the nurse did,that means he didn't have time to look at the form she filled up before he showed up in my room.hope things get better.

name: Kayla Hatcher
text: My 5 year old and i both have been seen here very family friendly fast but great visit!

name: Alice Dwyer
text: I had a horrible experience yesterday at this clinic.  I’m not sure what I am going to do about it.  But people should know.

name: Jennifer Deitz
text: Shady billing practices and rude billing associate. It's a Doc-in-the-box, i don't expect more than a quick once over, honestly.  I took my son in for the Flu. The Nurse Practitioner was nice enough, especially when she found out I was a nurse and worked with someone she knew, the doctor came in to say hi, that is about it.  We have the high deductible health plan so I knew i was paying out of pocket.  I paid the $150 up front, then a couple of months later got a bill for his flu and strep tests, this should be included in the up front fee. My real disagreement is that they charged for both Flu A and Flu B, when i know it is the same test.  When I asked the billing associate to remove the charge she became extremely rude and said the insurance "required" her to charge that way.  The insurance told me it is up to their discretion, but they can charge for each to make more money.  After the way the horrid lady spoke to me we will never go back.

name: Andrew Hedger
text: We're on a family vacation 900 miles from home.  I drove my dad here for a nagging earache.  They said they couldn't accept his insurance and then proceeded to tell him he would need to pay $150 just to be seen.  $150 just to look in someone's ear to see if he has an infection or not?  That's criminal.  A 5 minute exam and maybe a prescription for a antibiotic and he would have been out the door.  I could see maybe $75 for the exam if he needed a script.  Instead, you got nothing.  That flat out price gouge on out-of-state travelers made him so mad we left.  He said he'd rather deal with it until we get home and he could see his doctor.  This place would never get a dime from him after that.  This place will be out of business soon enough with that kind of business model and price gouging for a simple walk-in exam.  Talk about taking advantage of out-of-towners here on vacation.  Most urgent care facilities will do a full physical for less than a 1/3 of what they priced my father to look in his ear.  I urge all other travelers to seek care elsewhere if needed.

name: Baylor Smith
text: Nurses are incompetant and the doctoe doesnt care about patients

name: guy scott
text:
Waited 40 minutes and they were taking people who came in way after me.
Receptionists were not friendly at all.
People hacking and coughing all over waiting area.
Should have them use a mask.

name: Mary Collins
text: No one likes to visit these places but for sure this is the one you need to come to..they have never failed in listening to me and giving me the treatment for healing process..

name: Velisa Rivera
text: In this place the dont care about patient is all about the money..u pay 150 for a 10 second service...doctor is young and is not friendly...u can tell he dont care.i went to franklin health care pay 30 dollar and the give me a exelent friendly and caring service

name: Leland Havel
text: Pain wasn't taken seriously, what happened to the hippocratic oath? The nurses were trainees and the doctor was in my room for literally 30 seconds. The convince isn't worth the headache

name: Ben
text: Great service with compassionate employees!

name: Mary Collins
text: I have copd/emphazema and about 3 times a year I have to go in and get couple of shots and some meds...I like this place all staff are friendly and most of the time im in and out fairly  quickly. . I WOULD RECOMMEND COMING HERE

name: Blaine Lyons
text: Went in with extreme back pain. Paid $150.00 for an anti-inflammatory shot and a prescription of Naproxen(basically Aleve). Still in pain, just now without money to see a doctor who can actually help. Will never go back.

name: Cindy Sellers
text: 150.00 co pay is there policy if you haven't met your deductible..RIDICULOUS... Urgent care clinic in Robertsdale stated the ins that I have has NO copay.  Don't go here because you will feel worse when you leave than when you get there.

name: Gene Dye
text: Way to slow and they didn't give us paperwork to fill out until 30 minutes after being in there don't recomend

name: Kathy Van Kirk
text: i went in to Immediate Care today with Workman's Comp as my payer. They were more interested in getting paid in advance than they were in treating a patient in pain. This was my first and last visit to them.

name: Donna Proctor
text: Love this place nice nurses and doctors

name: Travis Johnson
text: Very unprofessional spent very little time in the room. Was rushing too much trying to get me out of there

name: Sasha
text: I paid a $150.00 to be weighted and bp; just to be told they Will Not help me.  Was threatened when asked for a refund that if I did not leave the police would be called.  It is such a shame!

name: Mark Laurence
text: 2 hour wait would not  see for insurance issues wast of time

name: CCurtice
text: Not professional at all.  I knew I should have driven to Gulf Shores to the South Baldwin Urgent Care.

name: Marlene Mckay
text: I just took my very sick child with a high fever to Immediate Care in Foley to be seen, I have health insurance coverage through United Healthcare which, of course, also covers her, I do not, nor have I ever had a copay & they refused to see her, they said I had to pay $150 beforehand which is totally rediculous & I do believe it's illegal!

name: Molly Wilhelm
text: Long wait. Did not take patients in the order they arrived.

name: Andrea King
text: Took a friend here because she cut her arm they looked at it and said go to the hospital we do not take care of things like this

name: Matthew Canceleno
text: Charge me $150 to tell me they didn't know anything and that call my prescription in when I went to pick up the prescription they never called it in and when I went back to talk to them they tried to charge me another $150 to get my prescription

name: Tammy Nance
text: Cheaper than the local emergency room.......open after hours......

name: Brian Saxon
text: Charged my copay to have my wife seen for strep the meds she was given was discontinued then caused an allergic reaction and now I'm about to have to take her to another doctor this was a pointless waste of money!

name: Fink Condo Rentals LLC
text: Horrible service.

name: Karen Biggs
text: Horrible experience

name: Jamin Carter
text:
Although you never want to go to one of these places, sometimes you have to.   I went in with an injured knee and the front end employees were very friendly and helpful.   The brought my insurance info to me as opposed to having me hobble back up to the desk.
The doctors were great.   Good need side manner and attentive.   They provided an excellent experience to an unfortunate incident.
Highly recommend this team!

name: Eslam el bakry
text: The receptionist told me that the covid pcr results will be done within 24 hr but it was was not done within 24 hours. As a result I am about to miss my international flight, whose tickets cost more than 2000 dollars. Absolutely, irresponsible people.

name: Theresa Rivers
text: Dr. Natasha Horner is always compassionate and caring, taking time to lister to her patients.  She is thorough and knowledgeable and is the reason I go to First Care. I recommend going to see Dr. Horner to get the ethical care you expect from a doctor but so seldom receive. Thank you Dr, Horner for your diligence and dedication.

name: John Nairemore
text: From out of town, needed help, fast, clean , very nice people who made me feel like I was in good hands. Five stars is not enough to tell how much I like this place.

name: Jayejaye Lawson
text: Was not the best experience. I was in pain from a really bad cut finger . They had to burn it to stop the bleeding. Was asked 4 different times where to send the my prescription by 3 different people . Was seen Sunday and it’s Tuesday and I still don’t have the antibiotics for the infection or pain medicine..

name: Kristin Rastall
text: Went for my 2nd Covid shot today, and had an anxiety attack and became very emotional. The nurse practitioner immediately came and spent 20 minutes talking to me. She immediately ordered some additional blood work and assured me that I would be taken care of. Highly recommend!!

name: Brandyn Leo
text: Some of the rudest people I’ve ever dealt with. Never seen a group of nurse practitioners who were so annoyed with the fact that they actually have to do their jobs.

name: Lauren Cardon
text: I have come here before and had a good experience. However, recently I went in, and their waiting room was packed with people coughing and not wearing masks, during an ongoing global pandemic. Literally not even anyone checking people at the door or anything. I turned right around and left.

name: Shae Smith
text: i waited in the lobby for   one hour before being taken to a room and then waited two more for anyone to come see me, absolutely horrible place, would give it 0 stars if possible. staff is very rude, and they hangout and talk rather than getting people seen.

name: Emily Rhea
text: First Care - we were given excellent service during our Covid testing. Quick to test and the care given by the professionals was exceptional. Ana Nunn especially was kind and helpful !!

name: Ronald Higgins Sr
text: It was a fast pleasant and informative experience!!! Thank you for what you do there!! Be positive test negative... Happy holidays 😘

name: Shelby Lamkin
text: Very polite and professional staff. The process for COVID testing was efficient and smooth. Would definitely recommend them!

name: Raven Lewis
text:
This is my second time coming here and each time it’s been unpleasant.
I came here on 8/31 6:30pm to get a TB Skin test for school. It was quick, as I was the only patient in the facility. As I waited, they loudly talked about their coworkers and gossiped which I felt was inappropriate with a patient in the waiting room.
I returned on 9/2 to to get my TB read, I got there at 6:05pm, as the directions said and what I was told was to come before 6:30pm this day but not before 6pm as my TB will be expired after then. I check in, at 6:25pm (no other person ahead of me) I ask how much longer it will be to have it read and she said “it’ll be 3 more minutes”.
Okay.. why was I not informed on the very specific time when I left on 8/31 or when I got there 25 minutes early vs just having me sit there with nothing being said to me. The lady at the front desk also had an attitude with me asking on why I was not informed.
Ten minutes later is when they called me to the back to read my arm, technically after my TB expired and after the time they told me to have it read by then.
I give whomever read my arm the paperwork I needed to have signed by the dr or np. I specifically turned the page and let her know only the TB section is what I needed her to sign. In the next room, I can hear the dr or np ranting about how she wouldn’t be signing all my paperwork because I didn’t get the vaccines there and how it was inappropriate. The girl who read my arm didn’t even bother to relay my message.
I get my paperwork back unstapled and out of order, at this point I’m irritated with the whole experience. I let her know how she should have relayed my message instead of making me seem like I was trying to get over on them, upsetting the dr or np. Also how inappropriate the conversation went with me sitting in the next room and obviously thin walls. She just looked at me and never offered an apology.
This may all seem small but to me, it makes all the difference with where I decide to go.
I’ll just stick with American Family Care in midtown from here on out.

name: Hellonwheels999 (Hellonwheels999)
text: It’s a drug test for a employer, how possibly long can this take certainly NOT a hour! I have done many for jobs and was out the door in ten mins! If everyone would stop jaw jacking it something might get done! Not coming back here! Absolutely insane!

name: Marilyn Pearce
text: Horrible!! I came in for a terrible migraine. Was the only one in the lobby and got called back fairly quickly. Waited for almost 1.5 hours to EVEN see a doctor. All while having a terrible migraine and nausea. The nurses continued to giggle and were very loud out  in the hallway. I could hear the nurses and Doctor in the hall goofing off!! Horrible bedside manner and no professionalism whatsoever.  Save your time and go somewhere else... especially if you are in pain!!

name: Brenda Cagle
text:
The nurse's and office worker's  was so amazing. And I meet the head Doctor
And he really  cares for the patient he's  with he listens closely to what you say and tell him he has the greatest  bed side manors and especially nice and gentle  . But # 1 young male nurse stood out the most with me on how he could get sumone to talk especially  when that someone  doesn't  wont to talk about how there injurys  surcome about . But I returned to  be checked  for  congestion  . He was so nice whn I meet him but he left the room while I was getting a  breathing  treatment  he had returned  20 min later and suggested that he had meet me before it disturbed me  cause I had never  seen him in my life time and neither had I been eczamend by him ever. But he had asked me was I feeling better I told him yes and proceeded to ask him about getting a  refill on my pain meds he said that I would  have to see the head doctor  for that I replied ok but asked him if he could write me chantix to stop smoking thn he proceeded to leave the room with a yes reply so I was happy to know I would  soon be a nonsmoker  I was just letting  him know about me needing to  quit , and be for I could say thank you he put his hands up in the air and replyed very hastily and snapped at me with these words I will never for get them either ( I  just cant deal with any of your problems  cause I deal anuff with  mine . ) I stopped so sudden and with shock and embarrassment cause I wasnt telling  him  anything about my problems so I walked to my door of the room I felt my emotions in my throat and I new I was fixing to bust into tears cause this doctor had no clue of what
I went through weeks prior to  my 2ND.
Visit   he spoke real loud then at me replying dont leave that room and step into the hall way to the nurses desk  and I wasnt goin to the nurses  station  and it struck me that I would be better off if I left and set up an appointment with  the head doctor!! But B4 i opened up the door to the lobby  area  he spoke loudly and hateful (DON'T  YOU LEAVE, YOU GET BACK HERE , IF YOU DONT YOU WILL NOT GET YOUR PRESCRIPTION ) But I was already embarrassed and felt awful and I told him I will just see the head doctor for my prescription and that he had no right to speak to me that way and I would  make sure I asked who was the doctor on duty  so  I would  never be seen by him ever again.  I never received a  apologie from him still to this day and I never did get to see the head doctor . Cause he put a complaint in  on me and the head doctor had a nurse to serve me with a  disclaimer that I was not to come back to any of the emergency  and urgent  care clinics  in   Tuscaloosa   so I still to this day wonder what his complaint  about me that was so extreme for me to be denied service for ever . All I done was leave because iv been physically, ppl and mentally ,emotionally abused all my life even as a child . And he had abused me mentally and emotionally  that it affected me  physically" but he never took any blame or owed up to the medical  board about what he done ,and acted towards me and what manner he spoke to me . But iam still punished for  his abuse towards me .so I hope no one else has or have to go through what I did tht day . I NEVER WAS ASKED , OR SPOKEN TO BY ANYONE ABOUT THAT DAY . SO YOU ALL BETTER HOPE THAT YOUR NOT  BEING HATED ON FOR SPEAKIN  ur amendment rights !!!!!!!!!

name: Jennifer Waters
text: Their covid testing procedure is painfully slow. Our family waited over 90 minutes for tests. We arrived with our paperwork completed in advance and there wasn’t even a line when we arrived! If you need a covid test, definitely go elsewhere.

name: Gail Harmon
text: From now own, I will use Med center North in Northport. They are the best!

name: Rhonda Gilmore
text: No line, no waiting, nice staff comfortable and clean waiting room.

name: Nicole LaMoreaux
text:
Very caring staff
Great Dr

name: Jordan Poe
text: Very rude! Will lose your covid test if you don't do the rapid test! Needs way better customer service! The nurses are very hateful and no mangers! Would not recommend this place to anybody!!

name: Mimi
text: We are so grateful for the quick COVID-19 testing we were able to receive at this location.  The frontline caregivers were professional and caring.  We received our results the following day.  Thank you to the team here who risk their own health to take care of ours!

name: Tamara Robinson
text: Their service is horrible!! Please avoid!!

name: Edward Sazonov
text: Very inefficient, slow and highly disrespectful of others' time. A mandatory COVID test was assigned to my mother. Had to be taken at First Care, not any other place. After 4 hours of waiting in the car, they still have not checked her in! If there is a line, could they take a number and call when the queue is close?  The reception phone was not picked up when we trying to check on further wait time. Hopefully we never have to come here again.

name: Cailin Kerch
text: Excellent care. A big thank you to the medical staff for their professionalism and warm/caring response to patients. Above expectations, we highly recommend as a first choice for walk-in clinics!

name: Patty Brown
text: Very professional friendly staff.  Dr P will put you at ease with his big smile and gladly answer any questions you have about your condition. They got  me in and out quickly. My first choice for Emergency care clinics.  Highly recommend😊

name: Princess Patterson
text: Excellent experience! I took my daughter on a Sunday. I only had a handful of places to choose from since it was Sunday, and I decided on this one because it had the best reviews. The receptionist was pleasant, the atmosphere was great, and we were called to the back literally 3 min after completing new patient paperwork. We saw Dr. Sumanthi shortly (about 7 min) after. She was pleasant, knowledgeable and explained everything perfectly. I literally can’t think of anything they can improve upon.

name: Charlene J
text:
I scheduled an online appt through the ALABAMA FAMILY MEDICAL CENTERS’ website. Received a CONFIRMATION EMAIL FOR MY APPT ON 07/08/20 @ 8:45.
The site directed me to this location (1st care), I thought it was odd, but I saw my appt was with Dr. Peramsetty, a familiar physician with AFMC so, I thought maybe, they have a new way of scheduling online appts?
Once I arrived, I spoke with the nurse outside(who was compassionate and understanding) regarding my scheduled appt on 07/08/20 @ 8:45 at this facility. She explained to me that the clinic does not do appts, and Dr Permasetty will not be in at all today. She also encouraged me to speak with one of the ladies in the office, because they would know more than she.
When I went inside, I explained to the lady about my appt, and showed her my phone with the email confirmation. She looked uninterested, and proceeded to say “well we don’t do that here, and I don’t know what you should do”! She also, was doing multiple things while I was trying to explain to her my situation.
I was in sever pain! I scheduled an appointment to see a doctor because of my pain and symptoms!!
We are living in complete madness!! A kind face friendly gesture or compassionate responses are needed! I pray those receptionist show more interest to sick people in the future!!
I will NEVER RETURN TO THIS FACILITY!! I can only pray your loved ones are never treaded so rudely in their MOST VULNERABLE TIMES IN LIFE!!

name: Teresa Rose
text: It is not true when they say 48 hours and you will know the results of a covid test.

name: Cindy Grimsley
text: Excellant staff! Very professional and friendly. Nurse practioner very knowledgeable. Great experience!

name: Kelsey Bush
text: My grandmother took my 3 year old son here after being up all night with 103 fever, sore throat complaints and chills. They would not test him for anything because he would not “participate”. Called the doctor & he informed me that they do not need the negative drama & were too busy with 20 patients.

name: Harold Beach
text:
I went there for covid-19 test . Never got my results back . They called me at 11:38 on
Left a message about me calling back to see my results . I called for 3 days never got anyone to answer to answer the phone .
Thanks first . I'm new to Alabama and I know not where to go even if I'm sick

name: Jay Bee
text: Great staff!  Came in after 6pm for a foot issue and they didn't make me feel like I was wasting their time so they could close up.  Doctor was great and listened to me and my concerns.  The nurse who gave me a shot was personable as well:)

name: Marilyn Fair
text: My experience with First Care was great! The staff was very friendly and informative. I didn't have to wait long in the waiting room or in the exam room. The doctor was very nice and knowledgeable and took time out to answer all my questions. The doctor and nurses explained everything very well. I will definitely be back to First Care and so will my family.

name: Brian Swain
text: Numbers they give you to call don't work and if you try to reach occupational health, they don't answer. How unprofessional.

name: mindy wiant
text: I had the best experience here at first care. It was the first time in a long time that the doctor and nurses was so loving and caring! I will never go any where else!

name: Megan Liljenquist
text: First Care is my go to!  I have only had to wait once for over 30 minutes and it was because it was the middle of flu season.  Otherwise, they are quick and efficient.  Doctors and Staff are nice!

name: Hannah Cooke
text: My experience at First Care was great! The receptionist greeted me with a smile and the nurses were eager to help. I was seen very quickly and the doctor was very interested in each of my symptoms and gave me the best treatment I could ever ask for!! I would highly recommend it to everyone I know and will definitely come back!

name: Megan Gunter
text: Always kind and friendly staff. Very quick, polite, and professional. Very thankful to have them in Northport.

name: Countess King
text: First Care is a hidden jewel. I went today and received excellent care. Dr. Remona Peterson and staff were phenomenal from start to finish. I highly recommend First Care to anyone looking to receive urgent care.

name: Jamie Radcliff
text: We were visiting Tuscaloosa when my 3 yr old took a nasty scooter fall and needed stitches. The staff was AWESOME and very helpful! No waiting and very responsive. Excellent cash prices!

name: Amy McGohon
text: Very friendly, quick to see md/ nurse practitioner, prescriptions sent to pharmacy quickly. Definitely will go back!

name: Ben Carithers
text: I had a great experience here. Really nice people/employees. CLEAN & quickly in & out. I'll go there again. 👍

name: Hue Nguyen
text: I've been coming to First Care since I moved here as a kid. My favorite place to go! Everyone has always been so nice and caring to me. The staff has always been so sweet and they always got me in and out pretty quick. Love the doctors there!

name: Maggie Badgwell
text: I absolutely love First Care... Dr Shepherd & Permasetty are two of the kindest Doctors I have ever seen!!! I see Dr. Shepherd if I can because he is the ONLY Doctor that has tried to find something that works for me instead of running up alot of bills that have been done, over & over!  The nurses are great and always helpful & friendly!  Love this staff and the care I receive there!!

name: John Knox
text: You are absolutely the very best in Tuscaloosa. Don't change anything !

name: Lindsay Sims
text: The front desk women were so rude. After letting me wait over 30 minutes they tell me I have to have my insurance card (after telling md it would be fine without it). I had my work fax over my card and they rudely claimed that wasn't the correct card. Instead of offering to call and get the info the said I couldn't be seen. I called to get the info and ironically the office had just closed (had I known from the start it would have been open). What if I just wanted to pay cash? What do those patients do? I needed an xray of my neck after sustaining an injury. I just didn't appreciate the fact that I could have paid for it with my flex card. Its 2017. Is there really only one option and you have to be so rude about it? How about advertising on the pop up that an insurance card is required.

name: Secunda Steele
text: Staff are  always professional and friendly. You are in and out in a timely manner and they are thorough

name: Cham Kim
text: They are rude to sick patients because we are not considered human being but CASH COW. Also, they are racist to minorities. I experienced it in person. To people who are surprised, yes we minorities get disrespected and mistreated just because we look like we can't speak ANY ENGLISH! (So stupid right? See how I am writing a review?)It is not some GRAND, MEANINGFUL reason, but illogical and nonsensical reason. Never going back here. This FIRST CARE is DONT CARE facility so conserve your precious time and energy from going here. You'll regret it. Instead go to Urgent Care (Northport) instead. They see let you in right away and figure out what you need. The doctors are kind and they actually CARE for the patients. EASY AND FAST. For simple prescription/diagnosis, you'll be back in your car in 30 minutes.

name: Lora Fairley
text: Facility was very clean. Front desk staff, nurses and the doctor were really nice. Good experience

name: Lori McGill
text: This is where I go if I am ill or injured and cannot see my regular doctor.  They are quick and responsive to my needs.  They also see my son if he is ill or injured.  I haven't had any issues with billing either.

name: Jonathan Bradberry
text: Great service.

name: Nikki s
text: I second what another reviewer stated. Their billing system is awful. The medical staff is fine, but not worth dealing with the mismanaged billing.

name: Robert Serum
text: Courteous and professional care at each station.   Waiting reasonable

name: Deborah C. Kim
text: This is a review and proclamation. The First Care should be recognized for horrible management of patients' billing, and I am going there tomorrow to file a complaint. To First Care employees and representatives, I am very disappointed at how medical-related personnel can play with a patient's health and welfare. Is it fun to STEAL money from patients? Is it fun to FALSIFY medical information? Is it fun to LOOK DOWN on patients? * I am not pulling this review down, and I am never writing anything good about First Care. I will continue to write ONE STAR EXPERIENCE(it should be ZERO STAR) with First Care review page. You should have avoided my attention, but now it is too late.*

name: Charles Greenberg
text: Professional, friendly staff.

name: Vanessa Fields Brown
text: I have visited First Care on many occasions and have found them to be very thorough in all my visits, the wait time is never ridiculously long, I'm really beginning to not mind visiting this place....I hate going to the Dr

name: Alex C
text: Staff was attentive to my daughter and Dr. Ramshackle Peramsetty is awesome!

name: Jimmy Adams
text: Decided to try first care after 3 other same clinic visits! Dr. Sheppard and staff excellant,  prompt in and Dr. Sheppard was very thorough looking at the meds i brought in and extensive questioning toward me to help solve my problem! Excellant bedside manner, important when one is sick!!

name: Chris Jowers
text: Dr. P has been my primary care physician for about 5 years. Wouldn’t go anywhere else.

name: Mike Lee
text: Prompt service and a lot of attention. Very nice staff.

name: Karendee92@gmail.com Crazyluv
text: Excellent Care I had WITH staff

name: Cayleigh Schley
text: This clinic is awful with communication, they do not answer phone calls, nor do they return documents. I would stay far away from this clinic, especially if you need anything for the DOT.

name: Keon Allen
text: In and out quickly, very friendly

name: Lanora Bayer
text: Professional nurse doctor team! My go to when I need to get in for immediate care.

name: Shawn Williams
text: Nice friendly people!

name: Kimbley Draper
text: Great

name: Sherry Shi
text: I went there for test covid and they charged me as an doctor visit. I didn’t see a doctor nor a nurse practitioner, only a tech did a covid test for me. Cal insurance billing and everything, they are very rude and not helping. Also they mistook my result to another patient’s and I had to redo the test. It’s horrible experience. Would not recommend this place.

name: Becca Nance
text: This place USED to be great. But it has really gone downhill. Not sure if I stopped in on a bad day, but I waited over an hour for an appointment and the entire time I was there, only 1 person was called back. There was only about 3 of us in the waiting room. Their efficiency is poor and the front desk workers were goofing around. I’m disappointed because this used to be the only urgent care I trusted for good service in Auburn. But now I guess I will have to find a new place.

name: Jordan Adams
text: If you want to experience friendly staff, clean environments, and also get motivated to accomplish your wildest dreams by listening to the workout studio next door while you're waiting.... Stopwatch Urgent Care on Moore's Mill is for you! After leaving the facility, I was ready to take on the world. Thank you Stopwatch Urgent Care on Moore's Mill! Fantastic people who truly care about each of their patients.

name: Wendy Burpee
text: My college student’s appointment did not go well. Came out with OTC allergy medicine and decongestant for 5 days of fever, sore throat and an earache that kept her awake all night. I acknowledge my daughter’s communication skills probably weren’t great, but she hasn’t ever advocated for herself in a medical appointment.  However, the NP returned my call and listened to my concerns and agreed to an antibiotic for an ear infection because she did notate fluid in the ear, but didn’t fully understand from my daughter how much pain was also was involved.  I will do a better job of coaching my daughter through what’s important to tell her health care provider and how to make sure she is heard, but we are happy with the end result.

name: Whitney Nichols
text: Fabulous place. Reception, nurses, and nurse practitioner were all extremely friendly. I was in and out in 30 minutes also . Thank you!

name: Afra Williams
text: This is the nicest urgent care I've ever visited. Super friendly staff. I had an appointment but I was very early and they saw me almost immediately. I highly recommend this location!

name: Melissa Atkinson
text: Very organized and super convenient rapid covid testing. Made an appointment online for the same day. Easy to use website. Waited less than 10 minutes once we got there. And results can back in about 10 minutes. Staff was incredibly friendly.

name: Ali Donnes
text:
This has been my go to testing site for COVID. I have always had a pleasant experience with the staff, and the wait times aren’t too bad. There was one occasion where they were extremely busy and it took a little longer to get my results (rapid testing) but other than that I’ve had an overwhelmingly positive experience. Much better atmosphere than other local urgent cares.

They did not have a rapid test option when I went in recently, so double check before you go (or be prepared to have that possibility).

name: T Woolley
text: Very friendly staff. I needed an x-ray. I was informed that I would need to be referred, and they let me know that while I was waiting to see the nurse practitioner. I thought that was very courteous instead of learning that after I had waited to see her. It was also very convenient to make an appt online to limit the wait time there at the office.

name: Anissa Perkins
text: I absolutely love this place! The staff is so nice and I was treated with respect. They do fill up fast if you want a COVID test, you need to walk in as soon as they open. I got in line at 7:45am and after they opened @8 and I got to the front of the line my appointment was at 1:15pm. I waited for 15 mins in the lobby and 15 minutes after the test. Everyone was so nice.

name: M Stevens
text: It's better than having to go to the emergency room. Clean facility, more organized than the other location across from hospital.

name: Sheri Turner Fowler
text: I had a wonderful experience at this urgent care. I needed to get a negative Covid Test and they were efficient and timely! I love being able to “get in line” on my phone! The med tech and the doctor were friendly thorough and efficient! I will definitely come here for urgent care in the future!

name: Jimmy Johny
text: I just finished this morning getting a COVID-19 test from a wonderful nurse, named Marcy and really help with the process of getting tested. I had a great experience I do recommend this place over anywhere else. It was clean and well-kept up. I got my results in a 30 minutes and they apology for the wait, which did not bother me because 30 minutes isn't that long to wait to see if one has COVID-19 or not. One of the best urgent cares in the Auburn and Opelika area.

name: Patrick Klesius
text: Appointment was pushed, after traveling to the location. Then I was told I needed multiple appointments upon arrival, even though I explained the reason for my visit prior to scheduling the appointment. The receptionist decided which test I “can” receive. Otherwise, facilities are fine.

name: Alexis Dunn
text: They keep trying to charge me after I’ve paid already. I keep getting put on hold and no one will help me. Do not go here if you use a flex card!!!

name: Shaneeka McClendon
text: Sucks! Do not go here! The staff are incompetent and they are so slow! They have NO urgency what so ever!

name: Melissa Lasater
text: As an urgent care clinic this should be a place that covers more than just covid.  My child walked in earlier today with back pain and was turned away because of no appointment.  That’s the whole point of an urgent care clinic.  I was highly upset with your service today.   We will make sure we tell everyone in auburn to not go to your establishment.  Very rude and terrible service.

name: Sebastian Dixon
text: This is absolutely the most unorganized location in the Auburn Alabama area!! My daughter made an appointment and was tested for covid-19 as required by the University. 7 days later no results. Upon calling Another location and acquiring the lab’s #, we called them.. they stated that the results were sent back 3 days later with important information.. they have yet to call.... So.. what we found out is that this location failed to label the specimen rendering it useless.. a total failure

name: Jessie Forte
text: Phenomenal service. Fast and friendly.  Arrive 15 min before open, checked in online, walked right in when they open and were ready for me.  I wasn’t there 15 minutes total. Thank you so much!!

name: Scott Key
text:
Don’t waste your time going in. Was stung by multiple yellow jackets, went here to try to get a steroid shot for the swelling. Was told I could get an allergy shot right away but would have to make an appointment to get a steroid shot. Next available appointment was 3 hours later. Only one other patient in the waiting room at the time. I asked the nice receptionist to check with the doctor and explain my need for Urgent Care. She did and I was told that was policy. Go to the ER.
Would have let me get an allergy shot right away but having an actual allergic reaction requires an appointment! What BS! Thanks for  nothing. Should change the first part of the Urgent Care sign from Urgent to We Don’t...

name: Andrew Caldwell
text: This place should be renamed from Stopwatch to Hourglass because you will be waiting 30+ minutes after your scheduled appointment time without being seen.

name: Donna Bowman
text: So far out of all Urgent Cares Stopwatch is by far the Best One in our Area ! Staff was very helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend this Urgent Care

name: Liz Shultz
text: This place was so professional and helpful thanks to all of the staff

name: Ché Shunta
text: I made a COVID appointment for 11:10am I was only 3 minutes late because I never been to this area.I walk in then the lady at front desk told me I have to reschedule before I was late and that would push everybody back. So I got a 12:30pm appointment, I arrived 10 minutes early like they told me to and I had to wait til about 1:30 for them to call me to the back. It was a lady and her daughter who was 2 people behind me and they got call before me.

name: Kaysen Hearn
text: Amazing people, got a Corona test here and they did an amazing job. Very professional and fast!

name: Zekari Gordon
text: Called the place did not answer...Came up to the place they told i have to make an appointment... Made the appointment for 2:45pm because that was the only one they had... I WAITED FOR 4 HOURS !!!!! JUST FOR THEM TO TELL ME "OHH YOUR APPOINTMENT WAS AT 2:10PM OR SOMETHING LIKE THAT!!! ARE YOU SERIOUS!! DON'T GO HERE!!

name: Mabel W Etchison
text: Good experience overall.

name: Emmalyne Sisson
text: Went to get tested for covid a second time for college. It’s been over a week and still haven’t heard from them. I have called and called and no one answers. I have sent emails and still no answer. I cannot go back to school until I get this test. I have only 3 weeks left before I get my degree. I’m just sitting around waiting and NO ONE WILL GET IN CONTACT WITH ME. I will never go here again.

name: Kara Gordon
text:
This place is an absolute joke, DO NOT GET TESTED HERE! I never got my results back and it’s been a month now. No one would answer the phone and when I went in they couldn’t tell me why I never received any results back.

The website clearly states that all COVID 19 testing is free. No co pay, no deductible and no cost for the uninsured. Well I received my bill today for $181 from my insurance company for my COVID test.

name: McKenzie Daniel
text: Went for the first time with both of my kids on a Holiday. We had a very short wait and the staff were delightful. Very clean facility!  Highly recommend!

name: Race Harden
text: Absolutely amazing experience! Everyone was prompt, kind, and knowledgeable! Thank you!!

name: matt baker
text: Didn’t have to wait to long and the nurses and doctor were very nice and answered all the questions i had and explained everything to me

name: Sedrick Jefferson
text: I picked my daughter up for the summer. I wanted to get her tested for COVID because her mom was not following any guidelines. We called our doctor and they said they could only test her if she was showing signs. So we asked around and this place was suggested. I do their online sign-up and go up there to get her tested. I called thinking someone would come out to test her like every other place. They asked me to come in. Why would they want to expose their patients and staff to someone who may have COVID. This did not make sense to me. So I asked why they were not doing some of the safety stuff like our doctor's office. The lady at the front desk got mad. Told me I could go find another place if I have a problem. Then she said I must be having a bad day. I told her I was not having a bad day. I was just curious about why they were not doing the drive-by test. She said again if I didn't like it I could go to another place. After that rudeness things went well. A nurse came and got us and showed us to a room. She did the test and I thought that was it. Nope. They wanted her to see the doctor/other nurse. I asked why. They said it was mandatory. She came in and asked a few questions and listened to her chest. I was thinking why would they be doing all of this extra stuff. A lot of unnecessary contact with people. I concluded that it was to get more money out of the visit. My wife got the test done at our doctor's office. She got tested in the parking lot and didn't need to see anyone else. This company needs to be checked for fraud. Do to the receptionist rudeness alone, I would not recommend this place to anyone. I know I will not be going back.

name: Jaime Burnham
text: I made an appt on Thursday to have my son tested for COVID.  I received a text twenty minutes before my appt time and arrived on time to find that the COVID testing would take 5-7 days for results.  I was hoping for a rapid test so I canceled my appointment.  Two days later, I scheduled an appt for my son to get swabbed for strep.  I got a confirmation text letting me know that my appt was scheduled so I showed up twenty minutes early.  When I arrived I was told there was no provider in the office and they were technically closed.  I was terribly frustrated after two bad experiences in two days at the same StopWatch so I will not be back.  We've had other negative experiences in the past but this was enough to cause me not to return.

name: Yamikani Ng'ona
text: My experience was good, everyone was a friendly.

name: Gabrielle Cutts
text: Visited this establishment and saw a doctor for hemorrhoids. I was in and out in less than 40 minutes (wait and all) and paid my $25 copay that my insurance required. The visit itself was great, however, things went South when I realized I was being further billed for a "global fee" for this particular urgent care. I was not made aware until after the visit when I received an email two weeks later that I would be responsible for $105 (that I do not have) to be paid to the office just because they are an urgent care. Now I know to ask if there will be any other exorbitant fees tacked on before I sign any paperwork giving consent for treatment.

name: Jessica Baldwin
text: I love going here! I went yesterday and was in and out within 20 minutes. They are fast and very helpful. The doctor, Dr. Perry, made sure to explain things to me and make sure I didn’t have any questions. The medical assistant,  Heather,  was very sweet and easy to talk to! The receptionist, Pam, was also very nice and made my visit pleasant. I highly recommend this place!!

name: Myles Landers
text: Very nice overall experience. The receptionist was very kind and did her best to keep things moving along as quickly as possible. The nurses and the RN on site were also very sweet and understanding of my situation. I was only there for about an hour and half total and I was a first time patient there so that seems very fast in my mind. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

name: Stephen Watkins
text: Came here on a Saturday morning. Facility was very clean and the staff was extremely polite and compassionate. The doctor was very attentive and had a wonderful bedside manner. They also took a look at another small issue that I had while I was there. As with any trip to a medical facility the outcome is never what you want it to be because you usually end up finding out that you are very sick. Which was the case with me. Viral stomach infections are nothing to mess with. All in all it was a very good experience and I would definitely go there again but hopefully no time soon.

name: Nomo Scams
text: I made an online appointment for myself and my son to be tested for Corona Virus.  I kept getting texts that our appt time was being pushed back, not a big deal.  Several hours after our original appt time I drove up to the office.  They are NOT EVEN OPEN.  Why on Earth are you allowing people to make online appts for an office that is CLOSED?!?!  I wasted an entire day waiting.  Maybe update your website?  Or have an automated message on your phone lines which ring and ring with no answer.  Unbelievably poor customer service.

name: Ope Ope
text: Tested for Covid on 7/2. Never called with results. Won’t answer phone. Contacted on Facebook messenger and was told I would be called. * Called on 7/12 with results.

name: Marion Lightfoot
text: Both times I have been there waited over an hour and a half (even after checking in online previously being told when to get there). Waited this long with only 3 people in the waiting room max. Front desk woman was not the nicest. Would recommend going somewhere else.

name: Cason Garner
text: I reserved an appointment online. Checked in, did some administrative updates to my account and waited 5 minutes. Nurse and NP were professional and had me in and out. Great experience.

name: Myfirstcar66
text: Brought my very sick son in, had trouble with the sign-in tablet and I casually mentioned it's not a good idea for a well person to have to use a touch-screen where all the sick people come in and use it. Young person at the counter said I should have signed in online. I said I can't do that while I'm driving. She said with more attitude I should have done it home. I said I obviously wasn't at home, and asked if there is a manager I could see and if I needed to go somewhere else. She said with even more attitude, "You can if you want to..." So, I did, and I hope she is fired.

name: C D
text: I went here in the past and female Docterwas awesome! She listened to me and even ordered an x-ray. The next time I went I saw a make Dr. He was not concerned at all about my health issue at all😢 The front desk receptionist seemed like she didn't want to be there. She was dry and snappy towards me! I work with the public and it doesn't hurt for someone to have a positive attitude and give a fake smile to someone regardless of their race or sex. I used to recommend this office to my family and friends until my last visits.

name: Thomas Cole
text: Dr Abby Barnes is the best!!!

name: George Runion
text: Had a wonderful experience today. Although I was a new patient,  the process went smoothly and amazing quickly and I was in and out in around a half hour.

name: thomas sumner
text: The staff is so friendly and caring, from the front desk to the back. Pam greeted me at the front desk, as soon as I walked in, with a big smile and friendly attitude. The nurse, Heather, was very friendly, caring and easy to talk to. Dr. Almeida took great care of me. I was in and out in 15 minutes. I will definitely be back next time I need to see a doctor. I definitely recommend this place!

name: Rhonda Turner
text: I was in and out in 15 minutes! Very efficient! I appreciate the blood work. One finger stick and immediately you know if you have an infection. None of the guesswork and letting you know in 3 days at this facility!!

name: Flavia Harrell
text: My recent visit to Stopwatch Urgent Care went very well.  The staff and physician were friendly and helpful.  The office space was convenient and clean.  I was seen immediately and soon on my way home.  This was my first visit there but will certainly not be my last.

name: Z M
text: They close early from the business hours that they have listed. They don’t answer the phone, and never return your calls whether it was me or the pharmacist calling. Will never go to another urgent care again, definitely not this location.

name: Marisela Favela
text: The doctor was very kind and concerned about my dad’s health. I highly recommend this urgent care.

name: cherish pharez
text: The staff was great! I was in and out in under 30 minutes. The Nurse practitioner BJ was wonderful!

name: Victor Padron
text:
If you are self paying, and need specilized care do see that specialist. In my situation the specialist I was going to see was closed and it was my first time here. Called to check if they had anyone capable of dealing with piece of debris in my eye. Was told they can over the phone and then walked in and waited in line. Then was told the practitioner can "probably" remove the debris and if not can refund me.

Told practitioner I felt something and was given a solution to help tear the eye.... No prescriptions, given. Still felt it inside after I left.

The next day went to the doctor I usually see and he took the debris out ,  that was in my eye and also provided a prescription since was told it was infected.  So Stopwatch Urgent Care my visit their, I felt like I was lied to with broken promises. Honesty comes a long way. If their isnt anyone capable just say no. Or I do appologize I think you may need to see a specialist. Prior to wating an hour and then 10 min in the room told to see a specialist and just given  band-aid

name: Cristy Blom
text: Always feel well examined and taken care of. In an out quickly, which I value a lot. Staff is always professional and friendly. Very happy!

name: Tyson Ong
text: Great doctor who really cares about you

name: April Olive
text: Big thank you to Talia and staff for taking great care of me when I had a nasty injury to my knee and required a bunch of stitches! Not only did they do a great job then but they also called to check on me a couple of days later. They are wonderful!

name: Matt P
text: I've been waiting on my COVID-19 results for over a week, and still haven't heard back.

name: Alan McNew
text:
Dr. Roberts is an excellent physician.  Within 45 minutes, I was seen, 2 diagnostic lab tests performed and read in-house, and diagnosis given.  He was extremely through and the staff was very professional.  I am very impressed with everything they did to ensure I received the best health care possible in a very timely fashion.  If I had gone to another other physician's office it would have been 2 weeks minimum (or longer) wait time to have the exact same standard of care given, along with multiple additional appointments.  Thank you Dr. Roberts and team for putting me, the patient, first and making sure my health care needs were met!!
Alan McNew

name: Andrew Burch
text: Super fast. One page of paper work! Literally in and out after never being there before. Staff super friendly!

name: Christy Arrington
text: Got me in and out quickly. The staff here is awesome! I would definitely go here again if I needed to. They made it easy!! Would recommend them to anyone who needs quick care.

name: Tracey Wilson
text: Dr Reese listened and was very helpful.  Super nice!

name: Homer Inman
text: From the time we walked in, to the time we left the service was excellent, every one was so nice! I will and would recommend Stopwatch Urgent Care to everyone! Your score is a 100+ and I hope you have the same continues services for everyone in the future!!!

name: Gregory Stich
text:
Very straightforward check in.
Short wait to see the Doc, who was quite friendly and professional. We struck up a good rapport and he made a pinpoint diagnosis and treatment plan. I'm confident that I'm on a quick road to recovery.

name: Elizabeth Kosters
text: Don’t go here if you need a couple of issues looked at. They will charge you for everything and will only be seen by the doctor no more than 5 minutes. I’d rather go to a hospital than be seen here again. Waste of time and money. After going to another Urgent Care I was diagnosed with Pneumonia and the doctor I saw at Stopwatch Urgent Care wasn’t concerned at all with seeing further into what was wrong with my breathing and lungs when I came into this office.

name: Linda Stack
text: As always everyone was courteous and efficient. I was seen quickly but not rushed. Thank you for such a wonderful experience each time I have had o use your service.

name: Marcy Ripley Gilder
text: Absolutely the best urgent care in the Auburn area. I was and out in 32 minutes. The staff was courteous and professional. The physician, Dr.Almeida was kind, caring and professional. I highly recommend Stopwatch Urgent Care at Moore’s Mill.

name: Debbie Newton
text: I was seen quickly.  Receptionist was friendly and knowledgeable.  Office is really clean.  Doctor listened to my symptoms and treated me accordingly.  Will return as needed

name: Aaron Bennett
text: My family and I have been multiple times to this place with no issues. Last time I saw a nurse practitioner on July 19th 2019, who apparently was not in blue cross of Alabama's network for my plan until August 2019. I was never informed of who I was being seen by the front desk. They turned out to be not covered by insurance . Blue cross informed me that I should always check who is in my network. Yet you are not informed of who you are seeing until they come into the room. Blue cross and stop watch have no problem sending me a $609 bill for bloodwork and a shot. I now know to not go to this place for their unethical ways. I hope you enjoy my money that will be the last you get. Make sure you are covered with each dr and nurse practitioner when you check in with the front desk. Good luck enjoy your bill 3 months later!!!!

name: Becca Bryant
text: They’re always so quick! Each person took such good care of me today. Talyia was the Nurse Practitioner that I saw and she was so thorough. I appreciate Stopwatch!

name: Remy Whatley
text: Always very quick service and everyone is very pleasant. It is awesome to have a place available on weekends when your child is sick or hurt.  Abbey Barnes is wonderful

name: James Smith
text:
We were traveling for the holidays and I came down with the crud. These nice folks got me in and fixed up in record time.
Great staff, efficient, and pleasant to visit   Thanks

name: Adrian Eves
text: They did an amazing job and were very nice!  They took good care of me and answered all my questions! I was in and out quickly. I would recommend them.

name: Kerry Channel
text: This was one of my best experiences at an urgent care. I came in, filled out 1 sheet, and was called by the nurse within 5 min. The PA was able to see me and perscribe my medicine without any problems.

name: Anna MacDonald
text: This was the worst experience I've ever had at a doctor's office. First of all, I waited an hour to be seen when there was only two people in front of me. I went in because I was running a fever, aching all over, and had chills. The doctor did not seem to care about my symptoms, told me it was just allergies, and did not even want to write me a school excuse for the next day. By the time I got home, my fever was 104, and I had to go to another urgent care location that night. The next doctor I saw told me I should have definitely been put on an antibiotic and would not let me go back to school for the rest of the week because of my high fever. If I could give this place 0 stars, I would.

name: Carey Johnson
text: If you go when they first open, they will see you quickly. The best part was that the Doctor came in, listened attentively, THOROUGHLY explained the issue, THOROUGHLY explained the solution, and was kind, friendly and sympathetic. He managed to make me feel like I was properly cared for in less than 10 minutes. The earlier you can go, the better! The establishment is clean and efficient.

name: Ryan Schoonover
text: Refused an appointment that we were a couple minutes late to, and would not bump us or help us reschedule.

name: kim shackelford
text: I love this urgent care clinic! Everyone was very nice and super quick- but thorough. The doctor is responsive, knowlegable and concerned. He was very personable! I will use them again as needed.

name: Ken Jackson
text: I've been to this clinic several times and got excellent service each time. Lines might be long if there's something going around; happy to wait.

name: Jennifer Paz
text: It took longer for me to fill out the paperwork than to be seen today! While I’m sure that’s not always true, I recently spent 3 hours waiting for my son to be seen at a different urgent care. Not only that, but Dr. Almeida was very nice and helped my 4-year-old remain calm. I also appreciate their quick and easy blood test, and the fact that they don’t throw antibiotics at a viral infection—I got the same diagnosis as my older son did a few days ago (elsewhere), but he had been given an antibiotic “just in case”, and it has had no effect. Dr. Almeida recommended taking Zinc instead. How refreshing!

name: Susan Key
text: Excellent experience. Very professional staff. I was in-and-out in 45 minutes & they diagnosed me properly!

name: Diana Rowell
text: I use Moore's Mill Urgent Care every time I am sick. They are quick and the doctors are very friendly. I trust their opinion and highly recommend this urgent care to anyone. No one else in the area can compare!

resp.text: THANKS so much for your kind review! - MMUC

name: Ashia Word
text: Best urgent care around. I never have to wait long and you are always in and out fast. The staff is very friendly!

name: Rachel
text:
(Read entire thing) My first experience here was great. I saw the female nurse practitioner and she took such good care of me and was very professional during my visit, so I knew I would go back in the future.
However, I went back today after class and work because I've been having difficulty breathing for 2 days, heavy wheezing all day yesterday and last night, dizziness, and bad chest pain which just came on today- so I immediately was worried about my asthma. The doctor who came in (tallish, brunette, male, 30's) just listened to my lungs and said-with the most smug attitude- that I was fine and there was nothing wrong.
Obviously I wouldn't be in there at 6:30 pm if something wasn't wrong; I have better things to do with my time.
When I told him how concerned I was & how I was having trouble breathing he told me just to take my inhaler (which I've been doing for 2 days without much help).
THIS WAS WHEN IT GOT RIDICULOUS: when I asked for a chest x-ray (just to be sure/for my own peace of mind) he just stared at me, then LITERALLY threw his hands up, swung the door open and marched out like a 5 year old. I was appalled to have seen a medical physician act so unprofessional AND in front of a patient. Moments later, I could hear him telling another staff member about how some 'stupid patient was asking for a X-ray just because she was having chest pain' and the other staff member saying 'oh my gosh, are you serious??'
I KNOW, THE NERVE I MUST HAVE TO ACTUALLY WANT TO KNOW WHY IT FEELS LIKE IM SUCKING IN AIR IN THROUGH A STRAW.  -- Someone I grew up with died 2 years ago at the age of 20 from having a blood clot in her chest and that's why I wanted to take extra precautions when I started having difficulties breathing and then chest pain.--
I was so astounded and felt humiliated to hear them talking about this right outside (keep in mind he had swung the door wide open so I could hear every word they were saying) so I just got up and told him not to worry about it, and that I was sorry for taking away his time and for actually asking him to do his job. I never once had an attitude with this doctor before that moment (I had zero reason to have an attitude towards him beforehand when I actually came in because I had such a good experience in the past). But the entire time he was talking to me it felt like he was just outrageously condescending or like he didn't actually know what the hell he was even talking about. I honestly don't know why he's even a doctor when he hates dealing with worried patients all day. Get a new job. I've had asthma my entire life. I wouldn't have gone in after a 12 hour class/work day & paid a $40 copay just because of chest pain if I wasn't seriously concerned about it. But it seems as though he couldn't care less about the health of his patients. I will not be back after this experience.

name: Nathan Simmons
text: Very clean facility and convenient. Staff was very professional and courteous, and I was very confident in the physician’s knowledge and experience. I did not have to wait long to see the physician (30 minutes at the most).

name: Wanda Holt
text: Everything was good.  No long wait. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful.  I was very happily impressed with the Dr.

name: Kell
text: AUBURN STUDENTS- DO NOT GO TO THE MED CLINIC ON CAMPUS, COME HERE!! *Everyone* here is extremely kind and helpful and will get you in and out. I've had to go here twice and they've been amazing both times.

name: Ireland Pulley
text: Staff was very helpful and courteous!! Ms Abby was very attentive and displayed a for real concern for my problem, diagnosed, came up with a solution, and I was out of there. Thank you so much! Urgent care, for real!

name: Joelle LeRoy
text: The nurses there are really great! I have been in and out of here with an infected dog bite for the last week and each visit was quick and efficient.

name: Taylor Sims
text: Unprofessional. I could hear the nurse practitioner and her colleagues joking in the hallway about me. Saying I probably googled my symptoms. Will not be back to this location.

name: Luann Simpson
text: Fast, courteous service!  They tested my daughter for the flu even though she didn’t have all the symptoms & she was positive.  Glad he didn’t rule anything out!

name: Abby Hilyer
text: I never have any problems using Stopwatch. In and out in well under an hour. Super nice staff and the doctors really listen.

name: Will Lane
text: They have really nice people working there. In and out pretty quick. It's my go to urgent care clinic. 5/5

name: Patti Gibson
text: I had a really good experience.  Receptionist, nurse and PA (Abby) were all great.  I waited less than 5 minutes in lobby and the PA came in almost immediately.

name: Cassie Walter
text: I was pleased with the care provided and the staff was very friendly. I appreciated the ability to have an x ray at their facility and received results quickly.

name: Sharon Golden
text:
Friendly and efficient staff
Doctor was very thorough in diagnosis
No long wait
Highly recommend to others

name: Terry Dozier
text: Very nice office, friendly employees,  and super medical staff!!  No waiting time and that really helps when you are not feeling well:)  tx

name: Clayton Dennis
text: The facilities and the staff are great, but the doctors try their best to avoid prescribing certain medications out of fear of getting in trouble. Personally when I get sick, I have a severe cough that causes tremendous pain. This also causes me to get little sleep. The only cough medicines that seem to work for me have narcotics in them. Doctors here seem to want to reserve those for the sickest of people which is ludicrous.

name: Karen Holt
text: It was very clean and I didn’t have to wait long. The doctor was very nice and had me on my way in record time😀 I was very  satisfied!!

name: RoseAnne Hurd
text: My 5th time & have been pleased every time. This time was for staples for scalp cut. Highly recommend this site!

name: Justin Poiroux
text:
I typically dislike urgent cares but I had an absolutely fantastic experience here. Nurses were nice. Doctor was knowledgeable and I was in a room within 15 mins of being there.

Great place for quick service.

name: Rich B
text: Quick service today for a physical. Co-pay was $40 for my insurance, which is a little high. Good service and nice doctor though.

name: 30a4life NC Personal
text: Couldn't ask for a more pleasant experience . My two year old daughter typically doesn't do to well at the doctor .they were very sweet and great with her .I would highly recommend .easy in and quick.

name: Olivia Morton
text: They get you in and out fast! Also take care of all your needs. Did not take long for me to see a doctor

name: Caroline Milton
text:
Best urgent care iv ever been
Al the staff was so kind and the office was so clean✨Deff will be recommending it and coming back when I need too.

name: Lizette Morgan
text: We were seen quickly,with great bedside manner and care. I really appreciate the whole experience. I’ll be back and definitely recommend y’all. 😊

name: Jo Ann Hollingsworth
text: Got in and out pretty fast. Staff was very nice and professional. The doctor seemed concerned and she was very nice.

name: Melany & Tony Iannuzzi
text: Very quick and thorough. Friendly doctor and staff.  Total visit time was 15 minutes and I was a new patient.

name: Niketta Williams
text: I want to Thank You Guys for the EXCELLENT SERVICE PROVIDE...THEY LISTENED AND TOOK GOOD CARE OF ME...THANKS STOPWATCH

name: Cathleen Golden
text: I went in for infected wounds. The check in was friendly & efficient ( I was there back in January). The Dr. introduced himself, assessed the problem, prescribed medications, and asked if I had any other concerns. I was in & out in 15 minutes. Love it!!

name: Betty Gibson
text: Today was my first time visiting this urgent care,and it want be my last time.There wasn't a long wait before you was called and you didn't have to wait in the room 30minutes.Everyone was very nice,and treated you that way.I give this office a 5 star

name: Nathan Pohlman
text: Very fast and very thorough. I will definitely return next time I am sick

name: Marcia Chandler
text:
I was called back quick and the doctor was in before the nurse had finished.

I was there for a while had to have exrays.   But taken very good care of.

name: Maddie
text: A misdiagnosis from this urgent care has costed me a lot of time, energy, and money. The mistake could have been easily avoided with a simple test that should have been performed at my first visit. I have been very disappointed and frustrated with my experience here. Fortunately the receptionist was at least kind and helpful.

name: Beth Watkins
text: It was great. Very little wait time. Everyone was so nice .

name: Carol Hoggle
text: No long waiting. Nurse and Nurse Practioner very amiable and professional.  Made me feel like they were truly concerned.

name: billy padgett
text:
Once I got into the treatment room everyone was great. But front desk crew were dissapointedly unprofessional.
Billy

name: Peggy Browning
text: Everyone was courteous and professional. Was seen within 5 minutes of waking in and finished in 20.

name: Rick Orwin
text: In and out and all fixed up. Very little wait. Everyone was very friendly and professional. Highly recommend.

name: Louis Loving
text: The staff and experience at Moore's Mill Urgent Care were great.  Unfortunately their parent company, Stopwatch Urgent Care, has a huge problem.  I paid my co-payment during my visit in September 2016.  They have billed me monthly telling me that I owe my co-payment and I have called them monthly to inquire why. Every month, I have been assured that I was correct and that my balance was paid in full only to receive another bill the next month. I feel that I now must pay again in order to avoid credit problem for their mistake.  It is frustrating beyond belief.

name: Aimee Sacks
text: Would have given 5 stars but they forgot to call my prescription in for my sick child, glad they were still open to give it verbally to the Pharmacist or I would have been furious. They did get us in and out quite quickly.

name: Elizabeth Bowerman
text: Quick, convenient service. In and out with prescriptions in 30 minutes. My go to place for sinus infections.

name: Maria Tyler
text: I  was greeted with a smile. I  had a very short wait time. Everyone was very professional and friendly.  Thanks for helping me so efficiently.

name: Leah Pink
