text: I went first thing in the morning so there wasn't really a wait. The staff were friendly and professional, the doctor was thorough and really seemed like she cared about my health. Definitely my best urgent care experience.

name: Fuller Mitchum
text: Easy check in. Didn't take long to see a doctor.

name: Carson Goff
text: By appointment only. How in the world is it URGENT care if it’s by appointment only??

name: JoAnna Williams
text: Friendly, helpful, and fast, courteous service. I’ve been using Stop Watch Urgent Care since its inception and they continue to improve at each visit.

name: David Weaver
text: Service at this establishment was excellent.  I have no problems with their medical expertise and treatment.  However, for some reason my BC/BS insurance rejected the claim, so I had to pay more than $600 for the treatment.  After I straightened things out with my insurance and the claim was paid, I am owed more than $600 by MMUC.  I have been trying to get my money back since October 2012, and still have not been repaid.  Their billing company is not local, and their policy seems to be delay, obfuscate, confuse, and lie to the customer.  Anything to avoid payment.  I have made multiple phone calls, and each time I get a different story about why I have not been paid.  They admit they owe me the money.  Seven months have gone by with no resolution to this problem.  I will not be using this facility again.

name: Jemekia Tolbert
text: Very professional and friendly staff. I was in and out. Which makes me happy!😁

name: Jane Wynn
text: Awesome patient care from the front desk to the Nurses and the CRNP.

name: Buster Fincher
text: Excellent treatment by the staff. Abby was very thorough and I am feeling better already.

name: Taylor Ferpes
text: I hardly ever leave reviews but this place is great. Workers are very kind and the service is very quick

name: mary middleton
text: Friendly staff. Quick yet thorough visit. I drive past other urgent care places to come here.

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: I loved my experience at Moore’s Mill Urgent Care! The receptionist was friendly, the nurse was efficient in recording all of my information, and the doctor was so nice, answering all of my questions!

name: Me Me
text: All the employees are very sweet. I could have asked for a better visit.

name: Greg Bradham
text: Very quick to get in to see the doctor/PA. Only two pages of paperwork for a new patient, very nice office and Dr. Perry was great. Thank you!

name: Sharla Smith
text: I wasn’t satisfied with the diagnosis I got there today. I went about what I believe is excema or something like it on my face around my eyes. However I was told I only had an infection in my eye and was prescribed eye drops! I wanted some kind of cream to put around my eyes. I’ll just have to wait on my dermatologist appointment in a week from now. 😟

name: Gail Dunn
text: I always receive quick care by a professional staff. Highly recommend!

name: Sudduth Alexander
text: Best Urgent Care I’ve been to! I was in and out in about 45 minutes. The staff was very friendly and the Nurse-Practitioner told me which pharmacy I can get my presciption from for free!

name: Jane Poe
text: Most efficient office visit I have ever had..

name: Susan Reed
text: Great staff and got me in to see the doctor quickly.

name: Cindy Roberson
text: I interacted with 3 members of the staff and the Dr.  ALL of them were wonderful!  This is by far the best urgent care I have been to.

name: Kimberly Montee
text: Awesome Nurse Practitioner. Needed stitches, done very professionally and quickly.

name: Marvin Taylor
text: The best urgent care ever! Super fast friendly service, wonderful doctors, not one negative thing to say about a single visit yet.

name: Kat Methier
text: The wait was reasonable, everyone very helpful, and the doctor was great. Couldn't have had a better experience.

name: Kay Hargrave
text: Excellent receptionist. Excellent nurse. Excellent nurse practitioner.

name: Brooke Moore
text: The doctor I saw was AMAZING. She made me feel extremely comfortable & was so nice!!!

name: Zachary Kovacs
text: No where else would take me without an appointment. Walked in here, and was out within 15 minutes. Great service

name: Richard Huntly
text: Doctor listened to me and took care of my needs promptly and with professionalism.

name: Gary Hamilton
text: Took my daughter to be seen by this office. We checked in as requested and waited over an hour to be seen. It turned out that the front desk receptionist had crossed off my name from the checkin list without realizing that we had not been called into see the doctor. Then, she realized a while later that we were not established patients and asked us to complete the new patient paperwork. Not a well managed office from my perspective.

name: S E
text: Very helpful staff.  Was in and out quickly.

name: Katherine Powell
text: Saw someone right away. Seemed like they knew what they were talking about. Friendly staff. Great experience.

name: James Hill
text: As advertised; with the addition of a friendly, caring staff. Outstanding service!

name: Judy McGaha
text: Seen almost immediately,  very pleasant staff, a very positive experience .

name: mary kathryn muller
text: Super quick and excellent staff! Very friendly. I was in and out in under 30 min! Only urgent care I’ll go to!

name: Jordan King
text: I always get the best care when I come here! They are the best!

name: Barbara Allen
text: Dr. was great !!! The person that check U in could be a little more friendly.

name: T W
text: I brought my son in on Sunday morning right when they opened. About five people signed in before me and I was worried we were going to be there for a while since he was a new patient.  We filled out our paperwork, they processed our insurance, triaged him, strep tested him, Dr. Adams examined him, prescription escribed to our pharmacy, and we were out the door in 30 minutes with a doctors note in hand. So efficient!

name: Donna Hamby
text: They are very quick to get you in, thorough and caring.

name: Kristen King
text: They are so sweet! Best visit ever!

name: Kyle Adams
text: Everyone in the office was extremely courteous and professional, and Dr. Roberts had my finger sewed up in no time!

name: Denise Edwards
text: Always quick, friendly, and solves whatever issue I may present. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Desiree Sinclair
text: Love this location.   Always quick caring service.

name: Katrina Avery
text: These ladies did an excellent job at the WestRock Company Health Fair! Thank you for helping us on our path to health!

name: Cherry Andrews
text: Was seen in a timely manner and Dr. Almeida was very nice. Will use again.

name: Nancy Griggs
text: Really confused by the excellent ratings for this place. I will say that they are very fast, too fast. On my first visit the only paperwork I filled out was my basic information, SSN & birthdate, and how was I going to pay. I was called back very quickly, but not quick enough for the VERY loud music coming from next door to give me a headache. The nurse immediately took my blood pressure using my forearm as my arm is dangling beside me and proceeded to tell me it was high. Things you should know, you should always sit for 5 minutes before taking BP,  always have the arm supported to heart level, forearm measurements are always higher. The doctor came in quickly, asked a few vague questions about my health, listened to my chest, said I had an upper respiratory infection and prescribed a steroid and a cough syrup equivalent to Nyquil and Sudafed that cost $50. Needless to say, I didn't get it filled. I was in and out in 45 minutes, but I won't be back.

name: Meg Rainey
text: Less than 30 minutes from the time I walked through the door until I was in my car and on the way to the pharmacy to pick up my prescription. Efficient, friendly, and most of all - I have complete confidence in the staff.

name: Mike Schultz
text: Very quick!  Very helpful and personable staff

name: Cowan Woodham
text: I tried going here to see the doctor around 11:00am on Sunday. Both doors were locked and the business hours sign specifically read “Saturday & Sunday 9:00am-5:00pm”. Absolutely ridiculous! I will not be going back there ever again. Garbage!!!

name: Melanie Hildebrandt
text: Courteous providers and staff, efficient and quick care, and clean and comfortable facilities.

name: Brett Downs
text: The staff is always professional and polite. This is my go to whenever I’m sick.

name: Sharon Dillard
text: I took my 4 year old one day and me the next. I was very happy both times.

name: Yeojin Kim
text: It was quick to get in and receive help. Wonderful staff!

name: Heather King
text: They saw my son in a timely manner and were thorough, professional, and friendly.

name: Hannah Kellar
text: The doctor and staff was SO friendly. I’ll only be coming to this clinic from now on when I’m sick!

name: Bob Montgomery
text: Very courteous and told me what I needed to know about my condition!

name: Jason Belcher
text: All staff were very friendly, Doctor was nice and soft-spoken to my daughter, and we got in and out fairly fast even though they were busy.

name: Wendy Bonnell
text:
I called because I was bitten by a feral cat that has since disappeared and asked if they handle rabies shots for humans. The receptionist laughed at me and transferred me to a number that did not pick up.
Is rabies in humans that funny? Should I not bother to seek medical attention because it is a laughing matter?

name: Alexandra Neal
text: Nice to come in and be seen so quickly this morning. I had called my doctor and could not be seen there until THURSDAY! Dr Roberts got me in this morning.

name: M Lott Webs
text: I was in and out quickly, less than an hour from online appointment, travel,  and treatment. They were sympathetic to my agony and helped me.

name: Sarah-Callin Moat
text: First time visiting! Needed an X-ray and got in and out within an hour! 😃 Great!

name: Omar Figuereo
text: Fast Service, nice people, highly recommended.

name: Tj Coker
text: I was seen at urgent care today. I was in and out of there in about 30 mins time but the dr was very rude. I was trying to explain to her what problem I was having and she kept cutting me off and interrupting me... They act like you're some type of drug addict looking for pain meds. I dont take pain pills or any other medication for that matter and for her to treat me like she did was uncalled for. I didnt even get a chance to explain to her all of my symptoms before she so rudely interrupted me. Just extremely disappointed.

name: Shannon Bolt
text: Always prompt an thorough!!  Great team of workers

name: Samantha M
text: Was referred here by CVS on College Street because I had symptoms of the flu. They said go to Stopwatch, and not anyone else. Im glad they did. I went to the Moores Mill location and filled out paperwork and was literally seeing the doctor within 10 minutes of arriving. I was seen quickly by Dr Roberts, who was great. Overall visit was about 30 minutes total. WOW!

name: K M
text: Went in for a sinus infection. Nurse practitioner on staff acted as if I was an inconvenience. Only prescribed a strong antihistamine and said I only have allergies. I have suffered my entire life from seasonal allergies and I have become quite familiar with what sinus infections are like. I left feeling frustrated. A few hours later my symptoms worsened. I called and explain my symptoms are getting worse and to ask if an Antibiotic could be called in for me. I was told that I must return for bloodwork in order to be prescribed an antibiotic. Never in my life has bloodwork been a requirement for an antibiotic to treat a sinus infection. Will not be returning to this location ever again!

name: Jennifer Quillope
text: They always take care of my family and myself! It’s so convienent too.

name: Marcia Hillsman
text: I received great service in a very timely manner!

name: Matt Mock
text: Fast even when busy. We've been here about 4 times with our two children.

name: N S
text: They were more concerned with rotating me through than actually helping me at all. Have gone twice now and did not get a definite diagnosis either time. First time they did not even check my blood because they were afraid I would pass out but diagnosed me with "sounds like" mono without a single test. Second time took 10 minutes because they finished "diagnosing" me before I could even tell them all my symptoms and decided to give me a shot without even knowing for sure what was wrong because they were ready to close. Not even a full check up! So disappointed that people like this are in the medical field at all. Will not be returning. Not to mention I had to pay before so I couldn't even do anything about my terrible care.

name: jo ann gamble
text: Excellent experience, everyone, from the receptionist to the NP was incredibly helpful and kind.

name: Dana Raughton
text: Waited a long time, paid a Co-pay, doc/np didn’t listen, look in my ears, nor take blood & told me it was viral. When I questioned her as why no blood test, the machine was ‘down’ & it would take a while as she’d have to go read it....but she was confident it was viral. The worst part was her not listening to me. Since I had no fever, she was adamant not to treat me. I thanked her for her time & most of all the opportunity to donate my time & copay to doc in the box.

name: Alan Sorensen
text: Very friendly and efficient. In and out in less than 45 minutes.

name: Bob Kribel
text: Fast, friendly, and quality service. Dr. Roberts takes the time to discuss and explain the diagnosis and related medical issues.

name: Sarah
text: Nice staff, not a long wait time, clean and professional.

name: Chelsea House
text: Love this place! SOOOO much better than American Family Care!!! The doctors are awesome and don't just turn you away without checking you over COMPLETELY. Definitely recommended to anyone & eveyone!!!

name: Cindy Shadow
text: Professional, efficient, friendly and fast. Highly recommended.

name: Nina Hollingsworth
text: Quick service, compassion and very nice staff!

name: Cindy Franklin
text: Great and friendly staff ! The best Urgent Care in Auburn/Opelika!

name: Will Mooty
text: Quick and easy to get in. Convenient location.

name: Stopwatch Urgent Care
text: Come in for the BEST urgent care experience around. Faster and more thorough, where YOUR health and YOUR time are paramount.

name: champ champ
text: Don't know what they are doing

name: 49erfan160880
text: I was able to get in and out in 30 minutes.

name: Drew Waldrop
text: Very pleased with the staff and car provided. Thank you.

name: John Wells Warren
text: I’ve used Urgent Care since it first opened. It is excellent in every way.

name: DJango Bruce
text: Good doctor. Nice folks.

name: Jackson Davis
text:
I paid 100 copay for them to tell me I need to drink tea and they disregarded the rest of my symptoms when I was clearly very sick
Someone who listened during high school health class has the same level of education as the most skilled professional at Urgent care.

name: Landa Trentham
text: My husband and I both use Moores Mill Urgent Care.  Dr. Roberts is one of the most knowledgeable and caring medical professionals with whom we have ever dealt.  My several visits have always had good results - Dr. Roberts knows what is wrong and how to treat it in the most effective way.  My husband has in the past refused to go to a doctor at all.  He feels extremely comfortable with Dr. Roberts and has complete trust in him.  We both believe that that trust is well deserved since our treatment at MMUC has always had good results.  At MMUC you can expect quick, courteous, efficient and effective treatment.  We have, in fact, recommended Dr. Roberts to many friends in the area.  All of them who have used MMUC have also been extremely pleased.

name: Josh Rosenblum
text: Moores mill urgent care is a great place.  Dr.  Robert is a wonderful Doctor and his staff is very friendly!

resp.text: THANKS so much for your kind review! - MMUC

name: Elliott Wood
text: Great service. Definitely better than any of the other urgent cares I have used.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review! -MMUC

name: Buck Garrison
text: In and out in less than an hour. Tory, Dakota, Abby, and Adrian were all polite and professional.

name: Caroline Hale
text: Showed up with my friend and waited for 1.5 hours before we were seen. Only talked to the doctor for 2 minutes and was trying to convince my friend she was pregnant when it was impossible. The nurse and doctor seemed very unprofessional. Waited all that time and we were just told it was a low-grade virus and that he wasn't concerned by not having eaten in 4 days.

name: Cherron Sutten
text: Each time I visit the staff is always welcoming and the physicians truly care about the patient.

name: doug parkman
text: In and out in 20 minutes... fixed my problem

name: Mirage
text: Unprofessional office staff. I'm feeling bloody miserable, told them my symptoms, and the doctor recommended OTC throat lozingers. Are you bloody stupid? I came to you to get better, but I felt like I was scammed. Will not be returning back here literally ever again. Get rekt.

name: Claire Key
text: Best Urgent Care in the world! Always quick and the doctors and staff are also so nice!

name: R Sheridan
text: Great service and care

name: Erin Greer
text: I went in at 8am, super fast.

name: Janet Baugh
text: Super friendly and great service.

name: Wain Kellum
text: So fast and excellent care

name: Jenna Morgan
text: Such a friendly and courteous staff!

name: Audrey Barker
text: Super fast. Thanks

name: Scotty King
text: Brought my 6 year old in due to a bad cough. Was in out in about 30 minutes. Dr. Danny fixed him right up and we were on our way.

name: Angel Stokes
text: Fast , caring & great service!

name: lkbraswell
text: Staff was most professional and efficient!

name: Julie Scarbrough
text: Hardly no wait time . In and out with sinus infection and prescriptions called in..real nice people.

name: Peyton Ashmore

name: Tracy King

name: Al Jones

text: Good service, I was in and out...

text: Great service

name: Beth Huddleston
text: Tanya was awesome!!!

name: Kelly Phillips
text: Didn't seem knowledgeable.

name: M.L Stewart
text: Wait is never long, always professional and friendly

name: Grayson Everett
text: Excellent neighborhood care center that can do just about anything, with great walk-in hours and a terrific staff!

name: Christine Kamback
text: Excellent care. I recommend highly and will definitely use again.

name: Brian Dunbar
text: Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. Don't let the small office fool you.

name: David Driscoll
text: Great staff

name: Melissa El Guezouly
text: If I could leave a negative 5 stars I would. Friday we went to Decatur and on the way back I developed a migraine. I live in Florence, and I didnt think I was going to make it in time to go to my primary so I stopped at Med Plus since I used to go there when I lived in Muscle Shoals. I explained I had a migraine and was starting to feel nauseous, and seen the doctor.  All was going well as I thought, but certainly not feeling it. The doctor said he would send the nurse in and give me something.  But as I found it they didn't give me anything at all. They gave me a placebo.  I learned that after I received my blank shot and I was walking out the door. I heard both nurses talking behind me. One asking 'aren't we supposed to have her wait 15 minutes before leaving'?, and the other shaking her head. On top of that I had to pay for your performance.  I could only assume it was because you had seen the sores on my arms. They were in fact my psoriasis that had been scratching. You see I have a photosensitivity condition that makes me allergic to sun.  Just a few days prior I was out in the sun all afternoon working in the yard, and one day assembling patio furniture.  If you would have only asked, instead of coming to a bad conclusion of your own causing me to suffer even more.  After I left there, I immediately began throwing up, and did so for the next 14 hours.  I threw up atleast 20-25 times, so much so I burned the back of my throat and was unable to eat the next day.  My family begged me through the night to let them take me to the emergency room.  But why would I do something as silly as that? For more top treatment? Because I was under the assumption you had given me something for a migraine, I did not take anything further for pain when I got home.  Although I felt all along you didnt give me anything, I had to be safe and not take anything just in case.  You are a disgrace to doctors.  Instead of not causing more harm, you caused much more harm.  And I hope that my daughter becomes the doctor that you can't achieve to be.  I hope she learns understanding and empathy,... You should be ashamed of yourself.

name: Margaret Booth
text: Hours of operation are announced on voicemail with notice that hours may differ due to COVID 19. There is a sign outside the building which states you can call and set up an appointment. I’ve called multiple times during their operating hours to set up an appointment. No answer on the phone or a voicemail. My thoughts are they must be very busy. I waited and made a few phone calls each hour with no voicemail or answer. I decided I should just travel down there and after getting in line I could sit in my car and wait till they are ready for me. I arrive to locked doors. Someone is inside, but no answer to phone calls, and no voicemail. Aggravated because I was waiting all morning and trying to be patient for a health care provider who isn’t even opening today. Or so it seems. While I sat there trying to locate another health care provider. Two other cars pull up. Both dealing with the same situation. If your not opening due to COVID 19 or lack of staff please place a voicemail out so your patients can go somewhere else without delay!

name: Candy Prestage
text: Not sure this place even deserves a 1. The receptionist was the nicest person there.  The nurse was very rude. Didn't warn about shot before giving. The Dr was also very rude.  Pushing on back and kinda snatching my head around.  Also I was informed that he wrote same prescriptions for everyone today. This is ridiculous.  I definitely won't be using this place ever again.

name: Jeraca Coggins
text: They are SLOW. Like slow slow. An they can get rude.

name: Kim Azeem
text: They told me they'd keep the doors open until 6:20pm eventhough they close at 7pm. I called and said it might be 6:21. They said no problem. My daughter has an ear infection. I show up bang on 6:20. The lights were off and doors were locked. They had cars in the parking lot. Waste of my time!!! Beyond rude.

name: Jordan
text: Not sure what the bad reviews are about. I’ve always loved Med Plus. Yeah sure if a place is busy you’ll have to wait a little while. That’s just common sense.  Dr McGahey and Dr Ferguson are both great doctors. Explain everything well and give you options if you want a shot or just to take the antibiotics if you have an infection of some sort. Not too expensive either if you have to self pay. Thanks for always taking care of me

name: Andrea Goodloe
text: Excellent service!

name: Heather Wilkinson
text: Outrageously slow. Take the drive to florence and save yourself some time by going to welness walk in clinic. Never again.

name: Brian Cameron
text: Usually in and out pretty quick.

name: Connie Liverett
text: Always professional and helpful.

name: Hussein Eljoumaa
text: Very unprofessional.  Will never go there again

name: Michele Aycock
text: Absolute WORST service ever.   Would drive to Express Med anyday!

name: Sarah Hopkins
text: Its clean and the staff is friendly its like other places the waiting game to see a doctor

name: Lisa Bradford
text: poor management!!

name: Kevin Hendon
text: Nurse Practitioner was unprofessional. I had to wrap my wound up myself before I left. She didn't do what she said she would even after I called to remind her. Never Again

name: Erica Blanchard
text: Excellent staff, fast and efficient. Very clean. Absolutely no complaints. They went above and beyond to care for me.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Mvp Tootie
text: The staff there is amazing. I have my primary care doctor there and you feel like they truly care for you and go over and beyond to take care of you. The place is always clean and I rarely have to wait for very long. My primary care doctor is Dr hobbs and I know I can always count on her and she genuinely cares for her patients. Chris Davenport also is one of the kindest and very helpful staff there.

name: Faith Hubbard
text: My parents and I tested here 3 times for work requirements and we were positive two of the three times. The staff were very nice, friendly, and very helpful! Chris and Kelli were AMAZING and so patient with all of us. My momma is handicapped and has a very low immune system. They accommodated her needs by COMING OUT TO OUR CAR! I didn’t want to take her in before we knew for sure she was positive and they were so good to us! I’m very thankful and words cannot express how much I appreciate all they did for us!

name: Jessica Adams
text: Jennifer Hobbs is the absolute sweetest and listens to her patients’ concerns. The other staff is also super friendly. It makes a difference to be greeted by smiling faces especially when in a doctor’s office because you go in not feeling well. I appreciate this clinic being in our small town.

name: Gabriel Kelley
text: I had a great experience here at Chilton urgent care. The staff and nurses were super sweet. They were so thoughtful and made sure I had everything I needed. With me being pregnant they offered water and kept me comfortable until everything checked out ok. I would go back again if I’m ever sick.

name: Brittney Shearon
text: There aren’t enough words to describe this place!! Jennifer Hobbs is the best by far!! She was very understand with the situation and made it her goal to find a positive solution!! Staff is always super nice when I go in!! They truly treat you like family there!! By far the best!!!

name: Cassie Patterson
text: Jennifer Hobbs NP and staff are WONDERFUL!! She is very compassionate , knowledgeable and understanding !!  Would recommend this clinic to anyone ! Very efficient and clean. I have used this clinic as well as my family members. Great place for Clanton and couldn’t ask for better staff!

name: Misti Kelley
text: Every time I go to urgent care I get the best care and treatment! My wait isn’t long at all.  The staff is wonderful,  I absolutely love Brandy Patterson and Chris Davenport, they are so helpful in getting me in and taking care of me. I would recommend using chilton urgent care!

name: Kalyn Shannon Stracener
text: Friendly staff especially the Medical Assistant, Chris. He is a always cheerful and helpful! They try their best to get you in and out as fast as possible.

name: christa Frasier
text: Outstanding staff! They are all very patient with you and great at accommodating your special need! Much quicker than sitting at the er all day highly recommended!!

name: Tammy Harmon
text: Staff was very nice and was concerned for me. They took care of me. I didn’t have to wait long either. Would definitely go back.

name: Sondra Lenoir
text: I want to give a big shout out to Jennifer Hobbs, Chris Davenport I went in when I was having trouble hurting in my chest, they took such good care of me until they could send me out to the hospital. I had a heart attack, these guys are the best so caring and loving of their patients we need more like these two love you guys keep up the good work ❤️❤️❤️

name: Brianna Tinker
text: The providers are very caring! It’s very convenient and you don’t have to have an appointment.

name: Jerome “PirateKing” Johnson II
text: It was actually the fastest friendliest urgent Care I've ever been to. My wife was sick so I took her and checked her in and we were out of there in less than an hour. They ran all the necessary test and have her a couple shots and some medicine and we were done that fast..... AWESOME!!!!

name: Carrie Kromer
text: They staff are very friendly. They are very good about trying to get you in and out as quickly as they can.

name: Sabrina Shavers
text: Wait time here is awful! I was very bad sick and waited here for 6.5 hours before finally getting back and then had to wait another hour before I was finally able to leave. And the bad thing is there was hardly anyone else in there. The front desk also does not have it together. I asked them to mail my a copy of something (because they can not email and I do not want to go in due to COVID) and that was almost a month ago and I have yet to receive anything. And when I call they tell me that it has been mailed out and just watch for it.. Awful.

name: Kristina Horsley
text: Love the staff and all the doctors!! Highly recommend.

name: Jennifer Davenport
text: The staff is friendly and the Drs are very caring and compassionate towards there patients. I would highly recommend them.

name: Ashley Hodgens
text: HAVE USED CHILTON URGENT CARE  SEVERAL TIMES IN THE PAST 2-3 MONTHS AND HAVE BEEN IN AND OUT IN LESS THAN AN HOUR-HOUR AND A HALF EVERY TIME. STAFF IS COURTEOUS AND FRIENDLY. VERY CASUAL SETTING AND THOROUGH PROVIDERS. ADDED BONUS THEY ARE OPEN LATE WHICH IS VERY BENEFICIAL FOR OTHER HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS THAT DO NOT WORK NORMAL 9-5 HOURS AND CAN NOT GET OFF WORK FOR DR APPOINTMENTS.

name: Blake Smith
text: Worst urgent care I ever been too I waited for 3 hours just for the doctor to tell to go to the ER and the lady up front was so rude I wish I could’ve spoken to management

resp.text: I apologize you had that experience I would like you to call me if possible to discuss the situation. Patient care is our number one priority. 205 280 0620 ask to speak to Brandi.

name: Sam Barrett
text: Very Friendly staff and they were very quick!!!

name: John (Big John)
text: Of the few times I've been there it was after 5pm. The staff have poor attitudes. Don't want to do anything that would possibly make them have to stay late.(This isn't a guess. I was actually told this by their staff.) It doesn't matter why you are there, they act as you being there is an inconvenience to them. I'd suggest going to the ER at the 219 exit.

name: Rhianna Messing
text: Don't give this place your debit card number! I called in to pay a bill in full, my bank showed that the charge was pending for a larger amount, so I called to verify the payment amount. I spoke with Diane Patterson. She let me know that the charge would have to clear my bank, as is. They would send me a check in the mail for the overcharge. Apparently, the woman that took my payment entered in the larger amount by mistake! I was appalled when Diane tells me that they were running "wide open" and I should be glad that's all they charged...and trying to speak to someone above her about the issue is pointless. I've gotten the runaround for a week, being given other people to call - eventually coming back to the same person who is never in and doesn't return voicemails.

name: Aurora
text: I’ve used Chilton Urgent Care several times for my family and have only received the best of care. The nurse practitioners and doctors we’ve seen have been very thorough and kind.

name: Ashley Wallin
text: Wait time is unreal! Been here for 5 hours an still haven’t seen a doctor.

name: Teresa Teresa
text: Great service very detailed and every time I was in and out.

name: Shelly East
text:
Joke. Only about the money. Really no care for the patients . I do not recommend going here.
Do your research  first.

name: Debra “possum” Mefford
text: Front office staff is awesome. Very helpful and friendly.

name: Emily Spivey
text: Went here 8 days after a trip to the ER and getting no better.  Wait was very minimal, they listened to me, did some tests and prescribed meds that began working right away.  Will definitely go back.

name: Judy Smith
text: Staff is always friendly and helpful.  I have used this clinic multiple times and have never met a unfriendly staff member.

name: charles smith
text: Poor customer service. Tanya was completely rude on the phone. Went into the location and she downplayed the whole conversation and made me feel as if everything I said was a lie. I'll drive to prattville before I give these people any more money.

name: Debra Ward
text: Went in on a Wednesday. Waited one hour in waiting room. Was called back and then had to wait for 1 hour and 45 minutes in the patient room. Still did not get to see a doctor who worked there. Said doctor was busy. So this lady I found (don’t know who she was) after I complained of long nearly two hour wait, went to doctor about my symptoms and doc wrote prescriptions and orders for shots. During the wait had to go out of my room to find someone to see if they forgot me again. The workerlady had not put my order in for the shots. I ended up crying because I was not feeling good and having to wait in a closed up room for nearly two hours. I had been there before with no problems. Don’t know if I will go back.

name: April Oliver
text:
Long wait times not to mention the dr was very short and didn’t really help me much also they tried to tell me my copay to them was $50
That my insurance company said so well I just got my claim from insurance company and my copay to them is only $20 so they over charged me I won’t be going back there,,,,, they rip you off and lie. Scam artists my opinion. Just go to the hospital won’t be going back to this place EVER!!!!!

name: Christy Oaks
text: Always super sweet to me and my children. My 4 year old little boy had to have his ears flushed and the nurse called to check on him before she left the clinic that night.

name: Andrew Wells
text: Very rude office staff. Told us to go to ER instead of seeing what they could help us with when they hand no other people in waiting room and refused to call insurance company to verify insurance copayment

name: Trish Bufkin
text: 1st time Ive had to go to an urgent care since I've been in Clanton and Im a new resident for about a year and a half. The entire staff was great all the way up to the nurse practitioner. Would recommend them to anyone at any given time.🤗

name: Sonia cleckler
text: They have always been quick to take us back, thorough in the exam, and very friendly and professional. We have received excellent care each time.

name: Tara Terrell
text: Its pretty bad that you go in to see a Dr. cause you're sick and you have double insurance but they still cant seem to know how to bill it. But months later you are getting a letter in mail that they have turned it over to a collection agent cause of their own problems with their workers whom cant seem to know how to do their job.

name: Jovan Agee
text: This was the worst visit ever. The lady at the front desk was rude and looked at me as if I were another black coming in. It will have to be life and death before I go back there again

name: Mark Munter
text: Nice people that work there, only downside is the wait times. If you truly have an urgent issue go to the emergency room, because this place is set up more like a Doctor's office. You will usually be waiting an hour or more.

name: Kerri Martin
text: They offer weight loss clinic. They tell you no wait time  so you pay for your shots in advance and you wait hours worth sick people to get your shot.

name: Janie Hughen
text: I’ve always got great care there and I have Tricare insurance!

name: Callie Martin
text: Instead of having people wait in the lobby while you have a 2 hour lunch just close for 2 hours. This is ridiculous and then blame it on emergencies that came in while I hear microwaves going off and smell the food cooking...really. Not good!!!

name: Christian Littleton
text: OMG!! Wait 3 hours and never get seen!! Do not go here go anywhere else your better off!

name: Chuck Squirrely
text:
My wife brought in a form from employer to get tested for TB.
They looked at it and said it would be 35.00.
When she went back to get her arm checked, they refused to have the doctor sign it unless she paid an additional 65.00!
'Bait and Switch ' !!
They are going to have to answer the complaints that will follow.

name: Jason Essary
text: I will never go to this Urgent Care again! Was seen for a sinus infection. After taking the prescribed antibiotics I still had the infection. I called back to have them call a different antibiotic in and they wouldn't. They said just take mucinex. I did that for a week with no success. Called them back today and they said the doctor will have to see me again! Another co-payment, I don't think so! They're also not very good at answering the phone. When they do answer they'll take a message and never call you back!

name: James Brandon Littleton
text: My family and I have been seen by this clinic on numerous occasions and It has been a great experience each time! Everyone was very friendly.

name: Hilary Hurst
text: Love the staff at Chilton Urgent Care!!!

name: Kevin Corley
text: We were seen promptly and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. My four year old had a blast...at the doctor!

name: Phyllis Hendricks
text: Helpful each time I've been here  staff very nice .

name: Jill Lowman
text: Very nice people but very slow!

name: Terry Mims
text: Went in with a head injury and they took great care of me. But it's very hard to get someone on the phone to ask them a question though.

name: Raven
text: In my opinion this place is Bait and Switch.  I was told my son's office visit was going to cost $100.  I provided a detailed description of his symptoms.  He obviously had a throat infection, fever and cough.  I paid the $100 before seeing the doctor.  Now I got a bill for another $142 dollars.  They charged 2 x $35 for flu tests, $24 for a Strepp test and $48 for a Mefoxin shot.  Now they want $142 more on top of the $100 I already paid.  At no time was I asked if it was okay to administer these tests or told what they would cost.  When I asked for his test results the Doctor says "The results were negative, but based on his tonsil infection and fever he needs the antibiotics I prescribed him."  If he was going to get the antibiotic shot and antibiotic prescription regardless of the test results then why bother with $94 dollars in tests that ended up negative? In my opinion the "tests" are purely to increase their profit and were not necessary.  I will never go to this Urgent Care ever again.  Shame on you Chilton Urgent Care.

name: Krystal calfee
text: Went there on a Sunday with my 4 year old nonverbal autistic child because he hurt his foot. We were there for 2 hours (with us being the only one there).  They took x-rays of his foot then told me that they didn't see anything but in fact after my child's Doctor read the x-rays he did have a fracture.  Will not be taking him back.

name: Patrick H
text: The doctor performed unnecessary tests. Was billed almost $100 after copay and insurance. All of that for just a z pack.

name: heather ellison
text: This place is clean but when ya call for help they always tell ya to call somewhere else. Will not be back.

name: phillip smitherman
text:
NEGATIVE 5!!
NEVER AGAIN!

name: Billy Abrams
text: Very friendly staff

name: Jcb Blogs
text: It was 100$ co pay

name: Jerica Riffe
text: Long wait

name: D Oaks
text: Receptionist...Horrible... uncaring.. rude...does not take time to help....All she cared abut was adding up what it cost....and money was not our issue...not one time did she direct us or see my sons injuries....

resp.text: I am so sorry you had this experience at CUC. Please give me a call in the morning at 2052800620. I would like to discuss this further. I do apologize.  I would like to get to the bottom of this.

name: David Chambers
text: Everyone was welcoming and friendly.  Not in a rush, which is crucial for me.  Great staff.  Even got to talk "Harry Potter" with Gretchen.  Jennifer was thorough and SUPER kind.  The Doctor (Renee) was a complete professional without being aloof. A great experience.  I will return and encourage others to give the new crew a chance.

name: Marcelus Joseph
text: Absolutely amazing. The new staff is so much better. They take care of you and make you feel comfortable and at home. The wonderful ladies who took care of me were Madison, Rene, and Gretchen. I highly suggest everyone come here.

name: Marissa Lycans
text: This was my first time going to UCM and I was very impressed. The NP was super friendly and so was the staff. I was in and out in 15 minutes. The NP had my diagnosis and prescription within 5 minutes. The only negative is there wasn’t a purse holder on the back of the door in the bathroom. I would recommend UCM!

name: Krista Graham
text: Very nice from phone call to when I got there til the time I left. Very knowledgeable and worked with u to make ur visit easy and smooth.  In and out in no time as a walk in. The front desk, nurse,  and doctor was on the same pg and a very nice staff. I enjoy going here and very reasonable pricing.

name: Geri White
text: The staff is friendly, quick ,and efficient at UCM.  I get seen within several minutes.  The doctors and Nurse Practitioners have always diagnosed me correctly with correct medicines to resolve the issue.  Excellent facility...very clean and modern.

name: Heather Rice
text: I loved how quickly they got me back and seen by the doctor. I let them know I only had a short time until I had to be at work and they were very accommodating. The office was very clean and had a friendly atmosphere. The doctor made me feel like he was my friend and truly cared about me. I would definitely recommend this doctors office!

name: Maddy McKinney
text:
UCM

Very sanitary and clean environment. Caring and nice staff. I come here every time when I am ill and the doctors listen and care and try to get the best medication for you.

name: Robin Jones
text:
I went in and there was no wait... I got in and got out ! Ms. Jennifer and her team were AMAZING ! I do not normally rate business but this Urgent Care patient care and customer service deserved 5 stars.
If I was to make a recommendation, I would love to see some modern upgrade.

Thanks Team 😊

name: ANN PETTUS
text: I had the pleasure of being seen here today. The Staff was amazing and so kind. I was in and out they jumped right on my issue. Which was severe pain in my right wrist. I got grays that came out good and the Dr resolved my problem with 2 shots. 5hrs later I feel great no pain. I definitely recommend!!

name: Billie Jo Flowers
text: I was very disappointed in doctor even though I had been there several times in past year. Without divulging my medical problem,  they should and do have my medical history. The nurse seeing me before doc seemed to be more aware. Poor bedside manner. Done with this place!

name: Samantha Booker
text: I came in today as a new patient, I waited only approximately half an hour including the time it took to fill out the paperwork before being called to the back. The staff was very kind and professional. After being taken back my vitals were taken immediately, a little while later the doctor came in and introduced herself and got right to what is going on with me, called me in a prescription for my antibiotic and hot me right on out there for door. I was here maybe a little over an hour altogether. I will come back in the future and I definitely recommend to anyone else in need of urgent Care.

name: Josh Hiatt
text: I had an awesome experience at UCM! The staff was professional, very competent, efficient and thorough. I highly recommend.

name: Rick Jaramillo
text:
Waiting in lobby for three hours. Then into waiting room for 30m at least now. Here for sore throat, staying here til I'm dead apparently.
*Update* still waiting and probably contaminating this room with my sick. Also noticed the window is bordered up with plastic patient gowns taped to the window frame.
*Update* nearing hour four still waiting in my cell to be seen. Getting pretty hungry.
*Update* apparently walking out of your cell and asking how much longer earns you to be seen immediately by the doctor.

name: Madisen Molitor
text: I really enjoyed this place. The staff was very friendly and funny. They got me right in and explained everything very well to me. One of my favorite urgent care places.

name: Travis Eberhart
text: This is my third and final visit over the past year.  Pay close attention to your bill whenever you receive it.  They will often charge for items never conducted or agreed upon.  The wait times are ridiculous and the doctors are not very knowledgeable on common illnesses. They will automatically order lab tests ran despite having a correlating symptoms for those tests. I went in for the last time today with complaint of a sinus issue and they ordered abdominal X-RAYS to be conducted with lab tests on Strep, flu, and blood work.  I asked to speak with the doctor and they just asked me to leave the office.  I wish I would have read these reviews prior to ever coming to this place.  Again, pay close attention to your bill.  They charged me for a specialist co-pay instead a normal office visit co-pay.  I asked the lady at the front desk what "specialist" I was seeing and she stated that the owner of the clinic was a Pulmonary specialist and that is the reason why they are allowed for the increased fees.

name: Brother’s keeper
text: Had a great experience @ UCM. It was fast and friendly. Was in and out within one hour. Will be back for sure!

name: Brien Dickson
text: I was treated at this urgent care and had a very good experience. The front desk receptionist provided courteous and professional service from the moment I walked through the door.  I had a TriCare prior authorization which they accepted without issue. The nurse practitioner who took my vitals and history was equally pleasant.  She provide excellent care.  The Doctor capably provided his diagnosis and treatment plan.  All services were efficient and clearly communicated. I would have given 5 stars had they accepted an alternate id number besides my ssn.

name: A Google User
text: Do not go here! I have been twice now, once last year for a severe case of flu, and recently for an STD test. Last year when I had a bad case of the flu, I went, and was assured that insurance would cover the shot they gave me to get better. A month later, I got a bill in the mail. When I went for the STD test, they took my copay before seeing me, took my pulse, my blood pressure, and then took me to another room where they told me that insurance might not cover the tests. They then tried to give me a shot and a prescription for some pills. I refused, as I had not had a test, let alone a test that came back positive. They wouldn't refund me my copay, and told me to hold on to the prescription "just in case." This place is a scam designed to get your money. NEVER GO HERE!

name: elogrl
text: This is the WORST Urgent Care. I have ever been to. It’s a dingy office. The receptionist said she couldn’t pull up my insurance information. I called the insurance company and they gave me the exact membership number that was on my card. I also asked the receptionist if she needed to speak with them. She told me it was not pulling up and she would call them. She told me she called and they were closed as if I lied about calling. I called back and put the insurance company on speaker phone in front of people in the office to prove my innocence. I handed her my personal cell phone for her to complete my paperwork. I have never been through this much to see any doctor. The care is not urgent either. I came in at 10:30 and left at 1:05. There was only 2 people in the lobby ahead of me and 1 other patient that walked out of the back. The Practitioner came in and didn’t even introduce herself. ( Angela Gann ) She gave me my diagnosis and asked me to come back for a follow up. I told her I won’t be back and explained the situation. She gave me a dry apology. She went to the front desk and started talking about me. My door was open. I heard everything. I addressed the Nurse Practitioner letting her know I heard everything. The nurse that checked my weight said make sure you tell them in the review that you told her what you wanted prescribed. I told her I would. There’s absolutely nothing wrong with me suggesting the medication I would like to be treated with. The staff is not friendly or professional.  Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

name: Janelle Wassell
text: I have taken my son here several times and have been happy each time. UCM staff is friendly, courteous and the wait time is more than acceptable!

name: Kelly Redman
text: I got there at 5:10 on a Saturday afternoon.  The doors were locked but the website says they are open until 6 pm.  The girl at the front desk never even looked my way.  I noticed all the times have been removed from the door.  So, I drove over to American Family off Nance.  I arrived at 5:35 and was seen quickly.  I won't even bother trying Urgent Care next time.

name: de vida loka
text: Great place. Front desk is very nice, NP is great and Gretchen is a fantastic nurse.

name: Austin Marsh
text: We waited for 2 hours just to get back and an hour to see the doctor only to be prescribed over the counter medications that my wife has already been taking. I made him aware of the medications she has been taking and that they were ineffective. I called to request a different prescription and they refused

name: Kara Pleasant
text: They were very quick but no one was in there. Staff was friendly, but everyone seems to be unsure of themselves. Also,.recommend they get a female nurse.

name: Sarah Stimpson
text: This is a great office with a wonderful caring doctor. The office is never full and I am always seen very quickly.  Highly recommend!!!!

name: Derek Hunt
text: My Doctor was very knowledgeable and my experience here went well. Plus they got me in and out. UCM

name: Scott Simmons
text: My name is Scott Stiles. I am a Google Maps Local Guide (Level 6). My experience allows me to attest that the bad reviews of this place are real and genuine, not fake or manipulated. The public vetting process that is Google Maps reviews has exposed a bad apple in the local community. Consume a portion of this apple at your own risk.

name: Rachel Rozelle
text: They took me back immediately. The staff was friendly and helpful. The doctor seemed knowledgeable. They definitely resolved my problem.

name: Jon Bryant
text: This location is sluggish and slow with getting results back. I'd recommend going anywhere else when it comes to getting tests done. Buyer beware

name: George Barnett
text:
Their website states their open until 730pm M-F...
I went in at 655pm on Friday night and was told the doctor refused to see anyone after 630pm.
I have a chronic condition that needs attention at times but, this doctor couldn't be bothered to
take what would have been 5 minutes of his time to see a patient in need or URGENT CARE....
Too bad, what a way to present your business to Madison and the surrounding area.

name: Leeanne/Aaron Brown
text: Dr. seemed nice and knowledgeable however it took almost four hours from in the door to leaving.  Sitting with a badly sprained foot in a waiting room chair was not a pleasant experience.  If the least bit crowded, go elsewhere! Do not wait!  They are VERY slow.

name: Melitza Tonn
text: This urgent care has hours listed from 730am-7pm. We arrived at 6:10pm to be told they have taken their last patient for the day and will not be seeing any me patients. They made no exception for the fact i was there due to a severe cut on my finger. I was told they would reopen tomorrow at 730am and to go to an E.R. Why post hours that you are open until 7pm but so accepting patients at 6pm? Change your hours or make it clear that you stop taking patients at 6pm. Very unhappy.

name: Chris Dale
text: This place is great. You can get in and out rather quickly and the staff is amazing.

name: Dharmendra Kumar
text: Review is related to billing. I went there for preventive checkup. I asked them multiple times before visit and they assured that they handle preventive visits. They claimed to insurance as sick visit and insurance did not page as I did not have copay. I got a big bill for single visit and they were not ready to correct the bill after many follow up. I ended up paying from my pocket. Will not recommend anyone to go there as they gave me wrong info during visit

name: Grant Baker
text: Rudely turned down a 3 year old with a 103 fever at 5:30 PM, despite being open until 6:00pm.  The nurses and dr were behind the counter laughing about as my child suffered.  As fast as I could, I went down the road to to another urgent care (AFC) that also closed at 6:00.  They gladly accepted us at 5:58!

name: Jasper Kigar
text:
I'm going out of my way to complain in order to warn people. Pick your red flag: A). It's a reconstituted bank complete w/drive thru windows, B). Vomit stains on the lobby carpeting. C). Teenage receptionist who did not make eye-contact, doesn't know basics, and doesn't care.

These flags caused my sick self to not trust the care I might have received, and walk out untreated. I felt like I was in a less-developed country, to be honest.

name: Whitley Dawson
text:
Went in for cough and shortness of breath early morning on 4/7/18. This was my 3rd time here over the course of 2 years, the previous times I sought treatment here the experience had been fine. Long story short I was given only amoxicillin for my cough, ear pain, shortness of breath and congestion. When I asked for something for my severe ear pain I was told to take ibuprofen. The diagnosis was an upper respiratory infection. After 3 days of taking the amoxicillin my symptoms got worse and the ear pain didn’t go away. I went to a different urgent care center where they did a full work up and told me I had bronchitis. They gave me a steroid shot, z-pac, inhaler, steroids, ear drops and cough medicine. I’m not sure if they are afraid to prescribe medication at the other place but I will not be back.
A month or so ago my sister was in a car accident. She went to the urgent care center of Madison where they attempted to do an x-ray but they didn’t have someone experienced with the equipment as they took x-rays of the pillow and other places other than my sisters back. After exposing my sister to all that they referred her to an imaging center. They also sent her home with ibuprofen.

name: Katie Phonthibsvads
text: My husband went in for back pain . The doctor thought it might be sciatica and was going to schedule an MRI. 4 weeks later my husband called wondering what was up with the MRI. He was told they called to make an appointment but didn't know what time to make it for so they didn't schedule it, instead of calling my husband to see what time was good for him. He told them schedule it for whenever and the nurse said she'd she take care of it that day . 5 days later and nothing. I went in to see what was up. The doctor that my husband saw no longer worked there and she had to get the MRI approved by another doctor. Then they had to clear it with our insurance and she'd get an appointment for the next day. It's been 2 weeks now and still haven't heard from them. I have an  appointment with another doctor who will hopefully be more reliable and more professional than urgent care.

name: Sean Lovell
text: I went in on Labor Day and despite it being a holliday they were very fast, thorough, and friendly!

name: Erik Lakso
text: I will never go here again.  Ever.  An hour before they close we were turned away by the staff despite the waiting room and parking lot being empty.  Ended up spending 4 hours at the emergency room because they wouldn't spend 15 mins to check out someone in severe pain.  This place will NEVER get my business.

name: S Sidney
text: Update on my HORRIBLE experience. Visited the office Wed. Was diagnosed with a muscle spasm given a shot and 2 sample muscle relaxer medications and was told by Dr Dyer to let her know if the meds worked because she would call a prescription in. Meds seem to be providing some small relief,which is better than none. I call Fri, speak to "receptionist" Ashley, let her know I'm needing the Dr to call the prescription in. She tells me she'll let her know when she gets back. I ask if someone (the Dr, a nurse or herself) will call me back & notify me that it's been done. She says yes. 2 hrs later, still no return call, I call back to follow up. Ashley informs me NOW that the Dr won't be back until Mon. I let her know I'm in pain today and want to see if any other Dr is able to call script in. She says she'll ask & I'm told AGAIN someone will call me back. No one calls. Saturday I call a 3rd time, get Ashley AGAIN. Immediately ask to speak to a nurse. She doesn't put one on, instead wants to take a message AGAIN. I inform her this is my 3rd time speaking to her and was ensured I'd get a call back the 2 previous time and NEVER did. She simply states "we're kinda busy". OF COURSE, hrs later still no return call. A friend calls from her phone, Ashley answers. She ask to speak to a Dr. Ashley takes a message. My friend received a return call from the Dr in office NOT 10 MINS  LATER. I however, have called 3 times and NEVER ONCE RECEIVED A RETURN CALL. Never again will I spend any of my money in this place and I will tell EVERYONE I know to avoid them at all cost. The way the conduct business is REPREHENSIBLE!

name: Paula Spicerkuhn
text: I have been to this clinic twice over the last 18 months or so, on weekends with my doctor is closed.  The first time I was waiting on my new insurance card, so they gave me all the paperwork I would need to get reimbursed and each time they have listened to me.  This last time I had trouble at the pharmacy so I called them and they offered to call the pharmacy again.  It turned out the pharmacy was having phone problems.  I went back after the first time because of a good experience and will continue to use them when I need to get in on weekends.

name: Heather C
text:
Experience is very hit or miss here although the nursing and front desk staff have been great. This is the only urgent care in town that will accept my sons' insurance, so we came here early last month when he had the flu. That diagnosis went fine, and he was better in a few days. However, my husband started experiencing symptoms within days of my son. We came back here thinking it would be a simple diagnosis and they would give him a Tamiflu prescription since they diagnosed my son. However, they performed a flu test that came back negative (too early), refused to give him Tamiflu, and told him he needed to be seen by another dr if his symptoms got any worse. Because of this, we ended up in the ER the same night and were told at that time that is was too early for him to have a positive flu test. $800 ER bill later, we received the Tamiflu prescription. Urgent Care of Madison could have saved us money and time, but they would not even write a prescription for Tamiflu after diagnosing someone else in the family, and now they are sending a bill after doing nothing.

This is not our first poor experience here either.

name: Jim Williams (CenterFade)
text: Friendly staff that really makes you feel at home.  Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Kelly McGlynn
text:
I had an ingrown toenail and no insurance.  I was told my flat rate was 125, yikes big price.  But I paid it.  I was second on theblist and arrived right when they opened at 7:30. Had to wait about thirty minutes to forty before I was called to an examination room.

I sat there from 8ish until close to 11. I was told over and over again the practioner would be right with me.  It was freezing in that room might I add.  I was also tested for a blood infection cause of my toe.  She finally came in a little after 11 and examined my toe. I figured she would be able to cut along the side straight down.  I was told then and there she was not certfied/cleared to do such a procedure.  This confused because it is listed on their site they can treat ingrown toenails.

It was treated and it was painful.  I was told the proper care,  Ina small dose.  But what really surprised me was the lack thereof of a bandage. No ointment was placed on it after it,  but a guaze and a single bandaid was placed on my big toe.  It did not stay on long and started to peel off after an hour,  thus more infection invitation.

After that ordeal,  I go to pay and I am hit with a twenty buck charge for my blood work.  I was confused because I had no blood taken from me.  No, it was the prick they did and I was not told at the time it'd be another charge. So I did not appreciate that.  Nor did I appreciate the fact it was 145 for just a blood pressure and pulse check,  examining my toe and clipping?/ draining it and a prick ob my finger.  Nor did I appreciate waiting for so long when I was the second to arrive.

Also,  when I exited I saw many people dressed formally talking down the hall and outside blocking the path to the doors.  Thus,  they were blocking the way for possible elederly and/or people with special needs. I was told they were busy and hence why it took so long.  I heard people come and go through those hours I was in my room.

Anyways,  she did what she could and did help my toe some and the pain has died down  but i was over charged and unfairly charged for the blood work. The employees should inform their patients what and why they are being charged. So no i am not coming back and dont reccommend this place for urgent care.

name: Benjamin Khammar
text:
This urgent care clinic is very quick - you are in and out in a very timely manner; unfortunately, they don't bring anything else to the table. The nurses are instructed to run order tests (technically under the doctor's orders) before the doctor actually speaks to or looks at you -  this happened to me multiple times. Each time, a nurse has told me that the test are "protocol" and I can't turn them down - after I signed a patient's bill of rights, containing a clause stating that a patient can refuse any medical care - which is federal law. I had to argue with a nurse to turn down a chest x-ray for a minor sore throat. First, I asked why- she said that it will detect bronchitis. A quick google search told me that it bronchitis shows up on a chest x-ray about 25% of the time. It also informed me that I didn't have any symptoms of bronchitis. Turns out that they also ran a completely unnecessary white blood cell count test, which the doctor told me would not have affected his treatment, regardless of the result (after the fact). The doctor actually looked at me after this ordeal. He was able to tell me that I had an ear infection after a 2-minute physical examination. None of the three protocol tests were in any way necessary.

In a separate incident, there was another minor sore throat that had persisted for 2 weeks, accompanied by a couple bumps under the tongue. The nurse followed protocol and said they were running 3 tests, including a strep test. I declined this, only to be told in an extremely rude manner - by a different nurse this time -  that it is "protocol" and I can't change protocol. I reminded her that her protocol is internal, and it can certainly be deviated from. In fact, it is federal law.

My insurance company was actually billed for the 2nd incident (I was billed for a small portion as well). I went to the office to request a refund for myself and my insurance company - only to be told by the head nurse that they can't do it. Of course after digging deeper - she literally meant that they can't refund, but their billing company can. This was only the beginning of the battle of semantics. She also told me that she I can't speak to her manager, because she is the head nurse and the manager. After discussing further, I learned that she does have a boss (surprise!). She finally agreed to email him/her and have them contact me the next day. That was a week ago...

Please understand that this is one of the most important factor in rising health care costs and boycott this place. I have also been to North Alabama Medical Care in south Huntsville twice, and although they do try to pull some BS- it is not nearly to this degree. They actually have the doctor look at you before running unnecessary tests.

name: Bryant Keller
text: Dr P is a wonderful doctor that truly cares about his patients.

name: Tammy Coonfield
text:
NEVER GO ! EVEN PHARMACY NOT IMPRESSED WITH THEIR KNOWLEDGE of what they prescribed me AND SERVICE.
URGENT Care Madison Sullivan St.
They were not busy at all. Now understand why. Have bronchitis told dr over counter cough med was NOT WORKING . COUCHING keeping me awake and huurting in my chest. Was told giving me a liquid cough med and pill cough medicine decongestion and antibiotic and an antibiotic shot . Went to pick up prescription at pharmacy only pill cough medicine. Called them they called pharmacy to get straightened out. I called pharmacy they said it was an over the counter cough med insurance would not pay. Get it off shelf. I called Urgent Care back explained she said no that is not correct . URGENT CARE spoke to pharmacist and then called me. I then called pharmacy again. The pharmacist stated that neither the two employees she spoke to INCLUDING  NURSE EVEN KNEW THE MED that was prescribed to me and that she THE PHARMACIST WAS NOT IMPRESSED WITH THE URGENT CARE STAFF and NEITHER AM I OR MY HUSBAND.

name: Carol Foster
text: Not so urgent.   I waited 4 hours when there was no one in the waiting room.   They wanted to talk about everything besides what I was there for.   X-ray tech was incompetent.   I waited over 6 weeks to get info to file with insurance even though I called the same afternoon, and had to call and remind them after 4 weeks.   2nd piece of info was promised to be ready to pick up. I was left waiting AGAIN so they could collect Co -Pays from other patients sitting in the lobby even though my Information was laying under the counter and could have just been handed to me.  Avoid this place like the plague.   ER would be faster and less hassle.

name: April Zimmermann
text: Don’t waist your time if you’ve got an infant. My insurance company suggested I bring my sick 4 mo old here ASAP. Upon arrival was told they didn’t have a nurse practitioner present that could see a children under 3 years of age. Save yourself the hassle and go across the street to the Urgent Care off of Ivory Pl.

name: Steven Sims
text: DO NOT GO HERE!!! Insurance did not cover my visit because Urgent Care doesn't bill as an office visit and had to pay $140 out of pocket + medicine costs for routine visit. They would not adjust or change billing so insurance would cover after several calls.    I have used other "urgent care" such as American Family Care numerous times with the same insurance and never, never had to pay more than my co-pay out of pocket. I have BC/BS.  I will not be back.

name: shelly moo
text: I am EXTREMELY greatful for the Dr Benjamin Fabvis( sorry, if spelling is wrong:-) ) who helped my mother. It was truly a matter of life & death for her. And for that I will be forever greatful. With that being said, I hope & pray we don't have billing issues like other patients according to the reviews.

name: K Pax
text: Waiting for at least an hour for something as simple as a prescription.

name: Kimmese Smiths
text: Terrible service. after seeing a nurse we had to wait 2 hours before the doctor came in. The front desk nurse gave us dirty looks when we asked how much longer we needed to wait. Will never come back.

name: Shawn Sullivan
text:
When I first went to Urgent Care, I had a good experience. Unfortunately, I developed Thrush when I was put on strong Antibiotics. I called when I discovered my tongue was covered in white, and i was told that I didn't need to come in, that they would just phone it in for me. I waited a few hours and nothing.. I called and I was told it was phoned in. I asked them which prescription was phoned in, and when she checked my files, she said "Oh, it hasn't been done yet.."  I was assured someone would call me back in 30 minutes, which didn't happen. I then called back in and was again given the run around.. I told her I expected an update ASAP, and if they didn't have one, I'd call back in. Well, needless to say, they didn't give me one. I called back at 4pm - almost 6 hours after my initial call and was told "it's in the doctors file and they're waiting for him to approve it, which he will in between patients.." The next day, at 11am, I called back to find out what was going on. I was then told that the doctor that was now there didn't feel comfortable prescribing me an anti-fungal cream because of the legal risk - like I'm going to be freebasing Nystatin?!? They gave me two antibiotics, including Levoquin.. How could I not develop Thrush? All they cared about was getting my $$.. No one bothered to call me once. I had to call them a total of 4 times to eventually be told that they wouldn't help me unless I came in.. The irony is I OFFERED TO COME IN ORIGINALLY AND THEY TOLD ME IT WOULDN'T BE NECESSARY!!! They wasted my time.

MDVIP - Here I come. I'll pay money to get someone that cares, and not just trying to pack in as many patients and copays as possible.

name: Colleen Noletto
text: This Urgent Care was advertised as being open till 7pm. I arrived, sick, at 6:30 pm. I was turned away because things were "slow" and they decided to close up shop early. Will not be back. So unprofessional.

name: Thai Huynh
text: Worst service ever. They will not see you unless they feel like it. 3 hours between getting into a room and actually seeing somebody.

name: Robert Turner
text: this is the most horrible place to go to!!!! I will never go there again . the staff was horrible and the nurse practitioner was worst. The wait was forever and the staff was not nice and i could hear them complaining about  pt's in my room. Very unprofessional staff.

name: Peggy Cobb
text: Madison Urgent Care opens at 7:30 a.m., I'm the only person here and after 30 minutes, I'm still sitting in the lobby.  The Doctor and staff just got here.

name: Machelle Naulty
text: Wanted to charge $30 for a flu shot even if I had insurance.

name: Joseph Oberlander
text: Front office staff was unprofessional and the doctors tend to be in a hurry and do very little to diagnose. Had to go to another clinic.

name: Janna F
text: Terrible experience. Office billed with incorrect diagnosis code, and services were not covered by insurance. I've been calling every week, and their "billing" department states they will call me back but never do.

name: Brian Stewart
text: They claim to open at 7:30 so I get to the parking lot at 7:25 and am the only one here.  Staff begins to rolll in about 7:35, doors don't get unlocked until 7:45.  Finally make it to a room at 8:10 and don't get to see a doctor until 8:50.  If the 7:30am open time is your selling point on this location, don't bother.

name: Jonathan
text: This place is no longer in business

name: Tristan Myles
text: WORST PLACE I EVER BEEN TO. WAS THERE FOR 3 HOURS AND DIDNT EVEN GET WHAT I NEEDED!

name: BOBEYR HIALL
text: Worst service ever, took 3 hours just to get in a room!

name: Michael Jones
text: They are a walk in clinic and refuse new patients after 6 even though they're open until 7.

name: Amber Yell
text: The Staff is very personal and friendly. Really Listened to me and the wait was not long at all! We be going back!

name: David Keel
text: Thanks for the warning.

name: Martin Powell
text: may 10 -2021 i have called all morning trying to reach out for covid testing ; The phone line continues to be busy . Went to location the door is locked several people there awaiting appointments and still have same problem only busy signal . i went to door it is locked also went to window workers are there however they ignore me they see me but ignore me . This is downright terrible .

name: Kaylie Hayes
text: This place and people are a joke.

name: Thomas Ray
text: Thorough ,excellent care andeven a follow up call.

name: Melissa Reed
text: This place says urgent care and advertises closing at 6pm, however my dr told me to go there before 6pm today.,I called the urgent care center at 5:20pm and was refused service because they were closed. So much for urgent care

name: Deidra Parker
text: Husband was bit by an abandoned dog and they sicced the health department on us. No good deed goes unpunished, we'll never go there again for any reason.

name: Tonya Walker
text: My family and I have only used Dr Med Care of Gadsden since moving here from Fort Worth, Texas 2 years ago.  They give us the same quality care as a big city, with a down home manner that we simply love and appreciate.  From the receptionist when you walk in, to the office staff and nursing, all the way to the wonderful Doctors. I recommend Doctors Med Care to everyone who asks....and some who don't 🙂

name: James Jordan
text: I went to the website and printed the patient forms, filled them out and made a copy of my drivers license, and insurance cards in advance of my visit. I entered the office at 7:28 am and was the first patient called back. Everyone was so nice, courteous, and compassionate. After a series of tests, ex-rays, blood tests, I saw Doctor Eddy Smith, an excellent physician. He was a great listener and explained everything the tests revealed and what medications he was prescribing. I couldn’t have had a more pleasant experience. I would highly recommend this facility.

name: Cassandra DaSilva-Dimmick
text: Gave 2 stars because the only thing good about this place is how fast they got me in. Went for a bad kidney infection and was prescribed generic whatever you got antibiotics. A week later I took all my meds and still had a bad infection and lots of pain. They called in a pain medication instead of different antibiotics. Called another week later feeling worse and they said I would have to pay another visit fee when they never got it right to begin with. (I dont have insurance) if I'm going to pay more money im going somewhere else.

name: Wilder Transit
text: Foreign body was in my eye. He spent literally 3 mins in the room with me. Mentioned its not contagious..really? Never even really looked at my eye. Prescribed drops and sent me home. Fast forward 4 days later, went to a different doc. Put uv drops in found it and it was removed. Ill never go back. Why would I? Really pointless

name: Chris Martin
text:
Wonderful, loving expedient care is what I experienced.  Dr. Greg and Ms. Howard made my terrifying gashes, which needed a lot of stitching, get immediate and calming professional care.

I love them both for their great care and work.   Yes, LOVE THEM!  😊

name: Rebecca Jones
text: We've been patients here over 20 years. Wouldn't go anywhere else. Love it!

name: carol anthony
text: The staff was great ... I really feel bad they have to work with Dr.Pernick he was a total jackass will never go back 😕

name: Victoria Lynn
text: Highly recommended  dr pernick he is amazing he listened and figured out why I was in so much pain and has started helping me :) thanks so much dr pernick

name: Cortney Jacques
text: They took x-rays of me and than put me in a room for 3 hours than came in and told me they didn't know what was wrong and that I needed to go to another doctor. They didn't give me medicine or anything to help with the pain. I wasted my only day off to be told they didn't know to go somewhere else. Than they send me a bill for $80 dollars. The doctor was rude too.

name: Jeff Chapman
text: Dr Eddie Smith was very kind, considerate, and thorough in his treatment for me in January 2020. And the staff were diligent and respectful. So happy that Vets can now go here because the treatment, at least in my experience, is better.

name: Kristal Haynes-Fail
text: Called to verify just walk in or call and wait in parking lot due to Covid, receptionist was very very rude.... Her reply to me was we are open like normal, you WALK in, and hung up the phone. Cheryl needs to find another job if she is going to be the Karen and unhappy with her job!! Other than that the staff and Drs are absolutely AMAZING...would definatly recommend. That is the reason I give 4 stars.

name: Suedo name Phantom
text: Dr Ed Smith and the staff on duty were so kind to my elderly father. My father is a minister and a man of faith, and has very little experience with going to doctors. Dr Smith and the nurse showed the love of GOD like I've never seen from  people in the medical profession. I was amazed. I appreciate all they did for him, I highly recommend this clinic.

name: william raber
text: Always had good experiences here.

name: tmony81
text: Dr. Pernick is straight forward and extremely thorough. Nurses are caring and compassionate. Everything is great at Gadsden Doctors med care except the people who attend the call ins. Best to go in person, never had a pleasant phone interaction.

name: Kathy Maxwell
text: Nurses and staff were very friendly but I wouldn’t refer anybody to Dr.Pernick.Hes rude and very unprofessional.Im speaking with my lawyer about my experience.His practitioner even discuss my health file out in the lobby before I cashed out. You won’t have too much privacy there.Dont Go

name: Misty Tooley
text: I became real sick Feb of 2019 having to change primary care due to travel reasons I give then 5stars for my satisfaction I was not disappointed..have seen dr Smith and dr pernick!! Very friendly and very comfy with choosing a new primary care doctor..staff is very helpful..and generous..hope to become an established patient..

name: Kimberly Shelton
text: Friendly and professional doctors and staff. Always been good to me

name: Laura Smith
text: I would recommend Drs med care in Alabama city to anyone. They're affordable and everyone working there that I have ever encountered were so nice and thorough. The front desk, the nurses, the lab and the Dr were all 5 stars. I had 4 tubes of blood drawn and never felt it and didn't bruise at all.

name: Angela Parker
text: I was looking to get checked out for a possible infection in my leg. The front desk was friendly as were the nurses. That is the only reason I even give them 1star.  I would identify the Dr. if I knew who he was but he failed to introduce himself. There was only 1 other person in the office and I was there for 2 hours. The Dr. did not even tell me that I was done. He just said we will treat with antibiotics and walked away. I ask what to do if it gets worse and he rudely said that is the reason for antibiotics. I sat there for another 39 minutes with no instruction and was asked why are you still there. I was waiting to find out if it was a shot or called in for oral administration. Dr. Was terrible. I would not recommend to my dog.

name: no Battles
text: This office has a great bunch of people, all very friendly!!  Doctor was through and friendly as well.  I highly recommend them for urgent care or primary care physician.  Was glad my dental hygienist recommended them.

name: James Bowers
text: I use Doctors Med Care and always been satisfied with the caring staff , nurses and Doctors.

name: Rocky Presley
