name: Melinda Jacobs
text: My husband and I went there because they advertise that they do Family Practice. I have a condition that does not allow me to drive and he works 6 days a week with very long hours. Weekends are the only time we have to go. We were open with them about this. Our old primary care physician is too far away now that we have moved. We were treated like drug addicts because we both take some strong medicine which we never asked them to fill. Them called in medicine that was wrong. The amount of insulin they called in for me to take would have killed me. Thank goodness the pharmacist caught it, however it took 3 days to get the doctor to fix it. So I went 3 days without insilin. Then he didn't call in the needles for the insulin pens. I called for those and they called in syringes instead of pen needles like I asked for. So again another night without insulin. When they finally got it right I was told to find a primary care doctor to handle all the issues I have. They are supposed to be my primary care doctor now. The issues I have are that they can't get anything right with my prescriptions. I'm not the problem here. It scares me how bad they don't listen and transfer information and then want to blame the patient.

resp.text: Melinda, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at (205) 461-0038 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Geneva Marchek
text: I was kind of worried about coming here because of some reviews where people said they waited forever. I came at 9 in the morning and there were three people ahead of me. I got seen in about twenty minutes. The staff was kind and friendly and took good care off me when I got faint from my fever. I'll definitely be coming here in the future. My advice is just to try to come in the morning before lunch time if you can. If not, you might have a wait.

text: I was treated like family. Everyone was so kind and patient. The doctor took lots of time with me. He explained my health issue and everything about the medications i would be taking. If you want to be treated like family and feel like they really care about you, not like cattle being pushed thru. Then this is the place to go.

text: Went here twice in 2 weeks out of convenience. Dr. assured me he knew what the problem was. After a second opinion he was absolutely wrong. 200$ out of pocket per visit? I had bcbs.. unless you have 100 % coverage insurance you might as well go to the er and find someone who knows what they are talking about. Absolutely not worth it. If you need anything besides antibiotics I would highly recommend going some place else. Also, waited 1 hr first visit, 2 hrs second visit before I ever saw a dr.

name: Ariel Wagner
text: I have never been so displeased with a business in my entire life period. I arrived at 2. It is now 5:30 and I have yet to see the Doctor. My girlfriend has taken a 3 hour nap in the exam room without disturbance. I am here for an X-ray for my hand. That's it. It takes less than 10 seconds to say the phrase "it's broke"/"it's not broke". I have gone to the extent to open my exam room door to ensure the doctor understands there are living people still in this room that have been waiting for 3 hours and it just so happens the business closes in 30 minutes. I will never step foot in this business again.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback. We welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Jeremy Bahnsen
text:
Never seen such a bait and switch set up. They make you think you're getting in quick and then you spend well over an hour in the exam room before seeing the doctor (we still haven't seen him yet). I guess that way the waiting room looks empty and people will stay. And it doesn't matters that it is a holiday. I've never waited so long in the exam room waiting to see the doctor.
UPDATE: we've now seen the doctor and he is very thorough. My wife was very pleasedifficult with him. Just need to do a better job warning patients how long it might be when the place looks empty.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your feedback as well as your update. I am very grateful I was able to speak to you before leaving the clinic. I will use your feedback to make sure we do a better job in communication with our patients.  Again I truly apologize about your wait time. I hope that your wife feels better and may you be blessed with a wonderful new year.

name: casie franklin
text:
This place is a joke. Do not waist your time and money, but  seriously they lack in knowledge and experience!
.
They misdiagnosed my shingles with contact dermatitis..... and said my other symptoms of the shingles was due to a sinus infection.... sent me home with steroid shot, an itching med., steroid pack, and antibiotic.

They drew blood and said that my WBC was on the rise ( like they had been charting it over time), instead of saying my white blood count was elevated. Anyway she said that was from my sinus infection.
The shingles will also make your WBC go up.

On another occasion, my husband fell late in the evening and not sure why he stopped into AFC, but they sent him  home and told him that there was nothing wrong with it.  Long story short he still has problems with that shoulder. He ended up tearing a muscle.

Needless to say, I will never go back to AFC Bessemer/McCalla location.
Trust me go to the next red light and  take a left and go to Middle Creek Medical Center. I’ve never had a bad experience, or peronally heard of a bad review from them. My whole family has went to them and the ONLY reason I stopped into AFC this time was because I drove to Middle Creek and they had closed early this day. And I was feeling so bad. I should have went home because I knew better! That’s why I went and got a second opionion because I knew it wasn’t contact dermatitis!!!!!!! ( from personal experience plus I work in health care).

I never got seen by a MD. Only a Nurse Practioner.

resp.text: We appreciate all reviews, and appreciate you giving us the chance to improve by providing us with this feedback. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. We hope you will consider us again in the future. Take care.

name: Jeff Lewis
text: Staff was great. Best experience I've had at a doctor's office in a long time, even better than my regular primary care doctor.

name: Simone English
text: I visited with Dr. Harden on July 12, 2018 at American Family Care Bessemer, AL at approximately 5:30pm. Over the course of my visit with this MD in regards to my foot pain, he was very rude and harassed me about my weight. Upon entering the exam room, MD  requested that my daughter (2yrs old) turn off my personal cell phone without acknowledging me as the patient. Then he proceeds to insinuate that my foot pain is due to my weight. Also, he used  an analogy stating that my body weight was more like an “elephant and not a bull”;  therefore, I need to eat more vegetables and not high protein diets. Additionally, he not only harassed me about my weight but provided his personal opinion that I was "ruining my child” by allowing her to watch tv on my cellular device. Furthermore, he communicated that my child "must be a daycare baby” because she seeking attention from me while I was being examined. Lastly, he communicated that I should let him keep my daughter because he could "turn a 'F' child into a 'A' child." This MD’s words throughout my visit was harassment, derogatory and unacceptable.

name: Roz Dear Momma
text: The foreign doctor listened to me and researched other doctors notes before settling on my plan of care. She returned to tell me I was right! Urgent Care Doctors seldom care what the previous doctor treatment was. They follow their own treatment regimen.  She abliged me and did a more extensive lab. She confirmed sinusitis by elevated white blood cells. Although my urine appeared clean it was sent out for a culture. Funny, once I started antibiotics my 5-6 night trips to restroom decreased to 3 then 2. What a blessing to get some sleep again! I'm bad and do sip water through the night when I wake up thirsty. No more E.R. visits for non-emergencies. When ill who needs long waits and bandaid therapy, brushed off and told to make appt with your primary doctor. Urgent Care has faster triage, service in general and more likely to address EACH problem not just your MAJOR problem;-)

resp.text: Hi Roz, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at American Family Care - Bessemer. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Margo Bryant
text: The nurse practitioner here is unprofessional to say the least. Elena Robertson is her name. She didn't do an exam on my family member, just sent him on his way in terrible pain. When confronted, she lied and said she offered solutions she did not offer. She just argued with me. Very unprofessional. She said an x-ray would have given him too much radiation. OK. That's a first. There is no office manager in this office, so there is no recourse. An email to the corporate office was not answered. Complete waste of office fee and time.

name: James Townsend
text:
So friendly and fast. They are very knowledgeable and professional. No matter how the the mood customer gives off they where able to keep claim and work through issues (observations of other customers while there).

The check  Process 2as fast and easy with the tablet. All digital. And if you are missing required things like iD , as long as you have a picture your good. I did not have a co pay for my visit, butothers there paided about $30

name: Dennis Utz
text: Walked in yesterday feeling horrible. Been coughing, fever, too much mucus. The receptionist quickly took my personal info and made me an appointment. I was then quickly taken back to be weighed, get blood pressure, etc.  After that they took me to an exam room. Waited for the Dr only a short time. Dr. Campbell was very professional listening to my symptoms and then gave me a quick exam. He recommended I get an xray to check out my lungs. I thought, oh great. Now I gotta go somewhere else, but NO!  They had a xray room right there in the clinic!!  Awesome. After getting a few xray photos the Dr said I probably had a bronchial infection. Gave me a shot of antibiotics and prescribed some to take for 5 days. Excellent care!!  They even called today to check on me and give me some more advice!!  Best care I've had in a long time!!  Thanks Dr. Campbell and AFC!!

name: Johnje Jasper
text:
I had a close friend seen here recently on a Friday. The MD forgot to call in the script and the office told them to call back on Tuesday. Thats 4 days without treatment!!

Delaying care by 4 DAYS may result in my friend becoming more SICK due to the incompetence of this office. 0 stars.

name: Jessica Truong
text: I had a very good experience today. I have been having sinus infection symptoms for 1 week. A dr at MD Live was convinced I had Covid (over the phone) and would not prescribe me anything. I saw this place is doing rapid covid tests and I also knew my husband had a very good experience taking our daughter here a few years ago. So I came here on my lunch break. The receptionist was very friendly and got me checked in right away. Then almost right away I was taken back by a very friendly gentleman who even held my hand during the covid testing since I have high anxiety. Thankfully my test was negative. Then the nurse practitioner saw me and he was also friendly. I got some shots and a prescription and I’m sure I will be feeling much better very soon. In and out fairly quickly and easily. I highly recommend to anyone in the Athens/Madison area.

resp.text: Dear Jessica, Thanks for choosing us and leaving such a great review! It is truly touching to know you think so highly of us! We hope to continue exceeding your expectations with 5 star service. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Courtney Michael
text: I definitely wouldn't recommend going here. Waited in waiting room for over 2 hours. Front desk staff were nice but besides that the others weren't that great. I was not pleased with the "medical professional" that I was seen by, Elena Robertson only reason I know her name is it was on my papers. I had to wait an excessive amount of time in the back as well for vitals, and blood to be drawn. I will not be back due to the fact when the doctor came in she treated me as more of an inconvenience than a patient. She came in said "You having symptoms? You know this test isn't accurate?" And then just walked out. Not very professional. I had to go find someone and ask if I was ready to go.

name: Richard Kirkruff
text: Should be called we dont care not urgent care waited three hours for my girlfriend to get a covid test and they were not busy 3 ppl in the waiting room area. Your better off going to Wal-Mart and buying a box of band-aids and a bottle of hydrogen peroxide

resp.text: Hi Richard, thank you for posting your positive review. Our team here at American Family Care - Athens (256) 278-3000 is committed to providing high-quality customer service, and we’re thrilled to hear that we made a good impression on you. We hope you’ll visit us again soon.

name: Ashtian Harrell
text: This place is TERRIBLE!!! I waited 4 hours just to be seen today. All I got was a covid test, and whenever I asked the DR for a cough medicine (I have asthma and my cough is terrible) she told me just to use my inhaler and that it’s not good for my lungs to suppress my cough. All they checked me for was covid, my test came back negative, and the doctor told me I still have it. The ONLY person with a LICK of common sense in that whole building is the poor boy working up front. God bless him. I will NEVER come back here and I have never met such a STUPID and UNPROFESSIONAL doctor in my life!!!

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Zachary Luna
text: Went there today for a sinus infection and all They wanna do was tell me Covid this in Covid that didn’t even do a check to see what my sinuses were doing and then sent me with antibiotics but couldnt tell me what I had because the doctor was being wishy washy. They don’t want to treat anything unless it’s covid they could care less what you really have they will just say it might be covid. I had no covid systems.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at American Family Care - Athens (256) 278-3000  to speak to our manager directly.

text: Will never come here again. My husband waited 3 hours with a hand injury, just to be told they don't do xrays-- even though their website states clearly that they do. Should've read all the other negative reviews and known better. Lesson learned.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Derek Cox
text: Been here OVER two hours for a “rapid” Covid test. Was literally the 13th person in line. Keep being told “one person ahead of you”. Just be honest. Slowest clinic I’ve ever been too.

name: Jamiee Freeman
text: I would give this place negative stars if I could. I have been here before and have NEVER had any issues until now. Waited over 6 hours to see a doctor for uti symptoms. The doctor didn’t hardly see me. Did no exam and told me my symptoms weren’t consistent with a uti. Gave me meds for something totally different. (This is unrelated to me) but while I was waiting to be seen in my room I heard a nurse call a patient and tell her that they told her the wrong Covid results so if you are going up there for Covid testing don’t!!!!! Anyways I went to another urgent care the very next day and they immediately told me I have a uti and gave me medication for that. I am so upset. Do not visit they don’t care.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

text: This is an awesome walk-in clinic. Clean facility with spacing for Covid. Front desk staff are polite and efficient. Nurse Practitioners know what they are doing. Shout out to Erica, RN!

name: TJ Treviso
text: This place is a nightmare. Imagine yelling the staff at 10 am you have covid symptoms... waiting nearly 4 hours to get tested, charged the fee... then told they can't test you because you have symptoms. Tell people up front and not waste their time. Unorganized and unprofessional.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: James Smart
text: Waited for over 4hrs. I was told at hour 2 there were 6 people ahead of me. 1 hour later was told there were 4 ahead of me. Every person who walks in is handed the same tablet to log information in and spread germs. COVID test patients wait in lobby for hours as well. No one sanitizes the seats for those people either.  Madison ER is faster than heee as well as Approxie Urgent Care.

name: Britni Bethune
text: I actually like this urgent care; however, being 18 weeks pregnant and to know the lobby is packed with 8+ people and they're letting people sit INSIDE THE LOBBY to do COVID rapid testing makes me VERY, VERY uncomfortable. Especially when there's coughing and throat clearing going on. Why aren't patients who are being rapid tested asked to sit in their car until the test is administered, like other clinics? It is uncomfortable and alarming to know the person I'm sitting 3-6 feet away from is exposing symptoms of COVID openly and potentially exposing others, especially with longer than normal wait times and a full lobby. As mentioned, wait times are longer than normal - I waited about three and a half hours today.

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at American Family Care Athens (256) 278-3000 . We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Valentina Fuller
text: Amy was fantastic and explained well. Luis gave x-ray and was very patient and calming. Dara ll drew blood and one of the few times it literally didn’t even feel a pinch. Very thorough. Highly recommend if you can’t get in with your primary care physician.

resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. Its experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help.

name: Amy Harris Walker
text: It was the weekend and my son had a bad ear infection. The CRNP, Maggie Collins got him in and out. She was great with him, as were the nurses. Would definitely recommend!

name: Track Mom
text: A snail would provide faster service than this URGENT CARE” patients are waiting as long as 2.5 hours in the waiting room before being called back. Heaven forbid someone coming in needing actual urgent medical care they would die in the waiting room! The 2nd thing I noticed is they do not see patients in the order they come in they pick and choose by ethnicity who is seen first to last.

name: adam anderson
text: There is no reason for someone have to wait for a covid test for 4 hours NO ONE!!!!!! SHOULD BE IN AND OUT if I wanted to wait this long i should've just went to the hospital ridiculous how this money racket is going I will not ever recommend this place to no ONE!!!!!

name: Emily Taylor
text: My wait was over two hours but with the influx of Covid testing I did expect this for a walk-in appointment. During my wait I witnessed Endia and Andrew at the front desk show incredible patience and kindness, even with agitated patients and a medical emergency that disrupted the clinic. If they were flustered, I couldn’t pick up on it. That’s the kind of service we need, especially in medical offices. Kudos!

name: Amanda Stephens
text:
Everyone was very friendly and understanding. They actually took the time to listen to me and truly worked hard to try to pinpoint my situation. If I need a clinic again I'll definitely be back!

Amanda S.

text:
Dr. Akalonu was unbelievably rude to my daughter and myself. I was out of state when my daughter went to have her sore throat evaluated and I was on the phone when he came in to give her results of the rapid strep. He was rude, he dismissed my concerns and said she didn’t have mono because her tonsils weren’t swollen or red. Funny. She doesn’t have tonsils. He walked out on her before ensuring my questions were answered. He didn’t care to discuss anything with me and treated us more as an inconvenience to his schedule. I thought doctors were supposed to be more caring and compassionate but this one is not. He’s a joke. I wonder if his demeanor would have been more friendly had he known I’m also a provider and come from a long line of doctors and nurses.

I will say, the lady that was working the front desk was incredibly friendly, warm and kind and I appreciated her.

Within the hour, I started feeling better.  All this occurred around 6 hours ago.  I'll tell you, I feel 100 times better already.  I'm so proud and thankful for that crew.  Ty ty ty.  I recommend anyone to go there.   Thank you again, so much, guys.  :-)

name: Summer Mitchell
text: My husband has high BP and we went in today because our BP monitor was saying his BP was very high even though he takes his medication. We had called his primary family doctors office and she said he needed to come in and have it checked but she didn't have time to see him today so we went to AFC in Athens and they were so great! They office staff was extremely nice and the nurse that took us back to check my husbands BP was awesome. He is probably the nicest person I have ever met in a doctor's office even better than our family doctor. My husband hates doctors but the nurse made him feel so comfortable and relaxed. He talked to us with such respect and made you feel like he had known you for years. If the owner of this facility happens to see this you should give that male nurse a big ole raise because he was so polite and made the visit so much better just because he has an awesome personality! I would recommend this doctors office to anyone and I wish they could be my primary care office !

Greetings,

text: Stupid long wait

name: Nuke Life
text:
Not usually a wait in the lobby, if there is maybe 15 mins tops,  they test for everything to give an accurate diagnosis.  The staff is awesome always friendly.  This is my go to place if I am sick.  You could stay here for up to an hour or so for diagnosis waiting on the tests,  but it's worth it I never stay sick long after I come here.

I saw some people complaining about the time they have to wait after being seen,  there is always a minute clinic they could go to or Google search,  to get a guess at what's wrong instead of going through the testing to actually see what's wrong.  Just be patient and you will get better faster here.

name: Hope Sides
text: Clean facility, minimal wait time, friendly staff, and the nurse practitioner was very friendly- HOWEVER- I don’t reccomend taking young babies. After my pediatrician couldn’t see my daughter, (whole other issue 🙄) I decided to take her here.. she was diagnosed with an ear infection and given an antibiotic. After two full days, my daughter has not gotten any better, I would even venture to say she’s gotten worse. Checking over the antibiotic that was prescribed, I called the pharmacy where her last prescription was filled (which happened to be the exact same antibiotic for another ear infection she had). Only difference was the one that was prescribed to us at AFC was HALF the dose.. so it has done my LO absolutely no good up to this point. So now I’m forced to call my pediatrician back tomorrow and see if she will give another script (which I’m sure insurance will not pay for again in the same week- irrelevant because I will do what I have to do to get her better). But it’s a little disheartening having to watch your 11 month old suffer when it could have easily been avoided.

resp.text: Hope, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Please reach out to us at (256) 278-3000 when you can so we can address this situation directly. Thank you and have a great day.

name: Abby Goggins
text: Poor experience using this place over the Christmas holidays.  Took my daughter in as soon as she woke up running fever and achy on Christmas Eve...took 4 1/2 hours due to computer problems they had and a busy waiting room!  The swabs they took were negative, but they assured me the strep would be sent off for culture.(false negatives are common when strep test is done early)  Two days later, my daughter clearly has strep throat...still running fever, very severe sore throat with white spots and pus in the back of it. I called back to check on test results and the culture hasn't even been sent off.  There was no care, concern or customer service on the phone.  I was hung up on after politely requesting a retest.  We will not be back here.

resp.text: Abby, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like the opportunity to make this up to you. Please contact our manager at (256) 278-3000 so we can make your experience a positive one.

name: Trevor Staub
text:
I understand that it is flu season and I was expecting to wait for an hour or two but here I am, three hours later and still haven't been seen. The TV in the lobby plays the same sports highlights from 3 months ago over and over which, while the least of my concerns, is incredibly annoying and mind numbing. I agree with the other reviewer, that just about any other doc in the box would be better than this one.
Also, I found it strange that the technician or whatever you would call him took all of my symptom information down on an iPad that crashed once while he was getting info from me. I'm all about saving the environment and going paperless but he spent unnecessary time and effort trying to get that thing working again when he could have just written it on a piece of paper.

The doctor was very kind and made up for lack of punctuality with a quick and accurate diagnosis.
I guess the 3 and a half hour wait comes with going to a doc in the box.

name: Charla M
text: Everybody Acts As If They Don't Wanna Be There. Just Rude

name: Johnny Pribyl
text: I went to this clinic on my lunch break due to simple cold. Hoped to be out in 1 hour but it took 2 before I saw a doc. They don't view patients as customers.

name: Taylor Land
text: I was here for 2 hours just for some blood work. Unacceptable.

name: Anderson bri
text: I was diagnosed with shingles after about 3 seconds. He said that I should still go work in the Alabama heat and that I would be fine and I was not contagious after consulting the pharmacist and Google I realized that my doctor obviously received his degree from a cracker jack box. I would not recommended or will I ever use again. I have seen animals be treated better headed for slaughter! The doctor is gone in less than 30 seconds!

name: Caitlin Butler
text: Absolutely delightful staff working. Appropriate wait time. Once in a room, in and out. NP incredibly thorough and patient. Never been here before, but will definitely come here before American family care.

name: Sheri Chafin
text: I have used them for several years. The staff are friendly and helpful. The treatment has always been great.

name: Amanda Griffin
text: Unlike lots of other urgent care facilities that just do in-room exams, this clinic actually does blood tests and other necessary testing when you come in with any cold type illnesses. This is much better because they are able to distinguish between the multiple illnesses and provide better treatment and specific medications to help you get better quicker. I've been to other clinics that are essentially making educated guesses and prescribing broad antibiotics in case they are wrong. They also are pretty quick. I was in and out as a new patient in 30 minutes or less.

name: Helen Avilez
text: This is a wonderful clinic ... 100%recommends

name: donald tindle
text: we were up visiting from Florida and got the symptoms  of the flu. went to this clinic and received fast excellent service, blood work x rays and shots. told to go to hospital if I wasn't feeling any better by morning. the next morning I was feeling much better. I highly recommend this clinic.

name: EMILY FORD
text: -Stars. This place is an embarrassment. You would think that individuals working in the medical field would be compassionate, but these people are only chasing a check. This doctor was rude and violent towards my son. He tried to play it off, but my son fell victim to his extreme behavior. Do not go here. Save yourself heartache and just drive to Birmingham.

name: Carol Poe
text: Quick service with friendly staff. Have went here for myself and my child. They actually do blood work where as other urgent care clinics often do not, at least in my experience.

name: James Barnes
text: They may be great...I guess i'll never know, they won't answer their phones during business hours.

name: Joseph Wolf
text: Loved it.  Usually not there too long.  Push pin on the Google map is on the wrong side of Hwy 78 as of 27 Feb 11.  The street view photo gave it away.

name: Linda Pierce
text: They have always treated myself and my son great. I have been there alot

name: Lela Hayes
text: Always helped my daughters and normal we wasn't in there waiting no longer the 10-20 minutes then the doctor is always nice n then we would be getting the meds they needed n then out.

name: apollyan5
text: Its $120 per visit without insurance. Cash or credit card.

name: RVPeak
text: I liked nothing about this location.  When you asked questions about your health or billing, they were condescending as if they were the professionals and I should accept everything they said as if it were gospel.  I called ahead to ensure that they could help me with a physical and was told yes.  Nothing could have been farther from the truth.  After paying to get a physical, I was told that they could start the physical, (do about 3%) and come back for the rest of it on Saturday.  They failed to read the paperwork that I brought, I had to go back and explain what I really needed.  Every time I asked a question, the person I talked to would walk away, form a committee and put it to a vote.  This location and the one on airport road needs to be closed.

name: Re Bow
text:
I live right next door, so I've tried to come here a few times. My God they are so awful. Rude and condescending reception, and the doctors just throws an easy diagnosis and prescription at you without even barely looking at you.

Probably good for minor cuts and bruises if you don't mind waiting 4 hours.

Read the rest of the reviews here. They are not wrong.

name: Ken Reed
text:
Went to AFC Daphne last night after suffering from congestion for a few days. Arrived at 5:30pm and was checked in. Everything went smoothly until the primary guy came in. Don't know his name, fairly young, tall and heavy. He was obviously anxious to go home. Came in and asked a couple of questions and then told me he couldn't do anything for me because I needed to see a cardiologist because it was 100% a heart issue and I needed a stress test ASAP. I tried to ask questions but he was having nothing to do with that, just apologized that he had to deliver such devastating news and I had to leave.

Went home, obviously worried but thought I would get a second opinion first thing this morning before calling a cardiologist. Thank God I did. I went to Eastern Shore Urgent Care in Malbis and found out I have bronchitis and absolutely no heart issues. They are great there and after a few hours I already feel much better and the congestion is about gone.

For you own sake, don't go here!!!

name: Bill Kynes
text: This is it updated post for my previous post. I received a message from the owner saying they would reach out to me to resolve the problem not the case. I have spoken with the office manage directly your corporate office three different people. I just received billing to my insurance company for procedure that was never done when I was there for the visit. Therefore I'm asking for  Dr Bruce Irwin to contact me or if they have somebody there they call boss. I've contacted my insurance company and made them aware of this they're investigating your office manager has all the details and made copies please respond thank you. As of today nobody has contacted me from American family care my insurance company is doing an internal investigation they just contacted me. My advice is not to go to that facility if you have to keep all copies of procedures that they performed.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to American Family Care - Daphne so we can rectify this issue.

name: Mary Avera
text:
Been here since they opened and still haven't been out of the lobby, its been over an hour. I have been constantly vomiting all night and there is no triage system. I'm desperate for help and they just don't care how long everyone is waiting.

Edit* once I got into a room the nurses and doctors were very nice

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We hope you have a great day

name: AnnMarie Jackson
text:
Getting the covid test was pretty simple. Not a lot of options in Alabama for it, especially on the weekends. I came to visit from out of state so it was required to get a test done. I was tested on a Saturday,  12/5  they told me it would be sent off Monday and would take 5-8 days. A very long and slow turn around. My test was ordered on 12/9 and a couple days later was emailed my results which was actually empty. I tried multiple times calling to speak to someone with no answer. I sent my step dad there to see if he could have someone call me. On the first ring, now someone answers since he was in front of them.  We tried the same morning multiple times,my mom even let it ring for 9 minutes. Very frustrating. The emailed results to me which is a horrible copy to read. Would not recommend if visiting from out of state or need a quick turn around for results, period
Go to another town or state.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: hayden harper
text: Worst experience ever at a walk in clinic. I had three people in front of me when I got there and I waited for and hour and 45 minutes. DO NOT recommend going here. The front office staff is also extremely rude and not helpful at all.

name: Jessica Richardson
text:
Poor customer service and communication. Went to get a Covid test for traveling internationally (needed to present to the local government) and waited 2 hours for a 1 minute test. We made the staff aware of the reasoning behind the test up front. And again when the PA came in to discuss and ask question about my exposure (reiterating the fact that it was purely for travel purposes). Have not yet received results and will be detained and made to retake the test to be allowed outside the airport. When called to ask about the results today, was told that if they had known we needed results quicker, they would have sent us else where.
Super frustrating and a complete waste of time and money to end up empty handed.
Will not be back to this location for any visits.

***Edit***
Still waiting, 7 days after testing, for a result that should have taken "3-5 days". Not only was my trip missed and cancelled due to the extended lead time of this result, but I have yet to be contacted or given any information from American Family in regards to this issue.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at  American Family Care - Daphne (251) 626-5700 to speak to our manager directly.

name: Aden Xagod
text: They charged me $365 in addition to the $175 cost of my initial visit. floor blood work i didn't ask for. The nurse told me they where going to run some simple test, that would be covered by my visit cost of $175 then i get a bill for $365 in the mail.  BE CAREFUL when dealing with these people

name: Bryan Saifi
text: They need to state in there phone recorded message and On their website more clearly that they won’t see you if you come in after 5pm despite being open to 6pm.

name: Reese Grantham
text: I am sitting in the waiting room and was here 20 minutes before hey opened only to get a covid test-nothing else. They are not efficient with their time nor patients. It is an hour and 45 minutes I have been sitting here and I was 8th in line this morning. I am unsure why it takes this long to get people in for a covid test.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Kristian Morrison
text: Dr. Shandi Shiver is a wonderful doctor and person.      I have no insurance and pay out of pocket and I don’t mind because she takes excellent care of me and all my medical needs. Also the staff is so nice and helpful, especially Brittany. I highly recommend AFC.

name: KOOL May
text: My mother stole all my identifications, I did have my medical card, but I was denied access to get seen. The next day, I did an online doctor's appointment and was told to go the E.R., where I was diagnosed with Covid 19 related pneumonia.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: JAn G
text: Slowest urgent care I have ever been at! Still waiting after 2 hours with four other people waiting to be seen. Watched 6 people walk out and no one called back! I am stuck here but I assure you, I will never choose to come back here nor will I recommend this place.

name: Justin Stapler
text: Thought I had covid 19. Made an appointment. Waited for an hour in my truck with no a.c. I finally walked back in and ask if they were even close. I'm cooking out here. She looked and said oh Ive been calling you. No missed calls on my phone and full service. I showed her that. Then she double checked my number. She had the correct number. So I believe I was just skipped all together which I'm sure was an accident. Just own the mistake but they didn't... Upon realizing that. They rushed me back for a test. Well.... that was 19 days ago. Still no answer. Ive called 3 times now. To be told they are sorry. I should have results soon. Glad I'm not dead.... Hope if it was covid I did not make anyone else sick along the way. I get the medical field is crazy right now but this is just negligent.

name: T
text: Unacceptable wait time. I waited 3 hours before I left with the results of my 15min “Rapid” Covid Test. There were no more than 4 people in the waiting room when I arrived.

name: tj williams
text: Wonderful doctors office. Every person I came into contact with were nice and extremely knowledgeable in their job! Will definitely be my new doctors office!

name: lilsexymexy
text: I LOVE coming to American Family Care and have been coming here for over 10yrs now.  The entire team there is great and I absolutely LOVE Shandi, the very knowledgeable nurse practitioner Dr. Robinson has.  The two of them make for an amazing team, along with all of the other staff members.  I would recommend this clinic to anyone new in the area looking for a primary doctor or urgent care!!  Thanks AFC for always taking such great care of me and my family members, 10yrs and going strong!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: A. Clark
text: Covid-19 has really overwhelmed them. Do not expect your phone calls to be answered.... it will only happen if you are incredibly lucky. I called TEN different times on Friday and never once got an answer [even after letting the phone ring for 10 min straight once. Today I decided to let the phone ring until someone answered, it took almost 15 minute before someone was able to pick up... the young lady was very polite and provided me with my test results over the phone. It is completely understandable for them to be experiencing problems in such a difficult time, I understand, but it is still VERY frustrating and unfair to the patients. Management needs to assign one employee to phone duty during this busy time, that should be their only responsibility, to attend to the phone lines.

name: Autumn B
text:
I was left in a room for 50 minutes without any indication of when I would receive results or how long I would be waiting. When I asked the receptionist on duty if it was okay to recieve my results over the phone, she snapped at me and said it wasn’t possible. She said to go wait in my room until someone would come to me to which I apologized and made my way back. I had forgotten which exam room I was in and asked for help from my nurse, I heard the receptionist chide “I have told her three times to get back to her room, she is just wandering around.” Which wasn’t true.

My nurse and doctor were both very kind and understanding, I just wish that I was given more instruction on the procedure, which I was not. I was put into a room with little room to ask questions, and no one informed me on what was happening or how long I would be waiting.

name: Wade Burcham
text: I recommend you plan for a full day adventure if you go here. Not sure if their time estimates are lies or they have no idea and just say what they think you want to hear.

name: Tracie Alexandra
text: The absolute worst. Eastern Shore urgent is way better

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

text: Shandi is literally the best Nurse I have yet to meet. She made such an impression on me I will only recommend her to anybody. I have never had any short of IV work done to me and she made it so seamless. I wish her the very best and I hope to see her again soon.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: sneerious grinch
text: Not a good place to seek medical care. I went in with a staph infection amd told the dr it was a staph infection. Dr Robinson looked at it and agreed it was a staph infection. He did not drain it and now after running tje antibiotics wants me to come back in because they did not do a culture at the first visit. Why wouldn't they do a culture on the first visit? And if he knew it was staph infection then why did he prescribe a weal antibiotic? I will he charged double for the negligence on their part. I think sometimes people get burnt out at their job over time and I think Dr Robinson past time to retire. I would seek a different afc or a different means of medical care altogether. Theres a good chance this location will be negligent and unprofessional in their practicing medicine. It's really disturbing that a medical professional can be so uncaring about a patient's health and well beinh

name: Taylor Musso
text: By far the worst doctors office I’ve ever been to. Sorry excuse for an establishment.

name: Nathan & Jordan Watkins
text: Dr. Shandy Shiver is absolutely amazing! She helped both myself and my husband! She made us feel so comfortable, and she was so patient with us, and never rushed us at all during our visit! This was the best experience with a Physician we have ever had! Thank you !!

resp.text: It's experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! Thank you so much for the positive review!

text: Don't bother calling, they're too busy to answer the phone.  If you go in to make an appt for testing because no one ansered, you will get a lecture on how many times a day the phone rings. Very rude too.

name: Lance Latham
text: Was appreciative of how attentive the staff and the doctor were. They went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and asked several times if I needed anything.  The clinic manager also came in to check on me. The phone call the next day was so kind and made me feel like they genuinely cared how I was feeling. Great staff. Great doctor. Great care.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

text: These people are rude. I could not understand what she said whwn she answered and I said very nicely, " I cpuld not understand what you just said" she replied snippy "well ok, how can I help you?" Just be nice. Really? These are trying times. I will find somewhere elae to go. And so will my whole family.

name: Connor Adams
text: American family care offered a fast but thorough evaluation. Nobody wants to go to the doctor, but they made it an awesome experience. Shanti Shiver goes above and beyond to make her patients feel comfortable and cared for. I'll definitely keep coming back.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

text: Dr Robinson and staff are professional and provide the best in quality care. Very thorough exam with a quick diagnosis. Little or no wait time. I highly recommend AFC Daphne to everyone who needs exceptional,  quality medical care.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

text: Dictated by Barb J. “Went in today early, I suspected a sinus infection. No cars in lot, no patients in lobby. Did paperwork. Sat there for 55 min. Saw PA for 2 min. Left after shot and told to go pick up Rx they would call in. 4 hours later, called pharmacy to see if Rx was there, no it was not. Called AFC in Daphne to ask them to send in the Rx.”

resp.text: Please contact us at (251) 626-5700 when you have an opportunity, and we will be more than happy to try and turn your experience around.

name: John Smith
text:
Please note the outstanding professional service provided by Shandi Shiver. CRNP.  She was very caring, knowledgeable and took extremely good care of my bronchitis issue.  She took extraordinary and detailed steps for my recovery process and inhaler instructions that I had never been instructed in.  She is a credit to this care center and the medical profession.

I will pass this onto friends and family in need of Excellence in Family Medical Care.

Thanks again
Captain (JD) John Donnelly Smith, Daphne, AL

text: I would like to say thank you to all the staff for being so kind and understanding and helping me in my time of need. I really appreciated it.  Really great customer service. Thank you.

name: Britney Batrez
text: They are quick and super friendly! One of the docs seems to care about what’s going on in your life besides your “illness” and it’s very refreshing! Will continue to come back here for anything I can!

resp.text: Britney Batrez, your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us. If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

text: The front desk receptionist was so warm and friendly and the nurse, who was also a lab tech was so nice and caring from giving me my vitals to really paying attention to how I felt and what I was going through. It made the experience very enjoyable and if I get sick in daphne again (knock on wood ) that’s where I will go.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Chloe Tyner
text: My family and I have been using AFC Daphne for several years. The office staff is professional and friendly and has always moved us in and out in a minimum amount of time. Dr. Robinson and Dr. Colbert listen to the issue and address solutions quickly. Have on several occasions followed up personally on health issues. Have not had an unpleasant or unprofessional visit in the entire time we've used this practice. Highly recommend.

name: Jim Vaughn
text: Everyone was very friendly, and I was seen quickly.  The Dr spent plenty of time with me and I never felt rushed.  I would strongly recommend AFC to friends and family.

name: Taylor George
text: Had an appointment at 12pm. Got there at 11:45, was told they were just seeing 10am patients and asked me to wait in my car and they would call me in. Sat in my car until 3pm before they called me in.

name: Rachelle
text:
If you get dr. Mark Robinson just leave. Don’t know how he is certified to be a doctor. It baffles me.
He doesn’t listen and is agitating and rude

name: Madelyn Deaton
text: Went in with an ankle sprain and everyone was very attentive and sweet. They even called to check on me the next day.

name: Amber Parker
text:
I came here Saturday with sores on my throat, fever, body aches, headache; and just feeling miserable. I was tested for the flu and it came back negative. The nurse practitioner that doesn’t work at the clinic was apparently filling in for the real
Doctor that wasn’t able to come in for the day. She never diagnosed me and just decided to prescribe me tamiflu when I didn’t have the flu, the medication was not covered much By my insurance and wasn’t the medication I needed so I called and told them and they decided to prescribe me pills for a cough which I made it clear I did not have a cough at all at the time. Now it’s tuesday and I’m having intense nose bleeds, my chest is cold, and Im dry coughing and my throat and neck is sore radiating to my ears. I called and told them I needed something to help me and they said I’d have to pay ANOTHER co pay to see the real doctor because he doesn’t go by what other “doctors” have said. I feel this is not how the situation should have been handled so I am still miserable when I’ve reached out for help several times.

name: Lindsey Hirst
text:
This is the worst urgent care center in Daphne! I've been to the other Urgent care centers in the area several times and have never experienced the issues I had at American Family Care in Daphne.
I waited a very, very long time to be seen, and there were only two or three other patients in there. The nurse wasn't very confident with his blood drawing skills and didn't seem very knowledgeable. Then, I drove all the way to the pharmacy to find out they never called my prescription in!! The office closed at 6, and it was 6:20pm when I realized this. I was told by the answering service I had to wait until tomorrow to call and get it sent over. I was very unhappy that I had to wait another day to get my medications. I felt horrible and needed the antibiotics asap! I will never go back here!

resp.text: Hi Lindsey, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. Please reach out to us at (251) 626-5700 so we may assist you in moving forward towards a resolution.

name: Kelsey Vrieze
text:
I have been to other urgent care centers in Daphne, but decided to go to this one because it's close to our house. I was told by one of the office personnel that "for insurance plans with high deductibles we charge $100." In my insurance booklet from BCBS it says my Co pay for an urgent care center is $50. After telling her that we have a $300 per person deductible, she told me I was wrong and that my deductible was $7800 or $7900 which isn't true. If I could post photos of our State Employee Insurance Board book from BCBS Alabama it plainly states that we each have a $300 per person deductible per calendar year, I would. We have a $7800 Maximum out of pocket cost for one person and $14500 for a family, but she clearly stated deductible. I'm going to assume they were talking about our maximum out of pocket costs instead of deductible, but even then, that shouldn't be something that urgent care centers even consider.

I went to Eastern Shore Urgent Care Center in November or December and they didn't bill me $100 for seeing the doctor. I paid a $50 copay. I am going to go back to that one even though it is out of my way. Always be sure to look at your insurance booklet and read it every year for updates. There are some doctors offices and urgent care centers that will try to charge you more.

Edit: I went to Eastern Shore Urgent Care center and my co pay was $35. I called and confirmed with BCBS that my deductible isn't in the $7000s. I'm not sure if she misread my insurance or what happened, but I shouldn't have to pay extra for services that my insurance MIGHT not cover. They are basically saying that they are going to charge you extra because you may not pay your bill for services rendered so we will have an account. I would rather go to an urgent care center where I'm billed a Co pay and then sent a bill for extra services that my insurance didn't cover.

resp.text: Kelsey Herring, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (251) 626-5700. We look forward to hearing from you.

Received the tb test after the third time I was there and came back three days later for the reading and they told me they couldn’t see my bc the system was down. So I went up there today and it’s too late and have to pay AGAIN for a new test when it was there fault in the beginning. Proceeded to tell me they couldn’t do nothing for me and not once a sorry or apology. Also told me they couldn’t do the physical/tb test on the same day but yet they did it for other people. name: Donald Goram
text: My son went to this clinic on Saturday Jan 28th 2017. We suspected that he had the flue. After being examined the doctor said it was viral and gave him a Steroid Shot.  My son's doctors was not open on Saturday, that was the reason for using American Family Care. Monday morning he was still sick and we took him to his Doctor. My wife noticed that the test procedure was different they swabbed both nosterals unlike American Family care who just stuck the swab in and pulled it out.  I called and explained this to the office manager. She said that they often have patients that come back and test positive on their second visit. That you don't have to actually have tow swab both nosterals. Bottom line my sons doctor told my wife that the method they used to test is the correct method. We were told that Tamifu would not be effective being that he has had the flue to long. We spent $175.00 for the office visit out of pocket, I suppose we would have spent the same amount again if we had to take him back. I would not recommend this medical facility.

name: Jessica Sanders
text: I registered online and received a text it was time to come inside. Then I sat in the waiting room for an hour. I would have been more comfortable in my vehicle. Why have me register online, check in online and wait in the waiting room?

name: Kat A
text:
This was a good place to go for urgent care when my primary doctor was closed. Even with long wait times the care was worth it. I don't know what changed but I wish they would undo it.
My last visit, I was given a prescription and told at the pharmacy that they do not carry that medicine and I should talk to the clinic about a substitution. Only the clinic would not answer after trying for some time and during the middle of their posted business hours. I finally drove back to the clinic to talk to someone. There was no line or packed waiting room. Absolutely no idea why no there was no answer.
I read my  instructions when I got home. They were different than the in person instructions. No answer again, so no clarification.
I understand being busy and sometimes calls and messages get missed but this is just to much.

resp.text: Kat, I do apologize for the unanswered telephone. You are correct, sometimes it is very hard for two ladies we have on Saturday to catch all incoming calls. We have 7 incoming lines. During the weekdays there are 4 team members available to tend to the phones and greet and register patients.  An added aspect to this is that we don’t have an open waiting room currently due to COVID. So, we are constantly communicating to patients about their arrival and when to enter the building. No excuses however, we are looking into other options for answering our phones during this high volume covid world in which we find ourselves.   I appreciate your feedback in this matter as it has led to a productive discussion on how to offer better customer service. Please contact me if you still have questions concerning the provider instructions for at home care.  Ask for Ms. Morriss

text: This urgent care is the absolute best I’ve been too, every one from the past was just the worst, with long wait times and terrible customer service. name: Earl Morriss
text: I went in with a high fever - and I am one of those “I never go to the doctor” people- they ran various tests and decided it was a bacterial infection.  The doctor said that they would treat the symptoms, but that the source of the infection was unknown and that we would need to keep an eye on it.  The drugs killed the infection- but a couple of weeks later the same fever came back.  This time the doctor said we would again use drugs to kill the infection - but since the infection had reoccurred I needed to go to a urologist.  Middle Creek was professional and made sure I understood my illness every step of the way!  They referred me to a great urologist - and one less large kidney stone later - I’m doing fine.

resp.text: Thank you, Mr Morriss for taking the time to provide our team with feedback on your experience. We are glad you are doing better.  It is, as always,  a pleasure to serve and play a role in the health of our community.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Debby Jackson
text:
Called for Covid testing  was seen rite away,an was tested an got my results quickly!The Dr.was very helpful and took good care of me .
.

resp.text: Thank you MS Debby.

name: S Fowler
text: I was able to book an appointment online. I did not wait long at all and was seen quickly. Everyone I came in contact with was very friendly. The CRNP answered all my questions, and explained things in depth.

resp.text: Hello Starr,  thank you for that great review. We appreciate you!

name: keila webster
text: My daughter has been seen at this place for years and today of all days she received worse care ever . After being seen by the NP ,  Dr. Woodward came into the room and stated he did not know what was wrong with her and he would be right back . After leaving the room my daughter called me to tell me what the Dr said and then she stated she overheard him say to the nurse that he had to google her symptoms . I called back and spoke with a very rude nurse by the name of Cara who was no help at all . This will be the last time my family visit this place again ...

name: Rhonda Martin
text: I had been referred by my Primary Care Doctor to go to Middle Creek Medical for a Covid 19 test.  I had seen my primary in the am for being sick and treated for Pneumonia.  I'm already at high risk due to COPD & home oxygen therapy.  Dr. wanted a test done just to be safe.  I went as directed, checked in & made an appointment on the mobile app & was notified by phone within a couple of minutes to enter the building for my test.  The nurse & Dr. Amy were great.  Dr. Amy was also concerned about my health diagnosis from my primary.  She did the Covid 19 test which was a very simple test.  It was not painful at all.  Said I should receive the results within 2 days.  I should receive results tomorrow.  They were very professional & very polite & answered all my questions.  They actually treated me like family.  I definitely recommend others to go to Middle Creek Medical Center if you are sick or need a Covid 19 test performed. I definitely will go back if I need further treatment.

resp.text: Wow Rhonda, thank you so much for your thoughtful comments and for sharing your experience. When you say that we treated you like family, that is the greatest compliment we could receive. It’s our goal. We appreciate your trust in our team and they truly are a great team.  Carla

name: Byron Weatherspoon
text: Nice staff and they're work is awesome I don't have any complaints been going here since they been in business.

resp.text: Wow, thank you Byron for the wonderful review.

name: t thrasher
text: Every time I have needed to visit they have always been prompt, taken care of my needs and very professional. I dont have a Regular Dr that I see so they are a huge help to me.

name: Ashlan messer
text: Absolutely love all the staff!!

resp.text: Thank you very much. We love you as well!!

name: Megan and Randa Gilmore
text:
I went yesterday to this facility at around 11:00 am. I was so worried that they would think I was crazy because I had multiple symptoms and none of them seemed related to the other. The women front desk were all very kind to me. I was called back quickly by the triage nurse, and she was very thorough and kind as well. I was put into a room and it took maybe 10 minutes for the doctor to come in. I was seen by Dr. Samuel Flowers. He looked me over, listened to my concerns, and instead of thinking I was a nutty hypochondriac, he made me feel sane and was very thorough in his examinations and testing. I was also worried about going because I had just seen negative reviews on Google, but it was the closest clinic to me that welcomed walk-ins, and I wasn’t feeling well enough to go further. The negative reviews I saw couldn’t be further from my actual experience. I was incredibly pleased. Even though I do not yet have a diagnosis, we are working on that, and I have resources to get me by until these future appointments.

Overall:
5 stars for time, as I was there only over an hour, even with lab work.

5 stars for thouroughness

5 stars for kindness and professionalism

Thank you all so much. I would absolutely recommend this facility to anyone in need, and already have, in fact.

resp.text: Wow Zaryn!! Thank you for the kind review. We certainly strive for your complete satisfaction and appreciate your openness to share your experience. Please let us know if you need anything.

name: She She
text: I came here due to my blood pressure was high. And the doctor refused to see me due to I had a baby two weeks ago. I paid a co pay and everything and didn’t even see the doctor. I wish I can give them 0 stars.

name: Alyssa ellis
text: I arrived at 4:47 and the close at 5, all I needed was for them to walk my paper out stating that I was negative in order for me to return to school. I did what they said and tried to call but they won’t answer since it’s so close to 5

resp.text: Thank for your feedback. You may email info@mcmcuc.com anytime for quick answers to administration questions after hours.

name: Casey Benefield
text:
Way better than LiveHealthOnline/Telemedicine... who said "oh just put saline in your nose and take a cough pill you're allergic to."

Middle Creek's NP and DR exhibited the best attitude, the best professionalism, and knew what they were doing. They did a flu test, and took a look into my situation, and put together a simple treatment plan to knock out this crud.

Thank you MCMC!

name: Karen Schock
text: My daughter-in-law hurt her I had her on her job hurom HR called Middle Creek in McCalla and told them what they needed done and they said that she could come on over that they would wait for her it was five minutes to 5 when she arrived at the door the woman at the door was proceeding to lock the door and there was another woman with her and the woman the nurse supposedly forgot about her ethics class asked which of the ladies was the surname and the woman said oh that's me like all right you can come in and get your boot to my daughter-in-law said my HR called you and told you I had this is I can't see out of it I scratched it I don't know how bad it is that I could come over and they're like what we're not taking new patients and she's like no they said that you would wait for me but we didn't receive your paperwork so when the woman proceeded to slam the door in her face unlock it so she called her HR and they said that they have confirmation that the paper was sent and received so I just want to let you know I'm sure the doctors there don't know what their nurses are doing at that front counter when you go into the nursing field or doctor filled you do take a class on ethics and health and well-being comes first before you want to go home and eat dinner with your family that's part of the job I had a bad experience there I was sad that you was going to have to go there and now she has experienced it as well these ladies there do not know what they're doing. They push it through like cattle and they're just not nice and I think this is a shame that they would do this to a person who had it and I problem where she had scratched her eye so -5 stars on my end very sad about how this date is treating their people

name: Allea Grimes
text: I went in Tuesday as a new patient for a terrible asthma attack, the office girls noticed my distress and took me back immediately to be cared for by the most compassionate and caring nurses, nurse practitioner and Dr. They went above and beyond to make me comfortable. If you are anywhere in the area and need to see a physician, I honestly cannot recommend these wonderful people enough!! Thank you again for the A plus care, I'll forever be thankful!! I am adding to this a year later to further confirm how happy I am with their service. They have treated my son very well and fast .

name: Luhv 420
text: I had such a wonderful experience while visiting your facility. Such a great staff to say the least!! I had come in with a sinus infection and bronchitis and my visit was very prompt, effective and efficiently. The nurse practitioner, doctor and staff were very concerned about my overall well being and made sure I was very much comfortable while there. Before my discharge, my prescriptions were ready for pickup at my pharmacy. I would highly recommend anyone to visit this facility whereas you can share in such a great experience as myself.

name: Sincerely _Kristie C
text: Middle Creek Rocks!!! The ladies up front are AMAZING!!!! They truly care and TREAT YOU LIKE Family!!I love this place and will be back again. Did I mention the service is fast as lighting

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review.

name: Cathy Howell
text: I just wanted to say thank you to Middle Creek Medical Center for always providing great care to me.I have been seen at this facility more than once. Each time I have been treated very well, and the doctors and staff are very compassionate. I have been seen at both clinics for different things at different times, and the front desk is always helpful and pleasant when I walk in, the nursing staff keeps me informed of what is going on.  I am very pleased with this clinic and WOULD recommend both locations of this clinic to my family and friends.  By far, this clinic gives the best care to patients (in my opinion) than any other doc in the box. I will continue to go to this clinic to be treated.   Thank you Middle Creek for giving great care to your patients.

name: Gail Atkinson
text: I have had several visits at both locations, as well as my family. We were very pleased with the professional service from front desk to the doctor. There has been many times that we have not been able to be seen by our primary doctor, and with Middle Creek they allow walk ins so that has been very convenient for my family. I have recommended this Medical Center to many friends and family member. My grandson has been seen by the NP at the Middle Creek in the Promenade due to a virus and we were very well taken care of by Liz and their staff. The lady at front desk was very pleasing and greeted us as we walked in and got our information in a timely manner. Middle Creek is a wonderful place to be seen. Love it Love it!!

name: Brandon Herren
text: Wonderful place! The wait time is short and the staff is always very caring and attentive. My sister-n-law Rebecca Harris works there and everyone knows how sweet she is and the rest of the staff is the same way. The Doctors are always very polite and take time with you. I highly recommend Middle Creek Medical!

name: Caitlin Carter
text: I’m very pleased with the service and care I’ve received here. Being a first time patient, I was in and out in 30 minutes! It could be due to I was the first patient of the day, but none the less, they take urgent care literally!

resp.text: Wow thank you Caitlin. We do try to our best to be swift and accurate.  Feel better!!! And thank you for your business.

name: Janet Stanley
text:
Our last time to visit Middle Creek.  I took my daughter Sunday afternoon to the doctors office.  From the minute we walked in the door it appeared that we were bothering them and got the look "why are you here?"   From the front desk to the back everybody acted like they were mad because people were sick on Sunday.  The doctor comes in never introduces himself or anything.  Looked at her throat, ears and nose.  Walks out.  Nurse comes in and gives her a shot without explanation to what the diagnosis is and what the shot is for.  She got the shot which was an anti shot.  The last people to come in after giving the shot had an attitude with my daughter because she wasn't going to be in town in 3 days to ge a follow up visit.  She ever said "I've driven from _______there before it's not too bad."  When this clinic first opened up it was great. But something has gone really wrong.  On Tuesday I took my daughter to another clinic.  She is on the way to recovery now.  Don't waste your time going here.  They need a visit from Undercover Boss.

UPDATE:  After Middle Creek saw my post I received a phone call.  The lady I spoke with was very concerned about my visit and apologized for the way we were treated.  She said that the problem will be addressed.

name: Mary Ann Brooks
text: The staff at Middle Creek are awesome. I was seen several times last week and was treated GREAT!!! from check in staff up front  to the staff in the clinic. I would highly recommend this clinic!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.

name: Julieann Rogers
text: I visited this "medical" facility at 5:45 on a Friday after I got off work. All I needed was X Rays and a referral to a specialist. After waiting 30 minutes the doctor came into the room and told me in a very condescending manner what he was NOT going to do for me . I had to demand and X Ray after I was interrupted several times while attempting to explain. When the "doctor" entered the room he asked me which medication I was prescribed in the past. Which I told him. He then rattled off my previous prescription history in a tone less than professional. Apparently I waited the 30 minutes while he reviewed my history to come to a pre determined conclusion. After X Ray he came back into room to apologize by explaining I came in 15 minutes before closing and he needed to leave to go to his son's football event. So, he had time to do research to come to a predetermined conclusion before even seeing me but not time to listen. I worked in the bar and restaurant industry for over 30 yrs, if all I wanted was pills like he thought, it is a lot easier to pick up phone and call around to get what he thought I wanted than to waste time visiting a doctor that has plenty of time to judge and condescend but no time to actually do what he is supposed to. If you have a little cold or cough this place is fine. But for real medical issues I suggest going elsewhere.

name: Kristi Waltman
text: I have been seen at Middle Creek many times, especially during the flu season. I recently got a darn summer cold and went to be seen due to not having a Primary Care Doctor. The staff was very pleasing to be around. The Doctor was very nice and explained everything to me and did a flu test on me. The Doctor then prescribed me the meds that I needed and called it in to the pharmacy. The front desk was very pleasing and wished me to get well. They even called me a few days later to check up on me to make sure I was doing well and assured me that if I needed anything else to come up there to be seen. I would so much rather go to Middle Creek than a Primary Care doctor because my experience was just that great. I would recommend this facility to any of my friends and family. They treat you like family and show compassion.

name: Angela Byram
text: I wish I could rate a zero or go somewhere else. I’ll make sure I warn others about my experience so they will do the same. Let me again reiterate. PLEASE DON’T go to this establishment!!!!! If you’re needing any sort of treatment or customer service ... you won’t receive it here.

name: Janet Stanley
text:
Our last time to visit Middle Creek.  I took my daughter Sunday afternoon to the doctors office.  From the minute we walked in the door it appeared that we were bothering them and got the look "why are you here?"   From the front desk to the back everybody acted like they were mad because people were sick on Sunday.  The doctor comes in never introduces himself or anything. text: I have been seen at Middle Creek many times, especially during the flu season. I recently got a darn summer cold and went to be seen due to not having a Primary Care Doctor. The staff was very pleasing to be around. The Doctor was very nice and explained everything to me and did a flu test on me. They even called me a few days later to check up on me to make sure I was doing well and assured me that if I needed anything else to come up there to be seen.
