They treat you like family and show compassion.

name: MsIndy Red
text:
Well, this place has really gone downhill in the last couple of years, so I'm changing my review from 5 stars to 3 - just an average doc-in-the-box now. 1) The most recent visit took 3.5 hours. 2) Three people that signed in after were taken back before, despite having AccessHealth "priority". 3) I completed all of the registration info online - which took about 15 minutes - but then when I got there, they said they didn't have access to that info, so it was a complete waste of time. 4) The time before that, the doctor didn't approve of my face covering, so he told the nurse to "get a mask ON THAT ONE".  Yeah, that made me feel really special. So much for family.  Everyone has an off day every now and again, though, right?  But the couple times before that were also mediocre. so this must be the new pattern. Next time we'll go somewhere else. I'm done.

*****

This place is special.  I've been here several times and  every time I walk in, I'm amazed by how personal the service is.  I feel like a person ... an ailing person ... rather than a number.  From the greeting at the front door to the "hope you feel better" as I leave, EVERYONE has always been great.  They don't treat me like I have cooties; they treat me like family.  I would almost say they coddle me a bit (and who couldn't use a little TLC when they're sick?).  They're nice, friendly, caring, personal, and yet, still professional.  Not all cold and clinical.  Other places could learn a lot from Middle Creek.  Can't tell you how many doctors I've left because of poor staff.  I'm sorry for the few people that have had a bad experience here (and yes, some sound really bad), but stuff happens sometimes ... even when you're with family.  I'll be going here again in just a few minutes and, even if I have a bad experience, I won't allow that one time to cloud over all of the other wonderful times.  Thanks, Middle Creek, for being there when I need you and taking care of me in my pathetic, sick (or injured) state.  See you soon.

*****
I'm back.  For those of you that question wait times, I checked in at 11:22am and out at 12:05pm.  (Web check-in is also available.)  Less than a 45 minute turnaround in the middle of lunch hour qualifies as another outstanding experience.  And ... BTW ... Dr. Flowers is awesome!!  I knew we'd get along well as soon as he suggested echinacea.  Almost makes me look forward to getting sick!   ;-)

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience after giving such a raving review. It disappoints us when we don’t meet your expectation. We will review our process to ensure that it’s efficient and serves you better next time. We hope to have another opportunity to blow you away with outstanding service to make up for letting you down this time.

name: Connie Botcher
text: The only Dr office I actually like going to. They are always quick and thorough!

resp.text: Awesome. Thank you Connie.

name: Galaxy_birb the bird
text: Only leaving one star because I have to in order to write this review. Any Dr that doesn't accept Medicaid should be put out of business. It's like you're telling people they're too poor for medical care. Shame on you and everyone that works there.

name: Kerry Smith
text: Efficient and thorough. I found the overall wait time here was less than a scheduled appointment wait time at my primary care doc. The doctor explained all my treatment options and answered all my questions. The staff seemed to like being there. A great alternative to trying to get in to see my primary care doc on one day's notice.

name: PATRICE SLEDGE
text: Dr. Flowers and staff is so GREAT ‼️   The service is fast and friendly and I always feel better after my visit.    If I could use this office as my PCP I most surely would!!!!

resp.text: We are so thankful for Dr. Flowers. He is smart, he listens and he cares. Thank you for the very kind review.

name: PsychoUki
text: Get me back fast and out the door quick. Friendly service.

resp.text: Thank you Cory!

name: maddison rone
text: This is a great place to come. The staff is sweet and the service is great!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review Maddison.

name: Rhonda Toothaker
text: Had a very pleasant experience at Middle Creek.  Wait time was short and the staff were all very nice and caring. Highly recommend them if you are ever in need of medical care.

name: Alan Riethmaier
text: I appreciate this clinic because I feel like the staff takes time and listens to me.  Much appreciated!

name: Taikia Caffee
text: This is the best place ever!! The people are very nice and respectful! Was in and out in about a hour or so! But this was my first visit and I will be returning!!

name: Nicole King
text: No complaints at all... Great doctors and great staff.  I highly recommend them.

name: Lou Ann Scoggins
text: I rather go to Middle Creek than my own doctor, because they actually are concerned and listen. I could go to other Urgent Care Facilities but choose to go here because I trust them, have always cured my ailments!

name: carla busbee
text:
Recently had a bicycle wreck at Oak Mtn and was seen at Middle Creek by Dr. Woodward for minor cuts and bruises and r/o a fractured arm. The doctors and nurses are always fabulous, always accommodating and caring.  They are fast too!
I appreciate Dr. Woodward for approaching each visit thoroughly and methodically.  He always takes the side of extreme caution, and I like that kind of doctor because I can trust that his process will take him through all the options and potential outcomes.

name: Josh Defnall
text: Ive been here 3 times. Twice for the flu and once for a bad Sinus infection. They really do take good care of you and if their is a wait its worth it. fixed me right up and got me feeling better!

name: Angela Johnston
text: My husband was seen on a Thursday at this so called medical care facility.  He had a  terrible stomach virus that our whole family seemed to keep passing through the house.  He came home telling me that the staff acted like it was a problem for them for him to be sick.  They were in no hurry to help him or acted like they seemed to really care what was wrong.  After he was finally seen and treated he requested a work excuse.  The lady at the desk told him that they had wrote it for that day but if he still wasn't feeling well and needed it extended to just let them know and he could come by Friday and pick one up for Friday.  Of course he wasn't feeling well still Friday and being a coalminer the last place you want to be with a stomach virus is in the mine.  When we went to pick up the excuse Friday the receptionist went back to talk to the nurse.  He was told they could not extend they excuse after he was told they would.  When he tried to explain what he was told the day before the nurse practitioner stormed to the front desk with an awful attitude and was very loud with him.   Not once did my husband come across being rude just wanted to let the receptionist know what he was told by the one that was there the day before.   I have worked in patient care facilities and if I ever treated a patient the way my husband was treated I would have been looking for a new job.  It really irritates me to know that these people could be so cruel to someone especially when they need there care so much.  The people here should really think about how they treat the patients they see, because at the end of the day it's because of them they have a job.

name: LaDara Lee
text: The staff was very concerned and caring when providing me with wound care! They answered all of my questions and communicated with me even past the end of my treatment.

name: Lauren Hyche
text: Staff goes the extra mile.  Dr. Woodward is thorough and professional.   Great doctor!

name: Johnny Rhodes
text: Checked open/close times on website and it said they closed at 6PM. I drove my sick wife the 40 minute trip and arrived at 5:36 pm only to be told they stop taking patients  at 5:30 pm. Which means they close at 5:30 pm. Maybe this will save someone else a long  drive for nothing.

resp.text: Thank you for helping us correct this issue. There was a duplicate google account, one of the accounts had incorrect clinic hours displayed. We are very sorry for the inconvenience.

name: Courtney Newman
text: The worst service I've ever experienced. Avoid this place at all costs. The 5 star reviews look fraudulent.

name: Cindy Conti
text: My husband went there on a Wednesday at 5 pm to have his back looked at. They told him he had just made it in before they closed, the door said they closed at 7. The dr was pulling him back before he could even pay his co pay. The dr told him they were trying to get out the door. He was there for 10 minutes tops and all the dr did was give him two rx without even checking what was ailing him. He was is such a hurry to get my husband out the door that he let him out the side fire exit so that they didn't have to open the front door. We always use middles creek but not after today.

name: Lisa Coker George
text: Ive used MCMC since they opened in 2007. The staff have always been extremely nice and professional. The physicians are top notch and always very attentive to our concerns. I know that they have to see alot of people each day and with the convenience to us as patients not having to make an appointment and being able to be seen on the weekends and after we get off work, I know as a parent this is priceless. I cant take off work everytime my child is sick nor do I want to have the horrible wait of the ED. So I would just like to thank each and every staff member of MCMC for your hard work and dedication of being away from your own family to help mine. :)

name: Stephanie White
text: My expierence was very dissapoining.  I went to the Mdical Center after pulling a muscle in my back.  I was greeted nicely enough but waited over an hour to be taken back to an examination room.  THe intake nurse was very nice and accomodating. I saw a nurse practioner who did a few things to examin me then ordered x-rays.  I waited quite a while for the x-ray tech who did hid job efficienty.  After changing and sitting quite a while for the doctor, he showed up.  He came in and asked me how I was (duh I was in pain) and ask me where I hurt then asid my x-rays looked good. Then he left. No instructions or even suggestions on how to take care of my back.  A nurse came in with a shot that I was not told I was getting and was in and out in less than two minutes.  The nursing staff was cold and not caring.  After wasting 3 hours in thier establishment and not given the  care I feel I  dedserved I will be sure not to EVER go back and also, if asked by others, I will not reccomend this treatment facility.  Its quite a shame as they are right down the street but I would rather drive to Hoover or Homewood to get treatment.

name: Chris Pence
text: I'd rather die next time than to have to deal with the staff again. Snobby, stuck up and have bad attitudes.

name: Tamar Sanders
text: Horrible! Something isn't right with that lab

name: Jada King
text: Fantastic staff and great care!!

name: Ladd Lagrone
text: I would rather die than try a get help from them.

name: Steph steph
text: Just went to AFC for rapid test and also for them to see my daughter for an issue. The experience was 5-star from beginning to end. Staff was nice and took very good care of us both. Melanie, the nurse practitioner, was amazing with my daughter and made her feel at ease. Will def go back in the future.

resp.text: Hey Steph, We're delighted to hear about your experience! We're thrilled that you had a 5-star experience at our location. As always, our team is looking forward to your next visit. Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Josh Boozer
text: Presented on 5/18 with large boil on lower left cheek.   Requested specifically for it to be lanced because I needed immediate relief.   It drained some throughout the night while sleeping on wet washcloth with heating pad under it.   Nurse Practitioner came in looked at it, felt it, remarked on how big it was yet refused to lance it.   She offered to give me a shot which is good but would not have provided the immediate relief I went there for, so I left.   Went across the street to Doctors Care and Dr. Wilcox incised and drained it and the relief was instant.

name: Donna Bush
text: Service was great. I have an issue with them taking money every month out of my checking account. It said I authorized this. Ive not received a bill and do have issue. Anyone else have this problem? I'm going to stop the payments coming out of my account but everyone read what your signing.

name: Alecia Basile
text:
Called. No one picked up. Called again. They forwarded my call immediately. Called a third time. They answered and hung up on me.
However, once you finally get in, the nurse practitioners are wonderful. I felt like she really listened to my questions and did her best to care for me.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you had difficulties trying to reach us by telephone. If you would like to try calling and speaking to the center administrator about this she would be more than happy to try and assist you. Thank you for leaving a review!

name: Justin Maddox
text: The staff here is wonderful and always friendly and helpful with whatever you need.There is never any issues in getting the care needed, they are the best in town.

resp.text: Hi Justin, Thanks for the great review! It is truly touching to know you think so highly of us! We look forward to providing you with more great experiences in the near future. It was a pleasure to serve you.

name: bart johnson
text: The staff were very friendly and attentive.  They saw to my need very quickly. If I am sick or need urgent care again I would not hesitate to come back here.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Amanda R
text:
Unreliable rapid Covid-19 test: I received a false positive Covid-19 test result at this clinic (confirmed to be false by two subsequent rapid tests and two PCR tests). The test used (Abbott ID Now) has a near zero false positive rate when a qualified technician runs the test. The AFC clinician I saw also told me that there was no way it was a false positive. However, I was told by a clinician at one of my follow up tests that the only way to get a false positive on the Abbott now protocol is if the sample is contaminated or if samples are mixed up. From this, I concluded that the AFC clinician/technician made a mistake, one that was quite costly for me both financially (I spent $450 in follow up testing) and emotionally (I feared I had exposed my elderly parents). I would recommend using a different clinic for a rapid test.

I was also disappointed in their safety protocols vis-a-vis Covid. The front office staff's mask compliance is very poor (some without masks, others with it below the nose), and they have all patients congregate at the check in. During my visit, I spent about 20 minutes just a foot away from another patient who ultimately tested positive (which I know because I heard them give him the results -- so much for privacy).

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to 256-485-0982 so we can rectify this issue.

name: Patrick Connor
text: Was a good facility the first time I went. This time, I have an infected ingrown toenail and need to see a doctor. Walked in at 10:30 and the front desk lady told everyone that she needed time to register all the people still waiting. She wouldn’t be taking anyone until 1:30pm. I went and got a haircut, and went shopping at Walmart and came back at 1:20 to see what was happening. I went to the front desk while the blond lady with glasses was chatting with someone at the window. After they finished talking I asked if I could see the doctor and was told that she hadn’t even finished the first page and that the time was extended. She wasn’t very sympathetic and a bit rude considering I had been driving around waiting for hours and my toe hurt. I ended up going to an urgent care in rainbow city where they actually cared about there patients.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at American Family Care - Gadsden (256) 485-0983 to speak to our manager directly.

name: Amy Brown
text:
Worst experience ever!  Went in for a possible broken rib due to a fall and they wrote it up as “back pain”.  My back was not even hurting.
Tried for 3 days to call them back to fix it and they wouldn’t answer the phone.  It rang and rang and then would be busy.
I also was the ONLY CAR there And went straight back to a room after signing in.  (Where I would WAIT ONE HOUR on an X-ray and then another 30 minutes on doc and results?)
Meanwhile I could hear nurses and staff “cutting up” outside my door. This place is terrible and I never ever have given anyone a review like this.
I just feel something needs to be done about the way they treat their patients.  It’s rediculous.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Becky Gay
text:
My husband needed stitches and we went to AmFam in Gadsden. I paid the copay with my credit card. About a month later I got a statement from AmFam showing that they charged the entire amount of the visit to my credit card instead of insurance.
The bottom line here is that they have no incentive to refile to insurance because they already have their money-they just charged my credit card a month later.
The billing department will not answer the phone. The office manager is not available.

name: J V
text: They just want the copay. Been using them for over a year because of convienince. Haven’t been seen by the actual doctor once, always the nurse practitioner. Have ignored my complaints about medication, I can only assume it’s because they get a kickback for pushing certain medications. Requested a week extension on my medication till I could get into the office for a checkup, they wouldn’t do it. I’ve never had these issues with any doctors office before them. I’m currently seeking out a REAL health clinic. I’d stay away from this one if I was you.

name: jenny alverson
text: I took my 9yr old son in 1/24/2020. We were greeted by Richard and Ashley at the front desk very friendly staff and helpful. Thank you,  Richard and Ashley for going the extra mile. Richard also kept an eye on my son while I ran out to the car to grab him some water, which I thought was very nice and Comforting. The staff in the back was equally nice and caring towards me and my son. Kayla, April, Erica, and Dr Crowe. Thank y’all some much for going the extra mile. We did not feel rushed or just another number to get in and out. The Dr. took time with my son and even struck up a conversation with him about his favorite subject. The staff talked and joked with him also. To a kid that feels bad and has to Endure throat swabs and nose swabs they made it easy and bearable. I would definitely recommend and will definitely go back.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: Martha Varner
text: Before covid we received great care from this and the Oxford location. however we have been four times in the past month with my husband experiencing dizziness, muscle spasms, headache, extreme fatigue, nausea, ear pain, stomach pain, and diarreah. They can't see past covid enough to notice that the symptoms he has are all side effects and allergic reactions to a medication they prescribed two months ago! My husband has been out of work for three weeks and could lose his job because they didn't even attempt to treat him. We will not be returning to this location or the oxford location.  Also, we have shown signs of having ear infections and literally have to ask for treatment. My daughter presented with a swollen throat and ended up having tonsillitis diagnosed at a different urgent care. The nurse practitioner didn't even feel her neck to check if it was swollen.

name: Controlled Chaos.
text: The receptionist is amazing but my experience has been horrible. I came in on Saturday (6/13/2020) for a DOT physical, after the physical was completed they couldn't get the paperwork to print off. They asked me to come back in on Monday because they couldn't get it fixed until then. I called 1st thing on Monday and they said they where printing it off. Then I arrived around 10:30 and was told they where still working on it, I said I would go into Walmart to pick up a few things I returned at 11:20 and the receptionist said it was almost ready. Then at 12:10 she called me up to the counter and said it would be a little while because all the rooms where full and she said it was on the doctors desk so I don't understand what I'm waiting on!! for her to sign it or what but if it's not ready by 1:00 I'll be demanding a refund and I'll go somewhere else. In the meantime at least two more patients have walked in requesting a covid-19 test because they've been exposed the longer I wait on her to sign a piece of paper the higher my chances of becoming exposed become.

name: Lady Bird
text: The staff was very polite, respectful and friendly. The facility was clean and welcoming. Any questions I had they answered and if they didn't know, they went and found out for certain before just telling me anything. I would highly recommend this urgent practice. They don't just try to rush you out and half step.

name: Gloria Bradberry
text:
PEOPLE BE LEARY OF USING THIS FACILITY

The staff refused to take Medicare at the Oxford office as he lost his card but call Birmingham Corp office next day she took over phone and filed.
They required $175.00 payment up front before seeing him.
We were the third party in line when we arrived.  They called the first two back then we were called back.  Put in last room on the hall.  When they did not check back I asked how much longer.  They had us down with 8 people in front of us.  I raised cain so the doctor saw us next.
Now that Medicare and blue cross have paid they are refusing to return then $175.00 less the $o.64 blue cross says he owes.
HOPE WE DO NOT HAVE TO RETURN

I am extremely disappointed with how this office is currently ran because I thought I had found a great Dr and staff.

name: Melanie New
text:
I've been past from doctor to doctor and finally met with Dr. Brown by accident in Oxford. I will gladly drive to Gadsden to make sure I get the right treatment.
I've seen her now probably 5 times and treated me with respect and sending me to the correct doctors to get a proper diagnosis.
My words cannot express the sincerity when she looked over my records from me being sick over a yr with no full diagnosis.
Can't thank her enough for not shoving me out the door saying she doesn't know what's wrong with me.
I'd recommend her to anyone.
Was just seen on a Friday evening for upper respiratory issues got a breathing treatment 2 shots and at a reasonable pace. Staff were wonderful. Thank you Dr. Brown and Staff. Yes even the one that administered the shots. Yep OUCH. BUT I do feel some better today.

resp.text: Melanie New, thank you for the high star rating!

text: First visit there.  I had been turned away at 4:00 from the place I regularly go and they didn't close until 5:30.  It was frustrating and I went in ready to give a new place a try.  Staff was extremely friendly and competent.  I was seen quickly and have always had a much longer wait at my regular place.  I was also given a prescription discount card which was nice.  I know 4 other patients also came in after me that were turned away from the same place.  If they all had experience as good as mine I'm sure AFC has gotten several new customers.  Thank you!

name: Anthony Noah
text: Our toddler spiked an extremely high fever on a Sunday afternoon. Our pediatrician was closing so we decided to go to AFC Gadsden instead of the ER! It was a great decision! Dr Cole quickly offered us several options for treatment and got our little one feeling better that evening. Our total time in office was barely 45 minutes. The copay for a ER visit would have been 5x the office visit copay!!! Thank you all for taking such good care of our family!!!

resp.text: Anthony, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Gadsden! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

text: I saw NP Beck and had a lovely short/dark haired nurse who did xrays of my neck. Wish I'd caught her name-- she is hilarious. You just want to hug them both. Liked them instantly. I'm a ball of nerves and they were very kind and patient with me😘. Hannah administered 3 shots with skill! Thank you girl! And this morning Alexa called just to check on me. How sweet?! So I was able to tell her what was working, what is not, how I'm coping, etc. And she said she would pass info to NP Beck. Healing from an injury is a process made more complicated when you have children to care for, and even though I'm still hurting I had to take the time to give them the 5 stars they deserve--L. Mosley❤

name: Vivian Downs
text: This is the arc in front of walmart: we walked in on a Sunday and the facility was empty. I felt relieved because I thought maybe they could see me pretty quick.  We go up to the front desk and no one is there. So we wait. And wait. And wait. Finally my boyfriend calls the front office and gets someone to come up. No apology for our having to be there for a while after I explained we had been waiting and never been to an afc  before. I tell the woman I don't have insurance. She goes over how much it will be. I decide maybe I should wait till the morning so I have time to get the money together. She had her lunch in her hand so I didn't feel comfortable bothering her anymore. We step out and I think about it and decide I should be able to manage the payment. We go back in she is gone. We wait a little bit again and then we call the front office. This time she doesn't come up and in fact, no one ever shows back up. It left me feeling like maybe that's how the service there in general was. As someone who has a fear of going to the doctor anyway, this lack of attention spooked me a little.

resp.text: Vivian Downs, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (256) 485-0982. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Hung Tran
text: Doctors and Nurses here are awesome. However, billing department is horrible. I am an active duty service member. Our family is insured with Tricare Prime which covers 100%. My wife goes to this clinic because the location is convenient and the clinicians are great. Two weeks ago we received a letter from American Family Care stating that the amount of $54.66 has been sent to collection. I was shocked. Called the clinic and they give me the number for billing the department. Call the billing department and one of the lady who happened to be super rude picked up the phone after I waited 45 min told me that the amount of $54.66 we owned is the deductible. I tried to explain to her that with Tricare Prime there is no out of pocket cost at all. She told me to call Tricare and ask one of the Tricare representative to give her a call. Called Tricare, the representative from Tricare said that they are a receiving call center only, they don't make call out to other people. Asked Tricare about that $54.66, they explained to me that the billing department from AFC mess up the claim. Instead of filling the claim under my regular PCM, they filed it under another physician who wasn't a primary care physician at that time. That's why Tricare didn't process the entire claim amount. Instead of reprocess the claim, no one from AFC ever go back to take a look at the claim but instead decide to bill me the remaining amount. Tricare advise me to call AFC and make a conference call while everyone is on the line so Tricare rep can walk someone from AFC billing department through how to reprocess the claim to resolve the problem. Called back to AFC billing department and talk to someone name David. I explained the entire process to him again and he said he will make some note and transfer the case over to someone who can resolve the problem and I should expect a call back either later that day or the day after. Guess what, today is 2 weeks later and still haven't heard anything from them. Tried to call the "patient advocate" number from whoever gave the number to Carol Peppers on the comment below and just as I expected "the number you have called can no longer received voice mail".  Wowwww that just blew my mind. Didn't see that coming at all.

resp.text: Hung Tran, we regret that you had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. Please call our manager directly at (256) 485-0982 for ways we can work towards resolving these issues. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

text: Wonderful

name: Rarity 2412
text: Went here as a quick in and out visit that was the opposite of what I received. The receptionist was very unprofessional acted like i was bothering her to do her job. She was very rude had an attitude. No one was in the lobby when I arrived. About 10-15mins I was escorted to a room. Waited almost an hour to be seen. The staff was just talking among each other laughing. The walls are very thin I heard someone say oh I forgot. Then it got quiet and shortly after a nurse practitioner came into the room. This is the most unprofessional place I have ever been in. I would not recommend this place or ever go back.

name: Devon Suns
text:
Pharmacy is actually shockingly fast and nice.

Urgent care side is unprofessional and slow. I left a review on a duplicate of this address I guess, the last time I was there. It took half an hour to find out I couldn't get a covid test without a doctor recommendation so I went somewhere else. Which is not their fault, but they could have just looked at my insurance card when I handed it to them before I filled out all the paperwork and saved me some time and annoyance. One girl was unmasked and the unbothered receptionist kept pulling hers down to talk to me. I got tested somewhere else and was positive so real good that I wore MY mask correctly the entire time. Also one of the nurses was preparing a syringe in the lobby doorway which is the biggest yikes I've ever seen at a medical office.

name: carolyn s
text:
I got there at 10 am, the lobby was full and I didn’t want to sit near anyone (this place sees a lot of covid testing) and they have the option to sit in your car and then call when it’s your turn. They didn’t call the number I provided instead they called my parents because I still use their insurance and their info is attached to mine. Not only was it a huge violation of privacy for me but I waited in my car for two hours before calling back, and then had to wait an additional hour in the lobby before being seen. I was also very upset and crying in the lobby the whole time and two people who came in after me once I sat in the lobby were seen before me. I was finally seen around 1:15.

I had a final exam that day and this made it one of the most stressful days of of my life. The receptionist wasn’t very kind and this mistake (both my own and the receptionist) was hugely violating and upsetting for me.

name: Lauren Badia
text: Gloria was truly amazing! She’s super helpful and nice.

name: cynethia Evans
text: I haven't had any experience with the walk in clinic at Quick Care but Mark and April are the best.  It would be hard to find faster or better customer service at another pharmacy.

name: john hryniewicz
text: I have had nothing but great service here.The staff is great and there HRT wellness plan is great .

name: Daphne Arthur
text: Whenever I am sick and need urgent care I come here. They are always so nice and professional. They get you in quickly and are very caring.

name: wendy troutt
text: Would not recommend!!!! Never again. Waiting on lab results and never get any answers!!! Continuity get the run around

name: Bobby Scheppler
text: Dr there is great. Explains everything out in black and white...would have given 5 stars if it wasnt for the girl behind the desk. No manners. It was like, me coming to the Dr's office inconvenienced her. Ridiculous.

name: Kimberly Baxter
text: I am sure it is fine for an urgent care.  That being said please read if you are going there for wellness, weight loss or hormone therapy!!  Save yourself A LOT of money, possibility of your system being messed up and also the possibility of being given medications that can cause cancer and go to an Endocrinologist!  I have found out that Dr Campbell is an anesthesiologist, not a hormone and wellness DR!!!.  I went there for help and was told I was severely low in all of my hormones and was put on Armour Thyroid, hormone creams, HGH shots(which was $300 a month by itself) and a whole lot of other medications and supplements.  Thankfully it was only for a few months because my husband took a different job in NASA and we moved away.  I found myself an Endocrinologist here after being off of all my meds for 6 months and got new labs done.  I gave the Endocrinologist my old labs Dr Campbell did and the new Dr said that Dr Campbell didn't even run the correct tests to determine I had hypothyroidism, low HGH or other low hormones!!!!  I do not have hypothyroidism or low sex hormones.  We have ruled out several things and are still in search of what is going on with me, but at least I am not being given incorrect medications that would cause serious harm had I still been taking them under Dr Campell.

name: Hannah Land
text: Kind, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff!

name: Emily Ratcliff
text: Fantastic experience at the clinic. Very attentive, caring, thorough care from the RN and NP. I was very impressed with their attitudes (I came in close to closing on a Friday), their professionalism, and their kindness. I was in severe pain when I arrived and they made sure I received prompt, accurate care.  They also were very kind to include my husband in the conversations, plan. I will definitely return if I ever need care again! Cannot say enough nice things.

name: Jordan Leather
text: Expect to wait over 2 hours in your car for covid testing. Horribly slow process.

name: Samantha Taylor
text: I’m really puzzled by all these 5 star reviews, they almost seem fake to me. This place is horrible. I was there earlier to try to get a simple refill on my insulin prescription. I have been there many times within the past year so I am an established patient. They have written me this prescription before. I explained to them that I was unable to get in touch with my endocrinologist and so I needed a refill on my insulin. I am type 1 diabetic, so if I don’t have insulin, I will die. The woman working up front very rudely told me that because of the type of insurance plan I have, I would need to have a referral to even be seen by them in the first place. I told her I have been seen here many times before without a referral. She shrugged and said “well I don’t know WHO allowed YOU to be seen” . I asked her what I was supposed to do and she said “go to the emergency room” and continued to eat her lunch and ignore me. Never again will I go this place. Horrible and rude staff that obviously do not care about patients and their well-being.

name: Pam Harnden
text: Very nice staff but the physician didn’t appear to know how assess my injury and then offered me a myriad of drugs that seemed totally out of line. Had to take an extra X-ray because the machine “was old and not working” according to the nurse. Didn’t use a lead protection apron until I asked for one and then it didn’t cover my thyroid as it was just a lap pad.  Filthy bathroom with no hand towels. I would not return or recommend this place to anyone!

name: Heather Libhart
text: I have been to this Urgent Care twice when I was unable to see my primary doctor as a walk in. Each time service was quick and effective. This second visit was exceptionally wonderful. The male nurse (which I have not been seen by a male nurse a lot, and I’m sorry I don’t remember his name) had great bedside manners and I didn’t feel uncomfortable. He was quick and personable. The nurse practitioner Mrs. Patterson was absolutely delightful and checked all areas being affected. Very professional and thorough. Prescribed me medications in case antibiotics aggravated a yeast infection, BLESS HER. Everyone has been incredibly friendly. I would recommend this clinic to anyone.

name: Ron Burgundy
text: Fast, $20 BCBS AL copay, pharm inside. Perfect for when you need attention quickly. Erin went above and beyond by doing a follow-up the next day and performed a quick treatment the following day. She's my favorite. ☺️

name: Carla Davis
text:
Second experience four stars: decided to give this walk in clinic another shot cause I didn't have time to go elsewhere and glad I did. This visit was much better. Male nurse was great he seemed knowledgeable and has good bedside manner. The physician was okay she provided fast service and I would return for very basic easy to diagnose emergency issues. I wouldn't use this clinic for major diagnostic problems though but if you need refills or antibiotics for a virus they are quick and competent. Pharmacy were fastand nice too.
First experience was a one star and here is that review: Worst experience ever, this sad excuse for an urgent care facility should be shut down.
As you can see, they do not care about client feedback because there are absolutely no responses to the reviews anywhere online and in person they definitely do not care about people. They do care about sales however as every question I asked about my care was averted to the pharmacist trying to sell their diet plan. The receptionist was rude and belittled me for not going to my regular DR. Who was not in town. Never again.

name: MaidintheCity CleaningServices
text: I will never go to this clinic again! I drove one hour from my job to get seen by this clinic before they closed at 8pm. I arrived at 6:15 with ear pain along with flu symptoms. This clinic closes at 8 pm and I was turned away by the receptionist because they had four people waiting and “all the rooms were full”. Okay, so I asked the receptionist to contact her manager because I needed to be seen. The NP was very rude and said they can’t see me because we want to leave and go home at 8 pm. As time pasted by they continued to call three people back to be seen. But they told me all their rooms were full to capacity. Another patient came in behind me with flu symptoms and she told them her insurance will expire at midnight. They told her and myself to go to Huntsville Main.  While all of this is going there was one person waiting in the lobby. The lady behind me (the one with the flu symptoms) said another clinic will take patients up to 7:45 off Bob Wallace. We both got in our cars, before we drove off the receptionist called the last patient waiting to the back. I’m actually glad I wasn’t seen at your facility, it was a terrible experience with NO sympathy to the customer behind me.

name: LeLe Skinner
text: This is the best place to go for any pharmaceutical needs. They have the friendliest staff of any pharmacy I have ever been to. You can tell they aren't just out for your money! They actually care about you & your health!!  I recommend this place over any of the other pharmacies. If you have never been there give them a try. I promise you'll forever be a customer of theirs.

name: Mint2Bee Bus
text: Dr. Campbell and Brett are amazing as is the rest of their crew.  I have lost 61 pounds in 3 1/2 months and I am still working towards my goal weight.  I have 57 lbs left to go and I am sure I will hit that by mid summer.  I have been losing in a very healthy way and my health has improved drastically.

name: Andrew Scott
text: I don't recommend this clinic to anyone. They over charge for all thuer supplements first off. More importantly they will change things up on you without giving any notice in which they seem to do frequently and then not inform you. You will show up to the clinic and find out there's been a change at the last minute. Also some of the employees there seem to be very rude. If you do choose this clinic watch out for a girl named Hailey. She is one of the rudest employee s there. Terrible experience overall. This clinic gets the negative star for -1 😂

name: Bradley Schrimsher
text: Amazing experience!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. This was my first visit and within five minutes they had called me and 3 other people back to run vitals. This is the fastest urgent care I have been to and highly recommend to anyone in a hurry.

name: Linda Speer
text:
Horrible experience, unprofessional staff- clinics like this are the reason people go to the ER for a sniffle!

After waiting for over an hour on an early Tuesday morning, we were finally taken to the back. The male tech (nurse?) turned my child's arms into a sieve with the number of times he jabbed her arms (he insisted that a blood test was the best was to test for flu), trying to get a vein. Then, when we notified him we needed a vomit tray due to being queasy from all the arm jabbing, he ignored us and we were made to clean our own vomit off the floor. He laughed and asked if I was hungover!!! I was completely shocked at this and I gathered my child and left immediately. I called and reported him to the owner, but only got a "Sorry about that" response.

The clinic never did call to let us know what the blood work showed and I did pay for the visit and test. I called them a couple of days after the visit and they said they couldn't find the results. I wish I could give a negative star rating b/c that is what this clinic deserves.

name: Lucas Roberson
text: Very professional easy transition in and out get what u need and go with reasonable prices and everyone is nice wether on the phone or in person

name: rhonda sisco
text: This has been a total change in my life, from all the supplements to the prescriptions  I feel like a human again. Thank you Dr. Campbell for all your help and the wonderful caring staff. These people truly care about the wellbeing of their patients.

name: No one Important
text: Quickest pharmacy i have ever been to. Pharmacy staff are polite and knowledgeable. Would recommend.

name: Patricia Thomas
text: I had a great staff to address my sickness today. The wait time was expected since it is the flu/cold season. My male nurse Josh was excellent in drawing my blood first drawcame the blood needed.  It usually takes 3-4 times due to rolling veins. I would recommend this Quick Care to everyone because I am hard to please. 😍😍😍

name: Matt England
text: I use Quick Care basically as my primary Dr.  Never had anything but correct diagnoses and aggressive treatment to get me back to work.  Brett in the pharmacy is as knowledgeable as some Dr's in my opinion.  Dr. Campbell and the staff have been awesome to me and my wife.

name: Benny Dupree
text: Best Pharmacy in town!!! Friendly and fast service. Pretty reasonable prices as well.

name: Kevin Reed
text: I've done business with the owner/pharmacist for many years and I have been 100% satisfied everytime I deal with him. I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes to get in and see the doctor or nurse practitioner. This is the only pharmacy/quick care that I deal with since they opened.

name: Alan Shaw
text: The website says patients are admitted up to 5:00pm, but this not true at all. I arrived at 4:30pm sharp, and was turned away. There was only one other person waiting. They didn't even ask why I was coming to visit. Want someone that cares? Do not go to this place.

name: Amber Smartt
text: Great place, wonderful pharmacy staff!

name: Fiery Opal
text: This is a great place.  Friendly and extremely knowledgeable people running it.  They will get the best prices for you as well.

name: Sherri Goodwin
text: Pharmacy staff is awesome; however, I was refused service by the mefical staff. The hours of opration say open till 6:00 pm. I was told we see our last patient at 5:15, but we just added two at 5:30 and since I didn't get here till 5:37, I couldn't be seen. Hate to think it was racial, but no one in the office or anyone waiting was of the same race as me. Sounds like a call to the office mgr on Monday...

name: Paul Burns
text: Pharmacy staff is always friendly and quick.  They are cheaper than other pharmacies when it comes to prescriptions not covered by insurance.

name: Angel Starlin
text: Best pharmacist ever!  Fast friendly sercice and if brett cant compound it and show you how yourself then no one can I promise that!!!

name: Jeremiah Leslie
text: I did not even get to sign my name down before I was spoken to very rudely and humiliated by the receptionist in front of visitors and staff. WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND. It was obvious that this "Urgent Care" clinic does not care for those with URGENT situations.

name: Jen Hann
text: Daughter had to call in sick today because of intense ear pain from a cold that she’s had for almost 2 weeks.  The dr there didn’t even look in her ear.  Said it hurts because she’s a smoker!!  I also went there when I hurt my back and he didn’t even touch it.  He also said it was caused by my smoking.  Also, because I take pain meds, got the speech I was going to end up on a street corner buying heroin!!  Call first to make sure someone else is there.  These fresh out of med school Drs only preach about not smoking and rampant drug use when you’re there for a simple ear infection!!

name: Trent Thomas
text: Easy and professional, I would recommend Quick Care to anyone.  Always clean and new equipment.

name: Christopher Stewart
text: Been a couple times now and received prompt and friendly service.

name: Amber gibbs
text: Always have taken good care of me and my family good pharmacist and good dr

name: Coming in Hot Kenny
text: This is no more than a band-aid station. Went in because I had a rash on my face and was in extreme pain. First things first I was seen by a nurse practishioner not a real DR, which should tell you right off the bat this person can't prescribe real meds if you needed them, only non narcotics. Any way the NURSE (not Dr.) Proceeds to tell me it's a bacterial  infection from a bug bite. (This retard must have got her education at walmart) so she proceeded to give me a steroid shot and antibiotics. Well 3 days later I'm in worse shape than before, so I go to the ER, the DR. walks right up and in 3 seconds says you have shingles and it's in your eye as well and can cause you to go blind if not treated. Moral of the story go see a REAL DR. These idiots almost cost me my vision in my left eye. I mean it was the shingles....anybody who is in the medical field should be able to diagnose something as common as shingles, anybody but these guys.

name: Seth Presley
text:
At a later date a full review will be written as such is deserved. I can tell you the people at this establishment make it 100% the only place I go for pharmaceutical medicines and advice, as well as treatment. I will have to write a longer testimonial siting some ezamples of why you would want to comr5
come to Quick Care Clinic before and Pharmacy instead of the big chains that seem to monopolize your health care. I will do that when I have first taken care of some other business, mainly that I just moved and am looking for steady work. So this is the short version of what I will share at a later date.

You should give your Healthcare business to this astoundingly responsible, empathic, knowledgeable, well managed, clean, convenient and kind establishment. Did I leave out experienced? Decades in the multitudes.

Respectfully, when I say you should give your business to quick care, I believe it almost to be an automatic misnomer due to the English language & grammatical flows. Truthfully the minute you walk through that door you will find that the people inside earn your business, and you will not be giving anything. You have nothing to lose, and but a world of good to gain. I stake my word on this. Not enough can be said here with the time that I have. Until I have a full testimonial written up explaining how they have changed my life for the better, I suggest that you trust in what I say in "brevity"... Cough... *um I'm kind of long winded*... Cough.. I (note: I didn't really cough... But if I were coughing I'd go to the clinic at quick care...) lol

Respectfully, This clinic is not a standard business. They don't treat you like your someone trying to damage their profit margin. It's quite amazing. They treat you like family. Every single employee is vetted by the owner who is there seemingly from open to close. A truly great man who has surrounded himself with employees so capable he could be off sipping margaritas in Rosorita. But he doesn't do that.

These people get their feel good from helping you and me get well. It's truly remarkable to find such a Gem amongst so much cold and igneous ruffage, splayed out into the deep horizon. Now I said brevity earlier.. And because of how good this place is, it's just hard to say less than you've read here. These people care about health and will care about you. I urge you to go here and see for your self.

Standard info : they take most insurances. They have the best Pharmacy team in town and are license profesionals. They have a walk in clinic, and multiple, highly skilled and experienced doctors. GOOD DOCTORS.( I don't think I've ever seen a pharmaceutical rep trying to sway opinions in the place even once. Every other place I've been it's maddening. Big pharma is there smooozing with the decision makers... Buying lunches and giving away expensive travel packages to get them to start prescribing you some new med that's more expensive than the others that do the same thing with less side effects.) No blonde hair rolling briefcase bombshells messing with your treatment walk these halls. They are with a sense of humor that's quite good. Going in feels like visiting friends. Best bedside and counterside manner I've ever seen. highly interested and driven skilled individuals who are not only the practitioners, but also patients. These are doctors that take their own medicine. That is to say; they would perscribe treatment to themselves or their loved ones exactly as they would to you.  I am 199% convinced of their convictions, and that they know what they are talking, doing and recommending to you about health. And when they don't know something.... They don't prioritize and lean on ego, and brush off your questions, and do a hat and dance show. NO! INSTEAD: I have had a conversation like this while in treatment, "I don't know about this area of the suggested treatments.. So let me confer with a specialist who is a friend of mine and I'll be right back. Please wait here five minutes. Would you like some water?".

So in essence I'm saying...

GO HERE!

name: Joseph Ridenhour
text: They got back to me to resolve a coding issue on the bill that involved an annual physical incentive benefit.

name: Tammylea Aldridge
text: Nice friendly caring people ''''

name: Jason Gleaner (Salt Yeeter)
text: Great people.

name: ElamCo Inc.
text: Called to ask if they were busy, placed on hold for 9 minutes, I hung up.

name: C. Anne
text: Fantastic staff, very clean, super efficient.

name: Casey Jones
text: Usually we have no issues with this place but the last visit really did it for me. The lady in the front office didn’t wanna do her job & had an ugly poor attitude. The heavy set woman doctor we seen acted clueless. It was just an easy money pit. I’m now taking my kids to their regular doctor to get the issue fixed. That was just a quick money stop at their clinic. Ive never had a doctor tell me they didn’t know. If you don’t know, look further into the issue until the patient is fixed!

name: Jaime ford cross
text: First and last time visiting this location. Tried to do online registration from parking lot. Server error tells me to come inside and register. Talk to girl working the desk and explained and she was rude. Gave me the tablet and I register and go back out and wait. I noticed people register after me getting in and out. Check online and she had me register for Brewton.  When I went back inside very rude and told me to register again and wait outside. I would not recommend  this location to anyone.

name: Sara hennings
text: Poor customer experience. Courtney Lambert at the Andalusia clinic is horrible. They should not be advertising that they do Workman's comp.

name: Tina Roberts
text: Being new to the area we do not have family Doctors yet. I tried to take my daughter in to have an abscess looked at. They assure you on the voicemail that once they text you to come in they take you straight back to a room. Front desk said we’d be in quick because we were not COVID. That did NOT happen. I got the text, waited 15 min, surrounded by COVID PATIENTS, I said we were gonna wait outside. She said they are getting ready to take her back. 15 more min of waiting in a corner. After that we left. I called and told them we were canceling and why. They didn’t seem to care when I called. That is not COVID prevention. Why didn’t THEY stay in THEIR cars? I’ve had it and don’t want my daughter to get it at all or I get it again. If we do I blame them.

name: L L
text: we received our first covid vaccination, the process of signing up and scheduling was fine the staff were very nice and courteous and the person that administered our shots was very nice and very professional i highly recommend the andalusia location (where we went) to get vaccinated

name: Crystal Mcneill
text: I sat there from 8:45 to 12 to get "rapid results" 😡 also charges double the other clinic Wich I didn't know until afterwards. The staff was friendly but it was ridiculous.

name: Lynn Fehr
text: Went in today for covid test . I had my response within 15minutes.  They gave me a full exam. Several prescriptions.  This was not just a your positive here's you results Dr. Very caring.

name: Bekah Jenson
text: All the staff was more than helpful and reasonable considering they were at full capacity for covid testing. Patients were able to wait in their cars to ensure they didn’t overheat and the wait was perfectly acceptable for the conditions they worked with. The nurse and doctor/practitioner were kind and moved as quickly as they were able to. Highly recommend this team!

resp.text: Thank you, Bekah!

name: Olivia Mitchell
text: Sat in the hot car for 2 and a half hours waiting to get covid test I got the text to come inside and was informed they reached their "max" on covid test. Could have told me that before I had to sit in the hot car for 2 and a half hours waiting.

name: Brandon Ward
text: I wasn’t too happy about my visit. I came for rapid Covid testing and it took over two hours. I opted to sit in vehicle to receive a text when they were ready. I got my text and came in and was told to sit down and wait as soon as they can help me. It defeated the whole purpose. Instead I was crammed in a room with other possibly sick people. People at the desk weren’t really that friendly and when a customer said they were going to wait outside instead of being sick inside one lady made a smart remark about possibly losing that ladies I.D and Insurance Card.

name: Arnold Clewell
text: The free coffee was nice but after 2+ hours I walked out as the wait was unacceptable. People who arrived 30 minutes after me were seen promptly. I understand that they probably prioritize patients by various means. Regardless its unpleasant to sit in a waiting room with nausea and a sore throat for 2 hours. Save yourself the pain and suffering.

name: Dee Boo
text: I have always enjoyed these people and Ms. Wiggins is amazing! Every time I leave I feel like she has listened to my problems and done the best she can and ALWAYS helped me or sent me to some one who could if she knew she couldn’t. Love this place!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We're so glad we can help you heal and feel better!

name: Kimberly Giles
text: Not friendly ..employee in the reception area are rude not helpful and the staff in the back was Great its like 2 different places

name: BiggSexii Aree
text: I dont recommend To anyone the receptionist is very rude and after speaking with her and telling her what services I came for she was even more rude. This will be my last Trip EVER to this walk in clinic save your time and money because you have to wait hours to be seen for a 20 min appointment.

name: Lisa Gunn
text: Very sweet and caring staff! Love that they have cold waters, juices and even coffee to enjoy while you wait ! Awesome place.

name: sunrise Dino
text: Very nice staff but with a 3 hour wait for covid testing, in a packed room, and no guarantee that they will have tests when it's finally your turn, I had to say no thank you. Why can't they count their tests??? I'll take my chances and NOT wait in a holding pen with a couple of dozen possibly infected people just to find out something they can't help anyway.

name: Tim Nahlik
text: I went on Saturday 1/9/21 morning when they opened for a eye infection there where fifteen cars already waiting so I thought I would do them a favor and request tel health which I did and was approved but never received a call so I followed up on Sunday 1/10/21 and was told I was approved and would be getting a call soon.Well now they have closed and didn’t get any treatment.That’s bad business to offer a service that’s not actually provided that’s why you have such a low rating.

name: Julie Rose
text: Very friendly and helpful. Dr went out of her way to make sure I was taken care of. I never usually have to wait very long. I will keep going back!

resp.text: This is great news! We're so happy to know that you had a good experience. Thank you for sharing!

name: Billy Lee
text: Sunday i waited 7 hours to get some relief for a sinus infection. The Nurse Practitioner said she called me in some stuff to Cvs and then sent me on the way. I go to Cvs they say they didn't get anything. I call the Clinic and they won't answer. I drive to the clinic. Its 2 minutes before closing. The door is locked and the girl at the desk won't come see what i need. Monday morning they won't answer the phone 30 minutes after they open. I go there and tell them CVS has nothing. They look on the computer and say it was sent and to tell CVS to look again and for them to call the clinic if they can't find it. I go to CVS. They don't have it. They call the clinic. The clinic won't answer them. I have to drive back over there. I tell the clinic CVS don't have it and that CVS called and can't get an answer. The girl walks in the back a few minutes. She comes back and says they are taking care of it right now. I return to CVS and wait 45 minutes. Still nothing. I went home (20 minutes away) and waited several more hours. CVS still didn't have anything. 24 hours later from when i first left on Sunday afternoon i went back again to the Clinic and they finally got me something sent to CVS.

name: Serita
text: You must get there around 7am for covid testinf.It is not a drive thru rather everyone has to wait in line outside in the heat for hours to get tested. Forget about social distancing as we are all close together. To have people wait in line in this heat outside while sick is highly irresponsible. I kept thinking one of these people may pass out at any moment.

name: Melissa York
text:
If you are from Fl and have medicade, make sure you say "Florida Medicade"
We waited 7 hours to hear "yes we take medicade but you didn't say Florida"  Seriously, she could have been nicer.

name: J.D. Bonham
text: I was visiting from out of town and needed medical attention. I went to Main Street Family Care in Andalusia, Al.  I was nervous being and did not know what to expect prior to going in. Once I checked in (easy process) and was seen by a Nurse then NP, my comfort level improved. I found the staff to be professional, caring, concerned and willing to help. I never felt the shot the Nurse face me. I recommend this very capable group of caring professionals and I thank you for your help.

resp.text: Thanks so much JD! We appreciate you sharing your experience!

name: Charles Nowling
text: The worst Main Street had to sit for 3 hours just to pee in a cup DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION

name: Tracy Willingham
text: MainStreet Family Urgent Care has the most amazing staff! They offer complimentary refreshments, ie. coffee, juice, tea, in the lobby while you wait although most times you are in and out within an hour! I will continue to bring my family to MainStreet Family Urgent Care!!

name: Leah January
text: I specifically said that I was allergic to a certain steroid when they wanted to prescribe that for my sinus infection. I was also asked about the medications I currently take. They logged it all down in their computer in the room. They call in my prescriptions. I wasn't even told what they were calling in. Odd, but ok. So I go pick up my medicine, go home, take it, and within an hour I'm having an allergic reaction to something. I go to the ER. They get me fixed up. They said there are 2 problems here. They prescribed me a STEROID that is 6 TIMES MORE POTENT THAN THE ONE I TOLD THEM I WAS ALLERGIC TO!!! There also is a MAJOR INTERACTION (doctors own words) with one of my daily medicines that I take. The risk is seizures. I feel like they could've killed me!

resp.text:
Hi Leah,

Thank you so much for reaching out! That is certainly concerning, and we definitely want to address this. Our Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Taylor has reached out and left a voicemail and the number we have on file. Please give him a call back as soon as you can so that we can look into this and get more information. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention!

name: Brandon
text:
Went in with a lot of neck and shoulder pain.

After two shots in the butt, I was in a lot more pain.
But after a very uncomfortable car ride home... I'm all better.

10/10. Would feel pain again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Brandon! We're so happy we could help you feel better! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Leah Blalock
text: I love this place! The free coffee, late hours, toys and color pads for the kids, this place really thought of everything!! Excellent care from an excellent staff!!

name: kenny Spurlin
text: Amazing staff and service they actually take time to find what will work best for you. they just give don't give you anything and rush you out like a lot of other's.  thank you mainstreet you made me feel like family

resp.text: Thank you Kenny! Treating patients like family is exactly what we strive to do! Thank you for choosing MainStreet and for sharing your experience!

name: Jessica Bulger
text: Please do something with your phone system. I have continuously been trying to call for 2 days to pay a bill. The 877 number listed is "not setup to receive calls" and the 427 number (option 2 for bill pay) just rings until it eventually hangs up on you. If you choose option 0 just hoping to find a live body to talk to, it hangs up on you as well. Update: the 427 number has now been busy for the last 10 minutes solid. You'd think with as much as you're charging patients that you'd at least make it convenient for them to pay their bills!!

resp.text: Jessica, we are so sorry for the inconvenience. We are working on the issue with the phones. Please let me know if are still having trouble reaching someone.

name: Joanna Wu
text: Bad service! Race! Attitude! Don’t tell them you wake up at 1 pm they will tell and give you the attitude you are ware !!!

resp.text:
Hi Joanna,

We are very sorry to hear you did not have a good experience. We'd love the opportunity to follow up and improve. When you have a moment, would you please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name, DOB, and any details you can provide about your experience? We certainly want to make this right for you! Thank you again for contacting us.

name: Amara Evans
text: They have one of the best ultrasound techs, Tonya Machen. She really knows her stuff and truly cares for her patients.

resp.text: Thanks Amara! We agree, Tonya is pretty spectacular!

name: Heisenberg Parks
text: I was told to come here to take a urine test that it would only take 10 minutes. It's been an hour and a half and I'm still sitting here. My wife had to be at work 30 minutes ago. 1 hour in I told the lady at the front desk I had to go my wife had to be at work. She said he should be with me shortly. Now were going on 2 hours just to piss in a cup!!!!!!!!!!!

resp.text:
Hi Heisenberg,

We appreciate you reaching out regarding your visit. We always pride ourselves on getting patients in and out within an hour, so we are disappointed to hear your visit took so long! We will certainly follow up with our staff to see what the hold up was and ensure it doesn't happen again. Thank you again for providing us with this feedback!

name: SHANNON “styson76” TYSON
text: Since main street took over it is horrible. You can't get them to answer the phone. They are super slow. Not to mention they don't seem to have  a clue what is going on. I have to fill out new papers every time I go. They no longer see primary care on the weekends and insist you give them a credit card even if you pay cash.

resp.text: We are so sorry for your unsatisfactory experience. We are currently working on our phone systems at this time. Our community educator will be reaching out to speak to you about your visit.

name: Becky Baskerville
text: Waiting room stocked with juice, water, etc..Very kind staff. Dr. Norris was very professional and calming. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you, Becky! We love your feedback!

name: Kelly Wilson
text: Great staff, friendly, and professional. I appreciated their kindness and attentiveness to what I needed.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelly!

name: Jason Jackson
text: Went yesterday and staff was great kind and considerate.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jason! So glad we could help!

name: Vincent Shelley
text: Worst experience ever waited almost 4 hours for an employment drug screen! Rude staff, Clueless and very inconsiderate!

resp.text: We are sorry for your wait time- With the rise of flu, we have experienced longer wait times. Again, we are sorry for your unsatisfactory experience.

name: Gorden Litchfield
text: Was here with my wife for over 2 hours first time,,, then they said her paper work was wrong after waiting for a long time we went and got it right then came back and waited for a long time again for a drug test...cold in the lobby bring a coat...customer service sucks...

name: tami killough
text: Told my daughter they dont accept Ins for a physical to be done. What the hell is the purpose of Ins then?

resp.text:
Hi Tami,

Thank you for your feedback! Insurance usually covers an annual wellness physical, but they typically won’t cover other physicals needed for school or work. What type of physical was she inquiring about? I certainly want to follow up to ensure we’re telling folks correctly on this. Thank you again for reaching out!

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great staff great care

name: Rose Pope
text: Have called several times to speak with a nurse and they take my name and number and never get a call back. And not to mention I got treated like a druggie. Somehow my drug test tested positive for thing I DO NOT DO! They had to of got my urine mixed up with someone else. And after that they just treated me horrible like I was there for drugs and that wasn't even why I wanted to see Dr go. I wanted a good Dr and heard good things about him not drugs.

resp.text: What can we do to help you? You can always message us through our Facebook or Google page.

name: Kelly Blankenship
text: Called to make a appointment for new patient. But also confused told me to wait to hear back for a approval or not to be seen. Was in car accident Feb 20th and been having trouble getting help I need. Been hearing awesome things that they could see what other doctors can't. Hopefully they'll get me set up for a regular doctor. I have all the discs that I need and medical records. How long does it take to get a approval and be seen?

name: True southern Accent
text:
Great place to come to. Very nice facility. Very modern. Staff was so nice and Doctor was great.
The lady that answers the phone is so sweet and nice. I think her name in Karla. I will come back.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Johnny Butler
text:
I have been seeing Dr.Go for a many many years. I have always appreciated the way he and his staff takes care of his patients. So yesterday 2/24/2021, I had a problem, post visit with my prescriptions getting filled. Basically the pharmacy didn't have my prescription. So when I used the telephone to call back into the doctors office, I felt like I wasn't going to be able to be helped properly. Not because of unprofessional staff or them having a desire to not help me. But because its a doctors office during a pandemic on top of already taking care of patients.
So I went online and began reading reviews. One response I kept reading was "did you try messaging us on social media or direct thru our website"? So that was what I decided to do. Now it was after 6pm when I messaged and just a few hours later I got a response. You may think getting a response at 9pm seems bad, but let me tell you. When your in need of help, getting a response at 9pm let me know that Go medical is taking care of their patients.
So now here we are at 930am the following morning and my problem has been resolved. Thanks Go medical. I could not be more pleased with your quick help. A million thanks over!
Johnny Butler

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Angela H Blair
text: Best staff around. DR. Go is very knowledgeable and has saved my life by accurately diagnosing me, that other doctors from Huntsville had missed. highly recommend him and his staff !

resp.text: Thank you!

name: asboaz smith
text: Some days it might be hectic and it take a little longer but it's like that at all Dr. offices especially now. They are all trying and doing a great job. Prayers for all our health care workers.

resp.text: Thank you for understanding. We are doing our best despite of this pandemic. Other people think they are the only ones who need care.

name: Miranda McCowan
text:
I’m rating again after having consistent care for 6+ months by Dr Go. In the beginning I was heard, I was treated for my conditions, everything was going fine in my life other than one issue.(5⭐️ then) Until my last appointment, I didn’t even see Dr.Go after being told that’s who I would be seeing that day. I seen a Np that knows NOTHING about me or my conditions & who was rude and kept cutting me off, wouldn’t even listen to what I had to say, She was hateful to me both times I was seen by her. She laughed at my concerns the first time. The second time she treated me like a liar and someone just fishing w/out allowing me to talk to inform her on what Dr. Go and I had discussed about MY issues and what actions we had taken so far. She admitted that she didn’t know what my apt was even for. Dr. Go stopped one RX, that is REALLY dangerous to just quit prescribing to a patient “Cold Turkey.” It states on the FDA website,& medical professionals that tapering IS necessary, I wasn’t tapered at all. I wasn’t I informed at my previous appointment with Dr. Go that I would no longer receive this RX. I didn’t even get my own choice on which I believed my body/mind needed more to have quality of life. Along with the only testing/imaging that was ever ordered was ultrasound and CT which my disease won’t show up on neither one of those as that has been proven by many other medical experts. Nothing further was even discussed to get an accurate diagnoses. Sent me for a CT with dye knowingly that I have a allergy to contrast dye and I had to be treated at the ER because of this and have my husband come 30 miles away to drive me b/c they didn’t check my chart before ordering the scan. Dr. Go has always treated me w/respect and mostly listened to concerns. There was a few times I felt like he was only concerned about a symptom we’ve already discussed when I had multiple concerns that was never addressed. I paid $70 copay to be seen every time besides once therefore I should see Dr. Go. He did help me for 6+ months, especially with my anxiety, etc, but now that my anxiety meds was removed w/o me even being informed my anxiety is @ it’s worse since I lost my dad & two miscarriages this past year. If I was told last month, I could of tapered myself knowing that you need to safely be tapered from any barbiturate. So I felt reeled in at the start. I didn’t break any rules or anything to cause this, either. My first apt I went I was told I would be seeing DR. Go, I didn’t see him that day either. That day was with another NP, Dr. McDaniel, who I DO recommend if you go and have to see a NP. She truly did listen to my concerns and try her best to treat me in the best way allowed, I’d solely give her a star alone, but again I was told by the front that day I’d be seeing Dr. Go & didn't. Normally most DRs would have you come back in two/four weeks to monitor how the meds are working/if they need to be adjusted/changed, to check on how you’re doing with them.  I was really disappointed in the care I received from the office my last visit. I’ve been referring a lot of people to this office, but now I’m unsure if that’s the right thing to do. I truly hope this was just a mistake on the NP side & when I do go back I can see DR GO HIMSELF & discuss options or I will be looking for a different PCP to receive the help to accommodate me. I truly don’t want to do that, but I don’t want to continue to throw away $70 with nothing accomplished, really. MOST of the staff has good bedside manner,a few that could use more discipline as JOKING ab patients after they leave & their private health info is very unprofessional.

•
•

Update: to the response, thank you for replying. I am not meaning my review to be hateful. I’m adding a star since you took the time to look into this for me and replied. I have been satisfied the care I’ve received prior to this day, that’s why I said I didn’t want to change PCP without seeing Dr. Go first to tell him how I am feeling about my last appointment. Hopefully we can get it solved.

resp.text: Will make sure that Dr. Go see you on your next visit. He was swamped with patients that day.

name: Peyton & Stasha Weddington
text: Very rude staff. The negligence and passive aggressiveness is outstanding and has been well documented. I would not trust my health with these people.

name: Luke Bouldin
text: Absolutely the worst Dr ive ever been to .the staff is about as rude and judgemental as anyone can be . they also over charge you with boguss bills . they are charging for all kinds of hidden fees if you haven't already got a bill just wait you will.dr go is a very rude individual.i guess thats why his staff is.i actually over heard his staff making fun of people who were coming in there for help.so pitiful.very unprofessional!

resp.text: Dr. Go has never seen this patient.

name: Adam Underwood
text: I been seeing both dr go and dr rabin go for ten years I hafta wait sometimes but mostly in an out if you hafta wait it’s because dr is spending time with patient because they care dr go and his whole staff have been great to me over years I wouldn’t want to go anywhere else dr go tells you straight whether you like it or not I could go on but tbh I owe my life to dr go’s staff ty dr go dr rabien go all crnp and staff Boaz Albertville is lucky to have quality sea like y’all

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Summer Skies
text: My experience when I visited the clinic was not the best but okay. However, trying to get in contact with someone who can update me on my referral status is like pulling teeth. The lady who answered the phone knew nothing about Tricare referrals and transferred me to a “nurse” which I waited on the line for 10 minutes with no answer. Called back to where they didn’t even answer the phone with any type of greeting and just transferred me, in which I waited another 6 minutes and still no answer. Worst phone etiquette I’ve ever experienced. Had she answered the second time she would have known I was still on hold! Rude! I will be changing providers. They say they get a lot of military, but I highly doubt that, just based on the outcome of my referrals and appointments.

resp.text: If you can give us your name and date of birth, we can try to sort this out.

name: Amberly C
text: The staff was incredibly rude and unprofessional. No one even acknowledged us when we came in. It took at least 5 minutes for the staff to say anything to me.  Two staff members stood behind the desk chatting while I stood in front of them. We will be switching physicians because of this. I don’t trust the judgement of someone who hires such rude people.

resp.text: Appointment or walk in side?

name: Jesse Buck
text: In and out quickly but dr go took the time to sit down and listen to me and answer my questions.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Cheyenne Johnson
text: Was told they couldn't do anything to help me

name: Gleason Simpson
text: I saw Dr Go for a long time and then he moves and now some guy up front wants to put me on a waiting list for him. Really? There are more doctors than just him.

resp.text: I am sure he can work you in next week if you want to.

name: Do wherever it takes Just do it
text: Good place to take care your health

name: Felecia Goble
text: The most unprofessional and rudest front office staff I had ever spoken with. I would never refer anyone to them.

resp.text: Did you get the name so we can follow up?

name: Andy Millie Martin
text: I am so thankful for Go Medical Group!! The compassion and knowledge the doctors have far exceed any medical practice I have been to. The Doctors, Nurse Practitioners, nurses and staff are great and truly go the extra mile to take care of their patients. Dr. Go has been a god send for me and my family on more than one occasion! When I suddenly became ill and was hospitalized the doctors ran numerous test to try to find out what was going on but I was becoming critical. Dr. Go was sent my records and knew my problem right away allowing for life saving surgery to be performed!! By far the BEST Doctor ever in my book!!! Thank you Go Medical Group!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. We work hard to give everyone the best care that we can provide.

name: Brenda Jenkins
text: Nobody answers the phone!!!!!  Wow, what kind of customer care is that?
