name: JaCori Williamson
text: Overall service was good. They got you in a room quickly but you had to wait a while for the doctor. The tech who took my blood pressure and weight was not the friendliest. I wish they would be more caring and compassionate. I understand they are busy but this is the work they chose.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Shaye Billingsley
text: This place deserves ZERO stars! Was in Sunday. Had a strep test and covid test done. Covid was a sendout and was told it would be 24-48 hours. Strep was positive. It is Wed and still no results and everyone we have dealt with is EXTREMELY RUDE! Antibiotics have not helped my throat and we are here again in attempt to get a rapid test.  So we have been sitting here for hours waiting on JUST A TEST.  Dont even need to see a doctor. When we asked how much longer it would be they were rude again and asked if we wanted to see the manage . We said yes we do only to be told that she isnt here! Convenient! NEVER EVER EVER waste your time at AFC in Alabaster!

name: Nick Mottola
text: Litterly wasted my time. Took 40 minutes for a 5 minute test. Worst place.

name: Teddy Peller
text:
I used to rate this site 5stars.  AFC  now has a policy in place that allows all their customers to be set up for credit card fraud ..

They want a credit card on file so that They can charge you for what the insurance does not pay.

They are requiring You to provide them a credit card that they can keep electronically onfile. With a third party.   An to protect AFC,  they are also requiring you to sign a paper stating that you are requesting an authorizing them to do this.

When I asked who would be responsible if the computer system of AFC or the Third party they are using to store the info gets hacked.  I get blank faces.

Because why would they be responsible if I an authorizing and requesting that they do so and I was told if I did not sign I could not see a doctor.    Somehow this just seems like fraud or setting everyone up for fraud

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us.We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495	  at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Donica Pugh
text: Any other time i would give this place a 5 The nurse practitioner and the pharmacy people are amazing!!! However, the front staff people that worked today are very rude!!  The have a smart mouth and wouldn't let me get out what was needed to get out. It was their job to fax a paper to my insurance because i was waiting on lab work. They assured me it would be faxed. The paperwork was supposed to be faxed in August.  Come October it still hadn't been faxed.  I called in again it still didn't get faxed. So i go to explain how my insurance company is charging me and the paper hasn't been faxed and they think it's funny. They were the most rudest individuals I have ever seen at this location!! Does anyone know how I can get intouch with corporate?

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Justin Rigsby
text: awesome place. Showed up around 5:30pm was gone in 30 minutes including prescriptions and paperwork. Would definitely recommended. Brad and Rodney were great. Even called after I left to follow up on my diagnosis. I would go back even though I’m not from this area!

text: Wonderful people, wonderful place!!! The people at this location were very accommodating, even at 7:50 p.m. when I’m sure they were ready to call it a day and go home. I was very pleased that they welcomed me in with bright smiles and cheery personalities, which was a relief after I was turned away from the location in Calera at 7:41 p.m. I would definitely recommend this location over any others. The people at this location take their jobs and hours of operation seriously and it is much appreciated.

text: The ladies were GREAT especially the one that took my vitals and and placed me in my room. I got there about 10 minutes till closing and no one made me feel uncomfortable or that I was not important. Thank you ladies so much for loving what you do.

name: John Allen Dees
text:
I had to visit due to flu. Was given meds that helped except for cough Med was completely useless even after being on it for almost a week. I calledand left messages over two days. Both times I was told a nurse would call me back. Never heard from anyone. Last time I use this group especially at the cost you pay for treatment these days.

—To your response about calling you. Are you serious?

The reason for the terrible review and warning to future visitors was due to the fact I have called, spoken with your staff numerous times, who each time said a nurse would call me over several days now.

Maybe adjust your auto response because it shows your complete lack of interest in assisting patients.

name: Jacob Good
text: I saw Dr. Cantley on a Wednesday for what I believed was a bad sinus infection. I got prescribed 4 medications which one was a over the counter the pharmacist pulled for me that was super expensive, which I could have gotten myself without a doctor bill, anyways Friday I got worse than I had been Wednesday all of a sudden. I got sent home from nursing school clinicals and I called the office to speak with a nurse about what other prescription I could try because the provider told me to not take anything else with this medication. The receptionist told me they would call me when they didnt have a patients. I recieved no call, I called Saturday again, no call back, I called Sunday, no call back. Monday I called at 658pm and they told me because the doctor wasn't there it was nothing they could tell me. Couldnt even recommend me another medication. I cant see my primary care doctor until Thursday due to being booked and ive maxed out on Afrin. As a nursing student I know the importance of rebound blocks and max dosages. I will never ever use this AFC or recommend to anyone! I never knew a doctor office could see patients and not return calls within 24-48 hours for their patients questions or concerns regarding treatment of care that they just recieved

name: Tim Bryant
text:
Went in yesterday and after waiting almost two
Hours was diagnosed with a sinus infection. Later in the evening I was running a fever of 102 and called to find out if my test might have been wrong. Was told to call back in the morning if I still had a fever. I woke up and had a fever of 102.8 and called at 8:10 and was told I would have to leave a message for the nurse. I never heard back and ended up going to another doctor who diagnosed strep. I would highly recommend going anywhere but here. Save your money and go to medhelp. All the care about is taking your money not helping or getting to the bottom of any issue. When calling about problems they don’t care and act as if you are bothering them

Update: nurse finally returned my call 25 hours later and all they can is say sorry. I don’t know what happened.

resp.text: Hi Tim Bryant, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit.  We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Elizabeth Mccrea
text:
My husband cut his hand and needed stitches. Our insurance encourages us to use urgent care instead of the emergency room. We go in and the reception area has three ladies in it, who informed us they don’t do stitches.
What is up with that?

name: Angela Carter
text: My son went in the day before Mother’s Day in the afternoon before 5pm. He was taken to the exam room, had his throat swabbed after seeing the physician, sat for 15 minutes, then was told he could leave because they closing early. Didn’t tell him what was wrong or not wrong, not given any prescriptions, or injections or anything. No treatment at all! It seems the physicians and staff do not communicate since an MA can tell a patient to leave without knowing whether or not they’ve been treated!

resp.text: We appreciate all reviews, and appreciate you giving us the chance to improve by providing us with this feedback. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. We hope you will consider us again in the future. Take care.

name: George Fasold
text: I have used them for several years. I like that I can just walk in and be seen early in the morning or in the evening after work. Dr. G is the greatest. She worked on my mother-in-law and kept us from an emergency room visit for an infection in her finger. I highly recommend them.

resp.text: George Fasold, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: Chelsea Jones
text: Alabaster has the most pleasant staff out of all the other afc locations. They are so helpful and do everything they can to make your visit fast & simple, especially the front office girls! The doctors here are great and get you in & out as fast as they can. 10/10 would recommend this location!!!

resp.text: Chelsea Jones, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at American Family Care - Alabaster. Thank you so much again for your feedback! We hope you have a great day!

name: Marcus L. Walker
text: Dr. John Watkins as my provider was very understanding he listen to my complaint and provided the appropriate treatment in a timely manner that was very helpful

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Joan Ware
text: I had a very deep and ragged injury to my leg. They took me in right away. Made sure I was ok and Dr came right away. After triage and wound prep it took good doctor 90 minutes to stitch it up. Yes it was bad. He did everything he could to reassure me all through procedure. I left feeling good. Went back 3days later for a check over and redress wound. Thank you AFC for you great care.

resp.text: Joan Ware, we are so happy to read such a great review about American Family Care - Alabaster! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: Courtney Brush
text: The day after Christmas, I came into AFC in Alabaster(Prodmenade) and knew I was in for a long wait. I was very sick. I had been vomiting all morning and was extremely weak. I asked if I could lay down somewhere. The ladies at the front desk kindly showed me to the back treatment area where I could rest until my name was called.( I have never been that sick and never would’ve asked to lay down unless I was about to pass out. People shouldn’t make it a habit to ask to lay down somewhere is my point.)I was checked on periodically and offered some water. The nurses and doctor were all very kind and thorough. I was diagnosed with Strep, and had them send my prescriptions over to USave Pharmacy at the front of the building. The Pharmacist was nice and quick as always. So, overall my experience at AFC was great. Even though there were probably about 27 people in front of me when I signed in at 11:15, I was still treated far better than any other ER or urgent care place would’ve in that situation. Clearly they were swamped with patients, but everyone was still pleasant and thorough. This location is always clean and everyone is always nice and helpful. I have even brought my two young children here to be seen when our regular pediatrician was too busy to see them or if it was a weekend.

resp.text: Courtney Brush, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at American Family Care - Alabaster! Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: Ed Carrick
text: Doctor's visits for me are rare but I was pleasantly surprised by my visit here.   The prep work was thorough and quick and I felt like the doctor and staff were treating the whole person.   Within a week I had no fever and was feeling fine.   Here is where I will go next time I feel the need to see a doctor.

name: Jason Dover
text: 4 hour wait time isn't what I consider "Urgent Care"..

name: Christin Davis
text: Received billing for service 13 months after the service date. Called 12/21 to ask about it - held for 25 minutes. Sent an email same day - no response. Called back 1/16 and held for 12 minutes. Constance informed me that AFC had not placed the billing into “patient responsibility” which is why it took so long to receive a bill. Also informed me that my email was “a long time ago” and she couldn’t see it. Was told that 12 minutes is a “pretty good wait time” and that she has held for much longer with other companies. Would give them zero stars if I could.

resp.text: Hi Christin Davis, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your call. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at 1-800-258-7535 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Rebekah McKee
text: The Doctor was very rude and in and out of the room the whole time and seemed confused and angry. She was complaining to me how hungry she was and how angry she was bc she needed food. She didn’t listen to me and Even laughed when I asked her a question. Like I was bothering her. Then she told me I didn’t have strep or an ear infection and prescribed me antibiotics. I asked what the antibiotics were for and she said, “because you are sick. You can have steroids too. What else do you want?” Like I was there just to get drugs. I told her I only needed medicine if I truly needed it. She just left the room without saying goodbye. When I left the room she was banging on stuff angrily. I’ve previously had good experiences here but I lost all confidence now. Such a shame.

resp.text: Hi Rebekah Mckee, we can assure you that we do not find this type of behavior acceptable, and we would like to address the situation you have described. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: harrison bourg
text: The white older male doctor was absolutely horrible did not care about his patents at all absolute horrible care took literally 4 hours to see me and prescribed me wacky medications 1/10 would not recommend to anyone ever.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: DeDe Ty
text:
Absolutely makes no sense...O my gawd I don't even know where to being. Ok the receptionists are incompetent and know nothing about the nurses or doctors that are here. I been calling everybody for days and still haven't gotten my nurse..a receptionist told me she doesn't work there What?! She's on my prescriptions! It actually funny sigh. Get better staff. Next, if its important don't come here, come here for like a cold or something. I didn't see an actual doctor even though I was to. Everything else if fine apart for the actual service lol. The only reason I gave two stars was because of a guy here named Ryneil.....
im sure the problems will continue

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at 205-605-0495 to discuss this further.

text: Been waiting to just be seen for over an hour.  We are still waiting right now.  At least 2 patients that have shown up way after us have already been called back.  Still waiting.  The lady at the desk said that they were not sure why we were skipped and that we shouldn't have been skipped.  Still waiting.  My wife is very sick and I have missed work to accompany her here.  Still waiting.  Not sure what the problem is, I know that they are busy but we've already been skipped so why wouldn't they expedite us on back given that fact. Still waiting.

resp.text: Andrew, it's upsetting to hear that you did not receive the top-notch service we strive to provide. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495 so we may assist you in moving forward towards a resolution.

text: All the nurses and doctors that work there are very nice and understanding. We were able to laugh and have fun even though I was there to get checked up. And i was not pressured by anyone to get a shot, which i loved!

resp.text: Hi Zoe, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at American Family Care - Alabaster. We're happy we could meet your expectations!

name: Rachel Lietzow
text: Warm, welcoming and friendly staff. I can not speak highly enough of Jennifer, the mananger here. She cares about you as a patient and as a person. Usually a short wait time. Dr. Pike is a caring and attentive doctor. I love this AFC.

resp.text: Rachel, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Alabaster! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

text: What a wonderful experience. The staff was extremely kind and friendly. I was also thankful that all the lab work was done on site. Doctor was VERY thorough.  I HIGHLY recommend them ..

resp.text: Todd Whaley, thank you for the high star rating!

name: john smith
text: I am sitting here right now. I took my mother to have her stitches removed from her finger where she fell and her finger got caught in electric hedge trimmers. Needless to say the laceration was deep! And they had to put holes in her finger nail to even stitch it up. Now she about came off the bed and this “”doctor”” G said my mother was just way to sensitive and it should not have caused so much pain. Well I had a talk about bedside manor. Needless to say this was not the best visit!!! Here. Problem is you never know if there is a underlying problem/issue causing pain like nerve pain. I just don’t think if it’s up to me we will be back. I know I was not satisfied at how she was treated. It’s almost like the “”dr”” G wanted to say don’t act like baby that’s how condescending it sounded!!! So I say give it some major thought if you have anything more than a cold going on.

resp.text: John, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Please reach out to us so we can work towards a resolution. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention. We hope to hear from you soon. All the best, American Family Care - Alabaster (205) 605-0495

name: sean thomas
text: I went to urgent care around 1645 on 27Dec18. The people at counter were nice, and so were all the nurses I interacted with.  The Physician Assistant, Christeen David was super nice and sweet. She listened to what I was saying was wrong with me. She didn't rush me. She even made a couple of jokes. It's nice to see compassionate providers still exist. I got a couple of shots and some meds. Not even 24 hours, I am already feeling better. Now I won't be giving this wonderful crud to my son.

resp.text: Sean Thomas, your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us. We always strive to provide top quality service to every guest, and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your experience here at American Family Care - Alabaster!

text: The provider was concerned with my health and wellbeing and made me feel welcome even though I was the last patient there after closing.

name: Carol Shelby
text: Generally the doctors are fine.  I've only had issue with one, and I refuse to see her again.  The front desk staff and billing departments are horrible.  My latest fiasco is billing that they billed incorrectly for 2013.  When I called my insurance on the advice of AFC and they told me that AFC had billed it under a depressive disorder (I only went in for regular lab work), which is covered under another section of my insurance.  The woman even told me that they'd told AFC that they'd billed it wrong and what to do, but they never did correct it.  So, I told AFC billing dept what the insurance company had told me and what they needed to do.  I didn't hear anything else, so I thought they'd taken care of it.  Nope.  They sent it to collections!  So I called them back and explained again, and the first person got an attitude and said they couldn't rebill because they already had done it once.  Which I know is BS.  So I asked to speak with the supervisor, who was rude and hung up on me after she asked me to verify my insurance #.  Anyway, I don't have the time to deal with it, so I paid the collection for that date.  Now, I've received another bill for the same date and due amount.  I haven't been to AFC in over a year, and I will not be back.  This is a $160 bill, whereas the original should have been maybe $30 max, and I've already paid it.  Anywhere else that has had a billing issue for whatever reason, has gone out of their way to correct things.  Not AFC.  Again, the doctors, nurses, and lab staff have been fine.

name: VJ Cook
text: The doctor I saw on Sunday august 20th was amazing! I can't express how much it meant to me that she actually took the time to talk to me and help me with my complaint.. just wanted to say thank u so much !! Unfortunately I wasn't thinking and I didn't get her name. But thank u again!!!

resp.text: Vj, thank you for the high star rating!

name: Cynthia Nicholson
text: Overall my experience was less than pleasant. The staff wasn't rude, but they weren't friendly and seemed more interested in socializing than helping patients. When I entered and walked up to the desk, no one greeted me. After I signed in, I went and sat down. Three people in a thirty minute time frame came in and were called back before I was. When I asked the desk attendant she said I didn't sign in (I had, but my name was crossed of like I had been called back). Once I was finally seen, the doctor spent less than three minutes examining me and I did not feel he was correct in his determination. He said a nurse would be right back to finish up. Another 20min I sat in the room and when I opened the door to ask someone the lady looked at me and then walked off.. it took 2 hours to be seen and I felt like the stuff did not care about patient satisfaction or care. I will not only not be going back, I will not make any recommendations.

name: Ty Beahm
text: So, you keep my debit card on file now, but you can't keep my insurance card on file for each visit? Makes a lot of sense. 😆👌

text: Don’t come in here if you have plans for the rest of the day. Only patient in the waiting room and it took an hour just to get into the back.

name: Kim Kohn
text:
Left work early and got to the office at 6:45 a.m
Around 7:45 a.m a nurse came to the front door and told the patients waiting, that “they didn’t have a key to open” and we could go somewhere else or wait. At this time there were about 10 cars already in the lot. Once the office opened,  which was about 8:07a.m the patients had to sign in on an iPad, which kept losing internet connection. No one seem to be in a hurry to assist with getting patients back  and the waiting room filled very quickly, I was the second person to sign in and at 8:40 was called back. At 9:20 the NP came in. Told me she didn’t see anything abnormal but could give me a Prescription to help? Help with what? This place is a joke and I will never set foot back in there! Also would like to mention that there was a sign on the door that the office had to close early the day before because they were short staffed. Might I suggest that AFC hire experienced workers and pay them what care professionals deserve and concentrate on Patient care and treatment. I paid to be treated and was treated with subpar care.

resp.text: Hi Kim Kohn, we can assure you that we do not find this type of behavior acceptable, and we would like to address the situation you have described. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at (205) 605-0495 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

text:
I have been going to American Family Care since about 2009 or 2010. They are so close to where I live, but that's not the main reason I go there. I always receive excellent service, from the office staff to the nurses, to the doctors and the pharmacists!

I think I have seen just about every doctor there, and they all have treated me with respect. They answer any questions I have and I never feel rushed. But I probably have seen Dr. Guttikonda the most, and she is wonderful! Frankly, I wish I could have her as my primary care physician!

resp.text: We're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: lyndsey clevenger
text: I have been forgotten twice in a cold dim lit waiting room. I went in feeling like I had the flu and no tests were done. Was told it was a cold and given a steroid shot and sent home. Went back next day feeling even worse and demanded to be tested for the flu. Guess what. That's what I had. They don't test properly but still charge you a fortune. They love to give you a steroid shot and send you home for everything.

name: Nikita Monroe
text: Staff was very rude when I asked to speak to the manager concerning personal information. Manager did not act very  professional  Nor did she look professional.

name: Adam Zeidan
text:
For your and your family's safety, avoid this place at all costs.

Inhuman and immoral.

After signing my mother in, she began choking on her own mucus. I tried to perform CPR on her, but was unsuccessful. I then rushed her to the front where I exclaimed the situation to the woman at the front desk. She went to get the doctor, but not before finishing her text. She took too long, so I rushed my mother to the back myself.

At this point, I was surprised that she was even conscious, but we made it to the doctor whom I begged for help... and was completely and utterly unwilling to help due to the fact that they had not finished processing our paperwork.

I was convinced that my mother was going to die, so I gave her mouth-to-mouth​ in hopes that it will give her enough air to dispurse the mucus. She was able to cough up enough to allow small short breaths of air, and I begged again for them to help her. They still refused, and suggested that I take her to the hospital. There was a chance that my mother would not make it to the ER, and would suffocate before reaching the ER, but the doctors here would rather let a woman die in front of them instead of bend the rules of their job once.

I was able to get my mother to Shelby Hospital before she suffocated, and she was given an inhaled medicine that the hospital physician told me that an Urgent Care Center like American Family Care should have already had.

Bottom line is that if you care about your safety and the safety of your loved ones, go someplace else. Even if that place is 100 miles away. The people here would rather see you or your loved one die instead of going out of their way to help. Yes it's immoral; Yes it's inhuman, but that's who they are.

resp.text: Adam Zeidan, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional service, so we are disappointed to hear that your visit with us was anything less than satisfactory. We would like the opportunity to find out how we can better assist you in the future. If you are willing, please contact us (205) 605-0495.

name: Mark Slye
text: Great place to go. Staff and doctors are friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Mark Slye, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at American Family Care - Alabaster. We look forward to your next visit! Take care!

name: Jay BIshop
text: Had to visit them on Easter weekend....late. Staff was very courteous and I never felt rushed. Patched me up and on my way. Thanks everyone!

resp.text: Thank you very much for sharing these comments, Jay Bishop. You really made our day today.

name: Anna Conte
text: Today, my dad walked in because he had been bit by a dog at work. He got his rabies shot. But he went in like this, & left like this. They didn’t even clean & bandage his wound!! It’s still huge & swollen. He is a mentally disabled man & has trouble explaining certain things, but I don’t think that he should have to explain for someone to clean and bandage his wound. Ridiculous!!

resp.text: Hi Anna, we can assure you that we do not find this type of behavior acceptable, and we would like to address the situation you have described. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Carolyn Lauriello
text: Great experience everyone was so nice!

resp.text: We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

text: Horrible experience!!! I sat for two hour just to get aTB skin test! I asked them what was the reason for this long ridiculous wait. The lady said miscommunication 😩😩😩 When they called my name to go to the back they called every name that was in the lobby with me. Even though I live and work in Alabaster I’ll go elsewhere for a TB skin test! But at least all the employees have fun at work while you wait!

text: Staff is not very professional. They assume they know it all.. The lady at the front desk was charging me a copay for an annual physical since she assumed I was coming in for other services. Didn't even bother to look at the forms I filled out... I waited over 40 mins, so that the doctor could see me for literally 2 mins.. Didn't ask me if I had any questions or concerns, just said "well you look healthy"........ Needless to say, I will NOT be returning here..

resp.text: Rinku Patel, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at (205) 605-0495 to discuss this further.

text:
The front desk staff did not check me in when I signed in. I realized there was a problem when people who had arrived after me started to be called back. I was told they would correct and I would be called. Still did not get called back. After I was finally called back and triaged, was told that since I had just been put into the system, other people would still be ahead on me once triaged. They say that there in
S no way to correct there mistake and all the can do is tell the Dr. I am perfectly willing to wait my turn but this is ridiculous. Almost at 4 hours now

text:
When you pay to see a doctor but you are only seen by the PA whom isn’t able to address what the reason for your visit is. The only time you see the doctor is when they poke their head it to let you know it’s been sent to you pharmacy.

And of course when I have an issue with all of this I am told that the doctor will not call to speak with me and neither will the office manager. Disgusted with what feels like highway robbery. Just how I feel. This whole experience what with Dr Reese and her PA.

Praise the lord for other clinic locations were the staff does indeed seem to care. Shame on you Alabaster location! Learning the meaning of respect might be a good idea! text: Well i have came here many times over the ER. they have always been good. I have to go this morning to have them look at what i think is a spider bite. I went in with a small mark on my arm now i got a hole the size of a nickle with dead skin covering the area.I will follow up my post with the visit from here. Follow up i seen Dr. G she is great. she gave me the treatment i needed to my arm & after the follow up with her my arm looks much better in just a few days and is healing great. Thank you Dr. G

name: Rachel McGuff
text:
As someone who works until 6:30 and isn't usually able to take time off work to go to the doctor, I rely on this location because its close to home and is open until 8. However, I have been seriously disappointed the last few times I've been to this facility. First and foremost, the Friday before Easter, I was ill and needed to come in for antibiotics. My fiance and I arrived at 7:15 only to find them closed. AFC used to be quick- in and out in an hour. As I write this I've been sitting here for an hour in the lobby. Haven't even been called back to triage or a room yet. Not to mention, when I checked in and paid my copay the receptionist tried to discourage me from being seen. "If you get tired of waiting, we will refund your money." I asked if there was a long wait, she stated that the doctor was only seeing seven patients at a time and that there were seven in the back already and "five thousand" in the lobby. After this, I watched the same receptionist pseudo turn away three more people, discouraging them to check in because of the "long wait". All three left, one a teenage girl with her mother, limping and in tears. If people come here, they obviously have a reason. This is a facility that is designated to help ill and injured people, and if that impedes your off time, then so be it. Most people in the working world have to stay late from time to time. Good workers still do their job. Also, the doctor may only be seeing 7 patients at a time, but there are more than 7 rooms in the facility. Instead of having people that are already unwell sit in the uncomfortable lobby chairs for hours at a time, they could move people to the vacant rooms so they could be more comfortable. Even still, this location always seems to be this busy so why on earth is there only one doctor on staff? Makes no sense. The last few times I have been in this facility for either me or my fiance, we have had to wait for at least two hours. There was one occasion that we didn't get out until almost 10pm, at which point I would have had to drive 25 minutes to get to a pharmacy that would be open and able to fill my scripts. I've been to Shelby ER and have been taken to a room faster than this. More to follow....

Update: 1.5 hours. Still in the waiting room. Still with two patients in front of me.

Back in a room. Angelise triaged me. She's a doll. Best part of this experience so far. She has great communication skills and was still upbeat even with it being 8:45 by the time I was triaged.

Took me another hour to see the doctor, Dr. Habert. I could tell what the holdup was when he spent a lot of time chatting with us in the room. I didn't mind that so much. Its better than seing a doctor for less than a minute when you wait for hours. What I did mind was being told that my diagnosis, walking pneumonia, was a result of dairy products. Now, to be clear, I didn't have an issue with this and I heard him out at the time, but by the time I got home, I researched it, and couldn't find any correlation or any research to support his statements... He was very nice and had a great bedside manner. But maybe we shouldn't be misinforming patients? Just a thought.

resp.text: Hi Rachel, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (205) 605-0495.

name: Courtney Barnes
text: I have been sick for a month, in this time I have gone to AFC twice have had numerous shots and medicines and still not better. After me second set of meds I called back and spoke with a nurse and advised of my situation and I needed to speak to someone because sick for a month over 200 in copays and not better, I'm not paying them anymore money. The nurse advised me she would have the doctor call me, I have yet to get a call back or any help.. This is a horrible way to treat patients. I won't be back and I will deter anyone I know from going there.

name: Haley Holden
text: Went in with body aches and a developing cough after being around my boyfriend who had mycoplasma. Doctor told me he wouldn't do blood work because it's "not a very accurate test" and only swabbed my nose for the flu. He gave me 5 days of antibiotics and some codeine. Well, I'm done with the antibiotics and I've been in bed for 3 days because my symptoms have gotten worse. Weakness, painful sinuses, cough is worse. I am relying on vitamins and NyQuil until I find a real doctor that will take the time to treat me.

name: Elsa Cream
text:
My first experience with this establishment was absolutely horrifying. My grandmother had fell causing her lip to bust open and was in need of stitches, so this medical facility was the closest and hopefully cheapest choice, But on arrival i was treated with such disrespect. I checked her in and give the nurses my grandmothers information and helped her back, but i wasn't allowed any further, so I go to wait in the lobby and waited for an hour. I go to ask how my grandmother is doing but the nurses acted like they didnt know what i was talking about so i ask how much longer was it going to be and they ignored me so i go back to sit and waited for another hour. I go up to ask about my grandmother again only to be given the same response as before, I get frustrated so i go out to check on my car, and as i was trying to come back to the lobby the doors were locked. I was locked out in the cold and had no idea what condition my grandmother was in so I knocked on the door until a nurse noticed and she just stood there staring at me. I wave her over but she ignored me and went back behind her desk.I dont know why i was treated like this but i can only come up with that my skin color wasn't white (all the nurses were white). It was 15 degrees out so i went back and waited in my car. A few minutes go by i see a cop car come by and he parks in front of the building like he got a call, and then i see him looking around the whole building for somebody (im guessing me). But i stay in my vehicle until he leaves. After all that i see my grandmother finally come out after 4 hours of waiting. Again i illiterate: i dont know why they treated me like a second class citizen but i guess its cause im not white.

In summary: This medical facility locked me out and called the police on me for my skin color. I am humiliated for being treated like this but sadden to know that they might mistreat everybody that isnt white.

resp.text: Elsa, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Please reach out to us so we can work towards a resolution. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention. We hope to hear from you soon. All the best, American Family Care - Alabaster (205) 605-0495

name: Chase Matherson
text: Place sucks.

name: Stacy Tibbals
text: I visited the AFC Alabaster on 3/31/2014 just after lunch.  I had what most would call a toothache. I, however,  called it the forces of nature trying to rip out my insides through a small opening in my exposed gum.  Anyway, I am also a Medicare patient who cannot just up and make an appointment with a dentist or oral surgeon like everyone else.  I have to get any dental procedures approved through Medicare, which by the way doesn't happen the same day (usually a 72 hour turn around, even then you are not guaranteed approval).  I had an infection and had eaten an entire bottle of 20 Alleve in about 48 hours.  I entered the facility expecting just average level of concern and kindness.  What I encountered when I got there was anything but that!  The front office staff was so nice and professional!  However, the best was yet to come!  The nurse who called me back and took my vitals was just such a lovely young woman. The EPITOME of professional, kind and sympathetic that one would look for while in pain visiting ANY doctor's office, but often never receiving.   Then, Dr. Pike entered the room.  I have seen Dr. Pike before while I was sick, and he was always professional.  Maybe, I am being swayed by the amount of discomfort I was in, but this doctor acted as if he were a concerned family member!!    I was SO IMPRESSED WITH MY VISIT FROM THE SECOND I ENTERED THE BUILDING UNTIL I LEFT!  I do have a PCP who practices several cities away.  Whenever I cannot get into his office (AND NOT RECEIVE THE KIND OF CARE LIKE I DID AT AFC-ALABASTER) I will more than definitely return here and also WOULD HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!  I PROMISE, YOU WILL BE SATISFIED.  If not, you might want to check out the Brookwood Hospital..........PSYCHE UNIT that is!!!  :-)  :-)   :-)        I also ready the review below by a Miss Cheyenne.......JUST REMEMBER some folks come in with a bad attitude or being rude or just looking for pain pills............Those types of people make it rough on everyone.......even the other patients waiting to see the doctor.........If you have once ounce of decency in your body, there is no way you would get treated in such a manner.  Her comment is disgusting and sounds like she did not get what she was after.  Doctors and staff are trained to recognize drug seeking behaviours in folks....If you are truly there for a medical problem, you will be treated with as much respect as you give to others.

name: shane smith
text: Never have had any problems with the actual visits...doctors and staff are very nice and professional..the billing dept could be a lot better..every time i ve taken my daughter its always "u dont owe a copay" even though i know i do..try to pay them for that day..they say no..if there is a charge we will mail u something..ok..thats great, right?..then receive a bill yesterday from visits in 2013..i'd rather just pay the 30 bucks each visit and not pay for 6 all at once

name: Beth Edwards (CurlUpWGoodBook)
text:
First, the front office staff and the medical assistant were AMAZING! The nurse and the medical assisant run this place!
Now, The NP was barely even in the room with me.  The medical assistant was still checking my bp and had not taken any labs yet and then another one came in with a steroid shot and antibiotic shot. So I was being given two shots as treatment YET NO LABS HAD BEEN DONE. SO what exactly what she treating me for? Strange to recieve shots before labs....and then she never even came back in the room...the medical assistant walked in and mumbled something about take your meds and went to leave. I had to stop him and ask him what medications I was given and what my test results were. He then had to go and ask the NP and try to get an answer and came back and mumbled ok follow me...next thing i knew i was being pushed out the door and i had no idea what meds i was given or where to pick them up. I stopped him and he had to go back and ask the NP AGAIN....all of this could have been prevented had she seen me and given me the results to begin with like a dr should. he comes back 20 min later and tells me that my meds got sent to calera and they got them changed to alabaster. only thing i was given was a Zpack. i was miserable for several days and could not sleep so i finally went to another urgent care and recieved the care i needed. I was also told I had a raging UTI and that zpac would not touch it....so they gave me Bactrim....so the NP ran all these tests on me and even my urine but didnt follow through.  I will not be back. After Dr G & Dr Pike left it has just been awful. I tried to continue to use AFC alabaster but after this experience...i WILL NOT. and I will be putting this review on google.

Decided to give them one more shot....went to visit last week because I was extremely sick....i mean EXTREMELY......imagine my surprise when the same NP came in ...and provided the SAME horrible service...talked down to me like I was an idiot....same responses as my last visit.....same meds....no blood drawn....left me in the room for over 2 hours for two simple tests and then nothing.....just came back in, gave me a shot, and pushed me out the door. I am done with this place. I will never be back and it looks like that is the same for alot of people because there was no one in the waiting room...never saw another patient while i was there... I wont be surprised if the place shuts down before long. You can only treat people like idiots for so long before they return the favor. Sorry not sorry. BYE!

resp.text: Beth Edwards, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: Stuart Smith
text:
During an office visit 5/3/2017 I passed out while my blood was being drawn and took quite a fall from the exam table straight forward onto the floor.  While the young girl did a good job trying to break my fall I now find myself with head and shoulder pain.  Very unsafe approach to drawing blood that placed the patient and care giver in danger.

I was prescribed a high dose of the steroid Prednisone and for the last 3 days have had continual hiccups keeping me awake for three straight nights.  When I called today the nurse acknowledged that was a side effect and would get something called in for me.  I later called back to find out the doctor refused. No call back to let me know and no explanation even though I'm in misery. Combine this with the head and shoulder pain I now have from taking a fall off their exam table when my blood was drawn I'd say they don't deserve positive rating of any form.   I can't believe they treated me this way.

resp.text: Hi Stuart Smith, we regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to use directly at (205) 605-0495 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Zach Cooley
text:
Pretty terrible. They will do all in their power to keep you from getting a prescription of any sort. Running a 104 degree fever like I was? Only to find you are at 98.9 degres 5 minutes later on their thermometer?

But that's just the preliminary round. What they did to be is quite possibly borderline illegal. Was out with pnemonia. I had filed a short term disability claim through unum and all that was left was the doctors statement. I gave them a call and they said they would not fill out my form because I was guaranteed to not be qualified. They refused to fill out the form and kept doing so until I called the management department. She even defended them and said and I quote "we just can't pick every person to be on short term disability". The fact is that YOU who god knows how you got the job does not get to dictate that.

Anyways, they finally ended up filling it out and oh... All that talk about about me being automatically denied? Yeah... I ended qualifying for short term disability on every single day I was out which was a full week.

Borderline illegal. Will cut every corner they can and you will walk out spending this xxx amount of money and accomplishing absolutely nothing.

Please people, STAY AWAY.

name: Nicholas Hamlett
text: We were told to drive to the front door to get some paperwork then was confronted by someone who apparently has had a terrible morning judging by her mannerisms and way I was told we couldn't be there (behind another car). They don't communicate with each other or this wouldn't be an issue. So my only experience with this place is rude, unorganized, unprofessional people. (I'm a kind, polite person and don't normally write bad reviews because I have a business and know how much they mean) will never be coming back and will be informing my community about my experience.

name: derf limpkin
text: I was the only person in there and it still took two hours  to be seen by a dr for two minutes  it’s obvious that he really didn’t care and to make things worse instead of calling in the prescription like he said he would. He didn’t bother. So my suggestion if you’re sick this is not the place to go

name: Jeremiah Goble
text: We had to get a test for our daughter prior to a procedure. We called a week in advance to make sure they would be open and could get the test results in time for the procedure and the assured us they would be open and could have the results faxed to the hospital in plenty of time. We pulled in the parking lot and to our surprise they were closed. Thanks guys. Due to your lies Or incompetence we had to travel all the way from Albertville to Murfreesboro TN to make sure our daughter got the care she needed. I guess that’s what we get for putting all our eggs in one basket. If I could leave zero stars I would.

name: Melissa Cochran
text:
Poor excuse for a “Dr”.
He had no sympathy whatsoever & acted as if he didn’t care if you came there or not.
This was our 2nd attempt at trying this office.
Won’t be another chance. 😐

name: Julie Vivian
text: We had a typical kid eyebrow gash while driving through Alabama to visit family for Christmas.  I'd never been before, nor do I know anything about the area, but the staff here was welcoming and helpful. We stopped in based off of other Google reviews, and it was peace and time well spent. No stitches were needed, but they bandaged our daughter up quickly and efficiently, moments before closing office hours. We are very grateful to them and highly recommend their services. Thank you!

name: Franklin Patterson
text: I have been a patient here for years. As of late, they do not return calls or send in refills in a timely fashion. I ran completely out of blood pressure medicine waiting on a refill. While no one called to let me know, that I needed to come to office for a refill. I went to office on Monday, after them being closed for the weekend. They were busy and I understand that. However, the receptionist was very short, unfriendly, also made a snide remark about my ability to fill out a form, as I walked away from window. Loudly enough for the waiting room to hear. It was very unprofessional, granted the form was probably not filled out perfectly. But this is not the way it should be handled. This office used to be the most friendly and helpful around. Now, it seems too busy to follow up on patient's needs.

name: Sarah Smith
text: Wait times are typically short and doctor sees you pretty quickly. I have only seen Dr. Favis and he is great. Very through, attentive and caring. The girls up front are all very kind as well. I've just had one encounter with a girl up front being kind of snooty and rude but 99% of the time I have no problems. Highly recommended!

name: Charles Coffen
text: This is not a good place to go when u need help because they are all about MONEY not your health .  No need to call u when some one has fell an got hurt an the place turns you away because a small amount of money is owed. Thats all about money not your health

resp.text: I would like to challenge you on this statement, if you would be so kind as to call and ask for Management. CarePlus is very giving and helps many who show need and some that don’t. When you make negative comments that are not true, it hurts the Employees that work hard to help EVERYONE. Please call to discuss!!

text:
I can tell you the CarePlus team  members are professional, knowledgeable and CAREING CAREING CAREING.

They are wonderful with follow-up information.

text: Very kind and attentive employees. I went in for  routine cold sympyoms and was taken back immediately and checked out. They called a few days later just to make sure I was feeling better.

name: Regina Buess
text: I have been going to CarePlus for years. My care was great until the last 8 months. I call about get my refills, after the 3rd call I was told I needed to come in for a 3 month visit. I didn't get a call from anyone letting me know if they were refilling my meds or what, I was calling them. I was put on high alert i think that is what she called it, but still no call from them. I was the one doing the return phone calls. My advice is if your meds are keeping you alive DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE , YOU WILL DIE BEFORE YOU GET A RETURN PHONE CALL OR A DOCTOR THAT CARES. I miss the other doctors, they cared unlike the one there now. I have decided I will no long go to Care Plus because I pay for the doctor to see me and you would think he would treat his patients with care and respect.

name: Shannon Sartin
text: I started going to Care Plus at first to have a regular  Physician. Then I decided to have the Lap band Surgery. I went to weigh in every month for seven months at Care Plus. Dr. Favis even wrote a recommendation letter to my health insurance so I could get approved for the Lap Band Surgery. Which I did get approved!!! All the doctors and Staff at Care Plus go above and beyond to help you. Will continue to use them as my regular go to physicians.

text: I have been here 2 time and both times the wait was horrible. The last time I went in they didn't even check for what I came in for and just wrote a prescription for steroids and a cream and had to go back. You don't usually get to see the doctor. It is a np, crnp that  you usually see.

name: Taylor Wagnon
text: My last experience with Care Plus in Guntersville was bad and so was my boyfriends last visit. On my last visit Dr. Ben Favis was VERY rude and asked me if I was even sick when in the end I had a severe sinus infection. The nurse never called my prescription in and lied when I said the pharmacy hadn’t received it. She said it was filled but it hadn’t even been sent in. Today, my boyfriend went as a new patient and the staff was great but again Dr. Ben Favis was INSANELY RUDE for no reason. My boyfriend had a very painful abscess and couldn’t handle a shot because of how tender the area was. Dr. Favis proceeded to tell him that he’d end up in the hospital and before he walked out the door, WITHOUT looking at the abscess, said “whatever, your choice.” He swung the door open and left. No “have a nice day” or “I hope you feel better” he just walked out. The way Dr. Favis acted and talked to my boyfriend was rude and uncalled for. We will not be returning to Care Plus.

name: Wayne Caudle
text: Great place!  Friendly staff and great doctors.

text: Very pleasant staff, they get you in very quickly and the doctor is with you soon after...I highly recommend care plus family....I will go nowhere else

name: Karen Smart
text: Staff an doctors are friendly an get to as quick as they can an answer all questions

name: Jaclyn Hopkins
text: The wait time was a little ridiculous. The receptionist said an hour-it was a little longer than that. The lady that called me back was probably the best part of this visit. She was very nice. Once the dr finally came into my room, I learned more about his family and such then I did about what was wrong with me. I like for them to be personable, but I had been waiting in the waiting room and actual room so long that I was kinda over it. I was told that they would call in my prescription to the pharmacy of my choice (Walmart). I got there and nothing had ever been called in. I called the drs office and she said usually they ask for 30mins in time to call in. Sounds legit. I then proceeded to give the sweet girl at Walmart my phone number so she could call me when it got there. I had been sick all morning and hadn’t ate anything all day so I figured it would have been a good time to go get something to eat. I returned to Walmart, ate some food in my car, went inside and waiting for a while longer. Finally the girl at Walmart said they had checked voicemails and all and had NOT received anything for me yet. I called the dr office once again and told them that I had been waiting a while and that the girl said they had yet to send anything over on me. She put me on hold and came back very quickly and said the nurse was working on it. This had been almost 2 hours since I had left!!!! I came to see them bc I wasn’t feeling well-  needless to say I didn’t feel like waiting as long as I have today. I left home at probably around 1ish and got home about 520-ish. I went straight to the dr which is maybe 12mins from my house- went to Walmart (which is closer than the dr), up the road to a drive thru and went back to Walmart. I do not see myself recommending this office to anybody.

resp.text: I apologize for your experience and will be contacting you regarding your visit.  This is absolutely not our norm and I will resolve the problem today,

text: The staff were eager to take care of my needs. The service was quick and addressed my problems.

When a patient has to use these facilities on the weekend, they (he) should consider what has worked for the patient instead of getting offended and being so condescending.

name: peyton bailey
text:
I don’t typically do google reviews, but I saw that they only 3.2 stars which is crazy to see because I had a great experience at the urgent care! I got there as soon as they opened at 8. Filled out paperwork and waited maybe 15 minutes which is fine. I know when you first open a clinic, you have to get everything ready for the day. I’ve been sick all weekend so I got tested for flu and Covid. They both came back negative. Although I don’t have tonsils, the NP treated for strep throat as the symptoms I described all pointed to that. (Yes you can still get strep throat). I felt that the NP was VERY thorough and made sure that I was taken care of. I will definitely be back!
If you ever have concerns or a problem please tell them personally. I am a healthcare worker and you can potentially be hurting others as they are going based off your review. People who work in healthcare, are there to help you. We have hearts for everyone and want to help as many people as possible

name: g-Baby
text: Was asked to inappropriately to " Drop my pants to my knee's during a supervised drug screen By male physician , my private parts were clearly visible already. . really would like a way to follow up with this issue also..not looking to speak to anyone part of  " Main Street Family Urgent Care "

resp.text: I am sorry that your visit was not satisfactory. However, we have certain protocols we have to follow when it comes to an observed drug collection. If you would like to discuss this further, please give me a call at 205-739-4879. Thanks!

name: Haley Isbell
text: I'm so thankful to have MainStreet close to home. Every time I go in they are efficient and friendly. I love that you can now make an appointment from home and that they will notify you when they're ready for you to come in. This cuts down on so much frustration and too many people in the waiting room. They always listen carefully to my concerns and seem genuinely interested in making sure I feel better.

name: L M
text: I registered online for an appointment. I got a text message promptly saying that they were ready for me. When I arrived the receptionist took my credit card information and asked me to have a seat. Literally 30 minutes later I went to the front desk and said you sent me a text saying you were ready for me. That was very misleading. I thought the whole point of registering online was so you wouldn’t have to wait. She said that was not the case. No apologies. Ended up just leaving and going to the drugstore and getting some over-the-counter medication for my sinus infection/cold. These people do not know how to hustle. There was no one else in the waiting room. I saw many nurses standing around in the background looking at their cell phones. Do not come to this location if you expect exceptional service. These people are disconnected and seem completely careless. Not sure why they chose this profession. Very disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about you experience. That is certainly not the Family Treatment we expect our staff to deliver and we will be following up with appropriate disciplinary action.

name: Larry Anthony
text: Very friendly and competent staff.  Excellent no-contact check-in,  just scan their QR code at the front desk - be prepared to take pics of your drivers license and insurance cards.  Nice facilities, short waiting time.

name: Ashley Talley
text: Excellent, kind, and efficient care. They’re very good with kids!

name: SCARLETT Phelps
text:
They are BUSY.
You will wait a good while. Take advantage of their online check in and understand that they're doing their best.
I did my online check in around 7am and was seen at 1:30pm.
I was able to wait at home until receiving my text to come to the office.
Once you are there you will be treated very well.
The Nurse and NP were both helpful and attentive.
Thank you for helping me. Everyone there deserves a raise. I heard so many people being rude to the receptionist, her responses were professional and kind. She has so much patience!

name: Jason Blackerby
text: I’ve been to this clinic a couple times and I have not one complaint. Both times the people here were very nice and knowledgeable. They have earned my respect for sure. I’ll definitely use them again.

name: Amanda Dunn
text: Had the greatest experience I’ve ever had at an urgent care today. I woke up with a high fever and cough so I immediately went online and registered for a COVID test. The process was extremely clear and easy. My wait time said around 3 hours. I got a text when it was time to leave my house and another text when it was okay for me to come in the waiting room. The front desk lady, was so incredibly sweet and kind. I waited about 15 minutes before being asked back. They tested me for flu and COVID at the same time and it wasn’t as scary as I thought and didn’t hurt at all. That nurse was also really nice and kind. I waited 15 minutes for the rapid results. The nurse practitioner came in to go over my results and was very attentive and did not feel rushed at all. I felt horrible but was very impressed and walked out feeling relieved which is not usual from an urgent care in my experience. 100% recommend!

name: Celeste Gable
text: Cant give less than one. I have been trying for 2 weeks to get medicaid referral for a patient there. They sent referral on wrong patient. No one answers phine or returns multiple messages. This is the MOST unprofessional medical place I have ever seen. I can only imagine the staff provides same subpar unconcerned level of care to sick people. If you live in a rural area it will benefit you more to come to a bigger city/town for medical attention.

name: Barbie Phillips
text: My husband fell on his knee and it was the size of a cantaloupe and we tried calling urgent care in Moody, to make sure they had an imaging machine for an ex ray and they will NEVER answer the phone and they don’t return the call either!!! Hours later we decided to get it checked as it was getting worse, drove all the way there..25 minutes Only to find out their machine was down,… So then we called Trussville urgent care and they answered the phone without any problem… If moody urgent care would’ve answered the phone it would’ve saved us some gas and my husband getting in and out of the vehicle with crutches!!!! You want courtesy...SHOW IT!!!!! Oh yeah...The parking lot had three cars in it there was one person sitting in the waiting room… Wasn’t like they had a line and couldn’t get to the phone

name: Scott Frishman
text:
They were slammed being that it is just before Thanksgiving, but able to get me in same day earlier than estimated.  Online registration was easy.
Everyone was super friendly and helpful, and i was in and out with my test results in 30 minutes.

name: jodi isbell
text: Laketrah the medical Assistant was fantastic! she made me feel comfortable and was so friendly and nice the whole. I am so afraid of needles and she talked to me through the whole thing and never got frustrated with me, i love her. That woman needs a raise!!! The lady at the front desk was also very kind and helpful, but i did not catch her name!

name: Melissa Jackson
text:
The people were just as nice as they could be!! If y’all were getting a grade in would 100!
However I don’t text or email my daughter does that kinda thing I just use my cell phone as phone...per my Daddy..Thomas Berry

name: Love Assoue
text:
The wait time was a tad long, but not absurd. They have guest wifi which was very convenient since I work in healthcare IT; so I was able to work while I waited. The staff was kind and knowledgeable about what I needed help with today. As a patient I felt that my concerns were heard and I was cared for well. The NP apologized for my wait time, but as someone who has worked in healthcare I understand that sometimes it takes a little longer than wanted to get around to see the  patients.

If I have any reason to visit the Urgent Care in the future I will be returning here.

name: Cami Foster
text:
Quick. Thorough. Friendly.

10/10 would recommend.

name: Joanna Nicholas
text: I would give zero stars if that was an option. I scheduled a COVID vaccine online at 6am when registration first opened. If you wait much later than that, the website will tell you that they have already reached their limit for the day. My estimated wait time put me getting the vaccine between 8am and 9:30am. I called at 9:45 because I had still not been seen and was told that they don’t “puncture the vial until noon to keep from wasting doses.”  Perhaps this key piece of info should be somewhere on their website, in the confirmation email, in the confirmation text, or in the estimated wait time. I completely understand not wasting doses but how about letting patients know this so you’re not wasting their time. I would gladly have registered online at 6am and then waited until noon to arrive at the clinic. I know this is an evolving process but it can be made so much easier if you are up front and give realistic and accurate information to the public. No wonder Alabama has only given a fraction of the vaccine doses allocated to the state.

name: Lashae Vick
text: The staff is soooo amazing the lady at the front desk is so sweet thank you for all that y'all do. My visit was 2/6/21 so pretty recent.

resp.text: Thank you so much for choosing MainStreet Family Care, Lashae! We're so glad we could help you heal and feel better!

name: Richie Clements
text: Horrible communication, customer service was nonexistent.  Times and policies fluctuated with each person I talked with at the Moody location.  I feel very sad for anyone trying to get accurate information from this place.  The system they have in place for COVID vaccines is more than broken.  I saw elderly people waiting for hours, due to this locations lack of concern for their patients.

name: Quinn Bee
text:
I will not be returning to MainStreet for any care. I have been using them for any of my non-emergency doctor's needs for the past three years with no issues. I developed a sinus infection with no Covid symptoms and could not schedule an appointment from the office. When I attempted to register online, it was taking me through a new patient process, so I put it off. A few days later, I was exposed to Covid through a coworker and begrudgingly went through the online process. When it failed, it told me to register at the office. Upon returning to the office, I was told that I cannot schedule an appointment for Covid testing multiple days into the future, and if I wanted a specific day, I would have to return to the office and register using their devices on that day.

I don't understand why a) I can't schedule a test ahead of time, knowing that I am currently in the incubation period, and b) why they are entirely unable to process a returning patient using existing information. Trying to schedule this appointment has been a nightmare and wasted an hour and half, at which point I still do not have an appointment. They have had nearly a year to figure out the best way to handle testing, and I find it hard to believe that this is the best solution.

name: Kelly J
text: Avoid this place at all costs. They’re rude and lie. My mother has been waiting for over 5 HOURS now to be seen. She’s been told “you’re next” for the last hour. However, multiple people have been called back in the meantime. How can she be next, but never be called? When I called to ask what was going on a rude lady at the desk berated me for asking. She told me that 80 ppl signed up before my mother and it was her fault for not signing up sooner. After that my mother was pushed out to wait even longer. NEVER EVER GO HERE. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

name: Hunter Wallace
text: Every time I have used MainStreet Urgent Care the staff has been very polite and caring. The online registration form is quick and easy to navigate.

name: Virginia Franks
text: Worst people ever. If I could give them a negative star I would.

name: Jennifer Brunner
text: The staff is incredibly friendly and genuinely concerned about patient welfare. I would move to Moody just so I could go to this clinic!

name: g hegenbarth
text:
Super nice group everybody was
Attentive and service professionals.

name: Michele Gamble
text: Signed up online, they got me in quick and everyone was very friendly.

name: Pamela Birchfield
text: Only giving this place a 1 star because a 0 isn’t an option. They opened @8... I was there by 8:05. Was told I would be waiting a LONG time to be seen... turns out I had a 12 hour waiting period. Staff is unprofessional and NEVER seem like they want to work. Maybe if working wasn’t an option for them, they would appreciate it. 👎🏾

name: Searcy Sledge
text: There website is lacking a lot of valuable information and their staff is rude. I was unable to receive the medical attention I needed because of their lack of information.

name: Eyram
text: My covid test results came 13 days after. It was supposed to come in 3 to 5 days. I ve to cancel my trip because of that.

name: Shannon Wilks
text:
It takes a lot for me to leave a review on just about anything. Normally, if I end up leaving a review it is because I have experienced a dissatisfaction on numerous of occasions. Which, in this instance, is accurate yet again. Main Street is considerably close to my home and therefore mine and my families first stop. However, over the passed several months I have been very ill on-and-off. After being sick for nearly a week, I finally decided to make a trip to just try to get better. I was tested for both the strep and flu. However, both came back negative. This is a typical situation result when I come here. The last several visits I have been diagnosed with a “sinus infection”, upper respiratory infection etc. When their PA told me last night I was negative again for flu and strep, with full knowledge knowing I 100% have both, I got incredibly frustrated. I told their PA, after she said it was probably just a sinus infection, that every time I come here that is what they diagnose me with. I have had to pay multiple doctors bills because of their misdiagnoses and having to seek out another doctor to properly diagnose me. To which each time, when I get tested elsewhere, it comes back positive. They said they gave me a “shot” to help speed the pain in my throat, and it is 5:30 in the morning and the pain in my throat is so severe there is ringing in my ear now which has woken me up in even more pain. So, once again I will have to pay ANOTHER doctor to diagnose me with what I know I have. This is incredibly exhausting. I don’t know if it is malfunctioning testing machines or the lack of actual experienced doctors, but the fact that I have been awaken in such severe pain and body aches let’s me know I once again did not receive the treatment I needed. With all of that said, the PA who was there did call me in a prescription for both the flu and strep after I complained I was tired of their diagnosis's continuously being that of a “sinus infection”. I know if I let a good 48-72 hours of these medication stay in my system I will get better. The problem is, I am in so much pain and the shot they “gave” me might have well been water.

Sincerely,
A extremely tired sick person

resp.text:
Hi Shannon,

Thank you so much for reaching out. I can certainly understand your frustration. Have the flu and strep medications helped at all? I'd like to have our Chief Medical Officer review through your charts to see if there's anything we missed or could have done differently. This winter we have seen a like of flu-like viruses that feel like flu, but test negative and will ultimately run their course as a virus. If there's anything else we can do to help make this right and help you feel better, please feel free to email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com. Thank you again for sharing with us.

name: PedieFen F.
text: Went in because I had obvious tonsillitis and could not swallow my food. My tonsils were flared and swollen and no otc medicines had been working at all to ease the pain. So I went here and after seeing the doctor, I got two shots that he said would heal my throat by the end of the day. Number 1, he never told me what was in the shots or what exactly they did, 2 it’s now 1:40am, I went in at about 3pm, and the pain has not even SLIGHTLY went away. I can’t sleep and I wasted both time and money at the expense of relentless pain and suffering .

name: Kahla Echols
text: The quickest Urgent Care visit I have ever had ! The staff was super friendly and go us back quickly. Great job Mainstreet.

resp.text: Thank you, Kahla! We're happy to help!

name: Crystal Dew
text: Had to have a preop COVID test. After spending hours on the phone trying to get this arranged, MainStreet was the only place willing to help. The receptionist was so sweet and caring. They really touched my heart.

resp.text: We're happy to help, Crystal!

name: Yvonne Howard
text: There is such slow organization at this place. Don't they know people are sick? Their paperwork could at least be filled out online. People waiting to be covid tested should be much more organized. After reading a lot of reviews, I decide d that all your apologies and nice employees do not make up for slow, poor healthcare.

name: Alicia Brayden
text: I come in to get seen about some sinus and I’m told they only see so many people a day because of Covid. What kind of health care facility only cares about a hand full of people. If y’all are so scared then you guys shouldn’t be called urgent care! Also I would take down the walk in sign since that’s misleading!

name: Sydney Presley
text:
I have been here several times and have never had a problem.  Everyone is really nice and helpful.  Plus they do a follow-up call which I appreciated.
I saw Nurse Practioner Becky.
Very nice.  I will go back!!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing Sydney! We agree, Becky is awesome! We're so glad she was able to help you feel better. Thank you again for telling us about your experience and for choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Tina Graham
text: I had a great experience at Main Street this morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful.   Thank you Main Street!

name: Talaysha Wright
text: Everyone was so nice and helpful!

name: Patrick Smith
text: I was sick with symptoms similar to COVID-19. I attempted to call MainStreet Family Care two hours prior to their scheduled closing time. No one answered the phone but a robotic message stated that they took walk-ins. I went ahead and traveled 20 minutes out of my way to MainStreet Family Care and arrived one hour prior to their scheduled closing time. The waiting room was empty when I arrived. An employee inside told me they were done with COVID-19 testing for the day and that I would have to come back in the morning to be tested. If only they could tell me that on the phone before I wasted the trip.

name: Aliyah Holland
text: Horrible service! Receptionist was rude. Attempted telling her I had paperwork that needed to be filled out by employer. She refused to look at it and continuously cut me off while speaking. While in the back waiting to be seen I overheard inappropriate conversations between doctor and nurses about how big a patients butt was. I will NEVER go here again or refer anyone to this place. VERY VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. If I could rate 0 I would! You guys are a joke!

name: gacha blaster
text: Great service

name: Jenifer Phelps
text: Was in and out in about an hour and a half. Slowest part was the waiting room but once I got to the back they were very fast and nice and took great care of me. I feel 100% better, thank you again :)

name: Trey Roebuck
text: They say they offer “primary care” but refused to see me.  I had a prescription (non narcotic) that normally comes with 9 refills. Then you have to see the doctor to rewrite. They refused to see me and said I have to see the doctor that wrote it. The doctor that wrote it is a doc in the box and I’ve seen 3 different doctors over the years to rewrite this script. I explained this to them but they still refused.  They came off to be unknowlegable of simple procedure.  I m insured and thought I would use them for the convince factor.  If they don’t want my copay that’s fine.  5 min consultation and some lab work.  Easy money.  I think the lady just didn’t want to fill out new patient paperwork. Zero star was not a option.

resp.text:
Hi Trey,

I appreciate you reaching out and I'm sorry our staff was unable to help you regarding your refill. I'd like to follow up to see if I can find any more information for you. Would you mind emailing info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name and phone number and the day you visited or spoke with the clinic staff? Any addtional details you could provide would be exceelent Thank you again for providing us with this feedback.

name: BARRY DAVIDSON
text: Excellent Service and the lady at the front desk provided exceptional customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Barry! We're here whenever you need us!

name: Megan Proctor
text: Very friendly staff, I highly recommend. This place truly treats you like family. They really do make you feel better fast. :)

name: slydawg97
text: Sat for 1.5 hours for non covid related issue which on their website says non covid issues are priority. They then started to call people back who arrived after me

name: Nikita Ferguson
text: Had an experience with this clinic yesterday when I brought my child in after school. Someone who appeared to be the boss had her child with her and really just had a nasty attitude with everyone. After being called back to the exam room not only myself but my child could hear her yelling at another employee. Number one not only is it unprofessional to yell at anyone in front of god and all that's holy. Doing it while your child is there with you takes it to a new level of unprofessional.  Nice job moody.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing this with us. We agree that this behavior is unprofessional and isn’t behavior that we condone. If you’d be so kind as to email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com we would like to gather additional information so we can properly address these concerns.

name: Geno Osborn
text: I went there to get tested for covert 19 as my entire household has tested positive And they refuse me services because I didn't Have ID

name: wolfe whitfield
