I recently moved to town and was looking for a provider. I went the first time the wait time was long despite getting there when they opened. The doctor said she would take care of something that never happened and they sent my prescriptions to 2 different pharmacies. I figured I would give them another try so I went back I was the first person there and still waited 25 minutes to see the doctor (who I literally only saw for 2 minutes) I asked them to fill 90 days worth which they said they would. I went to the pharmacy to pick stuff up and they had only written 30 days. I'm done! Won't be back.

name: Angela Burton
text: It’s so hard to find good care with genuine concern. The staff was kind and friendly, I was very pleased and at ease. I  knew I was in the right place.I was given my paperwork and treated with kindness and respect all questions was answered politely. I was not waiting for a long period of time to see the doctor and much to my delight when she walked in she was just as amazing as the staff. She listened and heard all of my concerns ...she .did not brush  me off,,,and then she went from there. Absolutely love Crismon Care and I will gladly recommend it to all my family and friends. Thanks for a awesom experience.

name: Josie Rykhus
text: Very fast and went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and understood what they were doing and why.

name: Foster Brown
text: Don't go there if you need stitches. Took my wife this afternoon with a cut on her finger requiring stitches were told that the doctor doesn't do stitches. Isn't that taught in med school.

name: Katherine Woods
text: Fast and quick service!! All staff is wonderful and always so helpful to my medical needs. Thank you

name: Chelsea Channell
text: I walked in and they was super sweet and nice and helped me as fast as they could

name: Sebrenia Clancy
text: I have used Crimson Urgent Care Veterans parkway for years. Each employee that comes in contact with the public is courteous. The Doctor and the Nurse practitioner get an A.

name: Skyla Jones
text:
Horrible experience.  My husband and I literally went here for rapid covid testing. We were the first ones In The parking lot.   We had actually visited the other location on skyland earlier today.  After waiting an hour and being told they didn’t know how to input our insurance because “it was weird “ being bcbs of Michigan. We came to this one.
We waited hours.  We saw two different nurses wait on the same one patient in a car back to back. The lady brought the woman her dr’s excuse finally, about an hour and a half later.  Then there were about 9 cars waiting to be tested at this point.   We were only getting tested because we had 2 family members that had tested positive that we had been around.  Do not go here!!!! Go to Dch!! Or bear creek family to get ur results!!!!! They are 24 hours but they will get to you, quicker that 2 hours

name: Sarah Jamieson
text: Don’t come here for a covid test. Even if insurance covers it, they add in an extra fee claiming you saw a doctor. They never told me this and that never happened. I guess the provider just saying that I’ll get my covid results back in 24-48 hours is worth 21 dollars. I didn’t even leave my car. So stupid.

name: Tommy Morgan
text: Great service. very courteous and did not have to wait very long.

name: Kim Boothe
text: If I could have went anywhere else I would. The customers service isn't a priority here. I waited almost 3 hours, then 3 other ppl came in after me and got right back. This place isn't professional at all. I wished I wasn't sick and needing to get a excuse for work BC I would walk out of this horrible place

name: christen bonner
text: On December 18th I had to rush to Tuscaloosa due to a family member going to the ER bc of COVID and having symptoms. I needed to take my mom to have a COVID test completed bc of exposure. I do not live in Tuscaloosa so this place was close to the hospital. #1 we were there at 8am and the place didn’t open til 8:30am. At 8:30,while standing at the door in a line, the assistant didn’t welcome anyone or give instructions she just started placing signs everywhere and sitting out a stand with paper and a COVID test taking instructions. Because I used common sense I took two papers in order for my mom and I to fill out. Once completed I walked inside to turn in and completely fill out the document. We received our first call to bring back insurance cards. Because I’m from Ga, the receptionist asked for me to email a copy of my insurance card. She said she never received the emails so text her. She assured me that I had the correct email address three times. I had to text her my documents eventually. We took our test and we’re told 24-48hrs results. I went back to GA and my mom took a rapid test at another location and received her results.  Crimson care did not offer rapid tests. Two days later on Sunday the 20th I called to get my results and I was told they did not have them ready or could not find them. On Monday the 21st I called 8 times to speak with someone and 3 times I was hung up on. I finally had received an incorrect email address email from the wrong email address the receptionist gave me. Today is December 27th and my mother still hast received her COVID results from this place. Overall this place needs more training on customer service and delivery during these unusual times. The service was horrible and the administer of the test was horrible.

name: Lacharika Taylor
text: The staff here is very kind, and compassionate. It was my first visit here, and they made me feel very welcome. The wait is not long at all, and they be sure to answer all of your questions.

name: P Royster
text: Staff is very courteous and helpful. Way better than DCH

name: Carolyn Hamlett
text: Thank you all for professional service in the most caring way.

name: ISAAC ENGLUND
text: These people refuse to answer the phone. Could not reach anyone for 2 days. Also refuse to email me my COVID results and a terribly rude desk lady.

name: Imane Abhir
text: I had a very bad experience, the wait was too long almost 2 hours, and add another hour when you go inside to finally be seen, the nurse practitioner was very nice, very professional but the one who came to draw blood was the very unprofessional to say the least... Never ever again....

name: Ky Money
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful during my visit. I will definitely use them for all my urgent care needs!

name: Joey Gambarelli
text: Easy to work with, fast and simple.

name: Jonathan Beckham
text: Dr Permasetty is great. He helped me out rite off and actually wanted to help. He offers way more procedures and can do more then just about any Dr office. .

name: Jaynell Hughes
text: This clinic is very slow when it comes to getting things done. Went for a visit because my usual place closed early and got a covid, flu, and streptococcus test done. The doctor was and hour and half late because he was at another clinic. The healthcare worker who did my swab lost my covid test. I called again to see if they found my test and said my test came back inconclusive. I had to go back and get tested and had an hour wait time waiting outside just to face time and wait on a practitioner and get tested. Worst clinic I ever went to.

name: Lindsey Logan
text: This place is very professional and clean and caring.  I highly recommend

name: Ella Hurley
text: This single star is dedicated solely the amazing person, Justin, who helped me over the phone. The rest of the experience...horrendous. I went here last minute as my normal places were closed, was totally rushed through An exam, the medical staff was very nice except for the actual doctor I saw. I felt totally demeaned and belittled by her. I was prescribed medicine that I am highly allergic to and the doctor wanted to give it to me anyway, then prescribed medicine not for the right area of infection, then come to find out what I was prescribed ISNT TO TREAT WHAT I ACTUALLY HAVE. Ive gotten UTI’s all my life, I know all the meds for it. What I was given wont cure a UTI, and now I have to go pay another doctor to diagnose me and prescribe me the correct medicine. Please please dont go here because it’s open latest or the rating isnt so bad. It’s bad. Dont go. Wait til the morning or the next day, I wish I would have.

name: Chrystal Dawkins
text: I love this place. Very clean the Dr. & Nurses are very friendly and kind.

name: trisha gibson
text: Y’all don’t EVER answer the phone!!!! This is ridiculous! I witnessed you sit there and let the phone ring with 1 person inside. There were 5 people up front WHY CANT YOU ANSWER?! Smh I will NEVER use this place again.

name: Chris haley
text: Called all day then have you on hold for 35 minutes. Just slow as Christmas. And knowing they 👀 you calling.

name: Jessica Davis
text: This place is unprofessional don’t tell u no information of what’s gonna on when u have seen the doctor when ask for a doctor excused they put in somebody else name when u told the name 3 times to the nurse

name: Riley Raynor
text: I’m not sure if she was a doctor or a physician or practitioner but Bridget Smith was GREAT!! She talked me through what she saw and what she was going to give me for it. Took the time talk to me.. Really appreciate her and the nurses. Best experience yet.

name: Bruce Prescott
text: I have not been able to reach anyone in the office by phone and left messages online for someone to contact me regarding Covid results. No luck. I plan to follow up with my primary care physician and have the test completed again. Extremely disappointed with patient services.

name: salman Alotaibi
text: The main nurse was training the other nurses on me with injections. I wouldn't mind if they asked for permission but he was horrible, disrespectful, and spoke to me like I don't know how to speak English. Patients should not be treated this way. He should be checked or kicked out! 👎🏼

name: Mary Gardner
text: After getting hung up on by Morgan, I’ve come to realize crimson care puts money & insurance billing before making sure their patients have access to the medication THEY prescribe. So now, yet again I have to stop taking a medication cold turkey because they will not do a telemed call until they fix a billing issue they created. (My insurance was not saved on file correctly & my insurance company is closed right now.) Which is detrimental to my mental health. Thanks CCV. Not representing Dr P well.

name: Greer Jones
text: The only reason that there’s room for one star is because of the kindness of the NP I had while there. I’m self pay, meaning I don’t have insurance, which was made known from the moment I did paperwork. The doctor then wanted to do bloodwork to confirm some thyroid issues (which is absolutely what needed to be done.) Three days later, I had to talk to three different people to get results, which they told they’d call me about and never did. They told me to come back again for another panel and blood work. Again, I would have to call two days in a row to get my results from that test (they were in the system, but the doctor didn’t sign off nor did he ever discuss them with me). He told me he wanted to refer me out and I explained (for now the fourth time at this point) that I was self pay and was concerned about the cost of a specialist. He told me he could do medication on site and we’d wait for the blood results to confirm what he suspected. He later changed his mind and didn’t feel comfortable treating me, but he also misdiagnosed me, so I was taking ineffective meds. Now, almost two months later, I just received two bills for a total of $1200.00 for the blood work performed— blood work! And the company they use doesn’t offer deals or negotiations, so I’ll be on a payment plan for TWO YEARS for bloodwork. I was never told costs, even expected, and was still given these tests. I never would’ve had these tests done if I had known. I obviously went to a different doctor and had to pay $110 for the same bloodwork to be done because my new doctor couldn’t trust this doctor. My med records from this visit had presenting problems from 4 years ago listed as the main issue and they checked boxes for examinations they didn’t do.  Lesson learned— I will never go here ever again and would STRONGLY encourage everyone to seek treatment elsewhere. If you can’t, have them write out every cost in detail for you a and get every thing they say in writing. The absolute worst exper

name: Mark S
text: This place is absolutely terrible. I can’t tell you how many times I have had horrible experiences with this Urgent Care. They are unprofessional, in person and on the phone. Not a single response from them on the phone for the past four days. Let’s not even mention all of the other countless times they have been incompetent and I’m not the only one who shares the same thoughts.

name: Nicholas Shields
text: This my first visit to this clinic as a retired veteran and I can say they are very confident at what they do! From the doctor to the staff very confident. And there was  no hassle questions, told them what was need and the crew did it. In addition to the doctor's exam he also recommended additional items for my present condition.  All around I would give a 10 if I could, they handled business! Love it!!!

name: DAVID STEIN
text: The girls at the front desk was minus manners.  The receptionist snatched the form which I filled out completely and neatly as asked.  Then the other girl "demanded" my copay immediately and snatched my credit card from me.  There should be some staffing adjustment.  On the other hand,  the doctor and nurses and other staff in the back of the office were professional and proper.  I will not be going back there to be abused again.   Oh.   I had an almost three hour waiting time.  This office and Dr P deserves more respect than this.     I DEMAND MORE RESPECT THAN THIS.

name: Taneezia cook
text: Friendly employees and quick service

name: Natanya Vance
text: I’ve never felt so neglected in my life. The doctor rather take personal phone calls than to come and check on patients. I wish it was someone else I could talk to about the malpractice of this clinic but I’m pretty sure there isn’t. I’ll just have to take it up with my lawyer if something is really wrong. The medical machines were malfunctioning and he was made aware by his assistant and he still went with the faulty reading and dismissed me. I waited for 45 minutes to a hour just for him to come and tell me that I am fine even though I could tell something was wrong. Be very weary of Dr. P cause doesn’t do his job and rather laugh on the phone with his friends than to check on his worried, sick patients.

resp.text: We apologize for any problems that anyone may have experienced at any of our facilities. Please know our team tries to reach out to anyone that shares concern. We hope to learn from every good and bad experience.

name: Emma Milowski
text: Waited 2 hours just to get an antibiotic prescribed for my stomach bug... doctors were super nice though, although I was supposed to be next in line and 3 other people went in before me who had signed in after. I’m not sure if that was the receptionists fault but there should never be that long of a wait time just to talk to a doctor for a few minutes... something seems weird.

name: Abmiki Rii
text: They locked their doors at 6:30p on a Friday and refused to answer their phones

name: Scott Klatt
text: Cut on my finger was mistreated resulting in an infection that almost cost me my finger 6 weeks later still ongoing avoid their incompetence go elsewhere

name: Keneisha Simmons
text: I am writing this review as I continue to wait to be seen by a doctor. After paying a $40 copay (which is the highest i’ve ever paid) I have been waiting for 2 hours literally and time is still being added. I will not be back to this urgent care ever again! I don’t care how sick I am.

name: Sherry Harkness
text: My family and I had an awesome experience at Crimson Urgent Care. We were greeted warmly with smiling and friendly faces and given excellent customer service from the professional staff and doctor. I will recommended family and friends to visit here when feeling ill. Thanks again for the wonderful experience.

name: Patrick McGrew
text: Fairly fast on the in and out, and accurate. Haven't received a referral I was supposed to be needing, but don't know if it's their fault, mine or the other doctors office. Later they did follow up. But then months later I get an overdue bill for things either not done, or with confusing abbreviation next to a dollar amount.

name: Jahod A
text: Been here a couple of times, and the Doctors are always very knowledgeable and courteous.Overall one of the best Urgent clinics in Tuscaloosa.

name: Amber Nicole Smith
text: Love the doctors and staff here! Everyone is caring and a joy to be around! Highly recommend

name: Monica Taylor
text: Friendly staff and very helpful! I was a private pay and the doctor made sure he took care of me without running any unnecessary tests to help with payment. Would recommend 100%!!

name: Jessica lynne Card
text: Great quick care.   Very friendly staff

name: Tameka Harper
text: Friendly, and professional staff with great personality!!! Appropriate wait times for a busy day

name: Patrice Bailey
text: I was greeted upon arrival by the front staff. She checked me in and was informative as far as insurance and protocal. There wasn’t a wait, I was called back in a short period of time. The nurse worked me up and the Dr. came in shortly after. I didn’t spend an extensive amount of time there, which I prefer! in the medical and can appreciate my time being valued. And as far as the 4/5 rating there wasn’t anything that caused me to have a bad experience or “bad taste in my mouth” in layman’s term. I just believe there is always room for improvement!

name: Rodney Swiney
text: I have been trying to call them the past two days about my results from an ultrasound sound from dch that’s supposed to be sent to them but they seem to not know how to answer a phone call.

name: Harlyn Cowart
text: Crimson Care is amazing! The doctors there are always so nice and wonderful and helpful. Way better than SHC!! It’s also almost always super fast and they even helped me get in touch with doctors at home to get my tonsils out!

name: Lambert Jackson
text: My wife and I visit crimson care and we were very satisfied with staff and our care. We will surely use crimson care for our future medical needs. We really appreciated the service that   Dr. Romona Peterson provided us.

name: V-Selection
text: The facility is nice and everytime my daughter and I go, we're in and out! Exactly how I expect an urgent care visit to go! Thanks for being consistent

name: Nicole Martin
text: I have had to bring my children in short notice after hours when their doctor's office was closed and the service was excellent. The wait time was short, the staff was friendly and the doctor was in and out. Our needs were met exceptionally well within 1 hour. The nurse Matthew that works there is simply amazing!!!!

name: Dwanda Byrd
text: My mom has been using this facility and these Doctors for years. She has received quality, caring treatment. She is very particular about her treatment, as we all should be. She's been very pleased with the clinic. If momma ain't happy, ain't nobody happy applies with us. Momma is happy with Crimson Urgent Care.

name: Wanda Owen
text: Great first experience.  Very knowledgeable staff.  Quick service.  Will definitely use again.

name: Emily Lakey
text: I love seeing this staff.  I honestly have no complaints, as I have received continuously exceptional customer service from the nurses, administrators, and doctors here. The nurses go out of their way to make me feel comfortable and understand whats going on.  Dr. E is one of the best physicians I've ever seen.  He takes his time with you and makes it seem like he genuinely cares about helping you feel your best. I never feel rushed or uncomfortable.  I would recommend this office to everyone.

name: Brandi Aaron
text: Front desk staff are terrible and they are very rude. They are so unprofessional it’s pathetic. They leave you on hold until you hang up, it’s like their strategy make people wait forever so they don’t have to talk with them. I wouldn’t recommend this clinic to anyone not even a stray dog. I think they should replace the whole front staff with people who have better customer service, they are so uninviting they make you sicker than you already are. Don’t waste your time or money it’s not worth it!!!

name: Regine Jackson
text: I have been a patient here at Crimson Urgent Care since 2015. Service is always timely and professional. I haven’t had many issues with them if any at all! :-)

name: Dylan Mann
text: I highly recommend this facility. The doctors are nice and very quick to get you in and out. The front desk is very nice and makes you feel at home.

name: Smurf Pugh
text: Everyone was very friendly.  Did not have to wait very long. Everyone was very pleasant.

name: Adrianne Brown
text: They are always nice and speedy. Dr.s care about you and your family. This is a great clinic always been wonderful for my family.

name: Sharonda Magby
text: Being from out of town we had no primary doctor on Tuscaloosa. My son got sick and i took him. They were very professional and fast. I eventually went for myself. Staff was very empathic to my needs. I would recommend them.

name: Michael Reeves
text: I was in a great deal of pain from a toothache, and all the Dental places were closed. I went to see Crimson Care and they took good care of me quickly and efficiently. They were a lifesaver!

name: Kat Imma Kitty Kat
text: Love the doctor and everyone is so sweet. Highly recommended. The front desk is the best!

name: Britt Pickett
text: Courteous front counter and relatively fast service. But after my daughter was diagnosed with the flu and bacterial bronchitis apparently someone forgot to call in the prescription. By the time my daughter discovered their oversight at the pharmacy, Crimson Urgent Care was closed with no after hours or emergency contact info. Had to suffer through the night and most of the next day before the error was corrected.

name: Kimberly Griggs
text: I have been coming here for a year or better and I have NEVER had a bad experience. Even when there is a bit of a wait it beats going anywhere else. I have never waited for more than an hour in the waiting room and normally the dr is right in. The staff is very carrying and I normally go here when I have a migraine and they respect the fact that I am normally light and sound sensitive.  P.s I am here now with a migraine and although I am in severe pain I still feel the same way! Nicole has been an amazing nurse to deal with. She is a great nurse.

name: Marcus Daniels
text: The best doctor I ever met. Quick and talented.

name: Victoria Gilbert
text: EXCELLENT SERVICE IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR  GREAT PHYSICIANS, NURSES AND STAFF. THE LADIES IN THE FRONT OFFICE ARE ALWAYS HELPFUL IN PROVIDED INFORMATION ABOUT NOT ONLY THE URGENT CARE FACILITY BUT ALSO THE OTHER FACILITIES THAT THEY ARE IN RELATION TO.

name: Grace Vanderlugt
text: This was one of the worst experiences I have EVER had in a health-care environment. Let me start out with saying they do have an amazing doctor. He is very kind, caring, and professional. The front desk employees are a different story, they are very unprofessional and do not know how to do their job. I think that they forgot what custom service means in a business environment. The front desk "forgot" to give me back my credit card which is okay, but when I came back the next day it was no where to be found. When I proceeded to ask about my card, the main front desk employee started to use racial slurs. I have never seen this type of behavior in a professional work place. I will not be coming back here and I do NOT suggest that you do either.

name: KeAngela Kennedy
text: The employees are pleasant. My daughter was in need of care. The staff was knowledgeable and was able to provide efficient care.

name: Jewell Sandoval
text:
Short wait time.  Nurse does the routine checks as soon as you enter the exam room. Dr. Peramsetty very pleasant, understands the problem and gives whatever is needed to clear up the issue.
Jewell Sandoval

name: Sheila McDowell
text: The staff was very friendly and efficient. I was in and out in no time. The doctor was very attentive, kind, and understanding. I would tell everyone to visit this Urgent Care facility.

name: BerryCute Printables
text: Left with a lot of questions. Went for urgent care and had to wait over an hour, there was 1 patient in front of me. I got to see the doctor for 2 minutes and he said I needed shots and left. Now reading other comments, looks like it's common for them to give shots (good way to bill more than needed). I couldn't believe I waited so long just to get antibiotics and shots, Doctor seemed in a rush so I didn't get all my questions answered. I don't even know exactly what those shots were. Bad business.

name: Bethanie Barrett
text: I urge everyone to choose somewhere else when picking an urgent care place. I went in with severe pain in my left buttocks that was shooting down my leg and into my foot. He literally just had me stand on my tip toes then on my heels and sent me away with "muscle spasms." The medicine that he gave me only made it worse. I'm going to get a second opinion as soon as possible. He spent more time giving me a lecture about general practitioners and how he can't prescribe narcotics, which I specifically asked him not to give me narcotics as I don't like them, then he did actually checking me out. Again, please go somewhere else.

name: Hue Nguyen
text: I come here all the time for all of my needs! Dr. Peramsetty has taken care me for as long as I can remember. The staff is so sweet and caring and they always go out of their way to make me feel better and my prescriptions and referrals were always done in a timely manner. I couldn't ask for more! :) Thanks guys!

name: Brandon Campbell
text: Great service great receptionists great doctors they know exactly what they doing and will get you in and out at a convenient time really recommend crimson to anyone in the Tuscaloosa area!!

name: Whitney Watson
text: This location is TERRIBLE- Do NOT visit! I have had medications prescribed to me that I told them I allergic to multiple times. I have also made specific, direct requests to the doctor for services that he has straight up ignored. Not worth the copay, no reliable service or treatment.

name: Pamela Richardson
text: Though the staff and physician were personable they really should not be practicing medicine.  My son was diagnosed with tonsillitis and given three injections and three prescriptions.  Two days later he was still very ill and I brought him to our family physician who immediately recognized his symptoms as mono and the test came out positive.  Though we have insurance - our copay is $40 and the three unneeded prescriptions cost over $100 out-of-pocket.  We had to pay all over again for a visit elsewhere and new prescriptions.  The pharmacist told me no less than 3 times that he would never ever recommend Crimson Urgent Care to anyone.

name: Michael O'Grady
text: this is my first and only review of an establishment. i had such a bad experience that i felt the need to write this. the doctor was fine, but the nurses and girls at the front desk have no position to be working in a place that deals w people's health. i was the only one in the lobby at the time, and pre-checkup paperwork took close to an hour because they didn't "believe" my insurance card. they ended up being wrong and i got to go in an hour after i walked through the doors. they were no help at all during the process. they then proceeded to send my prescription to the only CVS pharmacy that was closed for labor day. i called and asked them to change that, and this task took almost an hour. the only reason i went here was because it was the closest to my dorm. do not waste your money. you'll have a bad experience.

name: Jolene Jenkins
text: Doctor was very good. Nice clean place.. Nice staff..

name: truk272
text: Terrible service

name: Bianca Woods
text: Overall excellent service. Friendly staff with no long wait.

name: Vinny Trifilo
text: Staff was the best! Middle check in window chicken very cool!

name: Michael Alexander
text: The staff are very nice and took the time to look at a picture before they took me back

name: Jenny Shuttlesworth
text: Very clean, very friendly staff  and the wait time was not bad at all.

name: Angie Johnson
text: Never trust this location. They gave my son a shot that he was allergic to when he made it very clear that he was allergic to a relate medicine. He had a sever allergic reaction the next morning due to their bad medicine. Never again.

name: Rachel Miller
text: The doctors are great staff has a terrible attitude.

name: Amie McCarter
text: Loved it, the staff was great, quick and easy . No hassle.  Was well taken care of . On my road to recovery now and definitely recommend to everyone ik and more

name: ark gg
text: Staff is always supper nice and helpful an always take care of my parents

name: Tanya McFadden
text: The worst I went because I had pinkeye doctor didn’t even touch me. Didn’t look at my eye but they were real quick to collect that money. I won’t be back ever

name: McKenzie Kellar
text: One of the worst experiences I have ever had in a doctor’s office. The front desk staff was not helpful, they were extremely rude, and didn’t know how an insurance card works (didn’t make sense to me either). Would not recommend to anyone. If you are looking for an urgent care go to American Family Care on 15th!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Terrible! Don't go here. Went for urgent care and had to wait over an hour, and there weren't but 3 or 4 patients in front of me. Got a couple shots & left. Got a bill in the mail for $224, and that's AFTER my insurance paid their part. Itemized on the bill, the doctor's visit alone cost $425, and the bill total was $737. WHAT?!?? That's what I would expect an ER visit to cost, not a simple urgent care visit. I wouldn't expect to pay more than $60 to $100 for urgent care. I called the office to complain about the amount they're charging and the person I spoke with was rude and didn't really hear me out. She just kept talking about health insurance and how much they will pay according to my policy. That's not what I was upset about. I was upset about how much you charged in the first place! I will never go here again. Dr. Bobo at EmergiCare is much better & works much more efficiently to get you in and out of the door with the medicine you need to get back to good health without charging you a small fortune.

name: Brooks B
text: Dr E is SUPER NICE and very knowledgeable.  I will be back here.

name: Bill McIntyre
text: Great service from the moment you walk in. My families choice for our health care in Tuscaloosa, AL. Stop by when you're sick or if you're looking for primary care. You win't be disappointed.

name: Ali Mankey
text: Dr. Peramsetty misdiagnosed both my daughter and I. Infections cannot be treated with Tylenol and water. This is something they obviously didn't teach him in medical school. We have seen other good doctors there but I don't care to be treated by him and my children definitely will never see him again.

name: Redelle Easley-Howell
text: Dr. Peramsetty is AWESOME. The wait time is too long.

name: Nick G.
text: They are always on top of it and get me in and out quick with the right medicine. Also the doctors are super nice and get to know their patients.

name: Patti Howard
text: Doctors and staff are caring and efficient. The wait time is much shorter there.

name: consuela lewis
text: Dr. E is my dude!!!! I don't see Dr. P that much, but he's pretty cool as well and a great Doc. I Love the front desk staff and nurses. Keep up the great AWSOMTASTIC job over there you gys!!!

name: Arshad Abdul
text: good doctors & staff, excellent treatment provided.

name: Cindy Kunis
text: Absolutely terrible service, mean people and they won't cure your sickness. I took my friend there and they diagnosed her with gastroenteritis and gave her nausea medicine when she really had a kidney infection which was causing an infection in her blood. She later ended up in the hospital.

name: Rion Golden
text: Clean and comfortable waiting space. Well staffed. Short wait time.

name: Stephanie Ray
text: I though Dr. Peramsetty was really great, but found his staff (i.e. the nurses and receptionists) were extremely inexperienced and unprofessional. They made it extremely difficult for me to get a referral to another doctor I needed to see to resolve my condition and refused to give me the paperwork for my visit so that I could give it to the specialist I needed to see. I was in extreme pain and the staff at Crimson Urgent Care did as little as possible to help me alleviate that pain.

name: Grace VandeWaa
text: The people here are fast and very friendly. They even provided me with coupons for the medicines they prescribed me.

name: Monica Vasiliu
text: Please don't step in this clinic, its a waste of money and i mean lots of money!!! Really really bad service! Staff was nice and pretty fast (maybe cause it was spring break!!) but other than i have no words to describe it! went there twice 2 days apart for same problem, seen 2 different doctors, Dr Earla and Dr Peramsertty! They spent less than 5 minutes with me and charged the insurance for 25 min visit for $173 and $311!! How is that possible??And what they called it surgery for my infected finger was to prick the finger with a needle and squeeze it soooo hard for the puss will come out! And by the time i got home the puss starting building up again, and next day.. a Saturday i had to open all that infected finger by myself ( no way i was going back to the same clinic), made a big hole this time and let all that puss drain!! Again... do not waste your money for a bad medical service!  Hope somebody will learn from my mistake!!

name: Brad Yarbro
text: Everyone was very nice, and it didn't take too long to be called back to see the doctor. Will definitely go again when sick in the future.

name: Rylan Raye
text: I went to this place for severe abdominal pain at opening. I was the first person there but had to wait an hour and a half and was the last person in the waiting room to be called. I get back there and the doctor pushes on my stomach, says something about an infection, and gives me a prescription for antibiotics. Later in the day, as the pain was getting so bad I couldn't breathe properly, I went to the emergency room to find out I needed surgery. I will never go back.

name: Benjamin Brown
text: Low waits, friendly staff, and I never feel rushed. Not and old school family doc but easily a 5 star doc in the box.

name: Amelia Walker
text: Very nice people!! Go out of their way for their patients.

name: Barb Letterle
text: My son went here over the weekend.  He said the doctor was nice, but the office staff were very rude & insisted that he use the CVS pharmacy even though he wanted them to use Walgreens where he is in the system and they know his allergies.  They told him he had pharyngitis, gave him 2 shots and told him prescriptions were sent.  A day later & 3 follow up  phone calls to them later, the prescriptions were finally sent in.  He found out when he picked up the prescription that they prescribed him Augmentin which contains Amoxicillin- the only drug he told them he is allergic to!  By this time the urgent care was closed and he could not get an antibiotic that would help him.  So 2 days later, he still has no antibiotic he can take and I'm sending him somewhere else to be seen and treated properly.  He will never be returning here again!  Wish we would have read these reviews before coming- he would have went somewhere else!

name: Billy Perkins
text: myself and family have been seeing the drs here for years and they are great,i manage a buisness here in town and they always get me and out

name: Victoria Kelley
text: I went to this clinic after I had an allergic reaction to an insect bite. I waited for over a hour and a half, the doctor spent less than 5 minutes with me. Weeks later I received a bill of an additional $50 dollars and when I asked what is was for I was told it was "a new patient fee." When I asked to see a breakdown of my bill I was told, "The doctor circles one of two charges on the chart, the $125 or the $175. He circled the $175 on your chart." This answer was not the itemized bill I asked for. I will not go back to this place.

name: Octavia Kelly
text: Love it. DR's are friendly and prompt. Great bedside manners.

name: addison matter
text: This place is a joke. Doctor peramessety did the same thing to me as a previous review.. Didn't even LOOK at my chart and prescribed me the ONE thing I told the nurse I was allergic to which was bactrin. He walked in looked and me for maybe 3 seconds and said I'll send you something to cvs.. And that was it!!!!! Didn't even look at my infection or anything.. I was told he rushes people in and out and to go to the partner one in north port but my god I was shocked at how crappy he was.

name: Crystal Fix
text: Probably the worst “urgent care” I have ever been to. Waited almost 3 hours to be seen and was only told I still had several people in front of me. Should probably change their statement on their website saying “in and out in a hour” false advertising

resp.text: Crystal we are so sorry for your experience, when this usually occurs it is due to a high voulmn of patient load that is unexpected. We make all attempts to get people in and out in about an hour, we do however take the patient care seriously, and in some cases it takes longer than others when assuring the best care. It appears to have been so in your case, and we would like to apologize. We hope you will still stop by and see us soon so we can give you the best care as well.

name: J. Lewis
text: I'm sorry to have to leave a bad review, because the doctor is incredibly friendly and nice. Two problems here: 1, it's $35 more expensive than EmergiCare, and, more importantly: the doctor here misdiagnosed an allergic reaction I was having to antibiotics as another infection and prescribed more antibiotics. Not only that, but he prescribed amoxicilin even though I told him I was allergic to penecilin (they're the same drug). The next day I went to Emergicare and, two antihistamine shots later, I was perfectly fine. Friendly doctor, but I've been through a week of hell because of his misdiagnosis.

name: Holly Whatley
text: Very caring and friendly! For the best care this is the place to go!

name: Lakesha Tillman
text: Love CUC and its staff. Dr. P is the best!

name: Portia Jones
text: Always a quick visit, with a very caring staff.

name: Brad
text: Friendly  people,  Knowledgeable Doctors. Fast reliable results.

name: Samuel Stockman
text: Service was great. A little wait but friendly staff

name: Robert Grant
text: Very friendly and courtious staff. Super short wait times

name: James H Black Jr
text: I was taken care of very professionally

name: Katie Davis
text: I liked that I am able to walk in and be seen quickly.

name: Amanda Steele
text: Fast and quick service. Friendly environment.

name: Pam Hunnicutt
text: My whole family goes to him, he is great.

name: Teresa Tingle
text: Very nice staff and concerning

name: Steven Fondriest
text: Very quick, Kind/Helpful staff and doctor

name: Rachel Yarbro
text: Quickest care in town.

name: Eric Harper
text: I’ve been going to Crimson Urgent Care for the past couple years. They are conveniently located and the service is always top notch.

name: Stephanie kaiser
text: Great service nice area!!

name: Miranda Watts
text: They were quick and knew what they were doing

name: abhishek srivastava
text: Very rude staff !

name: Robert Darnell
text: The doctor I went to was extremely clueless. I told him I had stomach pain around my appendix and he told me I had a stomach infection and gave antibiotics. Here I am 3 days later in the hospital with an appendicitis that's already ruptured.

name: Malinda Jackson
text: I love coming here

name: Dorothea Rhodes
text: Excellent service....

name: Andre Colombel
text: My first reaction came from seeing how clean it was and the welcome from the receptionists

name: Annie Culverhouse
text: Awful customer service. They were very unprofessional and rude. They seemed to not care at all. The doctor didn’t even look at the X-ray..

name: haley azwell
text: The wait wasn't long the first time i went and they were super sweet!!

name: David Ewing
text: Clean facility and fast service

name: Selena Hicks
text: Good service.

name: Savannah Baswell
text: Great staff

name: Cynthia Thompson
text: Cool and friendly staff

name: Kris Pourchot
text: The two ladies at the front desk were very rude.

name: Breanna Brown
text: Will, never go there again. Doctor diagnosed me without even looking at me took weeks to get results from test ran.

name: Cory Abercrombie
text: Slow but nice people

name: Erin Giles
text: Not open 7 days a week. Today is Sunday. Website says closed. Billboard says open 7 days a week.

name: Hannah Lott
text: This staff is absolutely amazing!! The receptionist, the nurses, the nurse practitioner, absolutely everyone there is amazing!! They try their best to get you in and out as quickly as possible. They are so friendly and make you feel so comfortable. They are very personal with children to make the kids feel comfortable and like they aren’t even at a doctors office. They seen my son, Bentley, my daughter, Grace and myself all together, when I never expected them to, they just did it to make it convenient for us. This staff is truly wonderful and everyone of them deserve a raise. My husband and I LOVED bringing our children here!

name: Lillian Jackson
text: I was told when I arrived that there was a two hour wait and that I could sit in my car until they called. I asked them if they would still take me even if they hit closing time and they said yes. It hit closing time and I was one of the only people left waiting, and I got a message that my appointment was cancelled. When I went up to the window, they had locked the doors. I knocked, they saw me, and hid. They ignored me, and I had to leave after waiting two hours. I was in a lot of pain, and I needed to be seen. :(

name: Amy Smith
text:
My husband and I each had an Instant Covid-19 test here (both were negative). We provided all of our BCBS insurance information and we thought everything would be covered, or at least mostly covered… Nope! Apparently mainStreet Family Care in Mobile is not in the BCBS Ntwrk. Be warned if you have certain BCBS Insurance or don’t have insurance at all you’re going to pay $125 a pop.
My husband and I each received a bill this week saying we owe $125.00… $250 for both of us! $250.00 out of our pockets for Covid tests…. Well technically it looks like the majority of the bill is for “management of a new patient”. That seems pretty high to me. Those were fees that we were not expecting. I wish we had known ahead of time. Hopefully this review helps somebody else avoid a surprise bill in the future. I definitely would have gone somewhere else and will not be back. Not to mention, it was about an eight hour wait.

name: Cassie Armitage
text: They were all so nice! I had to wait a little bit for my Covid IV and One of the nurses bought me lunch. I believe her name was Ellen. So amazing!! I feel for anyone in health care rn and no one here seemed down. I would recommend 10/10

name: Kimberly Black
text: HIPAA violation at my appointment. The person checking me in at the desk (who did not seem like she wanted to be there or want me there) asked me to check in online. I sat down across the room to do so with 2 other people in the room and she asks me across the room what I am being seen for. I asked her if she was supposed to ask me that in front of everyone and she said "well there are some things we don't treat here." There are other ways to go about this, i.e. lists or just waiting the 3 minutes for me to complete my online check in which tells you my ailment. I had to call out that I had a UTI in front of two other men. It felt embarrassing and really inappropriate. The only reason they are getting 2 stars is because the staff in the back were very kind and friendly it was mostly the front desk issue.

name: Keely Nicholas
text: I used to really like this place. They were open late and the staff was super friendly.  My appt yesterday changed my mind. I was perscribed two medications and asked what pharmacy I use. Unfortunately I didnt know my pharmacy closes early on Saturdays until i got there to pic up my meds. I immeadiatly called Main St thinking they coukd send my medicine elsewhere. They were closed. At 4pm. double cheked their website and confirmed that their clinc is open 7 days a week until 9pm. I was frustrated but there was  nothing to be done. I called them this morning and explained the situation. I was told by reception that they were busy and no one hsd time. I told her i was in pain and im sorry to inconvenience them but i really needed my medicine. She said she woukd try to get the PA to send it in but it woukd be a little while sincd they were do bus . I told her its fine-, gave her the nsmr of the pharmacy and asked to be called or texed when it was done. She said she woukd take care of it. That was a lie. I called my other pharmacy and thdy had no idea what i was talking about and i wasnt in their system. I called Main Street again and got the same message saying theg are closed. Im incredibly frustrated abd in severe pain. I expected better. They also let a person who was thde for Covid testinv wait in the waiting room with meand another paiten . Ill be calling their headquarters  in the morning

name: Noflave Dave
text: Had a great experience here! Staff was super friendly and helpful.  They spent alot of time explaining everything to me and going over my treatment plan. I was very impressed with the level of care at this facility. From the front desk to the nurses and to NP were top notch and I hope this company realizes what valuable assets they have here. Keep up the good work ladies!

name: Kay Handley
text: I spent 20 min. registering for a covid vaccine.  I received confirmation that I was registered, and that I would be notified when my time came.  They sent me a text to come in for my shot, and then called me right after to inform me that they are not giving covid vaccines.  What's going on here?  They obtained my personal information, including credit card info, under false pretenses.  I gave them that information because their website said they are giving vaccines.  It was only after they had all my info that they called me and said they aren't giving vaccines.

name: Paul Hester
text: The staff was awesome. Everyone was so helpful. And the lady's on the counter . When out of there way to help me get a conv 19 test . I would recommend anyone to go there.

name: r a (RA21)
text: They were very fast, friendly and efficient!

name: LeAnn Miller
text: Very impressed! Staff and doctor were all extremely nice and helpful and answered all my questions. The kindness and care they showed is such a rare thing. I don't normally leave reviews but I was so impressed that I had to :) You have a new patient! (By the way, the injections worked and I'm finally able to breathe! Thank you!)

resp.text: This is so great to hear! We're happy you're feeling better!

name: Honeybun
text: Not sure why an urgent care office wouldn’t be answering their phone at a time like this... you would think they would pick up so they could control the walk ins during covid 19. All I wanted to do was call and cancel my appointment but I’m not even able to do that! Very unprofessional and I’m sure during a pandemic not advised, someone needs to visit them and give them a citation!!!I just know they BETTER NOT charge me for not showing up it’s not like they respond to the portal cancellations either 🙄

name: Caramel Libra Girl
text: Terrible service. DO NOT BRING YOUR SICK CHILD HERE!! They don't care about children at all. Go to the ER or your primary care provider. I could write a book about the mistreat I recieved here. Again, Greater Mobile Urgent Care is the best urgent facility in Mobile. This place is a joke.

resp.text:
Hi Caramel,

Thanks for reaching out! We'd like the opportunity to follow up regarding your experience. When you have a moment would you mind emailing us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com to provide us with some more details about your experience? We appreciate the opportunity to make this right!

name: Jessica
text: They did a excellent job

name: Courtney Washington
text:
Please do not utilize this facility COVID 19 testing. They have a 10 day turn around and blaming it on LabCorp. LabCorpis sending results to providers within 4 days. This urgent care is not posting or updating results in a timely fashion. Use some other provider. They do not even respond to the portal messages
.

name: Elisa Blackburn
text: I am terribly sorry, but I potentially exposed your waiting room to COVID-19 today. You see, I came in Saturday for urgent care, and they told me is need to get a referral from my doctor in 72 hours, and my primary care doctor gave me a paper to bring to your front desk. I tried to take care of it over the phone, seeing as my PCP submitted the referral through the internet, but the front desk girl had "no idea what to do here" and kept putting me on hold to speak to someone named Erica. The first time was 20 minutes, then I hung up and called back, because this is something front desk ladies have been able to do at other medical offices. The second time, the front desk girl got snappy with me, explaining that there was a waiting room full of people waiting JUST for Erica. I explained to her that I'd had to receive COVID-19 testing this morning, and I didn't want to risk bringing the paper in, but this was a time sensitive issue, according to the paper this very office gave me. She told me I needed to stay home and wait on hold. I waited another 10 minutes on hold before I got in my car. I came in wearing a mask and explained to the front desk lady that I needed to give her the paper, which took all of like 20 seconds. I asked her if this could have been done over the phone, and she told me OF COURSE. I showed her where I was still on hold on my cell phone, making it over an hour on hold to get to Erica. So, I'd like to thank Erica and the sassy front desk lady for potentially helping to spread COVID-19, by putting me in a position where I either had to come in (despite potentially having COVID-19), or risk getting stuck with a bill I could not afford, due to their lack of time management. Oh, and the waiting room when I came in? Maybe 2 people in there!

resp.text:
Hi Elisa,

Thank you for reaching out! We are truly saddened that your experience was not as great as we would have liked. We take bad reviews very seriously, and we would like to ensure that your experience is better next time. We have followed up with our staff regarding your experience.

name: Gabrielle Anderson
text: The healthcare providers at MainStreet helped me out with my work physical exam and paperwork. They were very friendly and reasonavly priced. Thanks for a great visit!

name: Brother Smitty
text: Very nice staff. Little bit of a wait.

name: Jaicenta
text: Very great staff!! polite ,friendly, and take care of your needs properly.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Jaicenta! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Tabitha Grace
text: Do not use them! Came in 2 hours before closing and was rudely informed that it was 2 hour wait. Then the nurse came out and said did you tell them about the wait. An urgent care facility with zero compassion!! I left because I did not want people like that to treat my son. It was ridiculous!

name: Channing Cope
text: What type of COVID test is done here? Is it PCR Nasal Swab test?

name: Tiffany Gillerlain
text: The staff does not get enough credit for what they are going through during Covid. I witnessed all the staff members going above and beyond while I was there.

name: Brittany Gray
text: This pplace turned away my 6 month old more than once when she was sick don't go here

name: Jennifer Thomason
text: I haven't been there but what is the point of having a written referral from my childs actual dr for insurance? If I could get that I would take them there. Can you please explain this to me?

resp.text:
Hi Jennifer,

Trust us, we wish we didn't have to jump through such hoops too! While Medicaid and AllKids recently eliminated this requirement, certain BCBS plans require that we submit this referral before they'll pay for the services we provided. Thankfully, you have 48 hours after the visit to get this referral, so you can get the care you need, when you need it, and let us help get the paperwork finished afterwards! Thanks again for reaching out!

name: Megan Morgan
text: I have tried this place three times and each time, I have had an awful experience. They treat me like I am an inconvenience to them, but they sure don’t mind taking my money. They act like they do not care at all. I do not recommend!

resp.text:
Hi Megan,

Thank you for sharing, and we are sorry your experience was not satisfactory. We'd love the opportunity to follow up with our staff and improve. If you could, email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com and let us know any specific details about your visit, and how you feel we could make this right! Thank you again for reaching out.

name: Haleigh Parker
text: Okay so as with KidsStreet I was skeptical. I read bad review after bad review. So I originally didnt want to go. We went with myself and my daughter. They took the time to listen to all of my symptoms. My doctors office couldnt get me in and gave me something that made me sick . the staff at main street listened to everything i had to say . paid attention to my medicine allergies. They were able to get to the root of the problem and give me the medicines I needed to get better . As with kids street, I would definitely recommend main street. And I would go back if I needed to.

name: Hillary
text: Very clean and very fast! They get right to the point and I will definitely be using them again!!

resp.text: Thanks, Hillary! We're so glad we could help you heal and feel better. Thanks for choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Steph Andry-Wilkinson
text: From the moment we walked in we were treated with great care and concern. Kids Street made it very easy for my five-month-old to be seen since we were from out of town. We went to other facilities and walked out. This office is amazing  thanks for all your help !   P.s.   Excellent self-pay option I will highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Steph! We're happy we could help your little one feel better fast!

name: Amber Morrison
text: Erica is sweet and patient with all the kids, especially when it's busy! I appreciate her kindness even when the waiting room is full :) Kaylan and Christopher are quick, efficient, and accurate when providing patient care. They really put the kids at ease.

resp.text: Thanks Amber!

name: Jonathan Morris
text: Don’t come here unless you want the most generic of care. Type A flu, and couldn’t even get a prescription of comfort meds because they don’t have an MD on staff. Waste of time and money, just go wait at the ER.

resp.text:
Hi Jonathan,

Thank you for reaching out. We're having our staff and management review your chart to see what we can do to help you feel better. We'll reach back out through our message thread on Facebook to keep you updated. Thank you again for reaching out with your concerns!

name: Diane Harris
text: Usually use another facility but decided to try this one since it was close to my home. Very nice and accommodating outer waiting room but after being placed in a room, the wait was too long! My daughter’s regular doctor and my usually urgent care  is 1/2 the wait time. The outer lobby did not have any patients so I expected to be seen more quickly. Total time: 2 hours 30 minutes!

resp.text:
Hi Diane,

We're sorry your experience was not satisfactory! Our goal is to always get our patients in and out within an hour. We are reviewing your chart so we can follow up with staff to see why your visit took so long. Since we are still new there in Mobile, I'm sure they're working out some kinks to make everything go a bit quicker. We hope we will have another opportunity to help you and your family feel better fast! Thank you for reaching out and for choosing KidsStreet Urgent Care!

name: Michael Looney
text: I'm not really one to post negative reviews like this but I wanted to share the experience I just  had. I was skating at the skating rink (thinking I was alot younger than I actually am), fell extremely hard and landed on my finger.  I came to this urgent care at 8:40 p.m and the website and sign said they were open until 9:00. All of the lights and signs were turned off when I walked up to the door. Although the lady at the desk initially saw me I stood out there for several minutes. Finally she came out and said they saw their last patient at 8:30. I told her that I just needed someone to look at my finger to tell me if it was definitely broken and she said they couldn't do it. Honestly I just want her to read this so that she knows how much she let me down.

resp.text:
Hi Michael,

I am so sorry for your negative experience and we will certainly be following up with our staff and take appropriate disciplinary action. Our company policy is that we accept patients all the way up to closing time and we do not have a cut off time. If you experience this in the future you can immediately contact the corporate office at 205-545-5090 or reach the clinic manager’s cell by calling the local clinic, pressing option 4, and then option 2. Thank you for alerting us to this issue!

name: Roslyn's Dad
text: Nice waiting room free refreshments, friendly staff. The wait was a little too long only because the computer was acting up and the doctor didn't do to much when I was seen only talk, but overall good experience minus the wait and a little more intent on explaining medical issues to people such as causes, treatment, and etc. Would recommend if not for a serious concern of health

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Roslyn!

name: David MCclendon
text: Just seen one of your cars at Walgreen's on McGregor and airport blvd. Parked in a handicap spot with two children in the car. The one child was not in a booster seat and the driver was holding the newborn baby in her lap while driving and no one was wearing a seat belt.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention David. We have addressed this with the employee in question.

name: Erica Johnson-Arrington
text: The Staff at Main Street Urgent care is phenomenal. Amber Morrison-CRNP take time with each patient to provide optimum care. She's awesome and very suitable for her position. Rachel Dargan is Awesome! she is very kind and gives excellent advice. Rachel Carter-CRNP is an awesome provider. She gives wonderful health management advice & has a great approach! Christopher C. , Kaylan Short, Brittney, Spring, and Victoria are the best MAs any clinic could ever ask for. Despite what the patient count is  they are sure to take care of each patient fully and is the ideal Medical Assistants.

resp.text: Thanks Erica!

name: Tashia Bridges
text: Great customer service

name: Ashley Lassiter
text: Dr. Johnston and her staff were phenomenal. In and out in under an hour. Incredibly professional yet friendly. Only using Main Street from now on.

resp.text: That’s a BOOM! Thank you for sharing Ashley! So glad we could help!

name: Kimberly Theresa
text: Fantastic service. The staff is truly amazing. The waiting area is perfect.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Kimberly!

name: Conrad Bates
text: Sitting here now.  There was one patient before me.  Been sitting here for 45 minutes and still not called back.

resp.text:
Hi Conrad,
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us! We’re sorry to hear you had a negative experience, and we’ll certainly follow up with our staff. We always strive to get our patients in and out in under an hour, but I know with cold and flu season upon us, it can increase wait times a bit. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention and don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any additional feedback!

name: Scott Mckissick
text: Don't let applicants know whether they got the job or not, which resulted in loosing another job offer. Terriable unprofessional.

resp.text: Mr. McKissick, we are trying to locate your application. Would you have applied with another name? We accept all applications through our website, and we have several that apply. Once you go through our extensive interview process and a decision is made we always notify our applicants with our decision.

name: Shayla Thurman
text: Didn’t even get a chance to go in the office. Just calling and asking a question the phone experience made me go to another urgent care. Rude staff.

resp.text: Hi Shayla! Thank you for letting us know about your experience! That is certainly not the level of patient care that we expect from our staff and we’d like to follow up. Can you tell me what date and time you called so that we can follow up?

name: Jacob Huff
text: great place

resp.text: Thanks Jacob! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet!

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great facility!!

name: Jill Griffin
text: Very convenient but they need a faster process for the patients that are only getting a shot or TB skin test. We waited in line like everyone else that was seeing the doctor only to be called back and 1 minute or less to place the test. When I worked at a community clinic we had a separate clinic for these patients which shortened their wait time. Otherwise, we love the clinic and how they are open everyday of the week.

name: Gary Detwiler
text: I have been to Go Now twice and both times the receptionists, nurses, and doctors took care of me in a thorough and timely fashion. They also show great concern with the well being of their patients, a quality in my opinion, that has been lost in some medical professions these days. I recommend you visit them if you have a medical need. Keep up the good work.

name: Ashley Price
text: The facility was clean, cool and it was a welcoming atmosphere. The wait time was not long at all. The staff was very friendly, from Pam at the front desk, to Cindy and Joyce in the back. The Doctor I saw, Dr. Eicher, was very efficient and assessed me well. He listened to me and made me feel comfortable. The nurses were truly concerned about my well being and even got me water and crackers when I felt sick after an antibiotic shot. The doctor came back and checked on me. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

name: Thomas Benson
text:
Excellent staff and care. Wait was a little long but that was expected due to the high level of sickness in the area. Will definitely recommend to friends and use again when my primary care doctor is unavailable. Thanks again for helping me feel better.
Will Benson
Pleasant Grove AL.

name: Marcy Self
text: I would definitely recommend this doctors office to anyone.  Ever since my first visit,  this is who I use as my primary.  The staff is wonderful,  and kind and it's normally not a long wait.  Now they even have a kid section just for kids out in the waiting room to keep children entertained.  I would rather come here then go to middle creek in McCalla. I am very satisfied with the care I receive here and the doctors.

name: Jane Rollins
text: GoNow doctors was a nice facility. Courteous staff, seemed concerned, especially when you are not feeling well. Stopwatch Urgent Care has taken over as of 12/03/2018. 👎🏽 Nurse was rushed, did not allow me to give all of my symptoms and wasn't concerned about anything I was saying. She just wanted to take my vitals and move on to the next patient. Like I was an inconvenience to her. Never happened with GoNow.

name: Cecil Reed
text: Everyone here was so nice today. Had to have some xrays done on foot and ended up getting a shot. Barb at front desk was very helpful. Thank you all for a pleasant visit to something not so pleasant!!!

name: Caryl Hadder
text: The doctor was very nice as was everyone working however I had to wait 3 hours. Not a good impression on my first visit. I will give another chance if I need quick care but only one more.

name: Zbarroness Q
text:
I have been to this office twice for two unrelated issues. Each time I was treated  as if I was a family member. The staff from the front desk to the doctor was extremely friendly ,  compassionate, and thorough with their examination.
I will definitely go back and have recommended them to family members and friends.

name: Susan Roper
text:
Every one was very nice.  Would definitely go again if had a need to.
In & out in a little less than 1 1/2 hours which isn't bad for a walk in clinic.

name: Rheonna Wiuff
text:
6 hours wait time. Yes, it is Saturday but that's when people who work come in, staff accordingly. So far not impressed. They do not tell you an approximate wait time when you sign in. If you are not there when called, you get dropped to back lf line. We did not get out until about 4:30 pm.
Update; first visit was 6 hours, second (recheck for an Rx) was over 3 hours wait time.

This was without a doubt THE WORST EXCUSE FOR HEALTH CARE IN MY LIFETIME! It’s hard to believe Dr. Price really finished medical school. The front desk was rude. The nurses station was a shambles, you couldn’t see her desk for all the papers, charts, fast food, makeup covering it. The “Dr” Price actually said he was paid by Work Comp NOT to recommend keeping me off work so I could heal properly.
God help those Dr. Price treats. I HAD to go to Go Now Dr’s via Work Comp, but once I got to a REAL Dr. He said that Dr. Price did me harm and caused my injury to be worse.
Go Now has a new name on the outside. Maybe they went out of business. But if the same QUACK is the Dr. Inside...go now quickly to another Dr!!!

name: Laney Brown
text: I really like Dr. Eicher. I have seen him several times over the past couple of years and he has been great with diagnosing and subscribing the exact treatment I needed. Great nurses and office workers too.

name: Melissa Mann
text: Friendly employees from the front, to triage, to the nurse. The Dr listened and was nice as well. I am already feeling better just a few hours later. Very clean and nice set up.

name: Stephanie Miller
text: I have absolutely no complaints. This is my second visit and each time the staff has been wonderful. I arrived today at 8:00 a.m. and out the door by 9:05.

name: Karen Gunter
text: Everyone was professional, respectful, polite and concerned for my wellness.  This is a place I will definitely be returning for any of my health care need.  The staff went over and beyond my expectations!  Thanks for putting together an excellent atmosphere for every in the Hueytown location! 👍

name: Donnie
text: The doctor I saw when I went was great, but I've been waiting weeks on on test results to get back that I was told would be back within 4 to 5 days. Even after me calling and actually asking for them, I've been told they'd call me back and still haven't heard anything. They said they were too busy.

name: Pat Blais
text: This place must be getting some good recommendations because they were slammed when I went in on a Sunday.  Accordingly, it was a pretty long wait, but the waiting room was clean and comfortable.  Everyone was great from the front desk on and the doctor was of a caliber I have never found in a facility like this.  I had an upper respiratory tract infection (which I get every year) and he did order everything I expected to fight it and more while I was there. When I went to pick up my prescription, I was even more pleased.  He is the only one ever who has fought this thing with the 1-2 punch it needs and 24 hours later I'm 85% better.  Highly recommended even with the wait times.

name: Norm Wagner
text: Extremely friendly staff and knowledgeable doctor. I was diagnosed and given an injection and antibiotics and was feeling better that afternoon. The wait time was much quicker than my PCP and more convenient and didn't have to wait for an appointment.

name: Regina Ball
text: I am pleased with GoNow Doctors. I use them primarily for problems with sinuses. One of the doctors there recommended eating yogurt if you are having problems with sinuses. I have been doing that since March of this year and seem to have fewer problems. I also like the convenience of not having to drive across town to my primary care. Staff is courteous.

name: Kelly Gregory
text: Fast and friendly. My two kids had somethings to keep them occupied, the staff is very friendly, and the doctor is very nice and gets straight to the point!! I love the convenience of it all!

name: Alesia Smith
text: Very nice people you get called to the back quickly. Doctor was good on answering all my questions. I would recommend this place to family and friends.

name: Jennifer Veasey
text: I've been going here since they open and the Dr is great. The only complaint I've got is the wait times are tremendous. If you plan on going plan on being there at least two hours.

name: Kristie Grund
text:
I only give one star because the ladies at the front desk were so nice.    I took my daughter and we were the only ones there.   Only two people came in the entire time other than us.   My daughter had a little sinus drainage and she was back there for THREE hours.   That’s not even the worst.
The “doctor” tested her for strep and it was negative.   He said he still believed she had strep because her tonsils we SOOO RED AND SWOLLEN.   I find this hilarious because my daughters tonsils were removed in 2003.   I wouldn’t take a stray dog here after our experience

name: Mike Fuller
text: Giving a theee star because how long I waited on doctor. The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. Waiting on doctor seemed like eternity. Overall the place was clean, well maintained. Did I mention the doctor took to long? Good Day!

name: slim carrir
text: Everyone was so nice and accomodating. Took 3 hours but an hour of that was spent with the doctor. This place actually makes u feel cared for and not just cattle being hurried through. Dr. Price was great along with his staff.

name: Shaun Bridgmon
text: Doctor was late to the office, but that was due to inclement weather, so bot an issue there. Staff was friendly, doctor was very polite, knowledgeable, but the overall process was way too slow. 1.5 hrs, with 2 people ahead. I was 3rd in that morning. You only get a total of 10 minutes facetime with the nurse or doctor but are waiting 1.5 hrs total.

name: James Bond
text: Great place. Opened at 12 on sunday. They opened up at 1140 to let people in. Staff was great. Doctor was good, asked questions and let you talk. Not usual here's whats wrong,  thanks for coming.  Highly recommend using them over other place in McAdory.  Will use again .

name: Christine Mines
text: Only 1 other  patient when I arrived. My visit still took 2 and a half hours. Didn't understand the long wait period. Dr. and other employees were very courteous

name: Dana White
text: From the moment you walk in the staff was very nice and friendly. The facility was very warm and welcoming. I didn't wait long before being called to the back. Wonderful place!

name: Suzi Burke
text: Very good experience. Friendly staff and Dr. Attentive to their patients. Wait wasn't too long considering the sickness going around. Over all great experience!!

name: michael salter
text: 18 year old son went because he was sick. Waited for doc for 2 hrs finally saw him gave him 3 scripts and told him he was gonna give him 2 shots. My son fell asleep in room waiting. My wife got there 2 hrs later and they had taken him off board and probably would have just left him in room if my wife had not shown up. When my wife asked what was going on they were all confused and had no idea. My wife said to the nurse they gave him scripts & her response was well he can go. My wife asked her to get the doc he finally came and asked what was the problem & she explained he had been waiting for 2 hrs for shot. Finally they brought a shot in and gave to him. They left went to Walgreens because this was only pharmacy open gave them the scripts. The pharmacist was very confused because he had already filled the script because they had sent it over electronic too. Then gave him antibiotics and told him to take twice a day for 10 days but only prescribed 15 pills. Needless to say my wife was very unhappy with them.

name: Joe Edwards
text: Very professional, so kind and caring. Had to fill out new patient form, see the nurse, doc, then receive shots and rx paper. All in less than 1 hour! Highly recommend!!!!

name: Taylor Knapp
text: My nurses both days were sweet and the front desk lady I had the first day I went was too, but the lady working the following time at the desk was rude and argued with me about what I paid for in advance at my visit a few days before and was refusing to give it to me, until I walked out to my car to get my receipt (which she had a copy in my file but didn’t want to pull it). I went for a physical during a week day and was the only person in the waiting room. I waited for an hour and a half in the waiting room and another 45 minutes in the back just for the doctor to be in there with me for not even 2 minutes and have the doctor blame me for things his staff didn’t do when I was there a few days earlier.

name: Beverly King
text: I went there because my regular doctor was out of his office for the next few days.  Everyone was nice and friendly.  The doctor knew right away what I needed.   I got a injection of the right stuff and before I left the facility,  Walmart Pharmacy called my phone to let me know my prescription was ready!  I will definitely come here again if I can't see my regular doctor.  One more thing,  the wait time was not a long time!  I love that!

name: Deb Hudson
text: The staff is great...the dictor i had was very understanding and caring. Office clean great parking. Wait ..wow short..with full office..

name: Deb Beam
text: Very efficient and friendly staff and physician.  Thorough evaluation, including testing, in and out quickly.  Would highly recommend.

name: Regina Wagner
text: The office staff is extremely professional and kind.  Very efficient with updating my past records and allowing me to get my lab work started so it would be ready when I saw the doctor.  Fortunately I didn't have to wait too long to be called by a nurse who recorded my symptoms on my chart in a triage room.  Then I was taken to an exam room where I waited about 5 minutes before the doctor came in to go over my symptoms again.  At this point he left to check on my lab work which was ready as promised.  Doctor e-scripted my prescription to my preferred pharmacy after he went over my diagnosis and how to use my meds.  On the way out of the office the very thoughtful receptionist told me she hoped I felt better soon...My script was at my pharmacy ready for pickup when I arrived, 5 minutes later.  I would and do recommend Go Now to my family and friends when an illness or injury happen after hours or on weekends.

name: kim wheeler
text:
Doctor was great!!!! Front desk lady was Rude but seemed to get a little better. She seemed stressed so maybe that's all that was wrong.
Be prepared to be there a few hours 12:45 to 4:00.
The nurses and the Dr were very nice!

name: Shane Lashley
text: Went in for a TB skin test for work, they took me back very quickly. Professional staff and super courteous. Will be back!

name: Dev Cheatam
text: My experience was extremely wonderful. Everything, was professional and satisfactory. Receptionist, nurses and doctors were wonderful

name: Mary (Caroline) Putman
text: Very quick service, everyone was very friendly! The doctor I saw was very helpful and understanding! I would definitely come back!

name: Pam Sims
text: It did not take long at all. Better than waiting for hours. The staff was really nice and professional. Thanks GoNow Doctors

name: LaToya Drish
text: Sry nice and knowledgeable and quick. Showed concern and was very comfortable talking to the team about my concerns. Very professional.

name: Angel Roberts
text: I want to make this softer my primary care. He was nice, he listened, he was so nice to my son .....great docter

name: Constance Williams
text: Had a long wait due to a holiday weekend but visit was efficient pleasant and better than you'd expect in an after hours environment.

name: Heather Brewer
text: The service was good but I had to wait an hour just to talk to the doctor for 3 minutes, get a shot, & leave.

name: S H
text: Went to Gonow Doctors in Hueytown on 6/1/2018. Front desk employee and doctor was great. Nursing staff and lab tech giving shot had horrible attitude. Will never go back. I waited over an hour after being put in a exam room before seeing doctor.

name: Charonda Boyd
text: Friendly staff and welcoming environment. Ms. Stacey was nice enough to email me my paperwork so I could complete it ahead of time. With one stick my blood was drawn!

text: I love this place i take my kids there when ever they are sick and they get you in and out quickly almost all the time.

text: I went in Wednesday, Oct 3 and it went quickly because there was only one person in front of me. However, I've also been in and it's taken between 2-4 hours to be seen.

The staff there has always been extremely helpful and nice. I think it's just an all around great place.

THE DOCTOR DID NOT EVEN REMOVE THE BANDAID UNTIL I SUGGESTED IT. I wanted a tetanus shot.  He told me to get it at the pharmacy.   I will not go back.

So if sick don't go on a Saturday.
